author: {'steamid': '76561198074894053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 142, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1712257493}
review:
Купив и впервые запустив игру посидел в ней 20 минут и удалил со словами: "Какая х...я". Через пару лет решил всё таки, что чего-то не понял в ней. Установил заново и просидел ещё 2,5 часа и моё мнение не сильно изменилось. Но теперь могу отметить плюсы и минусы, на мой взгляд.
Плюсы: разнообразие крафта (шмотки, оружие, декор и прочее, всего много)
разнообразие собираемых ресурсов (много крафтов=много ресурсов, но считаю это плюс)
Минусы:
Интерфейс, по моему самый убогий из всех выживачей, что я видел
Отсутствие хоть какого-то сюжета и предыстории, вы просто тупо появляетесь неизвестно где, в трусах, всё - идите выживайте.... Очень странно
Отсутствие кастомизации персонажа, при виде от 3го лица она обязана быть в игре
Игра очень очень оооооочень сильно затянута: Отсутствием бега/ускорения, скоростью крафта, да любое действие персонажа - медленное
Прокачка идёт только от заданий, бредятина
Ну и лично от меня, это самая уе.....ая система ловли и приручения животных, чтобы поймать курицу, которая в отличии от персонажа может бегать нужно попасть ловушкой 2-3 раза подряд, т.е. не 1 раз, а 2-3 подряд, после первого попадания кура убегает и если остановится, то нужно снова попасть 2-3 раза. Какой уникум это придумал? Я  такого маразма вообще нигде не видел.
Периодически животные/гоблины выхватив приличное количество урона - разворачиваются и убегают, а персонаж не может их остановить, по мнению разработчика и не нужно, ведь зверь спустя 20 сек бега отхилиться полностью и нападёт.
Итог: разумеется я не рекомендую это, в данном жанре присутствует много интересных проектов, но данная игра к ним не относится, возможно позже, привыкнув к механике кидания ловушек или появления возможности ловить с первого раза животных, а также появления какого-либо добивания убегающих игра и станет лучше и веселее, но где же столько терпения то взять? Начало/пролог должно быть таким, чтобы заинтересовать игрока делать задания/исследовать мир и вообще проводить тут время. Возможно, когда-нибудь я наберу терпения на прохождение этого шедевра, но пока нет!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973572043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 78, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1711936427}
review:
This is an ok survival game.
You collect, craft items, you build structures, you explore.
Health and stamina generate by themselves but faster with the correct food.
You get seeds and so you can grow stuff.

Pretty normal and comprehensible progression.

But... the controlling of the characters is atrocious bad. 
It is just not fun to control the character.

So, if you are in desperate need for a survival game and can get it for cheap... ok... try it.

Don't expect an AAA experience.

But it is ... OKish :-) Not bad. Just not good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067584523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1709312524}
review:
Ce commentaire sera au fur et à mesure modifié.

Premier lancement du jeu, plusieurs chose négatif:

- Clavier en anglais
- Personnage que "homme", pas de "femme"
- PAS DE MANETTE DE PRIS EN CHARGE (Non mais c'est quoi ça, n'importe quoi, nul !!!,
  POINT TRÈS TRÈS NÉGATIF ICI)
- Souris non personnalisable, elle sert à changer la vue et attaquer avec les deux bouton, 
  clique gauche coup de point et clique droit coup de pied...)
 
  Il faut trouver un substitue, un logiciel qui va simuler le clavier et la souris avec une manette,
  pas simple à trouver ça.
- Carte pixeliser, n'importe quoi !!!

Bon et bien j'ai arrêter, bien trop chiant à jouer, trop compliquer, achetez le 2 et oublier celui-ci, perso jy arrive pas, c'est dommage mais c'est comme ça.

Rien que pour construire ou fabriquer un objet, que c'est chiant !
Le 2, tellement simple, tellement bien, rien à voir, c'est le jour et la nuit !

Le 2 j'ai tout de suite aimer et même adoré, le jeu m'as énormément plus bien qu'il y à quelque coté chiant aussi mais bon, qu'est ce que il est bien comparer à celui-ci !

author: {'steamid': '76561198042053286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1709118227}
review:
I really gave this game a good solid try. There is a lot to like about it (which is why it took me a while to give up on it), but ultimately there are some core flaws that I never was able to get past. So I sadly can't recommend this game.

Let's start with the good...
Early game is nice, so long as you stick to your starting area. Keeping the protective layer of plantlife around your base is ESSENTIAL... but so long as you keep it there, home base can become a nice spot for continuous progress. Progress feels nice. New things unlock even more new things and there is always something new to aim for.
The quest path is fairly straightforward. There's always something to work towards, and it teaches you the game as you play rather than throwing you in some odd tutorial world thing.
The scenery is pretty nice for a game of its age. I was particularly fond of the sunflowers.

Then there's the bad...
The controls are a mess. Pulling up the correct menu never felt right, so I ended up unintentionally forming a habit of opening my quest log to access everything else, which flooded my screen with a bunch of windows. Moving around is strange. Invisible wall collisions happen so often that they nearly caused the death of me multiple times. If you're trying to do ANYTHING in build mode, you can't rotate the camera. If you try, you exit build mode... that is just... mind boggling...
Progress is explicitly limited to your little safe zone you started in. Fences within range of enemies WILL be destroyed, so you can never truly claim an area for yourself and spread outward. It really puts a damper on the "taming nature" vibe I think the game was going for, and it makes it very difficult to venture out beyond a daylight's worth of distance from base camp. Maybe this is what the larger walls were for, but those were so resource-heavy that I didn't get to it during the 10 hours I spent playing it... partially because...
Enemies respawn when the game loads. This means no matter how much I tried to push back the tide, they always came back and attacked anything I tried to build beyond my safety wall of trees. And if a bear happened to spawn anywhere near my openings in the brush, I couldn't go that way. Even after upgrading my gear multiple times, I could not win against a bear.

Again, I really wanted to like this game. It's an older game at this point, and it looks like they have a sequel out. Hopefully they learned a lot from making this game and used it to make an even better one. This one had enough potential that I'm willing to give the next a try sometime in the future. But if you're on the fence about getting this particular one, I'd personally say it's not really worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1705776113}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
I just feels unfinished... I bought this game years ago, looked cute, but it feels like someone tried and gave up on making their first video game. It's very clunky, the controls aren't great, there are a lot of mechanics missing that I feel are fairly standard in survival games at this point in time. 


Then I see there's a second one? We couldn't just finish the first one? Disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986208088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 3511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2248, 'last_played': 1704996256}
review:
Good game if you wanna relax without time pressure or survival stats.
Quests make you build/use almost everything at least once and progression requires better gear and battle movement timing/trickery. Battle is simple, click = hit. Crafting and using healing items is recommended.
Reopening the game teleports you back to your base and respawns all mobs in the world, though you can build portals anywhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561199061794677', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1700828784}
review:
自由度がないね。
サバイバルゲームを始めてするような人には親切設計かもしれないけど、熟練者たちからすれば、規制が多いだけのこのゲームは面白味に欠けるだろうね。
要求してくるコストもそれなりだし、かといって強くなるわけでもない。
レベルによるアンロックシステムは邪魔でしかないし、どうせ作れないなら、全ての資源を周囲に置いてても全く問題ないわけで、探索させるメリットすら意味をなしていない気がする。
サバイバルゲームしたことがないような人が、ビックネームと差別化を図ろうと画策したのだろうが、どうやら知能指数が相当低い事が判明されただけのゲームだね。

author: {'steamid': '76561199208037935', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1952, 'last_played': 1697920391}
review:
в начале думала, что купила какую-то дичь. 

графика и управление первые 5 минут разочаровывали, а потом начался геймплей. 
первый запуск подарил 7 часов веселой добычи бананов, кокосов, прокачки и исследования мира. 
карту открыла не всю, но мир кажется довольно большим. биомы разные и на каждый нужен свой шмот.
хочу отметить приятные саундтреки завязанные на локации.
КООП:
в коопе все получают уровень хоста (я была 8, тиммейт 3. на моем сервере оба 8). 
умер 1 игрок=умерли все. 
так же в коопе не респавнятся мобы после сна и золотишко/мясо/шкуру не добыть.
упираешься в край карты и не можешь дотянуться до вожделенной шкурки или растения.
мой тиммейт фармил пшеницу на базе, а я уничтожила все живое на карте и было грустно, что дяди медведи не нападают, чтобы отдать шкуру на новый сет одежды.

в общем: много гринда, нападают толпой и делают смертельно больно, шкур нужно много, да и всего нужно д0xy@. 

игра хорошая. разрабы большие молодцы. советую к прохождению

author: {'steamid': '76561198012504050', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1717, 'last_played': 1697890595}
review:
Probably the worst grind in any game i ever played in my twenty years of playing games. The only saving grace is the co op and somewhat chill atmosphere.

+ Can be calming, its nice to just talk with your friend while you chop down trees and work on the main objective little by little, laughing at how bad the game is.

+ Progression is decent, you always know what you need to do and there is always something around the corner for you to keep going.
+ Nice graphics overall.
+ Quite a bit of content like gathering, building, crafting, fighting, alchemy, exploring
+ Co op mode
+ Runs well
+ Picking off enemies can be interesting

- THE GRIND, everyone already talks about this. It is insane. If i didnt play it with two other people in co op mode i would have never played this kind of game. Everything takes ages - not only does everything take a lot of materials but it just takes time to craft everything. 
- View distance is terrible, just like Morrowind from twenty years ago.
- Game is split into regions, your friends and you have to be in the same region which is annoying when some of you want to explore and others craft in the home base.
- enemies can destroy your base very quickly. There is only one spot to build a safe base and that is in the starting zone.
- Ending is terrible. You spend twenty to thirty hours to finally get the Force of Nature and you just get a pop up text box saying "Congratulations!". What a letdown.
- Combat is very basic, archery is super bad. Scorpions are very annoying to deal with.
- Enemy variety is strange. It is a mash of random enemies from some 3D store (goblins and undead are fighting together?)


Buy this only if you have a patience and couple good friends. Otherwise stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372167695', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1650, 'last_played': 1697403051}
review:
Points positifs : 

- Jeu vraiment chill et sympathique
- Possibilité de jouer à plusieurs
- Craft et exploration agréables :)


Points négatifs : 

- Le jeu crash très mais TRÈS souvent, que l'on joue seul ou en coop, ceci est très frustrant...Sachant que lorsqu'on relance, bah...les mobs sont revenus aussi et c'est reparti pour du nettoyage :< (le lit est cool pour cela mais ne sert à rien dans ces conditions). Le jeu crash dès fois au lancement d'une partie multi, d'un chargement de carte ou d'une téléportation avec un allié.

- Multijoueur : Les joueurs alliés ne peuvent pas monter le niveau d'eux-même, c'est à l'hôte de le faire, il n'y a pas moyen de faire une partie privatisé (mais bon, le multi étant en bêta, c'est un point négatif qui devrait se régler avec le temps même si le deux est sorti xD). On ne peut pas se téléporter sans forcer l'allié à nous suivre, ce que je trouve dommage car l'un ne peut donc pas explorer pendant que l'autre fait du craft ou de la culture à la base.

- Le gobelin dompté n'attaque pas si on ne lui demande pas de nous suivre et on peut en avoir qu'un. Je trouve ça dommage car ça aurait été cool d'en avoir pour défendre la base d'éventuels envahisseurs (j'ai eu un renard qui a couru à côté de lui sans que celui-ci ne se dise "il tape la base" xD). Lors de crash d'ailleurs, il reste là où on a eu le crash et le temps de le rejoindre, il se fait tuer...D'ailleurs un gobelin niveau 3 qui se fait dégommer par des gobelins niveau 1, pas compris...

Résumé : Très bon jeu mais présentant de sérieux problèmes d'équilibre au niveau du jeu (crash intempestifs), c'est dommage car il a du potentiel...Je continuerais d'y jouer car le jeu me plait bien mais il se peut que je l'abandonne un jour pour cette raison vraiment agaçante...Du coup je vais quand même voter "non" pour la recommandation car c'est un point vraiment désagréable mais qui, une fois réglé, je repasserais en "oui".

author: {'steamid': '76561198084405844', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1694033389}
review:
Creo que ha envejecido mal este juego. Seguro que en su día estaría mejor pero ahora es un coñazo horrible. Algunos puntos muy malos:

- No puedes correr. De locos.
- El inventario es un desastre. Tiene un botón de "ordenar" pero lo único que hace es apiñarlos sin orden ni concierto. Y como los iconos son tan pequeños, es un jaleo.
- No se puede automatizar prácticamente nada.
- La jardinería es un infierno. Tienes que estar súper encima para cosechar porque tarda muy poco y tienes que estar todo el rato replantando uno a uno cada uno de los cultivos.
- Con un pozo sacas 6 de agua cada rato. Pero 6 máximo. Y cada cultivo requiere 1 de agua. Así que si pones 6 cultivos, vas justo, porque además sale al mismo ritmo más o menos. Pero además la comida necesita también agua a veces... así que está desbalanceado. El jardín debería poder regarse automáticamente.
- El combate es ultra básico. Dejas el botón pulsado para pegar y te estás echando comida para recuperar y ya está.


Y bueno, 20 cosas más que paso de poner. De verdad, este juego no merece más tiempo de mi vida

review: Very good and addictive survival game.  Progression/leveling makes sense and is fair to the player.  Controls are intuitive and stupid easy, especially if you take  a few seconds to review the key bindings in the control menu.   Collecting resources and crafting is a major part of the game but is mixed in beautifully with combat and exploration.  You will enjoy crafting your way to becoming a force of nature.  Well worth the full purchase price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080079579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1690732255}
review:
This game looked to be quite exciting but there is no aspect of it that makes any iota of sense with regards to gameplay. The grind is excessive from the get-go, the battle system is terrible, and even starting the game you're left with enemies you don't stand a chance of defeating so literally have to sit back and let your character die, losing all of the resources you spent hours grinding for.

The "leveling up" is useless, as it requires extra "resources" to do so, which doesn't make any sense. The graphics would look at home on a first gen playstation and the control system is nonsensical. You have to hold the space bar and click to pick things up (after getting multiple messages that you aren't close enough). It's part sim and part 3rd person battle game, but it does neither well and just ends up being tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053927326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8908, 'last_played': 1691344044}
review:
The game is a fairly simple crafting/survival game, played entirely in the third-person viewpoint. 
The premise of the game is fairly typical of the genre: you basically arrive naked on a huge deserted island populated with  wildlife and monsters, the majority of which will attack you on sight. Your goal is to explore the island, gather resources and craft the items you need to survive, while protecting yourself from the creatures that attack you. The strength and number of enemies increases as you travel further out from your tropical beach starting point, and environmental hardships such as heat, cold and darkness, as well as character status hardships such as health and fatigue, are also part of the game. The leveling process is contingent on reaching various goals, such as crafting newly unlocked items, finding specific resources, or collecting set amounts of different drop-items (such as coins or gems) from defeated enemies. Building a camp is mandatory, since crafting some items (such as a crafting table), which can only be placed inside a structure such as a hut or dugout, are required for level progression. 

Players can pleasantly pass a few hours exploring the island and building a camp, but this can quickly become very tedious once the character has progressed through the first half dozen character levels, as each level requires greater and great effort, which often results in longer periods of grinding and hunting for required items. It should be noted that the ability to craft an item is level-restrictive, which can be very frustrating. 

The last game patch was Oct 14, 2021. 

Final thoughts: 
Because Steam only allows a yes/no vote for recommending a game, I am giving this game a "YES" vote, although I feel it should be more of a "MAYBE" vote. Although completely playable and a fair time-killer in general, the off-balance leveling system, lack of better late-game progression, unfinished feel (for example, maracas shown in the game trailer mesmerizing enemies have no function in the actual game), and lack of polished features such as being able to label containers makes this game progressively less enjoyable to play once your character has advanced past the first half dozen levels. However, the simplistic nature of the game mechanics, large playable game area, and (as of this writing) under $10 (USD) cost may make some players feel that this game is a bargain for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452644430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1689014714}
review:
Enemies run away when at low health which is worthy of a negative reviews by itself, 
enemies are faster than you so when they start to run away its extremely unlikely you actually get that kill, which means you lose health for nothing. terrible for a survival game
enemies do not de-aggro when you run away from them, which means if you cant kill something its a guaranteed death for you. 
one player dying in multiplayer results in all players "dying"

author: {'steamid': '76561198074758062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1688915062}
review:
Czy polecam? Tak, ale...
Gra ma potencjał: crafting, szukanie i znajdowanie rozwiązań, budowa.
Niemniej jak ktoś pisał - zbierać można tylko podczas otwartego okna ekwipunku (strasznie uciążliwe) bez otwartego okna nie widać co można zbierać zatem idziesz i szukasz po kształtach. Dalej - faktycznie podczas zbierania poruszasz się tylko przód, tył i boki. Nie ma szans rozejrzeć się za pomocą myszki. Nie wiem jeszcze jak z odzyskiem materiałów (ktoś pisał że drzew nie można siać).
Są to rzeczy irytujące ale nie niszczące gry, I jestem pewien że można by było je wyeliminować, tylko że .... stworzono force of nature II i ta część została na becie....
Tak niewiele trzeba żeby ta część była małym cudeńkiem.... Może ktoś kiedyś dokona tych poprawek

author: {'steamid': '76561198259339768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2166, 'last_played': 1688993415}
review: C'est bien la première fois que je vois un jeu de ce style où farmer ne sert strictement à rien. J'appelle ça jouer dans le vent, tout est long et lent que ce soit au niveau du craft, de la progression, du personnage... Le jeu ne mérite pas ses 7e et des brouettes et heureusement que je l'ai acheté à 1e et quelques. Après 36h de jeu sans parler des multis crashs surtout en multi, j'ai eu énormément de patience mais là je pense lâcher le steak et non le steak haché...

author: {'steamid': '76561198154004822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 4836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4836, 'last_played': 1688567485}
review:
[b] Ein schönes Sandboxgame, das leider nach dem guten Start sehr langweilig wird.  [/b] 

[h1] Pro: [/h1] 
- Sehr große Welt
- Einfach, aber schönes RPG, Rohstoffe sammeln, Sachen craften, Level aufsteigen
- Einige Biome, auch wenn diese teilweise zu groß für dieses Spiel sind

[h1] Kontra: [/h1] 
- Spiel stürzt oft ab, wenn man in einen neuen Kartenbereich kommt
- wenn es nicht abstürzt, ruckelt es dafür ordentlich
- je weiter man auf der Karte kommt, desto schlimmer wird es und der Ton wird ebenso schlimmer, der ruckelt dann auch
- wenn man ein neues Biom findet, kommt gute Musik, warum gibt es sonst keine Melodie in dem Spiel?
- der Gegnerspawn ist zum Kotzen, kaum bist du weg spawnen immer mehr Gegner und du musst alle besiegen, denn die sind schneller als du und machen dir ordentlich Schaden

[h1] Für Erfolgsjäger: [/h1]   
94% gut machbar. Der letzte Erfolg ist für ein Hardcore Spiel. Durch die Steuerung und den Immensen Schaden selbst durch kleine Gegner echt schwer.

[h1] Fazit[/h1]
Ich liebe diese Art von Spielen und auch hier, obwohl es so klein und ich sag mal billig ist, konnte ich 60 Stunden beim ersten Spieldurchlauf verbringen. 

Warum empfehle ich es nicht, wo es alles hat, was mein Herz höher schlagen lässt? Crafting, Coop, erkunden, Farmelemente, Tiere, Kampf, Levelsystem und eine große offene Welt?!

Wie gesagt es ist schön, aber leider auch nervig. Gerade das man immer jeden Gegner besiegen muss, diese viel zu oft spawnen und man teilweise stundenlang zum nächsten Ziel dadurch unterwegs ist, zieht das Spiel ganz schön in die Länge ohne Spannung aufzubauen. Im Co-op geht es noch, weil man die Gegner zusammen verhauen kann, aber alleine...
Hinzu kommen die dauernden Abstürze und das die Musik nur einmal kurz in einem neuen Biom spielt und man sonst die ganze Zeit nur Soundeffekte hat. 
Explodiert bin ich dann, als ich im Hardcore Modus zwei Mal fast fertig war und jedes Mal bei der letzten Scherbe beim teleportieren das Spiel abgestürzt ist und ich dadurch angeblich gestorben bin...

author: {'steamid': '76561198273844451', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6290, 'last_played': 1706625970}
review:
Title: A Breathtaking Adventure in the Natural World: Force of Nature Review

Rating: ★★★★★

Force of Nature is a mesmerizing video game that transports players into a vibrant and immersive world of nature. From the moment I started playing, I was captivated by the game's stunning visuals, enchanting soundtrack, and engaging gameplay mechanics. This review is a testament to the incredible experience that Force of Nature offers.

One of the game's standout features is its breathtaking graphics. The attention to detail in the environment is simply astounding. The lush forests, cascading waterfalls, and diverse wildlife create an atmosphere that feels alive and teeming with beauty. Whether I was exploring dense jungles or climbing towering mountains, the graphics never failed to leave me in awe.

The soundtrack of Force of Nature deserves special mention. The game's musical score perfectly complements the natural setting, enhancing the sense of wonder and adventure. Each track seamlessly blends with the gameplay, making every moment feel epic and magical. The combination of visuals and music truly elevates the gaming experience to new heights.

What sets Force of Nature apart from other games is its unique gameplay mechanics. As a player, you have the freedom to shape and interact with the environment, making every decision feel consequential. Whether I was building my own shelter, crafting tools, or cultivating a garden, I felt a deep sense of satisfaction and accomplishment. The game strikes a perfect balance between exploration, resource management, and survival, keeping me engaged for hours on end.

Moreover, the game offers a variety of activities and quests to undertake. From hunting mythical creatures to uncovering ancient mysteries, Force of Nature never fails to surprise and delight. The sense of discovery and the constant urge to explore every nook and cranny of the world kept me hooked, always eager to uncover the next secret or encounter a new challenge.

Another commendable aspect of Force of Nature is the developer's commitment to regular updates and improvements. The dedication to addressing player feedback and introducing new content shows a genuine passion for the game and its community. It's refreshing to see a game that continues to evolve and grow, ensuring that players always have something new and exciting to experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206636800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3127, 'last_played': 1677338701}
review: 6 sene önce çıkmış bir oyun olmasına rağmen bir ya da birden fazla arkadaşınızla co-op olarak hala çok keyif alarak oynayabileceğiniz bir hayatta kalma oyunu. Oyundaki görevler sizi sürekli bir amaç içerisinde tutarak kesintisiz bir oynanış deneyimi sunuyor. Oyunda iklim sistemi (üşümek, sıcaklamak gibi) de dahil olmak üzere birçok sayıda loot ve craft yapmaya imkan tanıyan bir işleyiş söz konusu. Craft süreleri bazen uzun olabiliyor, sıkıldığınız zamanlar olabilir ama eğer siz instagramda dolaşırken craftları ona kitleyebileceğiniz enayi bir arkadaşınızla oynuyorsanız bunu dert etmenize gerek yok. Popüler oyunların dışına çıkmak ve farklı bir serüvene dalmak isterseniz bir şans verin derim.

review: 游戏估计可以，又有中文，推荐。202211下，t a o宝，支付宝红包，杉果，本平台，本平台充值折扣掉卡，indie gala，fanatical，humble，daily indie game，loot boy，它处自定义包入的本体约3元。爱人如己，目前就这，看以后追评。有中文的游戏请耐心自研体验乐趣，攻略指南尽量不用。不建议使用外挂，插件，作弊之类的，游戏都要这样搞，那现实里那更是如此了。兄弟萌，强烈建议不要第三方平台的小店买y u额，通过饰品等挂steam市场转的，高概率red信乃至封号，且行且珍惜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198379926805', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1546056023}
review:
▬▬▬ГРАФИКА▬▬▬

☐ 1 - Можешь не покупать виар очки, ты и так не отличишь эту игру от реальности
☐ 2 - Очень красивый графоний, если выпить пивка, то будешь кайфовать на 100%
☐ 3 - Вполне неплохо, квадратных сисек ты тут не увидишь 
☐ 4 - Не так хорошо как хотелось бы, но лучше среднестатистической инди игры на unity
☑ 5 - Если у тебя есть проблемы с глазами, то лучше не играть в это
☐ 6 – Рекомендуется к прохождению только если ты незрячий 

                                                            ▬▬▬ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ▬▬▬

☐ 1 - Затягивает на многие часы
☐ 2 - Тебя отругает твоя мама за то, что будешь залипать в эту игру всю ночь
☐ 3 - Не самая лучшая игра в плане геймплея, но он тут не так важен
☑ 4 - Игра на пару вечеров с друзьями 
☐ 5 - Читать книги интереснее чем играть в это
☐ 6 - Алкоголизм будет веселее чем геймплей в этой игре

                                                            ▬▬▬АУДИО▬▬▬

☐ 1 – Поставил саундреки отсюда на рингтон телефона
☐ 2 – Идеально вписывающаяся музыка и звуки в общую картину игры
☐ 3 – Выше среднего
☐ 4 – Вполне неплохо, но Моргенштерн определенно пукнул в звуковую дорожку
☑ 5 – Саунды и звуки делала куча пьяных рок металлистов
☐ 6 – Первый раз скажу это, но слушать песни Тимати приятнее чем аудио в этой игре

                                                            ▬▬▬ТЕХ.ТРЕБОВАНИЯ▬▬▬

☐ 1 – Запуститься даже на кнопочном телефоне
☐ 2 – Если поставить икону рядом с ПК, то можно будет запустить на ультрах
☑ 3 – Пойдет даже на средних ПК
☐ 4 – Может быть запустится на средних настройках 
☐ 5 – Даже не думай убирать настройки с минималок
☐ 6 – Говорят, что даже Илон Маск не смог запустить эту игру на своем ПК

                                                           ▬▬▬АТМОСФЕРА▬▬▬

☐ 1 – В этой игре идеальная атмосфера, утонешь в ней и забудешь про реальную жизнь
☐ 2 – Прекрасная атмосфера, заставляющая тебя раз за разом заходить в игру
☐ 3 – Хорошее погружение, но до идеала далеко
☐ 4 – Вполне неплохо, но полного погружения ты не почувствуешь никогда
☑ 5 – Чтобы получить что-то атмосферное в этой игре, придется искать 1000 лет 
☐ 6 – Атмосфера убита в хлам


                                                           ▬▬▬СЛОЖНОСТЬ▬▬▬

☐ 1 – Сложнее этой игры может быть только переубедить маму, что ты не курил, а на тебя надышали в подъезде
☐ 2 – Высшее образование в этой игре тебе не поможет
☐ 3 – Просто жать 2 кнопки здесь не получится
☐ 4 – Есть пара сложных моментов, но особо запариваться не придется
☑ 5 – Пройдет даже твой пятилетний брат
☐ 6 – Если у тебя есть 2 руки, то игра покажется тебе прогулкой по осеннему саду

                                                         ▬▬▬СЮЖЕТ▬▬▬

☐ 1 – Поздравляю, вы нашли игру, в которой лор лучше чем твоя жизнь
☐ 2 – Придется смотреть теории и много часов потратить на изучение истории мира
☐ 3 – Неплохо, если хочется легкого чтива и незамысловатой истории, то игра идеальна
☐ 4 – Есть пара интересных моментов, но вау эффекта тут нет
☑ 5 – Лев Толстой курит от такой скукотищи 
☐ 6 – Ты просто скипнешь все диалоги. Зачем вообще играть в это? Тут есть сиськи? 

                                                            ▬▬▬ЦЕНА▬▬▬

☐ 1 – Игра бесплатная
☐ 2 – Дешевле только закупаться в ашане
☐ 3 – Если ты студент, то игра заботится о твоем кошельке
☐ 4 – За свои деньги оправдывает ожидания, а если по скидке, то вообще огонь
☑ 5 – Если ты хочешь зря потратить деньги, то пиши мне в личку, кину номер карты
☐ 6 – Игра не стоит ни рубля, хотя стоит как твоя почка

                                                           ▬▬▬ОПТИМИЗАЦИЯ▬▬▬

☐ 1 – Никаких багов, фризов и прочей фигни
☐ 2 – Фризы настолько редкие, что ты подумаешь, что это ты моргнул
☐ 3 -  Изредко лагает, но это не так критично
☑ 4 – Баги заметны и иногда мешают, но со временем ты привыкнешь
☐ 5 – Assasin's Creed Unity курит в сторонке
☐ 6 – Играть в это невозможно даже на мощном ПК, разрабы забили на оптимизацию


                                                     ▬▬▬ОБЩИЙ ИТОГ▬▬▬

☐ 1 – Игра идеальна по всем параметрам
☐ 2 – Чуть чуть не дотянула до игры года
☐ 3 – Эта игра станет одной из твоих любимых
☐ 4 – Ты будешь возвращаться в эту игру спустя годы и наслаждаться ей
☐ 5 – Хорошая и вполне интересная игра
☐ 6 – Чуть ниже среднего
☑ 7 - Игра буквально на одно прохождение
☐ 8 – Игра не достойна твоего внимания, если ты не извращенец
☐ 9 – Одна из игр, про которую ты пытаешься забыть навсегда
☐ 10 – Ужасная игра, если ты купил её, то друзья отвернуться от тебя, а мама сдаст в детдом


                                                   ▬▬▬ЛИЧНОЕ МНЕНИЕ▬▬▬

Как по мне, очередная недо поделка, имеющая сотни аналогов, однозначно не стоящая твоего внимания


                                                                   ▬▬▬P.S. ▬▬▬

Если ты читаешь это, то ты просмотрел этот обзор до конца, хотелось бы попросить тебя поставить ему оценку и если тебе не сложно, то наградить, спасибо тебе и удачи

author: {'steamid': '76561198289985235', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1681855214}
review:
El juego esta bueno y entretiene si buscas jugar relax para pasar el rato, es progresivo con sistema de niveles al completar misiones para desbloquear recetas, tiene tameo simple pero bueno, se ve bonito y al inicio es bastante entretenido pero tiene unos cuantos problemas.

-Es de progresión lenta, esto podría ser bueno o malo depende del jugador pero yo creo que esta forzado a ser muy lento.
-El combate es malo mecánicamente, literalmente tanquear daño al inicio mientras comes o caminar hacia atrás mientras comes y atacas si ya tienes una espada y quizá intentar darle un flechazo al zorro que se escapa
-Es un juego survival que no te condiciona con nada mas que las temperaturas en los biomas, literal no necesitas beber agua, la comida solo te cura, ningun evento aleatorio de raid, etc. es claramente para jugar relax y esto puede ser tanto bueno como malo
-Es un juego viejo y por lo tanto es normal sufrir crasheos, a mi el juego en 8 horas se me abra cerrado unas 4 veces, creo que es cuando carga nuevos biomas.

author: {'steamid': '76561199160000358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1694928096}

review:
So far this looks like a really fun survival/building game. There are things that are a little clunky...like combat. The tutorial definitely leaves a lot to be desired. And why do foxes attack people? Do they just all have rabies? 

Overall I'm glad I found this and have been enjoying myself. I just get really frustrated when I die and lose a whole bunch of things that were hard to get or took a long time to make...

author: {'steamid': '76561198043314158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1675566842}
review:
This is normally not my choice of game, but I purchased it to play in coop with my girlfriend.
For me, this game is just boring. I simply will never play it alone.
However, I have played it a bit with my girl and it's ok in coop.

[h3] +Pros [/h3]
+The game doesn't crash.
+Easy to use crafting system
+Relaxing theme.
+Very low system requirements.
+No gore, cursing, or vulgarity of any sort that I have seen. It's fine for kids.

[h3] -Cons [/h3]
-Bizarre player camera.
-Time consuming crafting.
-No real direction or story. It's clearly a game developer's experiment.

5/10 Not good, not bad. Grab 2 copies on sale to play with a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3232, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1646074034}
review:
Force of Nature, Crescent Moon Games tarafından geliştirilen ve yayınlanan bir açık dünya hayatta kalma oyunudur. Oyuncular, vahşi doğada hayatta kalmak için kaynak toplamalı, avlanmalı, inşa etmeli ve araştırmalıdır. Oyun, geniş bir dünya haritası, çeşitli öğeler ve silahlar, keşif fırsatları, zorlu düşmanlar ve dinamik hava koşulları gibi birçok özellik içermektedir.

Oyunda, oyuncular bir karakter seçerler ve dünyayı keşfetmek, malzemeler toplamak ve binalar inşa etmek için etrafta dolaşırlar. Oyuncular ayrıca çeşitli hayvanları avlayabilir, çiftçilik yapabilir ve bitkileri yetiştirebilirler. Bunların yanı sıra, oyuncular diğer karakterlerle de etkileşime girebilir, ticaret yapabilir veya işbirliği yapabilirler.

Oyunun en büyük özelliklerinden biri, dinamik hava koşullarıdır. Yağmur, kar ve fırtına gibi farklı hava koşulları oyuncuların hayatta kalmasını etkileyebilir. Oyuncuların, barınaklarını ve diğer yapılarını bu zorlu koşullara göre inşa etmeleri gerekebilir.

Oyuncular, birinci şahıs veya üçüncü şahıs görünümü kullanarak oynayabilirler. Ayrıca oyuncular, çevrimiçi olarak diğerleriyle oynayabilirler.

Force of Nature, geniş dünya haritası, çeşitli özellikler ve zorlu düşmanlar gibi birçok özelliği ile hayatta kalma oyunları sevenler için ideal bir seçenektir. Oyunun keşif, macera ve inşa etme unsurları, oyuncuları saatlerce meşgul edebilir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114286389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1678931284}
review:
[후기]
https://youtu.be/0E466nfa7zA
노가다 장인들을 위한 멋진 노가다 게임!
노가다로 시작해서 노가다로 끝이나지만
매 레벨업시 새로운 장비,음식 그리고 지을거리 등이
생겨나다보니 저도 모르게 계속하게되는 그런 게임이었습니다.
물론 그렇다고 개재밌다 이런건 아니었고,
딱 8천원대 값어치에 준하는 재미였던거같네요.
우선 스토리 그딴것도 없습니다.
그냥 시작하자마자 메인퀘스트를 따라 진행하시다보면
여러분 집과 생산시설, 농장, 도구 그리고 장비들이
하나하나 생겨날것입니다. 
근데 이 메인퀘스트들은 매 레벨마다 
3,4개씩 한정되어있기때문에,
다음 퀘스트 진행을 위해서는
레벨업에 필요한 요구사항들을 충족시키고
레벨업을 꼭 해주셔야됩니다.
문제는 그러는 과정이 진짜 엄청난 노가다...
추후 동물들을 길들여 자원을 생산하고
고블린을 내편으로 만들어 용병으로
데리고 다닐 수 있는 등 점점 삶이 편해지기는 한데, 
어쨋든 이 게임은 친구랑 함께해야 
훨씬 편하고 빠른 플레이가 가능할것같네요.
뭐 저야 혼자서도 충분히 재미있게 플레이했지만
하는동안 제 원형탈모가 짙어진거에 대해서는
누굴 탓 할 수가 없었습니다.

[단점들]
제가 이 게임을하면서 가장 힘들었던 부분은
좁은 인벤토리, 불편한 조작법, 개느린 이동속도
정도를 꼽아볼 수 있었는데, 뭐 이로 인해 이 게임이
노가다 게임이된게 아닐까 싶네요.
계속하다보면 중간중간
"이게 도대체 내 인생에 무슨 도움이 된다고 이 노가다를 해야하나?"
라는 생각에 잠길때가 많았던거같습니다.

[팁]
전투하다 죽으면 템들 개많이 잃기때문에
죽을거같으면 바로 esc눌러서 일시정지시키고
게임 종료 누른뒤 새로 접속하면
기지에서 아무일 없었다는 듯 다시 깨어납니다.

[결론]
저는 14시간째 즐기고있는데 아직 3분에2도 못끝냈습니다.
제가 볼때 총플탐 20시간이상은 족히나올거같네요.
이 게임은 할인을 자주해서 1700원에
구매할 수 있는 기회가 자주 오지만, 
솔직히 정가 8천원 값어치도 충분하기에
저는 정가에도 추천할만한거같네요.
(원래 2편을 더 추천하고싶지만 그건 한글이안됨..)

author: {'steamid': '76561198011795188', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1672889909}
review:
It's grindy and unstable, but then again I got it for less than a buck.

Wouldn't suggest you get it at full price, but it may be worth it if heavily discounted.

Get ready to repeat the same task 100x over the course of hours, chase mobs who can outrun you until they get stuck for menial amounts of resources, and generally be stuck for far too long on the same level while you wait for something to craft or go on 5 minute chases of goblins / any other random mob for 1 coin/pelt (50 needed).

author: {'steamid': '76561198368792341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1672281660}
review: No running maniac, aggro more than 3 enemies and you die. To get clothing, you do 5 million things first, so you spend over half the game naked. Traps DO NOT WORK!!!!! I had several instances where my traps were dead on and they would just break over the animals. Once a trap is gone, it's gone. There aren't a lot of animals to trap, so you have to travel a far distance to find them, then when you do, the traps break then the animal runs so far, you end up aggroing all the baddies. This game was 85 cents and I see why. When you die, you lose a lot of items, your inventory holds more than a damn barrel. Craftables are too expensive for what they are and the 'tech tree' is focusing on all the wrong things in early game. Clothes, food, and shelter should be the first 3 fundamentals of any survival game. More animals, better traps, and less aggro on the enemies would be helpful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285905133', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1672464356}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061908784', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1672001793}
review:
Another great concept game in open world survival.  The problem is the tedious tasks you need to do in order to advance to the next level.  When you get the the fifth level, the character requires gold bars to advance.  The only way to find gold in this stage is to chase goblins that randomly drop coins.  This nonsense could go on for two hours chasing goblins.  Sometimes the goblin will run away and there is not run command for the character to chase them down.  
The combat is simple, the character can only attack.  No block, no dodge.  I really need to have a more rewarding outcome to chase goblins.  Also, it seems to unlock better weapons takes many levels of doing the same stupid tedious tasks of chasing goblins.  
This was as painful as jumping on a bicycle with the seat missing. For 79c, I guess you can see and be the judge.

author: {'steamid': '76561199174853497', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 3066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1675432155}
review:
Great little open-world crafting & survival game.  You start out on a beach in nothing but a pair of pants, like you've been shipwrecked or something.  Starting quests are the simple stuff (find a good stick to dig with, tie a stick to a sharp stone to make a knife, build a fire, etc.).  You move up to things like build a straw hut, chop down trees, forge metals out of ore, and grow some crops.  Eventually you have to fight other creatures like goblins, bears, and foxes.

The crafting and building menus are very complex and very numerous.  Sometimes when I need to craft an item, I find it hard to remember which "station" I need to be at in order to craft that item (the fire, the anvil, the forge, etc.).  Animals like rabbits and chickens are very hard to catch and kill in the open.  Trapping animals is a pain as the traps often don't work.  And combat is as plain vanilla as you can get.  Simply click on your enemy repeatedly until either they, or you, die.

Biggest gripes?  Firstly, when you die, you lose a lot of the items in your inventory.  It's the penalty for dying, I guess.  Secondly,  resources don't grow back or respawn, so you have to play conservatively.  For example, once you shake all the coconuts off a tree, they don't grow back.  And if you cut the tree down, it doesn't grow back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151613539', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1658109898}
review: I don't remember what encouraged me to buy this game but I'm glad that I did. The game really encourages you to explore and go deeper into the map which is very helpful for me, someone who would be perfectly content staying in one spot for an entire game. The crafting and materials needed are simplistic and creative and the fighting mechanics are very easy to get the hang of. The further you upgrade and level up you crafting, the more you have to work it. The development of crafting vs outside threats is very well balanced in my opinion and I have a great time when I discover something new. If you like survivals with vibes of nuance, I'd recommend giving this game a fair shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198344000909', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4098, 'last_played': 1666974281}
review:
不知道什么时候入库的游戏，2022年7月27日闲来无事从游戏库里刨了出来，断断续续地玩到了当年10月28日，说长不长说短不短的三个月，游戏时长57H，把游戏通关了，当提示我造出了自然之力，可以开新局或者继续游戏的时候，就突然感觉像是什么任务完成的感觉，心定了下来，也仿佛是有什么一直恋恋不忘的东西丢失了一样，一时间不知道下一步做什么，而这时，游戏里的天也刚好黑了下来，游戏里的雨淅淅沥沥的下，我操纵着浑身武装的小人在初始地乱逛，看看自己养的鸡和猪，成箱成桶的物品，一言难尽。到了13级什么建筑物也都建过了之后，游戏其实也没有什么可玩的了，告一段落的我便在最后观光之后卸载了游戏。这个游戏内容并不算多，但很像是水经验的吧友，或者是水字数的作家，强行增加游戏时长：比如给所有制作东西都加上了时间，增加前期物品获取难度，体力消耗极其快，所以如果不是淡定无聊的人很可能玩不下去；另外，游戏难度也比较大，打怪也毫无技巧可言，闪避走位可以说几乎毫无用处。所以这游戏建议在史低时入手，闲的没事的时候挂挂机。这游戏极其小众，各大平台都难以找到攻略，不过在steam指南有大佬已经写好了攻略：https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1360952376。
之前问大佬问题，大佬也耐心回复，赞一个。

author: {'steamid': '76561198118433433', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 44027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1670605592}
review:
Не знаю зачем купил это но по дешевке взял, я люблю играть во всякое странное.

Минусы:
-боевка фиговая, простое закликивание кто передамажит
-камера не удобная
-гринд лютейший
-беготня скучная, медленная и с каждым разом все дальше, есть конечно порталы но забыв песок для него, в джунгях я его так и не нашел что бы построить и не бежать обратно
-ни сюжета ничего нет

Сомнительные плюсы:
+-простенькая графика пойдет на ведре
+-не самое плохое звуковое оформление

Из реальных плюсов увы только:
+цена (купил с купоном за 22 pуб)

Сама по себе игра никакая, просто гринд ради гринда, мне кажется будь у меня навыки, я бы сделал лучше.
Если включить cheat engine и перестать гриндить хлам, дюпая его, вечерок можно посидеть посмотреть на довольно скудный контент игры. 

Рекомендую игру только очень странным людям которым нечего делать и которым может зайти игра, я в нее наиграл немало, так что по соотношению потраченные деньги/проведённое время= сойдет.

Надеюсь получив мои деньги разработчик сделает что то более достойное или поправит уже имеющееся

author: {'steamid': '76561198282416852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1665907048}
review:
The developer has moved on so should you.

Essential resources such as wood do not respawn, which is a huge minus for such a grind based game.

The developer's description of a creative mode is nothing but a sad excuse.

The developer's reasons for not having a cheat engine or console command system is a false moral dilemma which in the end is another friggin sad excuse.

There are beings with full claims of sentient intelligence within the community who's solution to a nonexistent creative mode is a trainer program which is behind a paywall.

Skip. Don't look back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974520194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1665701528}
review:
Found this game hiding in my library I must have picked up some time ago un-played. Thought I would give it a shot, and yikes. Terrible building mechanics and options? Check.

Survival type game with no survival elements? Check. Invisible walls as far as the eye can see? Check. Lame "combat?" Check.

I played up through level five and what a painful experience. It looks like there may be some more interesting things to make later, but I am still stuck with the same boring stone equipment with no tangible upgrades or skills.

Saying the combat is lame is an understatement. It consists of trading blows with your enemy using your choice of clubs, with no dodging, skills, or other abilities. To make it even worse, half the enemies run away when close to death, with your slow half run speed you have no chance to catch them. Good luck using rocks throw and finish them off too.

The exploration consists of cutting through trees and bushes to open up a path. Most of the time you chop for several minutes using up all your stamina only to find a small raised outcropping blocks your path. Your character can't move down an even slightly inclined grade.

Stay away from this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561199080515268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3758, 'last_played': 1684357550}
review:
이 게임은 내가 찾던 최고의 게임에 매우 근접하다.
나는, 귀여운 캐릭터들이 
내 마음대로, 내가 원하는곳에 건물을 만들고 마을을 만들수있고
필드에있는 대부분의 모든 아이템을 수집하고 사냥하며 
그 수집한 아이템으로 물건을 만들고, 농사를 하며
동물들을 납치해, 키운 농작물을 주어 아이템을 얻는
 힐링게임을 찾고있었다. 음악도 힐링된다.
이 게임은 귀엽지는않지만 나름대로 동물들은 귀엽다...
 다만 아쉬운점은 내가 만들 수 있는 아이템의 끝?이 빨리보인다. 
지금은 생각보다 몇 없는 아이템으로 마을을 꾸미는데,
다른 아이템들이나 꾸미기 아이템들이 나왔으면 좋을것같다는 생각을 한다.
개인적으로 귀여운캐릭터가 뛰어다녔으면 좋겠지만....
이 게임은 힐링을 하기에 너무 좋다. 
하찮은 내 마을이 점점 발전되며 마을의 형태로 잡히는걸 보며 너무 행복해진다....ㅠ_ㅠ
추천!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198836900436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1664067343}
review:
90%offの82円で購入。
あまり続けてやろうとは思えないので、おすすめしないにしておく。

最初は「安いし、しょうがないな」という気持ちがあるから、
多少のことは気にならないが、いくら安いといっても、
その安さを理由に、
ストレスになるようなゲームをおすすめにはできない。

◆まず第一に『操作性が非常に悪い』
何かするのにすごく接近しないとクリックできないし、
ひとつでも画面を開いていると、視野角度が変えられない。
そして、敵に遭遇した際も、自キャラの移動速度が非常に遅いので、
逃げても絶対に追いつかれる。つまり戦う選択肢しかない。
だから戦うのだが、キツネやイノシシなどは、攻撃してくるくせに、
戦って90％以上HPを削って残りが僅か
（あと1撃で倒せるくらいの状態）になると、
さっさと逃げてしまう。
移動速度が全く違うので追っても追いつけない。
結局、ドロップアイテムも何もゲットできないのに、
こちらの体力と気力はだいぶ持っていかれたうえに回復アイテムを消費させられる。
という非常に不愉快な思いをさせられる。

戦闘の際に、何かに嵌って動けず、
身動きが取れずに、死亡してしまう事もある。

※とにかく操作性が悪く、非常にストレスになる。

◆それから、インベントリがすぐに圧迫される。
アイテムによって、イベントリにストックされる数がまちまちなのだが、
この枠がそれほど多くなく、調整が大変。
倉庫代わりのコンテナも作れるが、これも入れられる数が少なく、
すぐにいっぱいになる。

◆そして、一番厄介なのは、動物の『捕獲（テイム）』。
トラップを使うのだが、トラップというから、どこかに仕掛けておけば、
引っかかるのかと思いきや、投げ網のようなものを投げて捕まえるらしい。
「らしい」と書いたのは、これが全く捕まえることができないからだ。
何かやり方があるのだろうが、書いてあることを読んだだけでは全く分からない。
すでに「レベル１０」のクエストもこなせるくらいアイテムはそろっているのだが、
レベル４のクエストの『動物を飼う』が終わらないので、先に進むことができない。
罠（トラップ）を100個以上作って試したが、全く捕まえられない。
それに、飼える動物も決まっていて、どの動物でもいいわけではない。

もう少しプレイすれば何か面白くなるのかもしれないが、
あまり続けてプレイする気にはならなくなったのでこの時点でレビューすることにした。

総評としては、
単純なサバイバル：木を切ったり探索したりを、
暇つぶし程度にプレイをするだけなら、安いし、いいかもしれないが、
あまりお勧めはしない。
以上

author: {'steamid': '76561198097140269', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1664104236}
review:
It could be a fun game but a few issues stop it from being recommendable. This first is the crashes; don't expect to be able to play for more than an hour without the game crashing. The other things are gameplay related issues.

Combat relies on stamina, and each attack uses up your stamina. This is regained by eating or drinking certain foods. If you have no stamina and you're not carrying fourteen litres of coffee then literally all you can do is stand there and watch the enemy kill you. This brings me to my next point: when you die, the game straight up deletes some of your inventory. There is no way to get it back. This is one of the worst mechanics I've ever seen, most things in the game take a very long time to gain, either by crafting or by gathering or by RNG. I've lost an entire session of progress from dying before and this is really not acceptable in a game that is by nature tedious and 'grindy.' These issues aside it's an alright game, especially for the price, but any game should be able to run in a stable manner without crashing as a bare minimum in order to be recommended, and this game doesn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018273766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3215, 'last_played': 1663859263}
review: Bought this game for £0.57/90% off cheaper than a bar of snickers, the game is grindy as hell and unstable I've crashed a lot atleast 20+ times in the hours I've played had audio crackling and FPS drop like a mofo after prolonged gaming. The game is easy tho, enemies are brainless and can be dragged one at a time and once you get to the short sword tech you can just kite most of em without taking a single hit. Currently at the time of this review I'm almost at the end I have all the shards of nature (force of nature) and am grinding for the gems also haven't died a single time, the games only difficulty is from having to grind like a madman for rare resources and the few enemies that can negate your run speed (Yeti and moose, the fox can as well but it hits like a toddler). Some enemies will run away if their HP gets low which makes it quite hard to even catch up as you run like you skipped leg day since birth. I say the game is worth the reduced price for sure, other negatives such as having to manually feed each animal why couldn't they add a trough/feeder for the animals to eat from themselves? also collecting water from the wells or the bee hives there should either be a larger max limit or some sort of collection device to do it automatically. 7/10 game maybe higher if you enjoy grinding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098229578', 'num_games_owned': 1849, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 2263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1664568362}
review:
I bought this game at 90% off and I'd say it's worth what I paid and probably a bit more. 

Nice learning tree and crafting system to the game. Lots of different things to find/do. Combat is poor though... it's a single click, no blocking or parrying, no dodging/rolling/sprinting away. You just stand there and click. The game is also a bit grindy, but compared to other similar games I haven't found it TOO bad. One last negative is foliage - If ANYTHING blocks your path (even a leaf) you need to cut the whole tree/bush down. 

It's really not a bad way to spend some time and I definitely think it's worth a couple of £/$/€ if you like this kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961298805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1663497512}
review:
I was going to say I don't recommend .. Not quite yet but maybe after they do more work. But then I thought well there is no Maybe or Later option. Only Yes or No and I feel it is too soon to really review this game yet. It feels not done. It isn't yet done. And so far the game play ... It is very slow and boring. 

It does not feel like a game made in current times but like something made a decade ago. Reminds me of Valheim which is much more fun to play even though their roofs suck. Force of Nature you don't make any kind of shelter until after you explore into dangerous territory and you don't make any clothes until after then as well. The rotation of items you place is also hard to really tell which way you are facing it and you only have 8 quick slots and the map you bring up is hard to really tell where is what.  

I mean the game works but I wonder how they will improve this to make it stand out from other games already on the market that are better so far than this. So far Force of Nature bored me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013431177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1663306968}
review:
So far, it's not bad... but it's not super great either. Definitely not hand holding, beginning was a bit jarring, but after consulting the web I was able to figure out the sticking points. Could stand to add a vsync function in game (yes I know i can force my card, but it's pretty common setting these days...) - Would choke a nun for a sprint key... 6/10  but gonna keep playing because I'm waiting for other game updates.

Buy it on the cheap or if you just really love sandbox survival-craft stuff. Don't buy it if you expect to be fast... there's no fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113045548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3049, 'last_played': 1675699458}
review:
มันจะไม่มีอีกแล้ว เกมไหนที่ให้ประสบการณ์  ขุดดินไปด้วยส่ายตูดดุกดิ้ก ไปด้วยเหมือนเกมนี้ การเก็บกิ่งไม้ด้วยการเตะไปที่พุ่มไม้ให้กิ่งไม้กระเด็นออกมา  งานกราฟิกตกยุคแต่ดูเป็นเอกลักษณ์ มีการเลี้ยงสัตว์แปรรูปวัตถุดิบ การทำอาหาร และเพาะปลูก รวมไปถึง ตกปลาล่ามอน หาเหรียญมาอัพเลเวล ยิ่งเล่นกับเพื่อนก็ยิ่งฮา (ได้2-4คน) เพราะใช้ตัวแปรเลือดเดียวกัน แม้จะมีเกจหลอดเลือดแยกกัน (เพื่อนตาย คุณเลือดเต็มหลอด ก็ตายตาม ) ตอนใช้วาร์ปก็ทำท่า T-pose บังคับวา์ปพร้อมกัน  

 เฮ้ ! ฟังดูเหมือนแปลกๆใช่ไหม แต่มันเป็นรสชาติความสนุกดิบ ๆ  อีกแบบนึง เป็นเพชรดิบ ที่ยังขาดการเจียระไนไปบ้าง แต่เล่นแล้วก็เพลิดเพลินอยู่นะ

author: {'steamid': '76561198023850368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1663259291}
review:
Me sorprende que haya gente que vote positivo este "juego" por llamarlo de alguna manera, he aguantado media hora.
Los controles son malisimos, giras la camara y el personaje tarde tres horas en girar junto a la camara, luego para agarrar los objetos tienes que dar espacio y click en las cosas que quieres elegir, o spamear control izquierdo como un mono.
El juego te hace farmear muchisimo sin sentido para alargar mas el juego, de sandbox no tiene nada, estas limitado a completar las misiones que te dan sin sentido alguno.

No perdáis el tiempo con este juego y probar Valheim si quereis una experiencia infinitamente mejor que esto, quiero mis 0,79 centimos de vuelta, prefiero invertirlos en una skin de csgo

review: Grafikleri fln sallayın çok da kötü değil ama gerek lvl atlama sistemi olsun gerekse bir şeyi üretmek için talep ettiği aşırı kaynaklar olsun insanı bezdiriyor bir süre sonra oynamak istemiyorsunuz. Dövüş sistemi çok basit 100 yaşındaki babannemin ekmek pıçağıylan bişey doğramısı gibi saldırıyor karakterler :D. Karşınıza çıkacak düşmanlar genelde sizden güçlü oluyor yani lvl atlamanız fln bi zike yaramıyor. Yeni yapılar kıyafetler fln açıyosun işte anca o ve işte tam da burada lvl atlamak için gereken malzemeler devreye giriyor yani bişeyler inşa etmek yerine kaynaklarını lvl atlamaya saklıyosun oyundan zerre keyif alamamaya başlıyosun. Bilemiyorum Altan yani çok kararsızım; Ben işkence severim diyorsanız düşünmeyin alın ama ben fazla katlanamadım....

review:
I can't recommend this game unless you like grinding like a mad man for hours without seeing the end (it's worse than some big free to play mmorpg)... at least that is what i remember from this game beside the stupid way combat work and how they created some artificial boundary to block your path and force you to go another way (By that i mean oh no you can't climb that little dirt mount over there but you sure can climb that way bigger one over here)...

Anyway, i knew the graphic were dated and so was the interface but damn so is the combat system (or joke for all that matters regarding combat), progression, levelling, etc...

Update: Devs added a free camera mode as per a comment on my review. I reinstalled went to change the settings and it locked up. I had to end task to close it. This game still isn't getting a thumbs up from me. By the time this game is bug free it'll be to old to want to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045148362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4805, 'last_played': 1659244725}
review: This game is probably the only one of it's kind. It's sort of a sandbox survival game, but it's not. Building counts are limited by your level. Tech only unlocks with levels which you can only progress in by completing quests and gathering/crafting items to then buy your level up. It's an up hill battle right form the get go with poor balance and enemies that are usually about 4 levels higher than you where ever it really matters. The game is a major grind with little reward, as most the neat things you unlock from the crafting menus come too late to really enjoy. Even in the best gear you are kept feeling under powered and struggling all the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077960870', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1687849032}
review: This is such a slow paced game, I cannot play for even an hour without becoming incredibly bored. I was expecting survival mechanics (hunger, thirst, etc) but instead what I got was eating and drinking to restore health and stamina more quick than just waiting for it occur naturally (which is so stupidly slow). The combat is...well... slow as well (yes, slow is the theme with this game). The crafting, slow rant aside, isn't too bad. I'd be a bit more in depth with my review but honestly I can't bring myself to play anymore right now. I've been using a controller to bypass all of the UI screens but even with a controller the UI just feels unnecessarily  complex, bloated, I'm not sure even what to call the UI. All in all, the game seems fun after a few hours of tedious grinding but I can't bring myself to get that far right now. Some of my playtime was just afk, just to clear any confusion of after 6 hours of little progression. This is a weak 4/10 for me. If you feel the urge to buy this game, please do yourself a favor and buy on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198369812031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 4002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1696639147}
review:
在打一折 (90% Off) 的時候買的，只花了 15 元新台幣，很值得買，還蠻好玩的遊戲，雖然算起來是六七年前的遊戲了，畫質也不怎樣，但遊戲性還不錯，以 15 原來說，值回票價了，建議喜歡種田遊戲的朋友可以先丟進願望清單，然後等到折扣時再入手，我也一起入手了二代，不過先玩一代再說

地圖應該是隨機生成的，遊戲中期需要錫礦，不過花了很久時間開地圖都沒找到錫礦，目前卡在錫礦才能製作指南針，暫時就介紹到這，15 元買的遊戲又不錯玩，不香嗎???

author: {'steamid': '76561198361522478', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1656825244}
review:
以它-90%的價格來說算很可以了，該有的生存遊戲經典設定大概都有了~

>以老遊戲來說，我覺得它畫面表現和音效都挺不錯的。
>遊戲性和探索性的確不高(如果能有特殊事件和隨機寶箱會更好)，重複性較高(主要收集物資-製作物品-戰鬥)，戰鬥系統也比較陽春。
>荒島生存感頗真實，但就是因為太真實才會覺得平淡枯燥。
>意外地感覺很養老(除了會被哥布林圍毆這個部份)。
>任務基本上很線性，比較適合只要遊戲自由度太高就不知道做什麼的玩家

author: {'steamid': '76561198425180744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2916, 'last_played': 1656702748}
review: Niye bu kadar inat edip bitirmeye çalıştık bilmiyorum. 15 dakikada bir oyun çöküyor, harita sürekli yükleniyor ve takım arkadaşın olmadan kaynak toplamaya gidemiyorsun. Oyunu bitirmemize rağmen oyunun bir sonu yoktu, bu açıdan hiç tatmin edici değildi. Üstelik oyun başarımları sadece oyunu hostlayan kişi tarafından alınabiliyor. Onun dışında erken oyunun sonu, orta oyunun başında yaptığın şeyler tamamen birbirinin tekrarı olmaya başlıyor. Oyunda ilerlemek için gerekli görevler, üretilen eşyalar gereğinden fazla kaynak istiyor ve bu kaynakları toplamak fazlasıyla yorucu olduğundan bir zaman sonra oyun sıkıcılaşıyor. Oyunu oynarken bir yandan sohbet muhabbet edebildiğimiz için bitirebildik.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114702750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5993, 'last_played': 1656700057}
review:
Awesome game. Took me 113 hours to beat. Feels very nice in my base. There is no story or ending, just the game asking you to find 7 pieces of a stone called Force of Nature and then crafting it, and when you craft it, a text appearing saying "you beat the game, you can continue doing things in this world or start a game with hardmode".

But was fun. There is a second game which is far more advanced and has a story, I will start playing that too sometime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198856817733', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5808, 'last_played': 1658595946}
review: Vi um cara aqui embaixo reclamando, basicamente, que o jogo segue a vida real, fiquei pasmo quando ele reclamou de mudança de temperatura, o cara acha que o jogo se passa no Brasil. Gente, o jogo é muito bom, é um ótimo passa tempo, além de ser fácil de aprender, é complexo e trás um pouquinho da realidade, além disso, o jogo foi feito pra Pc fraco, e levando isso em consideração, o jogo é perfeito.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341403151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1656208945}
review:
I just... Sigh.
Not gonna bash it because it's an old game. It's kinda cute and I enjoyed that aspect of it. But holy f-- though, this felt more like a torture than anything else to go through. I finished it out of pride for spending all these hours playing it. Probably the least rewarding game I've ever played in my life, and that's constructive.

I liked my cow farm with flowers.

That being said, might try FoN2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131293618', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1699656849}
review:
Force of Nature, Aksiyon, Macera, RPG, Strateji ve Yönetim türlerini birleştiren bir Sandbox oyunudur.
Oyuncu, her biri kendine özgü flora ve faunaya sahip 10'dan fazla farklı bölgeyi keşfedecek. Kaynakları toplayabilir ve madencilik yapabilir, silahlar ve giysiler yaratabilir, evler, farklı işçilik masaları, laboratuvarlar inşa edebilir ve karakterinizi öğütebilirsiniz. Yararlı bitkiler arayın, onları tohum yataklarında büyütün ve istikrarlı bir besin kaynağı elde etmek için hayvanları evcilleştirin. Dünya çapında daha hızlı hareket etmek için portallar oluşturun ve kaybolmamak için haritayı kullanın.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199078702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1654634114}
review: This game defines boring quite well. You don't level up through fighting, gathering, and the usual means. No you level up after you complete a pre set list of tasks. Craft an axe, build a bonfire, gather 5 sticks. Go kill an endless amount of goblins and collect 15 copper and 5 gold. A bit too linear for most. It tells you to kick things for resources, then the last hit requires a tool. If I'm kicking a bush to oblivion, why do I need to whip out my axe for the last hit??? For some reason you have to take your knife/tool and put it into a crafting window to craft things. While crafting you cannot use that tool. Which I get. But when it complete you have to go back and grab the tool out of the crafting window. "Where's my knife??? Oh yeah! I've been using it to craft for the last 5 minutes..." It's just super clunky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039805069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1653955764}
review:
Just too many issues plus for some reason it never stopped playing.  It's annoying.  
I really like the premise but it's too much work for too little payback for me.  It's like if Sims found a way to be more annoying, they just don't have the option to yell at you for it in this.

Goblins come in packs in the beginning so you find yourself slamming back entire bushels (is that right?) of bananas and whole coconuts, trying to survive this mini onslaught of 2 types of gobbos, but you are supposed to kill 15 (I did but meh) and the levels need ingredients.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042406453', 'num_games_owned': 1063, 'num_reviews': 752, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1653848615}
review:
[b]force of nature[/b] is a survival/crafting/etc. game that does a bunch of things right but ultimately falls short. it's a pretty divisive genre (aren't they all?), so my negatives might be positives for others and vice versa.

mostly run-of-the-mill stuff, gather resources, craft, fight, explore, and luckily there's [b]no hunger or thirst[/b] to manage, there's even [b]a bit of auto-regeneration[/b], though I read that [b]protection against the cold is necessary in later biomes[/b]. I never got that far though.

[b]I also like how progression works, on paper anyway.[/b] there are a bunch of quests, largely regarding crafting, which of course involves gathering and fighting, and after they're done, you can gain a level. unfortunately, a bunch more resources are also needed, so might as well grab more than the quests demand (requirements can be checked anytime). stats go up and new recipes and related quests unlock, so [b]guided progression, if you will, but you're still mostly free to do what you want within your means[/b]. (there's a creative mode with every recipe unlocked but it seems pointless, no resources for anything advanced at the beginning anyway.) [b]inventory size is decent and dropped items never despawn[/b], which is great.

[b]controls are a bit weird and need getting used to[/b] (pickups are very piranha bytes-esque, unfortunately), but they're rebindable and there are hotkeys for 'harvest all' and 'grab all'. though seeing as 'interact' only works in certain windows, all these could've been merged into one. [b]the ui could use some improvements[/b] too and [b]the game doesn't pause while you're managing inventory or looking at the map[/b], another problem.

crafting is way too finicky and tedious with all the windows and [b]making anything takes real-time minutes, like in a shitty f2p mobile game[/b]. some of the resource requirements are crazy too and you can't queue different things at the same station, can't even top up the current process (start making 5 coal, can't add more ingredients to make it 6, have to wait until all 5 are done) and [b]the number of buildings is arbitrarily limited by your level[/b]. it's absolute nonsense that you can't have, say, 3 of a certain crafting station if you have the resources. god forbid tedium could be decreased in any way.

[b]taming animals and even enemies[/b] is also a thing, they can fight on your side or provide resources. [b]farming and fishing are available[/b], pretty easy too, but once again farming is on a timer. there's eventually [b]fast travel with portals[/b] and a bunch of other cool stuff.

[b]combat isn't great either.[/b] I was honestly and pleasantly surprised I didn't get insta-killed by goblins and boars when I first encountered them (waited until I got a quest for it, didn't go looking for trouble as soon as I woke up on the beach), and with a less effective weapon you can dodge too. [b]aggro range is pretty big[/b] and you really don't want to get attacked by more than one enemy, but the most annoying thing is [b]everything takes off at lightning speed either after the first hit or before the final blow[/b]. you'd think a mortally wounded creature would move slower but nope. not a chance in catching up, though there are some ranged weapons and sometimes (not sure how it works) if you find them later they still have the same health, so finishing them off is easy.

another annoying thing is, [b]enemies destroy your stuff[/b] and apparently [b]the only safe place is the starting beach[/b], mobs don't spawn there. just make sure to keep all the barriers intact (sturdy stuff like bushes and sunflowers) so they can't get to you when aggroed. a single clear path a bit further away should be enough and later there are portals to explore further.

it's still not that horrible if you're careful, one could say, but there are 2 major dealbreakers. [b]stamina always kills all the fun in a game[/b] and this is no exception. sure, use it as a resource so special attacks or whatever can't be spammed, but [b]everything except moving, crafting and picking up items uses stamina[/b]. movement speed isn't fast to begin with, especially compared to the speed boost everybody else gets during combat, but without stamina you're barely able to walk and of course can't do anything useful. the options are waiting minutes to chop down more than a couple of trees or using consumables that take ages to gather or make. [b]the game would still be tedious enough without a stamina system, but with it it's unbearable.[/b]

[b]respawns are the other major issue.[/b] on the one hand, [b]resources never come back[/b]. stones and ore I sort of get, though it's usually not a problem in similar games, but nothing ever regrowing is just sad. it's a big world and you're unlikely to run out of anything by farming plants, animals and enemies, but come on.

and on top of this [b]enemies respawn when you sleep, die or quit[/b]. sleeping isn't technically necessary, you won't even have a bed for a while, but it heals and who likes to explore in the dark. [b]dying is obviously something to avoid, especially since half your inventory disappears in the process[/b] (nothing from the hotbar and hey, no corpse runs at least), but it's bound to happen. unless you save & quit to avoid it by getting teleported back home, but that also respawns mobs.

[b]periodical autosaves are nice, as is the save & exit option[/b], and it's great that I don't have to worry about killing everything every in-game morning or so, but [b]respawning enemies at the beginning of every session is a colossal waste of the player's time[/b]. after finally clearing an area I'd be happy to just gather stuff there next time, but no, I either have to spend more time playing when I should be going, or start over next time with the killing. I'm aware some other games do the same, but it doesn't make it less annoying, plus those tend to be arpgs largely about killing the same things a million times and this has a lot more to offer. or had, were it not for idiotic design decisions.

fortunately, [b]the sequel is a lot more sensible and customizable[/b] (for instance, you can save without respawning things), so I'm looking forward to playing that for the right price, though I'm sure it'll still have some annoyances. [b]this, however, is not something to recommend[/b], unless the improvements from the second game ever make it here, which is doubtful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064913877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7151, 'last_played': 1674422590}
review:
Voce vai estranhar os controles no inicio, mas com o tempo voce se acostuma. Eu quase desisti no incio por causa disso. Nao me arrependo de ter continuado. Aqui voce ganha level completando objetivos e nao matando monstros. Cada level destrava novos itens e construções. Itens que deixa o personagem mais forte pra lutar e trabalhar mais eficiente na fazenda e no craft.  O que vai te fazer perder horas jogando. Construa sua base, plante, cuide de animais, explore os mapas com temperaturas, monstros e recursos diferentes,
Jogo vale muito a pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197830928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4144, 'last_played': 1650476134}
review:
See my Full Review on Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2EqgUWmCAVA
(I tried to post the full script here but Steam has a Char limit)

Force of Nature surprised me. I wasn't expecting at all what this game had to offer. 

In short, the world is really interesting and interactive for a $5-$8 game, and has a lot to explore. 
It's quite intriguing really, and there's an amazing variety in the environment and creatures for a small indie game like this. 

However, the controls suck, and there are no QoL features at all, and it desperately needs them. It makes the game way grindier than it needs to be.

Also the main questline had a really anticlimactic ending IMO

Worth it for the price, give it a shot if you like survival games.

review:
É um jogo bem simples, como você pode ver logo de cara, ele roda no pc da sua vó Neusa.
Ah cara, eu achei muito tedioso, tanto pra construir as coisas quanto pra pegar os recursos, lembro que uma vez eu precisava de umas 40 folhas de palmeira e pra isso eu tinha que dar chutes em arbustos e a folha caia depois de umas 4 chutadas, mano, tu tem que ter uma paciência pra depois chutar as arvores pra pegar 40 galhos, o jeito que você cria as coisas no inventario eu posso chamar de livro de construção de tanta coisa que tu lê, tem que usar muito o mouse, não me senti um construtor, perdi a paciência.

review: I remember buying this long ago.  I ended up watching giant rabbits hopping around. Did the rabbits capture me?  There was a feeling of impending attack of ... something.  After learning how to build a bonfire, I ended up spending an hour or so just watching it, clueless of what I should do. review: yep, pretty good for a older game. Been having fun with a friend. Only thing I don't like so far is that it has to be hosted by other player for other player to be on.
