author: {'steamid': '76561198428502378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1663423607}
review:
制作时间过长杀玩家时间，强行拖游戏时间，收集要素太过繁多和冗长，。其实以上都不算事！最过分的是操作手感跟SHI一样，大概整个游戏中唯一需要的技巧就是“秦王绕柱走”，只是，即使用上这个技巧也不会对战斗有多大影响就是了。猪脚虽然操作手感跟SHI一样，不过敌人倒是很灵活！你造吗！四五只怪兽围攻你，结果你顶着被人揍得满头包的痛苦，把敌人挨个磨成丝血之后，它喵的突然开了加速，疯狂逃窜！！！然后你就只能眼睁睁看着它消失在远方！（即使你手握长弓也没用，它哪里都钻！）啥都没留下！结果你磕了一堆用十分钟做出来的血药，射了一堆手感SHI一样的箭！战利品就捞着1只！反正我是一口凌霄血憋成内伤。
本来之前就有所耳闻，手感跟SHI一样，我想习惯一下应该还行，
但是我低估了这坨SHI的威力，我第一次觉得玩游戏是件累吐血的事。。。。。
给玩家一个创意工坊我支持一波。

author: {'steamid': '76561198828051731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1586321882}
review:
サバイバルで一から色々作って行くゲームで、結論から言うとイライラさせられるゲーム。

比較的動作は軽いのは好印象だったが、クラフトの自由度が低く、おすすめはしない。
レベルを上げないと上位アイテムが解放されないので、素材があっても作れるものが制限された。
さらに、その素材集めでも、設置物の建築数に上限があり、「素材はあるのに作業台が一台しか作れないから作業が進まない！」とイライラさせられた。

戦闘面でも自由度は低い。武器は種類が少なく、必殺技やスキル存在しないので、取れる戦術の選択肢が制限される。とにかく回復しつつ殴るくらいしか手段がない。
一定量のダメージを与えられると逃げる敵が出て来たが、止めを刺すのが難しい。逃げる敵に射撃武器を使ってみたが、威力が低い上に当たらない。もっと威力のあるの武器が欲しいがレベルが上がらないと解放されない。レベルを上げるには逃げる敵が落とすアイテムが必要だったので、急に気持ちが冷めた。

author: {'steamid': '76561198411051799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1583959697}
review:
(게시 일시 위의 '평가 전체 보기'를 누르시면 보기 좋게 작성되었습니다.)
[h1] 토끼가 커여운 저렴이 생존겜 [/h1]
[strike]토끼 없으면 스크린샷 찍기 허전해서 토끼 가두는 맛에 함[/strike]

[b]0. 게임 개요 및 총평[/b]
보통 50%까지 세일이 진행되며, 멀티플레이어를 지원합니다.
"2020년 4월 7일에 90%까지 세일되는 기이한 모습을 보았습니다. "
(최근에는 90% 세일이 자주 진행되는 것 같습니다.)

ARK 같은 느낌의 건축물이 많은, [u]노가다성[/u] 크래프팅 생존 게임입니다.
국내보다는 해외에 매니악한 유저들이 많습니다.

개인적으로는 플레이타임이 15시간 이상 뽑혀서 가성비 있다고 생각하며,
자잘자잘한 개선사항들이 보여도 가격값하다보니 무난하게 플레이했습니다.
조금 더 고퀄리티 멀티게임을 원한다면 다른 생존겜을 권합니다.


[b]1. 게임 설정 필수 요소 [/b][list]
[*] 매우 기초적인 캐릭터 커마 가능 [strike](근데 남캐밖에 없음)[/strike]
[*] 일반 설정에서 '최소화 될 때 게임 일시 중지 / 마우스 커서를 항상 중앙에 두기' OFF 권장
(Alt + Tab 을 눌러서 다른 활동을 같이 하다가 본 게임에 들어오면 겜이 멈춘거 같음.)
([strike]물론 멈춘 적은 없음.[/strike])
[*] 게임 켜자마자 마우스 들어가셔서 감도 조절 필수
[*] 생각보다 음악, 주변 환경 소리가 큰 편이므로 조절 필요.
( 본인은 음악 음량 0 / 게임 음량 15 / 가축과 건물 0 으로 설정했음 )
[/list]

[b]2. 만족요인 [/b][list]
[*] 50% 세일하면 4250원인데 생존겜이라 플레이타임이 짧지 않음.
[*] 일정 간격마다 자동 저장을 지원함.
[*] 건축물의 디자인이 투박해서 진짜 무인도 표류한 느낌.
[*] 허기를 관리할 필요 없이 [u]체력과 지구력(스테미나)만 관리하면 되어[/u] 난이도는 몹시 쉬움.
[*] 고블린이 건축물을 부수긴 하지만, 베이스 깊숙히까진 안들어온다.
[*] 밤눈이 어둡지는 않아서, 겁이 많으신 분들도 나름 무난히 할 수 있다.
[*] 수확하기(Alt) + 획득하기/줍기(Ctrl) 을 통해 파밍 자체는 상당히 편하게 할 수 있다.
[*] 8개의 퀵슬롯을 통해 상당히 빠르게 도구를 전환하거나, 포션을 먹을 수 있다.
[*] 레벨업하면 기본 방어도, 체젠 및 지구력젠 등의 스탯이 증가함
[*] 지도(M)에 적의 위치도 같이 표시된다.
[*] 텔레포트를 할 수 있는 '워프'라는 건축물이 있음.
[/list]

[b]3. 불만족요인 [/b]
몇몇 한계점이 눈에 보인다.
완성도가 극도로 낮은건 아닌데, 학생이 졸업 프로젝트로 만든 듯한 느낌 정도?..
[list]
[*] 도구를 사용하는 모션이 너무 투박하고 둔함.
[*] 레벨을 올려야만 건축물 레시피를 배우거나, 건축물의 최대 한도가 풀린다.
[*] 레벨링 조건이 레벨 7부터는 조금 많이 까다로워진다. 
[*] 레벨링을 위해선 무조건 퀘스트(Q)를 깨야한다. (I) -> 특성 에서 레벨업 가능. 
[*] 휴대용 등불을 설치하고 다니면서 어둠을 밝힐 수 있으나, 범위가 좁다.
(여담으로 나무 아래에는 가급적 필수적으로 설치하는 것을 권한다. 적이 안보임)
[*] 지도(M)의 퀄리티가 좋지는 않다. 집 방향만 참고하는 정도.
[*] 조작을 익히는 것이 생각보다 익숙하지 않을 수 있다. 
조작 방식의 다양성을 추구하지 않지만, 생각보다 보조해주는 단축키(가령 E버튼)가 있음.
[*] 나무, 수풀 등 구조물을 관통하지 못한다는 제약 사항이 있음.
[*] 특정 건축물은 무조건 집 안에 지어야 한다는 단점이 있음.
[*] [strike]멀티 하고 싶은데 똥겜같다고 같이 안해줌[/strike]
[/list]

[b]4. 게임 플레이 팁 [/b][list]
[*] Space 버튼을 누르면 아이템 명칭이 다 보입니다. 
특히, 건축물에서 제작시 무조건 Space 이후 해당 이름을 클릭해서 제작을 진행해주세요.
[*] 원거리 무기가 별로 좋지 않음. 무빙회피도 힘들어서 맞딜 권장합니다.
[*] 함정을 던져서 테이밍할때 [u]여러번 적중시켜야[/u] 테이밍이 됩니다.
[*] 음식을 먹을 땐 씹는 것보다는 마시는 종류가 대체로 쿨타임이 짧음.
[*] 게임을 재실행하거나, 침대에서 자고 일어나면 몬스터 리젠됨. [strike](횃불 깨짐 주의)[/strike]
[*] 레벨업 이후 뭘 배울 수 있는지 알고 싶으면 인벤토리(I) -> 백과사전 탭 이용하시면 됩니다.

[spoiler] <잔잔한 꿀팁들> 
- 무기 및 도구를 퀵슬롯에 두고 단축키를 이용해서 후딜레이를 제거할 수 있다. 
(특히 전투시 무기 후딜레이 캔슬, 곡괭이/삽(뒤지개)질에서 속도가 매우 빠름)
 - 전투 = 방어구 + 물약빨. 무기 후딜레이 캔슬이 익숙해진다면 피해량이 거의 30%는 감소.
 - 게임 '저장 후 종료' 를 누르고 다시 서버를 들어가면 무조건 스폰 장소에 도달함.
 - 커피 원두 농사 및 커피 제작을 배우기 시작하면, 지구력의 한계가 거의 사라짐.(Lv 5)
 - 생존겜 고인물들은 다 아는 상식같은건데, 템 바닥에 떨궈도 안 털림. 상자 불필요함[/spoiler]
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198165093463', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1582409735}
review:
Jogo divertido, meio genérico visualmente mas com bastante conteúdo e coisa para se fazer, apesar de não transparecer logo de inicio, ele deve render a pessoas que gostam desse gênero bastante horas de gameplay.
Uma coisa que acabou me irritando um pouco é o fato de cada vez mais demorar para craftar itens, conforme você vai progredindo no jogo, a cada item que fica mais complexo de se fazer e mais demorado de "fabricar". O craft do jogo te obriga a fazer muitas tarefas repetitivas, de coleta que por muitas vezes demoram muito tempo e acabam fazendo com que você fique meio desanimado.

Acredito que a melhor forma de aproveitar o jogo deva ser jogando com mais alguém...pela quantidade de itens necessários para cada craft. E ainda sim acabará tomando bastante tempo de todo mundo com tarefas simples, como farmar areia ou terra no mapa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212194447', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1584470732}
review:
Im Grunde ein sehr interessantes Spiel mit Quests die zum Aufbau erforderlich sind ( Aufbauspiel ). Dazu gibt es Gegner wie wilde Tiere ( Bär, Fuchs, Wildschwein ) aber auch Goblins und andere größere Gegner. fast die ganze Welt ist nutzbar wie Gestein, Erze, Bäume und Büsche, Pflanzen und Nutztiere. Das Spiel ist auch für schächere PC,s gut spielbar. Nachteilig ist ein gewöhnungsbedüftiges Kampfsystem, Steuerung aber auch Grafik. Dennoch sind die guten Spielinhalte im Gegensatz zur Grafik und Steuerung überwiegend. 
+ viele Spielinhalte
+ open world mit viel einsetzbaren Gegenständen etc.
+ komplexe Inhalte
+ auch für schwache PC,s spielbar

- Grafik 
- Steuerung
- Kampfsystem

review: Хороша. Без претензии на супер топовую графику, но с отглаженным, продуманным интерфейсом,с красивой, практически мультяшной картинкой.  Все такое...доступное и с заботой об игроке. author: {'steamid': '76561198214605785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2180, 'last_played': 1519509114}
review:
Kıyı da köşede kalmış, kendi türü için de başarılı olan ama sesini çok duyuramamış, ''ben de buradayım, beni de oynasanız ya! '' diye haykıran oyunları incelemeyi seviyorum çünkü oynadığım zaman keyif aldığım da hakkını ödemem için bir şeyler yapmam gerekli gibi düşünüyorum, borcumu da anca birkaç satır düşerek  ödeyebiliyorum. Buna mecbur hissediyorum çünkü bunu hak ediyor  fazlasıyla kendisi.Peki,  nedir bu bana inceleme yazmam için vicdan yaptıran, isminin hakkını doya doya yansıtan oyunumuz Force of Nature ? 

Öncelikle Oyunumuz; hayatta kalma tarzı üzerine kurulu bir oyun. Oyun da çok sayı da loot ve craft yapmaya imkan tanıyan bir işleyiş söz konusu. Hem keşif yaparak göçebe bir düzen hem de yerleşik hayatla kendi yapılarınızı, yakalayıp evcilleştirdiğimiz hayvanlarımızı beslediğimiz bir düzen var. Oyunda ki en büyük güzellik ve oynanışa doğrudan etki yapmış özellik ise; iklimlerin olması yani  her bölgenin farklı bir iklim yapısı var; eğer çöle giderseniz çöl kıyafeti, eğer soğuk bir yere giderseniz kışlık kıyafet yapmak durumdasınız bunu da yakaladığınız hayvanlardan ve gezdiğimiz yerlerdeki canavarlardan elde ettiğimiz malzemeler ile sağlıyoruz. Bu durum da oyuna sürekli bir ilerleyiş ve keşif yapmak için amaç sağlıyor. Oyun bu bağlam da durağan bir oyun değil ama söylemem gerekir ki tek başına oynamak biraz uzun ve yorucu sürebilir çünkü asıl anlamda bu dünyanın içine belli bir level aldıktan sonra girmiş bulunuyoruz. Bu durumdan keyif alacak kişiler de olabilir ama tavsiyem bir arkadaşınız ile birlikte oynamanız. 

Eğer ''Lan'' üzerinden oynayabileceğiniz eşiniz,dostunuz var ise fıstık gibi bir serüvene dalış yapmış olursunuz. Bu arada maksimum iki kişi oynayabiliyoruz ve belli bir mesafe birbirimizden uzaklaşamıyoruz yani sen git keşfe ben evdeki inekleri, koyunları besleyeyim pek mümkün değil , yani oyunun bize;  anca beraber kanca beraber diye bir dayatma sunduğu doğrudur, bu biraz üzücü ama verdiği keyifle bunu tamamen artı bir özelliğe dönüştürebiliyor. Eğer,  bahsettiğim gibi bir oynanış istiyorsanız ve bunu yapabilecek bir durum mevcut ise mutlaka şans tanınması gereken bir oyun kendisi buradan sevgilerimi sunuyorum.

Not: Benim oynadığım zamanlar da, oyuna ilk başladığınız da denizin kıyısına yakın bir yerde parlayan bir taş parçası bulmanız gerek, onu almazsanız ileri seviyede biraz sıkıntıya giriyor ilerleyiş , bulmak için giriş kısmını izleyebilirsiniz. Oyun, sürekli güncelleme aldığı için değişmiş olabilir ama hala aynı ise aklınız da bulunsun diye bunu da buraya düşmüş olayım, iyi oyunlar!

review:
Not recommended.

This is one of those games that I was excited to dive into because of the survival and crafting selling points. There are some good aspects to this game, such as some depth and variety of crafting and building. It has combat but that was not as polished as I would have liked. In the end, I was met with a mediocre experience that didn't quite grab my attention and left me wanting to play something else.

review: Open world survival game with crafting, battles, and multiplayer...but you have to play as a specific character. There is no character creation. Considering that, there are plenty of other games that offer these features and more, that are better. Character creation would do a lot to improve this game. As it is now, with it's clunky user interface, terrible movement and camera, it's just not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109112656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 6578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6578, 'last_played': 1578993342}
review: La cantidad de horas que tengo en este juego es de dejar al personaje obteniendo arena, arcilla y otros materiales con el botón del ratón apretado mientras yo me dedicaba a hacer otras cosas. Es un juego excesivamente básico, que pide un farmeo exagerado, [u] sin cinemáticas de ninguna clase [/u] *SPOILER* [spoiler] ni siquiera en el final del juego que básicamente consiste en un texto de enhorabuena [/spoiler] *SPOILER*. Tiene grandes problemas de diseño: El combate es horroroso, no puedes huir de los enemigos, ya que no dejan de perseguirte nunca y la única opción en muchos casos es abusar de la pésima inteligencia artificial para bloquearlos con obstáculos naturales ( o incluso construirlos ) . Además de la poca variedad, pueden escapar cuando están a punto de morir a una velocidad que es imposible alcanzarlos y apenas te da tiempo de hacer dos o tres disparos que ya se han ido de tu campo de visión. Debido a lo impredecible del terreno es muy difícil atacar a distancia sin que los proyectiles choquen contra algo invisible, o si quiera calcular la altura del disparo ya que solo encaras y estar en pendiente modifica tu disparo sin que puedas controlarlo. Los cambios de altura son surrealistas, te puedes encontrar una distancia de la altura de una caja de zapatos infranqueable o una bajada de terreno de un palmo que no puedes saltar. Solo recomendable para fans de los sandboxs o gente que quiera apoyar a los desarrolladores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010632875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 24578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9481, 'last_played': 1681932045}
review:
I really like this game, and recommend it, but understand some might not be able to handle the grinding aspect that is necessary to progress.
This is basically the spiritual successor to an old shareware game called Stranded II (NOT the borefest one on Steam).  It was made by a Dutch(?) college kid, and it was raw and cheesy, but boy was it addictive.  This game has taken what Stranded II did, expanded on the crafting and combat system, and made a new world for it.  My favorite part of Force of Nature is the camp-building.  The only place you can't get attacked is the area around where you start, so that's where you set up.  As you progress, you can get new buildings, and new crafting stations, until, like in Minecraft, you have workstations and corrals and farm plots all around, and you run around constructing the things that will make you strong enough to kill the next level of enemies.  I consider the crafting to be relatively deep, but there is a tremendous amount of grinding:  weapons need metal, metal needs coal, coal needs wood and embers, embers need sticks.  You can see how long things take, but I see it as the relaxing part of the game.
Now the bad stuff.
The annoying top-down camera.  It's uncomfortable, but I'm now used to it.  Also, combat is not real exciting, and it's frustrating to get swarmed after making a dumb mistake.  But once you learn what you're up against, you can really plan for all situations.  That takes more grinding, though.  And the ending is beyond bad, it's almost a kick in the keyster.  None of this stuff bothers me enough to quit.  I feel like progressing is fun enough.
So if you can stick with it, I think you'll see this is a better-than-average survival game.

review: There really just isn't much here to the game. It feels like the dev gave up halfway through making it. It is technically complete but you can finish it in a few hours. It's a fantastic game for what it is but as support has ceased as well there wont be any more bug fixes for the many many bugs (such as being unable to shoot a bow more then 10 meters). Overall it's not bad, it's just not good, It had the ability to be great.

review: It's concept is fun, the camera angle makes game play tiring and weird. author: {'steamid': '76561197971048020', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1578657039}
review:
딱 봐도 싼값하는 게임 수준으로 보이지만 가격도 싸서 그냥 사서 해봄.
시점이나 조작 불편한건 뭐 싸니까 납득하고 넘어감.
그런데 필드 탐험 돌아다닐때 필드가 확장되기 위해 아주 살짝 월드 로딩 메시지가 뜨는데 종종 로딩 오류인지 로딩 끝났는데도 미친수준의 랙이 걸림.
그래서 게임을 끄고 다시 켠다음 세이브 파일을 불러와서 다시 하려 했는데 게임이 그냥 팅겨버림.

결론 : 싼 게임은 수준도 싸다. 비추.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137663834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1632, 'last_played': 1675793159}
review:
Приятная и простая игра для тех, кто просто хочет расслабиться вдали от бесконечных Квестов Мегаэпичной Крутости, и просто почувствовать себя Робинзоном Крузо на острове с небольшой магической составляющей.

Пройти весь путь от палки-копалки и каменного ножа до золотой брони и алхимического стола? Легко!*
*почти.

Сам остров представляет из себя своего рода затерянный мир - всё давно заросло, причём настолько, что не осталось никаких следов цивилизации, кроме нежити и монет в их карманах. Путь в большинство мест приходится прорубать себе... в лучшем случае топором. Иногда киркой. Гоблины разной степени разложения, и более-менее живые тоже... каменные големы, убивающие при первой встрече с пары ударов - присутствуют.

Первая РПГ, в которой я встретил такое понятие как "температура окружающей среды" - правда, малюсенькая недоработка: в полном "тёплом" комплекте первого уровня герой спокойно выживает при температуре в +3 градуса (при той же температуре хорошо колосятся папортники и тропические растения. Как?!), но также в этой броне ему комфортно и в +30, будто он вообще голый!

Звери (а иногда и гоблины) обладают инстинктом самосохранения - и если их ждёт последний один-два удара, они могут сбежать от агрессивной несостоявшейся добычи... если их не нагонит стрела.

На острове огромное количество подсолнухов! Первое время восстановление энергии проходит в процессе лузгания семечек.

Небольшой совет для будущих игроков: если вам кажется, что какое-то сырьё бесполезно - лучше сделайте себе сарайчик, и скидывайте это всё туда! Например, из мяса можно приготовить не только стейк, но и пирог, на более позднем этапе.

10 фрагментов Force of Nature из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198026361392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 16430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1586132771}

author: {'steamid': '76561198167037384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1577808143}
review:
Die Idee hinter dem Spiel ist wirklich toll und es macht auch Spaß, aber die Umsetzung der Idee hätte besser durchdacht sein können. Die erste Hütte sollte deutlich früher freigeschaltet sein, Grund dafür sind die Grundvoraussetzungen des Überlebens: Wasser, Nahrung, Feuer und Unterkunft(Schutz vor Gefahr und Wetter), außerdem ist es unrealistisch, wenn man technologischen Fortschritt durch Kohlemeiler und Hochofen noch vor der ersten Unterkunft hat. Das Kämpfen ist ohne die Möglichkeit zu sprinten eher schlecht, da manch Gegner/Beute flieht und das ist eine große Verschwendung der Ausdauer und damit auch für die Nahrung.

Ich hoffe dass noch einige Verbesserungen am Spiel vorgenommen werden, da ich ein großer Fan von solchen Spielen bin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056510630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7036, 'last_played': 1691648393}
review:
Ok, so I finally beat the game.

I'm...  kinda still riding the incredible...  Yeah you know what it was a letdown at the end.  The game is an insane grinder.  I don't mean you'll be in insane situations where you have to rely on skill, wit, and courage to carry the day:  I mean grinding in the sense that you're trying to file down an I-beam into a knife with a grinding wheel.  It's incredibly repetitive for combat, you need to stock up on healing and stamina items before any real expedition into the island, and while the crafting does have an acceptable depth to it it can become, well, a chore.

That said, it has a decent base building mechanic to it, you can make your own little village, and if you beat the game you can try to kinda simcity it to make yourself a perfectly pleasant little homestead.

It's a rough attempt at a game, and I don't regret paying the price I did, even if the ending was...  Significantly lacking.  Seriously, it's not worth being impatient for the ending.  That all said...  I'll still give it a recommendation, as it's not a _bad_ game.  It has several hallmarks of a decent one. It's just too heavy on the grinding with a shitty ending for me to give it an enthusiastic recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026108348', 'num_games_owned': 699, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1576782757}
review:
Выживалка, со строительством и крафтом, в изометрии, да ещё и в фентези мире - все что можно сказать о данном проекте. Стандартно, одним словом.  
Из неприятного - крайне печальная дальность прорисовки и проблема с масштабом, стоило бы дать больше возможностей по управлению камерой.  
Настоящая пощечина - слишком длинная последовательность крафта и слишком долгий крафт, для игры то, которая не затягивает и не таит постоянного желания что то исследовать.  По этому можно смело крафтиться в упор и проходить игру по прямой. А для этого жанра это не простительно.

review: Craft sistemi çok kapsamlı ve oyundaki her şey birbiriyle bağlantılı. Keşif hayatının yanında yerleşik hayat da önemli. Oyun sürekli size bir şeyler yaptırıyor. Boş kalmadan dolu dolu geçen bir serüven. Ben çok keyif alıyorum tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007888964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1598631900}
review:
Okay
this game....
Poor Graphics, I mean it's fine to be able to know whats around but visually there is nothing really going for Force of Nature other than practicality.
Poor Sound, again it's practical.
Poor Controls, very clunky and not comfortable at all to use

However...
I completely binged this game with my friend, we are fiends for a good building/survival game and this really ticks those boxes. Game play and balance wise, Force of Nature really hits the mark! If you can look past (get used to) it's many faults, this game is a jewel, especially playing with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968378931', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1575245514}
review:
Dieses Spiel...puh... wo fang ich da an? 

Wenn man gerne für alles grindet...in jeglicher Hinsicht... und wenn einen eine Steuerung/Menuführung jenseits von gut und Böse nicht abschrecken kann, zu empehlen, ansonsten : Tut es euch nicht an. 

Ganz zu schweigen von der Grafik, die selbst meine Playstation 2 beleidigen würde. 
Viel Potential wurde bei diesem Spiel wegen groben Design-Patzern verschenkt. Im derzeitigen Zustand wirklich nur schmerzresistenten Menschen zu empfehlen. Idee gut, Umsetzung schlecht.

review: Normally, I don't mind a lot of grind in a game. Actually, depending on the game and my mood, I enjoy the grind quite a bit. But, this one is too slow. All the resources are incredibly far apart, you run really, really slowly, and the grind is too excessive for even me with a really low payout. In addition, the game mechanics are really cumbersome and weird, and the tutorial is lacking. I'm only 3 hours in, but I'm so bored.

review: I have one issue with this game, the controls. I love games like this, watched this one for a while, and nabbed it on sale. I didn't even play for that long because I couldn't do it any more, its so awkward to move around and go through the menus. Looking through the rest of the reviews it looks like all the negative reviews are the same so I'm not alone in this. I would LOVE to come back and try it again if the control scheme gets changed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120927068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7849, 'last_played': 1599249356}
review:
Magnifico juego de supervivencia. Con muchísimo contenido, decenas de tareas que hacer, un mapa grande en el que cada zona tiene sus "handicaps" y unos gráficos más que decentes. Si te gusta la supervivencia, el ir creando tu campamento, el crafting, etc. No te puedes perder este juego.
El único "pero" que le pondría, es el sistema de combate, que es un poco "tosco", y quizá también la poca variedad de enemigos (Aún así no se hace repetitivo).  Pero desde luego, el gran contenido del juego, compensa con creces esos pequeños defectos. 
La buena noticia es que ya está en desarrollo la segunda parte del juego. Se espera que esté disponible aproximadamente en primavera de 2020. Yo personalmente, la espero con muchas ganas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017023810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2232, 'last_played': 1574794108}
review:
너무 많은 노가다를 요구하는 게임

타격이나 장거리 무기로 맞추기도 힘들뿐더러 캐릭터의 성장이 아이템에 의해 좌우된다

몹은 때거지로 나오는데 하나씩 땡겨잡아야 하니 그것도 힘들뿐더러

범위공격하는 화염병도 거의 다깰때쯤 만들수 있기 때문에 마지막 조각 찾을때 말고는 너무 힘들다

이게임 끝까지 볼만큼 엔딩이 있는것도 아니고 그냥 창하나 띡나오고 끝나서 더 허무하게 느껴진다

author: {'steamid': '76561198260835943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4020, 'last_played': 1525270244}
review: If you enjoy grinding for resources and patiently crafting buildings and objects, this is the game for you. I really enjoyed playing it. The music is pretty relaxing to listen to, and changes when you enter a different biome. My only complaint would be that it doesn't have much replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148675509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2464, 'last_played': 1689252177}
review:
マイクラのような牧場物語といった感じです！
ゲームの操作性や進め方には少し古いDSのゲームみたいな癖が有るけど、慣れればあんまり気にならない！
マップロード範囲があるので二人以上でプレイする場合は一人で凄く離れて勝手に進める、と言ったことはできないみたいですが友達同士でプレイするならまぁ妥当かなとも思う。
マップロード範囲が変わる時にクラッシュはまぁまぁ有る･･･けどゲーム自体は信じらないくらいインストール速いし良いかぁと思えてしまう。
マルチは全員ロビーに揃ってからスタート、一人クラッシュで落ちてしまって戻ってきたいときや人が増える時はもう一度ロビーに集まってから開始という形になってしまいますが、人が居れば内部で放置できるのでそこまで苦にもなりません。
元はゲームエンジンを使用せず販売するつもりもなく一人で2011年から開発していた物と知り、なるほどだからかぁ～となる部分もありますが、友達とハマって徹夜したりしてますｗｗ
現在プレイできるのはおそらくゲームの第一部に当たる所までです、この先第二部として追加されるのか、「フォースオブネイチャー２」として出るのかはわかりませんが続きは現在進行形で制作中です！楽しみにしてるぞおおおお！

author: {'steamid': '76561198303058378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 18584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10673, 'last_played': 1701267439}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966961538', 'num_games_owned': 1200, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4253, 'last_played': 1574007167}
review: Povedená hra, multiplayer zlepšuje herní zážitek - vesměs jsem hráli ve 2 a chvíli i ve 4 - máme 12lvl a téměř dokončenou hru, jen nám chybí splnit pár úkolů. které vyžadují trochu času, či se jít poprat a vymlátit chybějící suroviny. Obsazené místo na disku a celková hratelnost jsou naprosto v pořádku. Dle komentářů, které jsem pročítal se auor snažil v průběhu vytváření hry s některými nedostatkybojovat a tak zde zůstal asi největší, který je "trochu prkené procházení terénem" ale i na to se dá zvyknout a po pár hodinách už člověk ví, co si může dovolit. Jediné, co jsem osobně nepřekonal je práce s lukem/sítí, avšak i s tímto jsem se trochu popral.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103677838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1790, 'last_played': 1595767431}
review:
컨텐츠가 부족한 게임일수록 반복되는 경험을 제공하게 된다.

이 게임의 경우에도 마찬가지로 게임이 진행될수록 정형화된 플레이를 요구하게 되는데 처음에는 놀랍고 재밌는 경험이다.
그러나 '특정 지역에서의 특정한 재료&특정한 장비' 라는 개념을 반복하며, 몬스터의 패턴 또한 정형화 되어 있다.
따라서 후반으로 갈수록 '엔딩보고 끝내버리자'고 생각하게 되며 흥미요소는 사라지게된다.

지속적인 즐거움이나, 심시티 플레이로 개인의 미적 취향을 달성하기에도 부족한 게임.

그러나 가격(세일가)대비 재미는 충분하며, 처음의 설렘을 느끼는 것 만으로도 좋은 평가를 받을만하다고 생각한다.
후속작 기대중

author: {'steamid': '76561198300607555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1573538041}

author: {'steamid': '76561198201620245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1573674847}
review:
Pixel hunting in 3D.
With interactions refused after clicking, via messages telling you to get closer instead of, oh, I don't know... making the click actually move you closer to do the deed?
With controls that don't make any sense whatsoever, and probably required a PhD in Impracticalities to be designed that way.
You can't grasp how ludicrous the controls are without trying them yourself, but unfortunately no free demo is available.

There are so many better games out there, no need to bother with such an amateurish head-scratcher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120035974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1734, 'last_played': 1524361111}

author: {'steamid': '76561198877436646', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1231, 'last_played': 1622568528}
review:
Добрый вечер, всем советую поиграть в эту игру. Да в одиночку сложновато, но для это-го есть мултиплеер. Ну конечно же не обойтись без минусов. 
Минусы мултиплеера: Можно изучать карту только когда все игроки рябом, нельзя отходить друг от-друга далеко.
Плюсы: реалистичной крафт, не так как везде все за секунду. 


В первый раз мы вообще с другом наиграли 9часов за раз.


В общем совету.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127226734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 10765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9019, 'last_played': 1679596601}
review: Highly recommended from me, this game has so many wonderful features RPG elements. You start on a beach with nothing the game shows you the basics of building and forageing for resources then lets go of your hand and sends you out into the world the trick here is patience you must be ready because there is many wonderful dangers waiting for you.Gathered resouces do not respawn only living things like goblins bears and other much worse monsters waiting for you so learn to farm and protect what is yours. Tempature in different biomes will make you have to manage different cloths so you can stay cool or warm or your stamina or health will drain.Two ways to play follow a quest line gather shards spread all over the world or creative no quest to follow but resouces needed to level up. Many different building options to improve your base that can be made anywhere but will get attacked if not hidden or defended tame a goblin to follow you tame farm animals to feed to produce resources create many different weapons and armors create portals for fast travel back to your base.I could go on and on about all the wonderful things this game has but at this price its a no brainer get it you wont be sorry just remember one thing no matter how good you are there is always something out there that is tougher so take it slow enjoy the creative side and be prepared.Enjoy a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056049121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1572463610}
review:
Graphics are PS1 quality, and this survival game adds nothing to the genre any dozen or so other games do better and better-looking. This character has no sprint, so you get mobbed and that is it. Stupid. You can't run away. You have to draw them out Diablo 1 style and fight each baddie solo. That is tedious.
You can't make a bow until later in the game, at least I got to level 5 and still no bow, and the problem is it takes 5 wacks to kill a pig but the pig runs away after 4 hits, then comes back with FULL HEALTH. FUGG YOU game.

I will not be checking out force of nature 2, not since this is so bad.

Unplayable but for the most punish-loving players. My character is level 5 and still naked, wearing skimpy Incredible Hulk purple cut-off jeans. Come on, survival game, get it the fugg together. No bow, pigs run away, need pigs to get clothes. FUGG!!!!!

I would say that if the character had a sprint system to run away better, then this game would be much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032557010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 2937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2937, 'last_played': 1572122039}
review:
J'ai voulu aller au bout des quêtes afin d'avoir la fin, mais que ce fût pénible! Tout au long du jeu, on passe par des moments où on prend plaisir à jouer et d'autres où on galère vraiment et ils sont un peu trop nombreux. 
Le jeu en lui même est pas trop mal, mais ça fait très (trop?) amateur et ça se ressent dans le jeu. On a l'impression qu'il a été publié avant d'être totalement terminé, essentiellement au niveau de l'interface qui est une catastrophe (clavier qwerty inchangeable, raccourcis non modifiables et qui ne font pas la même chose d'une fenêtre à une autre) et totalement archaïque (grosses fenêtres et trop de clics pour arriver à ce qu'on veut).
Le système de level est original et évite de monter trop vite et d'utiliser tous ce qui est à notre disposition. en contrepartie, ça demande de devoir farmer des compos et donc c'est parfois long (voir très long pour la dernière quête).

S'il est en promo et uniquement dans ce cas, il peut être intéressant de l'acheter par curiosité mais il ne vaut pas son prix actuel (8€)

author: {'steamid': '76561198136321977', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1576347487}
review:
I've barely played this game, it seemed beautiful, but I didn't find a way to progress or how to do the first quest, then my son visited and he found the ruby (that spawn where you first spawn) and we also figured out that we could get more palm leafs by kicking the palm trees with coconut and banana, then things started getting more advanced quickly. We could craft axe to chop down bushes and trees in the way for further exploration and a pickaxe for gathering iron and unlucked more and more things to build and finding more enemies, that you had to be careful around. I can't praise the varied enviroment enough, seen through the 3rd person, main character.

It's more of an RPG game, rather then yet another zombie survival game, thank God. But there's crafting from the very start to be able to progress, and as the pictures also show building, growing food and domestcating animals, a part I'm looking forward to when I start playing again. The map is large, but then again not endless, so I like the idea that it's possible to get to an end somewhere, and I have really played games with much more grinding then this that I enjoyed a lot. Personally I only get a sense of achivement when I look at a home with everything I need to make to go on an adventure, knowing it all come from hard work (fun playing).

For once a simple, relaxing, survival game, where you don't have to move around in an dystopian, post-apocalyptic nightmare (NOT one of the many I've had to ask for refund of, because it's only positive reviews, but only depressing crap once you try it) and beat things to a bloody pulp in order to get anywhere, and I really look forward to play. I've saved this for a long time, to have something fun to do a weekend I'm bored.

Will give further comments once I've actually played through it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150113652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1571822797}
review:
Let's keep it short

I love grinding, material gathering, and nearly everything that exists inside rpg-survival genre. However, this game still need more than polishing. Gathering is good, but camera is so-so, combat system is bad, and tutorial clearly contain so little information that i need few minutes before start playing. 

Honestly, if you really want to try it, go ahead. But if you want a game with good system, please take your time before decide to buy this game. And also, please read the reviews from other people. Maybe their review will help you to decide.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981638563', 'num_games_owned': 4007, 'num_reviews': 518, 'playtime_forever': 4488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1572351459}
review:
[h1][b][i]No! God! No, God, please, no! NO!!![/i][/b]
~Michael Scott (The Office)[/h1]

Seriously, though, I really wonder just how much of such games do we need. I mean, come on! It's like every second wannabe indie developer tries to make these. The open world sandbox survival games with nothing but grinding and crafting in them. You know the drill. You waste countless hours on cutting trees and collecting crap to craft some new crap and use it to collect even more crap. Repeat until you'll get just enough crap to begin feeling miserable and start rethinking your life choices. Guess what, guys? Here comes another one of those! Because we freakin' needed it in our lives! Just in case if you've got tired watching your poor looking character cutting trees in some other games, you can switch to this one! Why should you choose this one over tons of other games? Well, it's slower than some others (just because after watching your character cutting trees, you'll need to watch the crafting meter to [i]slo-o-owly[/i] move from one part of the screen to another, which is literally as fun as watching the paint dry), it looks especially bad (remember the very first [b]SIMS[/b]? That's the stuff we have here, guys, a very cute visuals... from a freakin' year [b]2000[/b]), you can tame cows (Ah, [b]Chauncey[/b]?! [i]How are you feeling today?[/i]) and then [i]eat mor chikin[/i]. God have mercy...

To give the developers some justice, though, I should mention the fact that, unlike many others, this game actually has a proper goal. That's right, folks! You can actually beat [b]Force of Nature[/b]! To do that, you'll need to collect some shards (of course, you'll need to do tons of slow, boring and unskippable crafting first, because developers hate you that much) and craft them into one epic shard of nature. Because, you know... the nature... it's cool... and stuff... But [i]anyway[/i], it's nice to have a goal. It really is. The problem is... well... guess what you'll get in the end of the game? No, not a cute little cutscene with our hero (who's always male, since you can't even choose the gender here) leaving the island with a beautiful lady (or man, I'm not here to judge). And no, not a long and mind-blowing text about all that being an illusion created by his broken mind after he discovered the fact that the Earth is actually flat and the entire space thing was a KGB conspiracy. Nothing like that, no. What you'll get in the end is a “congratulations” message. Congratu... freakin'... lations... After wasting hours and hours on cutting the freakin' trees and staring at your pet cow's ugly butt. F***k me and my whole pathetic life, this is some seriously depressive s***t we have here...

Anyway, sorry for the language in this angry little review, but honestly, guys, enough is enough. You see “survival, open world, crafting” in game's user tags, be careful. Be very, very careful. You see those tags with something that looks like [b]Force of Nature[/b]? With only a few enemy types and no variety whatsoever? You run for your freakin' life. As long as you are not the Time Lord and you don't have some extra lives to waste on all sorts of nonsense while eating fish fingers and custard. There are so many awesome things in this world... and yet, some a-holes want us to waste our lives on watching the crafting meter... Screw that. Now, excuse me, I've just suffered through a lot of stress and therefore need a drink. Or two. Or ten...

author: {'steamid': '76561198964809737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1602891693}
review:
Gostei do jogo, mas mesmo assim, deixa desejar.

Embora a jogabilidade seja meio travada, ainda sim da para ter uma gameplay divertida.

Mas alguns pontos no jogo, não me agradaram.
-O solo não se deforma, se houvesse uma leve deformidade no solo, seria muito bom, daria um ar de realidade bem bacana. Se contar que, abriria espaço para os jogadores fazerem construções mais criativas.
-O jogo é meio cansativo. Pelo fato de que, para passar de nível, você é FORÇADO a completar tarefas e missões, ao invés de trabalhar duro para coletar XP. 
-Alguns itens exigem muitos materiais, alguns exigem quantidade absurdas, para serem fabricados.
-Alguns itens demoram demasiadamente para ficarem prontos.
-Os inimigos(mobs) não tem "vida", seguem apenas um caminho automático(como se para mostrar que eles tem animação) e sobem de nível no mesmo ambiente/cenário, algo sem explicação. E eles só te perseguem por uma curta distância.

Enfim, por achar o jogo cansativo, acabei não jogando/explorando mais. 
Eu poderia até ter pedido reembolso, mas acredito que haverá alguma melhora, mas por hora...

author: {'steamid': '76561198180234717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1570910018}
review:
Overall, I like the concept of this game, but the controls/menus are a little clunky.

It's very much a chill survivor-type game (at least in the beginning). I'm a casual gamer, so I don't particularly like having to fight my way through hordes of zombies; this game felt like the right amount of challenge between how easy it was to get the hang of it and the slight challenge of finding crafting materials and exploring the island. It even has a place where you can get hints if you can't find a material.

I had to completely redo the key controls. If renaming controls wasn't an option I would have returned this game. I can generally get the hang of most default key controls, but this one was so awkward to use.

The inventory/crafting boxes are clunky. Some buttons have shortcuts and some don't have the option. Equipping tools or weapons is weird, I spent a good chunk of in-game time just equipping stuff using the mouse. I don't mind the time sink since I only play for the crafting and the farming, but I can see how it would be frustrating to try and switch weapons quickly while fighting goblins or whatever.

I like that I can interact with nearly every single thing in the environment. It was a nice surprise when I accidentally kicked some reeds (what I thought were just world decoration) and some materials fell on the ground! I'm very impressed with the level of interaction in this game.

I like that my character doesn't die from exposure and that he doesn't need rest every night. It detracts from the 'realistic' experience, but I'm a very casual gamer so I like when I don't have to worry about my character running out of time before I get to craft something.

I wish there was an option to change the gender of the character. I'm a woman, and I like playing female characters in games; it adds to the immersion. Even if you were just to put a ponytail on the character I would be fine! It takes away from the immersion (for me) for my character to be male.

Very cool concept, great gameplay, clunky (almost frustrating) controls and menus.

Recommended if you're a casual player like me, not recommended if you are a die-hard survivalist gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080552711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1970, 'last_played': 1539210236}
review:
The graphics were beautiful and there was a lot to discover about the world. However, it was very grindy.

The quest structure serves more to lead one through the levels of technological development and exploration than to form a narrative. The end game was basically a non-sensical grind, as well as being a cliffhanger: I wish it had lasted one stage longer, allowing me to use the Force of Nature to learn what was going on in this world to cause certain places in the world to be like they were.

In summary, I enjoyed the game a lot, but if you're looking for a story, don't look here. If you want to build a thriving little village to live alone in (I haven't tried the cooperative aspect), this might be a game for you. I didn't find it replayable, but I got 33 hours of entertainment for 8 bucks, which is a great deal.

One frustrating thing was that when you save, you respawn at a set location, so if you are playing and you have to leave quickly for some reason, you might lose the quest progress you've made since your last save unless you happened to get far enough to be able to set a new location.

review: Very fun and addicting for a simple little game. Lots of fun with friends. I also love how if you play with friends you have to stay close together.... and if one dies, you all respawns back home. It gives more purpose to putting in teamwork and surviving together without Everyone running off their own directions. It kind of seems to give you more enemies playing together then it does if you are Solo. Also very nice. Very great game.... addictive and fun alone or with friends.... so yes I would definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277810110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 6345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6345, 'last_played': 1569178374}
review:
Gamers who enjoy exploration may find, like me, the beautiful game overall. The vegetation especially and its layout on the ground is very well designed and colorful, forming mysterious scenarios that call for exploration.
Mining, cooking, cooking, everything the supposed castaway has to produce to survive is terribly slow and costs a lot of real time. This is not good for a game to have, worse for the player. It is as if in the story of a movie, the character enters the bath; So whoever watches the movie would be waiting for the bath scene in real time, embittering the wait, until the character comes out, dries up, gets dressed for the story to continue ... so taking about 30 minutes of real time. Absurd a Gamedesigner to use real time as COST of manufacture or currency within the playing time. This is because it seems to provide some likelihood to the game. Slutty stealing your clients time isn't it?
It turns out that some Gamedesigners, seem to think that attaching the player to the product created, need to produce a mental micromanagement addiction. I do not agree with this as it harms young people in the matter of time spent on games. Spoils the fun.
However, I tried out of curiosity to play this "force of nature" all the way down to see what was going on. But I could not. I repeat, It was absurd to take real time to do everything I said and beyond, pick up the ingredients, cultivate or explore to get them.

The game has no plot. It is in the mystery. So far so good. The player may assume that they have sunk and arrived on the island.
I think the developers, and I'm writing this for others to really see and change their minds - were very shrewd and unfaithful to their clients. Have you forgotten where your money comes from? Rolling up the player takes a while to get to the end of the game and then you see that the game didn't have fun or teach anything. Just stole the time and some money. Very disappointing that.
Today I accidentally clicked on his link in my Steam library. I played for over a year. Steam reinstalled and restarted from scratch. Then I remembered how long this game was when I stopped playing. And uninstalled again.
I will speak in all sincerity, and look, I like games. Should games be accepted are super built around micromanagement? They do this to stick to your brain. Example: Real Time Demand for making and progressing items or characters; Interfaces whose actions require more than 3 steps (I've seen 5 to 10+) will gnaw the keyboard / mouse behind another increasingly subcategorized option. Not to say that I am exaggerating. Take the test ... Doesn't it addict your brain and you stand there unknowingly counting and sorting and checking "little pebbles"? It's like knitting without producing the clothes. Instead of having fun it will frustrate you to the extreme, with a foolish face (that was polite ..) because you paid for it.
I don't want to hurt developers just by showing that we watch what you do and show what we don't like. Improve it, change this way of making your products enjoyable. Don't hurt your customers' time. Thanks.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Jogadores que gostam de exploração, talvez achem como eu, o jogo bonito, no geral. A vegetação especialmente e sua disposição no terreno é muito bem desenhada e colorida, formando cenários misteriosos que chamam à exploração. 
A mineração, confecção, cozimento, tudo que o suposto náufrago precisa produzir para sobreviver é terrívelmente lento e custa muito tempo real. Isso não é nada bom para um jogo ter, pior para o jogador. É como se na estória de um filme, o personagem entrasse no banho; Então, quem assiste o filme ficasse esperando a cena do banho em tempo real, amargando a espera, até o personagem sair, secar-se, vestir-se para a estória continuar... tomando assim uns 30 minutos do tempo real. Absurdo um Gamedesigner usar  o tempo real como CUSTO de fabricação ou moeda dentro do tempo de jogo. Isso por achar que fornece alguma verosimilhança ao jogo. Sacanagem roubar o tempo do seus clientes não é?
Acontece que alguns Gamedesigners, parecem achar que prender a o jogador no produto criado, precisam produzir um vício mental de microgerenciamento. Não concordo com isto, pois prejudica os jovens na questão do tempo gasto com jogos. Estraga a diversão.
Contudo, tentei por curiosidade, jogar este "força da natureza" até o fim para ver no que dava. Mas não consegui. Repito, Era absurdo demorar tempo real para fazer tudo que já disse e além, pegar os ingredientes, cultivar ou explorar para obtê-los.

O jogo não tem enredo. Fica no mistério. Até aí, tudo bem. O player pode assumir que naufragou e chegou na ilha.
Acho que os desenvolvedores, e estou escrevendo isso para que outros veja mesmo e mudem de mente - foram muito astutos e infieis com seus clientes. Será que esqueceram de onde vem seu dinheiro? Enrolar o player demorar chegar ao fim do jogo e então verem que o jogo não divertiu, nem ensinou nada. Só roubou o tempo e algum dinheiro. Muito decepcionante isso.
Hoje, acidentalmente, cliquei no link dele que está na minha biblioteca Steam. Joguei à mais de um ano. O Steam reinstalou e recomeçou do zero. Então me lembrei de quão ladrão de tempo este jogo foi quando parei de jogar. E desinstalei novamente.
Vou falar com toda sinceridade e olha que gosto de jogos. Será que se deve aceitar jogos são super construídos em torno de microgerenciamento? Fazem isto para colar no seu cérebro. p.exemplo: Demanda de Tempo real para confecção e progresso de itens ou personagens; interfaces cujas ações exigem a realização de mais de 3 passos (já vi 5 à 10+) farão roer o teclado/mouse atrás de outra opção cada vez mais sub-categorizada. Para não dizer que é estou exagerando. Faça o teste... Será que não vicia seu cérebro e você fica ali, sem perceber, contando, ordenando e  conferindo "pequenas pedrinhas". É como fazer tricô sem produzir a roupa. Ao invés de divertir vai te frustrar ao extremo, com cara de tolo (isso foi educado..) pois pagou por isso.
Não quero prejudicar os desenvolvedores só mostrar que observamos o que vocês fazem e mostramos o que não gostamos. Melhorem isso, mudem esta maneira de fazer seus produtos agradáveis. Não prejudique o tempo dos seus clientes. Obrigado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387156284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3531, 'last_played': 1592749339}
review:
ノーマル全てクリアした視点からのレビューです。
セールで買いましたが結構長く遊ぶことが出来ましたのでオススメです。
このゲームは無人島に流れ着いた主人公が資材を集めながら生活圏を確保し、クエストを進めていくゲームです。

これから思いついた点に関して感じたことや不満点を書いていきます。

【クラフトに関して】
　作製出来るものはレベル依存で増えていきクエストをやってレベルを上げて行くので煩わしく思う所は有りますが、逆にそれが分かりやすい目標になっているので自由度が高すぎるゲームで何をしたら良いのか分からないって人には良いと思います。
最初から強いのを作って無双とかは出来ないので自由度やロマンは無いかもしれません。
　作製時間は長いものもありますが、作製している間はその場に居る必要がないので　　（誰が作ってるんだ・・・？？）
色々なものを同時に作ったり、作製時間中に狩りや資材集めをして時間を潰すと良い感じです。
途中、作製時間を短縮するアイテムも作れるようにもなります。


【戦闘に関して】
　最初は攻撃が遅く面倒でしたが、ショートカットキーを駆使し2本の剣をテンポよく使うと攻撃後の待ち時間が短縮されてかなり楽に戦うことが出来ました。
ですが戦闘は同格に対しては１対１が基本です。囲まれたら手数の多さで負けるので諦めるか安置に逃げ込んでください。
木を切ったり、環境を整えるとプレイヤーだけが入れて大きなモンスターが入れない安置が作れるのでヒットアンドアウェイを駆使すると何体いようが勝てます。これで敵の制圧がとても楽になります。
　ただ最後の方になっていくとドロップ品集めのために倒す敵が増えていくので大変でした。ゲームを再起動すれば敵は同じ場所に復活しますのでドロップ品集めをする際は近くの敵を倒して再起動すると時間短縮になります。

ちなみに序盤の敵は体力が減ると逃げ出す畜生なので逃げたら無視が一番です。（特に狐）
レベルが上がってそいつらをワンパンするのが一番爽快感ありましたｗ

【移動に関して】
　移動は最後までやって装備を揃えても対して早くないです。
ですが早い段階でポータルという瞬間移動装置を作れるようになるので長距離移動はそこまで不便には思いませんでした。
どちらかというと木々が多いので速度よりそれを切り開いていく方が大変でしたね。

【食事に関して】
　このゲームで一番大事なところです。
スタミナが無いと何もできないので常に食事を持っておきましょう。
中盤の方になるとポーションが作れるようになりますので食事の大変さからは開放されます。（キノコは貴重）

【環境に関して】
　バイオームが火山灰が降り積もる場所？（寒い）、砂漠、ジャングル、雪山、春？と存在し
寒い所ですと体力が徐々に減少し、熱い所ですと徐々にスタミナが減少します。
そのため序盤は寒さ対策の装備一式を要求されるので人によっては合わないかもしれません。
これも中盤からアミュレットが作れるようになるので緑のアミュレットを使えば特に気を使わなくて大丈夫になります。

【資材集め】
　大抵、この時間ですね。サバイバルゲーで資材集めは宿命みたいなものだと思います・・・.
特に序盤は装備が悪いので時間がかかります。必要分取って装備が良くなったら大量に集めると楽です。
一言いうなら鉱石集めるのが大変だった。
鉱石の重要度は鉄＞錫＞銅なので釘を作るなら銅で作るのが効率的です。（銅は敵から無限に取れます）

【不満に思ったこと】
敵を倒していくのですがドロップアイテムが少ないのが不満でした。
ドロップアイテムを集めて作る武器があっても良いんじゃないかな…
また敵はわりとファンタジー要素が強いのでこっちも魔法など使えたら面白くなると思いました。
遠距離武器が弓と終盤に取って付けたかのような爆弾だけなんですよね。
攻撃手段が増えれば戦闘も楽しくなりそうです。
敵モンスターを捕獲して仲間にできるのですがゴブリンだけしか出来ないのも思う所ありますね。
作業とか手伝ってくれるようになれば良いのに…

【総論】
それぞれに関して思ったことを書いたので良い所と悪い所が見えてくると思います。
悪い点を許容できそうなら充分遊べる内容があるゲームだと思いますのでやってみると良いですよ。
これからのアプデに期待です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198815271796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 16304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10214, 'last_played': 1569621395}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009389605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 6830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6830, 'last_played': 1567469081}
review:
I literally kept falling asleep while playing this game, the pace is slow. 

To level up you need to craft/build specific things which is not so bad, at first. But when you have to build a house, when you already have 5 of them (smaller but still) and you really don't need a new one and it take you 2-3 hours just to get the materials to build it, just left clicking, doing nothing else. You start questioning yourself about why are you doing is profoundly boring thing. You also need to craft a huge about of healing supplies if you want to keep fighting and you often hit bottleneck in you crafting chain because the amount of building you can have are limited by your level.

This game was not worth it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373906414', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1545479001}
review: Oyunda anlayamadığım pek çok şey var. Ayrıca oyunu silip tekrar oynamak istediğim için yüklediğimde her şeyi en baştan yapmam gerektiğini fark ettiğimde her seferinde tekrar üzülüyorum. Fakat zaman geçirebileceğiniz, mantığını anlayana kadar garip gelecek, fakat mantığını anladığınız anda size güzel zaman geçirmenizde yardımcı olacak bir hayatta kalma oyunu. Uzun süren, sürekli gelişmeye çalışacağınız, her şeyi kendinizin yapacağı bir oyun arıyorsanız bu oyun çoğu yönü ile sizin ihtiyacınız olan oyundur. Bu arada oyundaki domuzlardan ve ayılardan nefret edebilirsiniz. Nedenini ben söylemek istemiyorum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198848935506', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1565876143}
review:
10/10 бесполезных побегов от медведей с кабанами.
10/10 кропотливых, растягивающих хронометраж игры копаний земли, глины, песка и сбора пальмовых ветвей.
10/10 щёлканий семечек для быстрого восполнения энергии.
10/10 спавна многочисленных надоедливых врагов и примитивного развития персонажа.
10/10 засорений инвентаря хламом, который нужен.
10/10 системе отношения организма к температуре окружающей среды.

Интерес к игре был только первые пару часов, дальше пошла нудятина.
Купил по скидке за 22р, она их отбила. Но не факт, что отобьет текущую цену.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003825601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1565518806}
review:
90% 할인 받아 850원에 사서 환불은 안했는데, 불편한 점이 아주 많다. 저는 싸게 사서 그러려니 하겠지만, 사신사면 할인할때 사는걸 추천한다.
요즘 나오는 다른 게임들에 비하면 많이 조잡해보이고 조작도 직관적이지 못한 것이 많으며 노가다도 재미없다. 다른 생존 게임을 많이 해봐서 노가다는 많이 해봤는데 역시 별로다..
싼맛에 하는 생존게임 정도다. 오래 한건 아니지만 초반의 갑갑함에 포기했다. 저가에 샀지만 다시 손이 안가는 게임이다..

author: {'steamid': '76561198272951070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1591887513}
review: Ciekawa  gra ale nie łatwa dla singla. Fajnie że można pograć z innymi. Dużo do budowania ,odkrywania, kopania, zbierania i walka. Przyjemna grafika oraz dźwięki , rozbudowany crafting. Można sadzić ,hodować zwierzęta i upiększać swoją farmę odkrywając nowe rzeczy wraz ze wzrostem lv. Polecam zostawiać cenniejsze  itemki przy ognisku lub w skrzynkach albo beczkach bo po zginięciu odradzamy się na plaży i tracimy cześć eq. Warto zacząć rozbudowę blisko miejsca w którym się pojawiamy na początku a portale stawiać dalej bo niestety hałasują i nie można ich przestawić.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987977449', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 3083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1569351148}
review:
It's a nice game and all, but it's incomplete. Some game mechanics do not yet make immersive play possible due to the way the game mechanics are put together a little too sloppily. A pity, because although it's a fully featured game, things like character movement is a bit clunky in itself, as is camera control. All the parts are there in one way or another to make the game and the story work. It's not a pretty game, but it is still a lot of fun to play and explore, as I said, incomplete, sound effects are very simple, as are graphics. There is a version 2 in the wings, but that's a bit cruel considering the game does not quite make me go "wow, I'll buy version 2".

All passable, but not ooooh yeah.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035452267', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1565791747}
review:
Un juego de supervivencia y crafteo, con un trasfondo de fantasía.

No lo he explorado a fondo, sólo juge unas horas con un par de amigos. El juego parece que tiene un sistema de crafteo intereante y muy trabajado, pero para mi le falta acción o desarrollo... vamos tiene pinta de ser otro simulador de leñador más con un sistema de combate bastante aburrido.

Esto no quita que la estrategia de crafteo y minimizar recursos para conseguir edificios y obejtivos no esté bien conseguida, si te mola solo la estrategia del superviviente puede estar bien, pero yo le pido algo más a un juego asi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044544701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1566691273}
review:
I recieved this game as a free gift during when it was on sale for 79 cents.  That said, this is an interesting rough-hewn gem that I would not have likely paid much attention to otherwise.

Force of Nature is a very simplistic basic survival game.  The mechanics are easy to pick up, the tutorials are packed in with the quests, and it is indeed somewhat addicting to play and work your way up.  However, I also would like to mention the fact that due to the developer being Russian, expect a few contextual English errors if you play this language.  Nothing unreadable, but certainly amusing if you enjoy that kind of thing.  The enemies are also somewhat monotonous and are used by the developer to pad the game out unnecessarily.  

Levels, which are how craftables are unlocked, are only gainable by doing the quests and spending some gold coins/ingots.  You will spend several hours beating goblins up for gold coins to make ingots with, and then refreshing the game, since the ingame monster refresher, the straw bed, does not work as advertised.  If you die, they will also come back.   If you die by the way, you also will outright lose some of your stuff with no chance to pick them back up.  Try not to die.  It hurts.

However, I do find myself enjoying this game rather more than disliking it.  If you keep in mind that this looks and seems to be programmed like a cheap but servicable Russian game, then you would be recommended to try this gem out.  For its full price of eight bucks?  Ehhhhh.... Ill let you figure that one out.  I personally would have skipped this one if I hadnt been given it, but I would probably recommend it on perhaps 4 or 5 bucks budget.

As an endnote: This is a finished game, and a sequel is coming out supposedly.  Any problems you encounter in this game will not likely be patched up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046059151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1567164569}
review:
I picked this up on a 90% sale and I feel like I ripped someone off! This game is very cool. It's rough around the edges, but it's still in development. Combat is simplistic and aiming arrows needs a LOT of work, but that's really the only criticisms. The quest line is great and walks you through most of what you need to do to advance the story. The tedium of gathering resources is not really tedium if you are a survival gamer. Need food? Put a heavy weight on a mouse button with enough worms and a fishing pole near the water and go do some chores. Come back and you have fish for days. Need 50 sand? same thing.  Farming for gold is the most tedious chore. I tried sleeping til morning for a mob reset, but to no avail. Restarting game works, though.

One suggestion to the dev, please let us build fences and gates. every reset I get animals attacked. It's annoying. If I could make a pen for them that would be helpful. Also a perimiter fence and a gate for my property would be handy, too. I definitely got my $0.78 worth out of this game! If I had played it on a weekend preview, I would have paid full price and been happy with my purchase. I can't wait to see what happens mid game now. No telling what endgame is like yet. I have some ideas, though, and feel certain the devs won't let me down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123305975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1215, 'last_played': 1566038476}
review: Na początku do gro podszedłem z dystansem, gdyż ostatnio gra zebrała trochę negatywnych opinii. Zapoznałem się również z nimi i muszę powiedzieć, że są bezpodstawne. Pomimo, że grafika nie jest spektakularna, to gra jest bardzo grywalna. Dla wielbicieli gatunku będzie świetnym wyborem, szczególnie, że posiada tryb multi w którym możemy pograć np ze znajomym. Nie jest to Minecraft i od samego początku musimy odblokowywać możliwości konstruowania oraz budowy. Daje to ogromną frajdę i zadowolenie z osiągania kolejnych poziomów i nowych możliwości. Gra ma kilka niegroźnych błędów jak np: sukno konopi (w grze nazywa się "konopie") tworzymy z... wełny :-))). Ale to jest tylko kwestia nazwania przedmiotu lub braku wiedzy i nie przeszkadza w rozgrywce, a jedynie czyni grę bardziej zabawną. Grę zdecydowanie polecam i za 7,99 Euro i za 79 eurocentów (obecna promocja). To prosta graficznie gra, z nierozbudowaną mechaniką walki ale mimo to wciągająca na wiele godzin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047294647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1565886742}
review:
부지깽이로 땅쑤시는게임 

삽을 만드려면 6래밸이 되야하고 6래밸이 되려면 진흙과 모래가 수십개는 필요하다,
그런데 정작 그 진흙과 모래를 빨리 얻으려면 삽이 필요한대 그외의 방법으론 부지깽이로 땅쑤시는거밖에 없다, 거의 온종일 땅을 쑤시고 앉아있어야한다.

90퍼 세일해서 800원일때 삿는데 그냥 플레시게임 사이트에나 올라왔으면 잘만들었다 소리를 들을법한겜 

그러나 같이할 친구 혹은 노예가 많다면 이 과정이 극히 단축되고 상당히 할만한 게임이된다.

90퍼세일할때 여러게 사서 노예를 모집해보자

author: {'steamid': '76561198322560368', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1588337029}
review:
It's a title inspired from symbian OS java game STRANDED with overall same concept but, enhanced Graphics, new features/systems.

There are minor bugs, execpt that it's nice to relive the memories of stranded on pc.
As the dev stated second version of game is coming out, i'm more excited to explore it.

Dynamic weather system is plus point, but the transition between TOD and weather condition is slightly faster than required as enthusiast users are going to play the game for looooonnnnnnggg time.
Audio is really nice as weather elements are nicely placed and it is somewhat realistic.

[b] There is one major issue about the video resources this title used despite the small draw radius. The GPU usage is always at 100%. On my laptop with an old GT GPU where I've played games which require huge draw distances like Euro Truck Sim 2, ARMA 3 it never went till 100%. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198040972691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 4308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1796, 'last_played': 1566358736}
review:
For informational purposes:

1. The game is really slow paced. Crafting feels like you're downloading a 1 GB file with a 100 kb/s download speed. It's not actually that bad, but it feels that way sometimes. The same goes for cooking and trying to level up, it takes a while.

2. You don't have access to all the craft items from the start, you have to unlock them by leveling up.

3. You level up only by doing quests, which are mostly crafting items and some kill quests here and there. The requirements are usually ridiculous, crafting many things to craft into a bigger thing. You can imagine that takes forever.

For multiplayer:

1. Once the lobby is created and the game starts, no one else can join in until you restart the lobby. The max players that can join is 4.

2. Players must stay close together if they want to explore the map, an invisible wall will stop any player that goes too far from the rest. 

3. There are a lot of loading screens when exploring the map. These loading screens are not a problem on single player, but when it's multiplayer... it can take very long depending on the other player(s)'s download speed. And I mean, VERY long. And it's not a one-time only thing, it will keep happening on the same part of the map.

4. All achievements go to the host ONLY. There's a workaround which involves saving the file and backing up the world BEFORE getting the achievement, and then sharing it with your friend(s). 

That should be enough reason to not recommend this game, right? Well, not really, at least for me. It's actually a really enjoyable game for the price. And even better on sale. To me, it's all about the feeling of progression, and IMO, this game has that. While I don't really like how the quest requirements are, for the most part, completely absurd; it gives you a great incentive to keep playing. It's a good, cheap survival game with many faults, but if you can ignore these, you'll likely enjoy this.

review: 这个游戏总体来说体验很好了，屎一样的视角，屎一样的新手指引，屎一样的攻击方式，屎一样的PVE平衡机制，玩个游戏像在窝屎一样，很爽。游戏带给我的快乐是无法比拟的，尤其是将它关闭的时候，心情无比的舒畅。另外，在评论区里的每个红色大拇指都点上一遍，让我感到了人与人之间的交流是如此密切，这么多人有着和我一样的感触，让我内心一抹笑意。最后提个建议，将退款的手续简化下就更好了呢，因为感觉会有很多人退。嗯嗯，就说这么多啦，祝大家游戏愉快。

author: {'steamid': '76561198306142266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1565512713}
review:
this game has some good concepts. i like how when your health decreases the screen gets more fuzzy.
as a game still in developement, there isnt much to do in it, but to die allot. lol
what i dont like, is how fast enemies can run and how slow it takes to swing a weapon in the time frame for them to run away, its a bit silly. also that they keep being able to run away when they are super low on health, causing you a wasted effort, no xp given for this, because its based on crafted items availability and resources per leveling up.
would be great if they couldnt just destroy your builds/craftables in a mere 10 seconds. or invade your camp while your still on level 3... its happened twice to me. i gave up trying after this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101578868', 'num_games_owned': 5286, 'num_reviews': 287, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1565433468}
review:
90%OFFの82円で購入(・∀・)ﾉ
今まで買った１００円以下のゲームの中では断トツに面白いです☆d(´∀｀)


現在レベル6まで進めたんだけど、タスクをこなしてレベルが上がって、クラフト出来る物が増えて行く。
他の人のレビューに『レベルが上がらないといきなり高性能なアイテムを作れない』というデメリットは、どうせ素材がそもそも入手出来ないから別に私的にはデメリットに感じないですねぇ(´・ω・｀)
家畜を捕まえた後にウロウロされると探すの大変なので、家畜を捕まえる前に家畜を入れる為のフェンスを用意しましょうね☆
個人的にはどこからでも入れる様に普通のフェンスじゃなくて『玄関4*1』と『フェンスの角』で囲ってます。
現状１辺を『玄関4*1』×5 『フェンスの角』×６個で作った中に家畜を入れるぐらいが丁度良いです(＾ω＾)

現段階で作れる小屋と家は２個ずつで、小屋Aには作業台と小さい箱、小屋Bには小さい箱×3、家Aにはベッドと小さい箱１個、家Bには小さい箱×４という状況('ω')ノ
家の外から箱にアクセスするならもう１個ずつ箱入れれるんだけど、ちゃんと家の中からアクセスしたいから今の個数になってる。
今はまだ使わない素材とかをストックしとくと結構収納圧迫しちゃうね(´・ω・｀)

review: Adquiri este juego como muchos otros cuando estaba en descuento y tuve un poco mis dudas en el momento, pero algo me decia que valia la pena intentar. Y efectivamente el juego a pesar de parecer algo aburrido y sin chiste a primera instancia es bueno, ya que te da un mundo amplio para explorar y algunas criaturas interesantes (Que me encantaria se hubieran podido atrapar) ademas de una cantidad decente de articulos para construir y decorar. author: {'steamid': '76561198262750301', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 6308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6308, 'last_played': 1565201449}
review: Force of Nature é um jogo de sobrevivência, com um mundo aberto bem amplo e muitos crafts. O jogo é bem divertido, garante várias horas de jogo, bem complexo e no modo hardcore pode até ser desafiador. O único ponto negativo é que não há um enredo. o game te joga em uma ilha com inimigos e recursos e te desafia a sobreviver e prosperar, avançando nas tecnologias e trazendo inimigos mais difíceis a cada level. No entanto, não há história alguma, você não chega a lugar nenhum, ficando uma sensação de que algo falta, mas não chega a comprometer o potencial do jogo. Recomendado, especialmente com preço promocional.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054149967', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2494, 'last_played': 1564886663}
review:
サバイバルゲームだと思って買いましたがRPGですね。
サバイバルゲームっぽく素材を集めて武具やアイテムを作りはしますが、敵と戦いながらマップを探索するのがメインのようです。

他のレビューでも書かれているように激しく一本道ですがRPGだと思えば、それほど違和感はないかと。
私はマイクラなどの自由なゲームが好きですが、このクエスト方式は細かい達成感が得られるため別の良さがあると思います。
クラフト部分も武具や斧などのアイテムが少しずつ強化されて効率が良くなっていくのは楽しいです。

問題なのはクラフト部分が妙に面倒くさい。
施設を建ててアイテムを作成するのですが、その時間が妙に長い。そしてスタック上限が妙に少ない（井戸は水６個とか）為マメに回収する必要があります。
後半は井戸に張り付いて６個たまったら回収を延々と繰り返していました。後で自動化ができるようになるとかがあれば、この面倒くささも先に進めるモチベーションになったと思うんですが、自動化無いんですよね。

このあたりの面倒くささを事前に認識して遊べるという方は大丈夫だと思います。
私もぎりぎり大丈夫でした。値段も安いですし結論としてはおすすめです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197982950877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3146, 'last_played': 1697764159}
review:
I have to say it is a grinding game with no boost. I recently reinstalled this game and now I'm stuck at lvl 6 waiting for 30 more coin peaces. I do remember having fences in the game, right now I have 6 or so animals just floating at the beach.  It seems they too want to drown in the ocean.

lets get to the grit of it
Pros 
- Its a slow pace game where you might not get epilepsy.
- The start of the game is like every start. beach surrounded by trees where you are in the bubble of safety.
- You learn how to dig with a stick. (it looks like a high moon dance.)
- And very minimal survival skills needed. (I wouldn't say I would trust my life with this game.)
- The index in the character inventory tells you where you need to find all the items.

Cons
- Sloppy camera angle, which would be good for a simcity kind of game.
- The amount of grinding you have to do to achieve the next lvl is overboard
- Advance items are only in the later part of the game. 
  - example;  to craft a bow you have to wait until lvl 5. I would expect it a lvl 3
- Enemy weapons are more advance then yours.
- You can't make a raft and float it for the ocean Screaming at you new found friend Wilson!
- There is only one gender 
- The map looks like mincraft and yellow soap. (good news is you can see how close you are to the nearest enemy.)

If you got through this and if you think you manage I say it is well worth the investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389455706', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9255, 'last_played': 1565577528}
review:
I spent 95% of the time in gathering materials, making all kinds of things, and waiting water. Particularly at the last part of the game, you must combine all your 7 force of nature to become one piece, and with 5 of each gem: Ruby, Emerald, Onyx, Amethyst, Diamond, and Topaz, as well as 15 gold ingots. This part you  can do in two ways 1) Go back to kill monsters, and get random gems ( I don't  know how many percentages to get one chip), and 2) Plant hundreds of 6-color roses, make tubes by smelting sand to glass ingot and to glass tube, mix roses with the mill,  bring to Alchemist Desk to make chips, and  lastly combine 5 chip to one gem. These are no points to do all these processes.  If you are not prepared for this, just don't buy.

Pros: Beautiful Graphic and good environment

Cons: Everything takes longer time to complete
          Buildings are smaller and not fit in the place and looks unreal

author: {'steamid': '76561198324189612', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1600651180}
review: This game is decent at most. Everything feels super slow to do, mining, cutting down trees, digging, killing enemies, and even progression in general, especially with the stamina mechanic. Crafting shouldn't take as long as it does, and the game gets really stale when half of the time you're waiting for stuff to finish crafting. The map having to load a new area for you to go into it takes forever, and this is the only game I've ever seen that makes it seem sort of open world also forcing you into a loading screen every time you accidentally cross into part of the map that, for whatever reason, can't be loaded while the rest of the map is also loaded. Mutliplayer is also pretty bad. When one player dies, they both get sent back to spawn, and, last I checked, one player using a teleporter teleports both players to the teleporter on the other side. The game can be fun, but it gets boring quickly. I would not pay eight bucks for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020586563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1624, 'last_played': 1563435487}
review:
Like a 3d Version of minecraft. Except there's a stamina system that had me afking more than actually playing the game, just to recharge it.

If you play the game on the default setting, its just a massive grind and you struggle and feel trapped because better items is locked behind a level cap, which can only be raised by impossibly hard objectives compared to your level.

If you play in creative mode, there is no level cap on buildings or items. So its easy to skip 90% of the content without even getting to level 1. So basically you're stuck with impossibly hard (not challenging) or too easy to be fun.

In addition, when you do complete the game. All that happens is you get the option for a newgame+, nothing special.


Note: As far as I'm aware, This is a complete game that is no longer receiving updates but it definitely needs some. Namely balance and some form of automation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159860340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4501, 'last_played': 1573079121}
review: i LOVE this game! Don't need food or drink as a condition of survival, but use it to prevent battle death, and water grows crops and mixes potions. Enemies are a good mix of natural (bears, foxes, etc) and unnatural (trolls, animated skeletons, etc). And there is an ABUNDANCE of crafting to be done. Also, one can choose between quest mode (which is basically tutorial mode) or free range (which is your open sandbox freestyle). Great mix of survival and builder genres! I love it so much, i'm addicted! Don't change a THING!! Highly recommended!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198152069030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1562834378}
review:
Bad design on map and quest, funny gestures and terrible UI, fights are totally inconvenient, extremely unfriendly to individual player, the worst part is, my game has been interrupted when I try to going a little bit further on the map, it saids 'loading the map' then the whole game freezed and automatically closed, I couldnt even finish the quest that called first fight and collect enough coins. 

To be sincerely, this is an unfinished game but published to soon for money. Won't suggest people to getting it.

简而言之，这是一款未完成的游戏，开发商有敛财骗钱的嫌疑。我们会将这款游戏的开发商拉入黑名单，永远不推荐他们生产的游戏，并极力劝说我认识的所有人避免这家开发商的作品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198300926778', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1562574437}
review:
说一下游戏初期体验：
1 视角锁死只能看自己脑壳和地面
2 升级不靠生存战斗或建造，必须靠完成任务+材料（我想升个人物等级凭什么要木头煤金币这种乱七八糟的东西）
3 所有生物移动都比玩家快，而且没血都会跑，基本不能杀敌获取材料（而人物升级需要啥呢？？？当然还是这些材料）
4 初期没血没精力都没有回复道具（地上的香蕉？别逗我了）然后基本靠等自然恢复或死亡回满
5 死亡掉东西不是掉地上 是直接从世界上蒸发 而且初期没有箱子或仓库这类东西 不知道后期会不会有
6 说好的多人？？？

个人还是比较喜欢生存类游戏的 但这居然让我玩出了一种国产网游的感觉？
升级要材料 材料要杀怪 低级还想杀怪？？？
