author: {'steamid': '76561198064843921', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3370, 'last_played': 1554500212}
review:
Kesinlikle harika bir atmosferi olan hayatta kalma, craft ve combat öğelerini çok güzel işlemiş bir oyun. 

Yorum yapan arkadaşlara bakıyorum oynadıkları saatler ile oyunu anlamaları gerçekten çok zor biraz önyargılı davranmışlar.

Quest sistemi ve combat sistemi sizi birşeyler üretmeye ve savaşmaya mecbur bırakıyor. Yakın bir arkadaşınızla keyifle 50-60 saatinizi geçirebileceğiniz bir oyun. 

Tek eksi yanı son seviyeye gelmenize rağmen 5-6 adet su kuyusundan çiftçilik ve hayvancılık için yeterli suyu edinemiyor oluşunuz hepsi o kadar.

5,75 TL iken almıştım oyunun gözümde ederi en az 20-30 lira indirimde kaçırmamanızı tavsiye eder, iyi oyunlar dilerim.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986805907', 'num_games_owned': 1982, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1531401187}
review:
This is not a good game. It's the skeleton of a perfectly decent game, but the development seems to be on hiatus. So whether its many issues will ever be resolved is anybody's guess. As it stands in its current state, it's not a good game, and you should stay away.

The core issue is time. Everything takes a long time, and mechanical skill at the game doesn't make it any faster. It's just designed to take a long time. Gathering is slow, crafting is slow, combat is slow, healing is slow, regaining stamina is slow... Even using the interface is slow thanks to bad UI design that requires multiple clicks to accomplish frequent tasks.

Even setting aside the slowness of the game, one of the many questionable design decisions in Force of Nature is its linearity. It's a survival-crafting game that isn't a sandbox. That's not necessarily bad, but the way FoN does it is simply used to make progress take arbitrarily longer. The things you can craft are not only limited by your available resources, they're also gated by levels. The initial stone mace, the first available proper weapon, guarantees that you're going to get hit about half a dozen times in every single combat. That means that each fight requires at least a minute of slowly consuming healing items and watching your health slowly refill, and lord help you if you aggro two enemies at once. (Three enemies is a guaranteed death.) And because better weapons are gated behind levels, you'll be using that initial stone mace for at least an hour, maybe more. You're compelled to use it until you're allowed access to better weapons. You'll also be naked for a long time, because clothing and armor are comparatively deep in the progression.

I've never actually gotten past the stone mace. In order to level, you have to obtain specific items and complete specific quests. The quests are nothing to write home about, but the items quickly become terrible. Specifically, to advance beyond the level where you first obtain the stone mace, you need to collect a certain number of gold coins and a certain number of copper coins.

Those coins are dropped by goblins, which are by far the least dangerous enemies on the island. So far, so good. The problem is that goblins are dramatically outnumbered by animal enemies. Animals don't drop coins, do far more damage than goblins, and love to run away before you can kill them, virtually guaranteeing that you'll get nothing for fighting them. The next problem is that there are two kinds of goblins, and only the rarer kind has a reasonable chance of dropping copper coins. In both my attempts at playing this game, I have spent well over an hour wandering the island looking for copper coins, all the while having to chew my way through unproductive fights with animals who mostly just cost healing items without any reward. And then, both times, I wound up aggroing something far too powerful (which will happen when enemies have levels that you can't see until they're already chewing on you), and finding that the game had decided to change the rules on me - instead of being able to run away until it dropped aggro, it kept chasing me for ten minutes of slow loops around a section of the island, very slowly biting down my health just barely faster than I could slowly eat healing items. So I died.

The death penalty in FoN is straightforward: you permanently lose a random selection of things from your inventory. Not that big a deal, really. Until one of the things you lose is nearly all of the copper coins you just spent over an hour beating your head against.

So yeah. With further development and reworking of certain mechanics, FoN could be quite enjoyable. It's the skeleton of a decent game. But right now, it's quite bad. Stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021625231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 2606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2512, 'last_played': 1543217222}
review:
The final teir armor looks like a hobo shirt, with plastic gold bars glued onto it... This game has the ugliest armor and char model in the history of gaming.





=FORCE OF NATURE- aka- taking a dump= When nature calls yo!

This is one of those games I seen on steam for a long time, in my maybe pile... finally I decided to bite when the sale price was low enough... Why a maybe? It looked kinda janke from the promo video, pretty low production value. But every now n then, you buy a game like this that looks pretty janke n stanke, but then has this magical gameplay, such as empyrion. You never know where a gem can turn up!
After playing for 40+ hours, and finally beat the game I gotta say---


It's no gem, or even "survival", but it is still a pretty fun game.




========SLOOOOOOOOOOW MOTION=========

Indeed as expected, as I expect from all good janke games... it started very slow... REALLY SLOWLY... You move about as fast as a turtle, and your stamina drains to 0 after cutting down just a few trees... Most negative reviews seem to be about this, and that's a shame. It's still more then playable! If you stick with it, it gets a little better.
I personally like slow weak characters at the start of any game that features progression. I don't want to start out super strong with nothing to work towards. However, you never do get moving very fast unless you pave the world in roads, which you probably won't care or need to do. 

Another problem with speed is how overgrown the world is, no matter what biome you are in. You have to hack your way through the thick vegetation to get around which is fun at first, but gets old later on. You and the monsters can't just squeeze through trees and brush even though visually there might appear to be enough space... so techically all the monsters are actually trapped in the world, and you are rescuing them so you can slay them for the precious gem shard drops. 
The landscape is pretty bad too, and your char can't jump, or even slide down slopes, a slight incline can stop you from moving forward. Yep... The ugly terrain random gen ensures you will constantly find hills that impeede your movement.

Cutting down trees, and bushes is also slow, with a slow animation, and quick drain of your stamina... The player char ends up being the ultimate coffee junkie, as you will need to slam down hundreds\thousands of coffee to get through this game.

Your view distance is turok 1 level of fog... You cannot see very far, and there is no option to change this. So expect to take a bad path through zones, and have to backtrack to find a better route to where you are going.

All of that contributes to what is a pretty slow moving experience in the game.... 


====EXPLORATION====

You only go to new biomes to farm the next force of nature shard (need them all to win the game, and level up), and to get new gem chips which are also needed to level up. You might also go there for the next type of rose you'll need to mass farm later perhaps, and to find more minerals to mine. But for the most part exploration isn't that big a feature here. The world is so overgrown and open fields so rare, the exploration honestly is pretty bad. There is no special places, or ruins, or loot to find, just generic overgrown wilderness. OH LOOK A HUGE GOLEM!!>.. oh it just drops stone\1ore\gemchip?... \yawn...

There is various biomes, but it all ends up being the same experience. And the same 3-4 types of mobs that can appear in any given biome are spammed every so far in spacing from one another. It's pretty repetitive and lazy. Scorpions.... everywhere...

To even explore most biomes you have to sacrifice the GOOD ARMOR you'd like to wear, to instead have to wear tempurature resist gear, hot and cold sets.
SO WHY EVEN HAVE ARMOR FOCUSED GEAR!?
You know it's bad when they have to make a ridiculously named "amulet of comfort". So either you sacrifice wearing armor with good protection, or amulets with good stats.




COMBAT---

The combat is as barebones basic as you can about get, and is so janke you can even exploit a glitch. Swap melee weapons to interupt the swing animation to effectively double your dps!

Bows exist, but using metal arrows is too expensive to bother with, so most of the game you'll just use burning stone arrows. In real life-  arrows are retrievable- especially metal ones.


CRAFTING---

The game might have exploration and combat but crafting is the real heart and soul of this one. You will do a LOT of it. Sadly most of that crafting is the micromanage type.
It starts out fun but by later game you will be sick of the fact that wells fill over time to hold so little max water, only 6...
How tedious it is, to collect the 6 water, every other minute- which in this world is not very much water.

Then to collect\replant the crops which yes... fully grow in only about 2 minutes
then to collect the mushrooms that yes, fully grow in 2 minutes
water and feed the animals every 2 minutes (not required but they only make eggs\milk if you feed them)
then roses which fully grow in about 3-4
then the coal is done about every 15 minutes
the burning embers (who holds those in their backpack in real life lol?) every 30 minutes
then manage your crafting tables of other types, workbench\altar\alchemy\tailor\stove

What you get is the most busy work I've seen in a crafting game in a very long time...
Which is really fun at first... indeed the first 20 hours I had fun doing it, but this ends up being 90% of your played time in the game sadly. The game definitely needed a way to upgrade all your constructions, so a well can hold 50 water, crops should take MUUUUUCH longer to grow, but have more at harvest time, same with animals, and everything really... More automation, less tedium clicks, and just make it take longer!

nope...
All this busy work is there to hide the fact that the combat and exploration sides of the game are extremely lacking. It's the only way the game can keep you busy for long. 

You can craft an epic city, with defensive walls... but mobs only attack you if they happen to wander into them... what's the point then? Unless you build in a dangerous biome, but why would you? What benefit is there? The game doesn't give a reason to build an epic base. Just build the various craft stations and call it a day.



=====CONCLUSIONS OF JANKE=====

I liked this game far more then other crafting games like stardew, or starbound *anything named star really lol*.

The game ended up being way more fun then it deserves to be. Despite all my points against it, I had a pretty good time with a friend, even though the multiplayer is pretty badly done. You can't go far from each other, AND the hideous long loading times you have to deal with when travelling about 300 meters in any direction. See? I can't help it, so much is wrong here... But it was still a pretty good time! It was fun to live and work in a world together and achieve every new structure and level up. Even bad crafting survival games often end up fun. A testement to this genre being better then most others imo. 



===EARLY ACCESS===
The engine is so bad I don't expect the dev can work miracles with this game, and I do not expect it to grow much with time. He will probably just add a few more biomes of the same repeating gameplay, a new craft station or 2, and call it a day. It's not like he can completely revamp the graphics, ai, and other broad systems... doing so would pretty much call for just starting over and making FORCE OF NATURE 2: FORCIER!


===SHOULD YOU BUY IT OR NOT?===
Recommended to crafting fans, who like a slow down to earth feel, and are not afraid of a little grind. A unique take on crafting, at the expense of pure unadulterated janke... The problems are worth enduring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175130595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1796, 'last_played': 1531162684}
review:
I'm a bit torn on whether to recommend this game because it all depends whether or not you like true painfully grindy games.  

Each world as far as I can tell, is like Minecraft, it generates a new randomated world for each new game started, placing different things in different places different spaces away from the player.  Great, I thught, unpredictability and different world each time could be interesting exploration wise.  

However...

If you think this is going to be like minecraft, think again.  

So you start the game stranded on a beach with nothing as a male with no clothes except a pair of trousers.  You have to gather materials to build things.  The minute you start gathering, your stamina goes down and regenerates slowly, so you're in a constant bind to find food.  You unlock certain crafting stations, great...but some things take a minute to make one food ingredient  (like minecraft's furnaces).  If you have to make a food item with several ingredients this is painfully slow as guess what?  They CAP how many things you can have at once.  I'm level 8, I can two have two food stations.  I need Butter and and Flour...they take AGES to craft.  It takes me an hour to get enough of the two ingredients I need to make one thing that won't get me very far either.

Your levels are capped until you pass certain requiremnts and quests like "find a force of nature", an element that can be at one end of the bloody map too far to get to.  You spend three hours getting enough materials and food together to make the journey a quarter of the way which takes maybe half an hour to forty five mins depending (as you'll spend more time trying to find a way through badly designed terrain or cutting your way through forest which are blocking the path).  You can spend nights and nights just getting half the way to one level.  You do less hunting,exploring and gathering resources outside of your base.  What do you spend 95% of the time doing?  FARMING, because you need those farm resources to crafft the food to survive the wilderness.  Unfortunately three hours of constant crafting can get you about half an hour's worth of adventuring, which is a pain in the bloody backside.  Everything hits much harder than you do.  You're level 8, a bear is level 3, bear is wrecking you in three or four hits you're nearly half dead.  Foxes and boars constantly attack you, and OH FUN, they effing run away when their health gets low and they run WAY faster than you and the bow and arrow are rubbish (they can't fire up hill for example)  so you can't even kill them.  You get no experience for the trouble either.

I think the worst part is really that they cap everything.  You need tons of water to feed the animals AND to water crops you need - you need tons of crops to make one small food item, but you can only have a few wells so it's a case of feed animals, or water crops, make food and survive past the farm.  You can't do both most of the time.  Even with three wells, it's particularly hard when a cow takes two buckets of water a time but your farm takes one bucket per seed - you get three wells at lvl 8, so that's 12 buckets.  You have six chickens that ned a bucket each, two cows that need two each, etc...they make it far too hard to truly feel free and enjoy the farm or building anything,   You have to get higher up in level to unlock the right to build another item or farm, etc, which just really stunts being able to freely build and have fun.  I've played nearly 30 hurs, my character is level 8 and can't get any further because the map is so poorly designed, rivers i can't cross, hills that can't be climbed or descended, it's just bad design entirely.

If you want a game that you'll spend weeks grinding in a farm for a couple of hours of adventuring, go for it.  If you want a game that you do a lot of other things beside farming, get Conan or Ark.  Or get this on sale, play for a day, then hang it up because it's too repetitious.  I'm done, I don't have the energy for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033577891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3502, 'last_played': 1535270554}
review:
This game had a lot of promise.

TLDR:
The early game's building and crafting is fun and engaging
The combat is very mediocre
The end game turns combat into a frusturating grind.
The game could benefit from way more building options, including more cosmetic options. 
[spoiler] The payoff for all the work you put into the Force of Nature is quite disapointing.[/spoiler]

I liked the building at first. You start off with basic tools, basic huts etc. The progression feels good at the start. I was fine with the limited amount you could build at the start because there was the expectation that the cool stuff would be unlocked the end. However the end game just does not reward you with enough payoff in the customization you can unlock. 

As for the base functionality, I like that you can queue up crafting in your base at every workstation. 

The focus on the game is the Force of Nature. As such, you will be after Force of Nature Shards for the majority of the game. This will force you into the wilderness, where you will be fighting in a combat system that gets stale quickly. It essentially consists of spamming the attack button and your food hotkey to heal. After the first two areas, the combat for me felt like a chore to get to what I really wanted to do: build. 

And then there was the Force of Nature itself.
[spoiler] For all of the work and grinding it takes to construct this artifact, I would expect it to do something cool.
It took:
7 Forces of nature 
4500-4000 Roses
16,000-18,000 Water for each of the roses 
2250 Sand
4500 Glowing Embers (1500 sticks)
225 Coins
930 logs

And yet there was zero payoff. It did not do anything cool like I would expect. You can place it if you want. It looks alright. But otherwise it's only interaction is to be consumed to level you from level 12 to level 13. I was fully disapointed.
[/spoiler]

Perhaps I was expecting too much out of the game. However the game could have done better in many areas. The game is fun for what it is. I suggest playing in creative mode to bypass the tedium and get straight into the game's limited strength: the base building. 
If base building was added to the end game, Force of Nature would have been a much more satisfying game. It is a shame because in my opinion, the base interactions was it's strongest point. 

I had fun with the game. And it was SO close to being a more satisfying game. But it just misses the mark on so many points, and this saddens me. 

It's fun enough for something to do if you buy it during a sale, but in my opinion there are much better games for both the combat and the building.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005357441', 'num_games_owned': 1911, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1530863985}
review:
I love this sort of game, but I have to give this one a no. 

-Stamina system is annoying. Not enough stam food, at least in the first 4 hours. Takes so much stamina to do anything you have to eat at all times. The net gain from chopping trees makes this a constant problem.

-Tool progression is too slow. 4 hours in everything is still a pain in the ass.

-Level system preventing me from building whatever I want in whatever quantity I want means this is NOT a sandbox game. Its very linear. 

-Combat is forced, boring and clunky. Early on there is no way to stop a running enemy until the bad path finding does it for you. Not enjoyable. 

-Game doesn't like to alt-tab. Every graphic change requires a relaunch. Exit from main menu likes to crash. 


I liked the lootables laying everywhere. Graphics were ok. General concept needs work, but overall it was a good start. Maybe my map gen just sucked, but all the metals I needed were hard to find making everything stupid boring.

The hardest achievement I earned was dying. With no armor I literally pulled 5 mobs and had to just stand there... for like a minute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051457792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1531497382}
review: Пока на раннем этапе (на момент отзыва 8 часов), но игра очень интересная, для любителей песочниц и спокойных выживалок. Немного времени ушло на "приспособиться к управлению", но после дело пошло. Абсолютно не жалею о покупке.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175740649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3058, 'last_played': 1596666721}
review:
A momento de jugarlo son 27hrs de juego y mas menos puedo opinar:

¿recomienzo este juego? solo a cierto perfil, si eres de esos que disfrutan con la exploracion de supervivencia, si eres de aquellos que aman la construccion primitiva y que buscan ese seudo-realismo: ES TU JUEGO.

Graficamente no es perfecto pero se juega fluido que da gusto, tiene sus parones MUY puntuales pero no es nada que dañe o merme la experiencia.

El combate es; mediocre, es tosco y poco practico aunque es a doc, agradececia que a posterior añadieran, bastones, lanzas, ballestas y javalinas le daria al juego un aire mas primitivo. El uso del arco esta bien me falta profundisar su uso para decir si esta bien o no pero desde ya comento que puede ser perfeccionado. Solo que si agregan el chanse de recuperar municion o partes de este se llevaria el 10.

Los recursos, hay que entender en que si hay cuevas en todos lados como bien pasa en Minecraft generaria un uso de recursos enorme, Donde si brilla la ausencia es en que los recursos como manzanas, cocos, platanos, ramas, troncos o hojas de palmera; NO SON RENOVABLES, si la mecanica de juego fuera lenta aceptaria ese hecho pero hay recursos que son acelerados como la comida asi que este factor puede ayudar el incorporar la forma de renovar recursos como arboles, arbustos y que elementos como las palmeras o manzanos puedan regenerar frutas o recursos adicionales siendo el manzano un elemento fundamental en unas mecanicas.

La exploracion es comoda no le veo mayores problemas o defectos, el uso de portales es muy a acertado facilitado el traslado.

Mis mayores quejas serian:
-el uso de adoquines da mucha velocidad de movimiento si la reducen sentaria mucho mejor.
-la obtencion de oro es a mediano plazo FACIL, es saber grindear y tendras mucho oro. Puede evitarse reduciendo el drop de este y añadiendo recursos como puede ser pepitas de hierro, cuero, carne, cuerda o semillas del bioma

donde pueden mejorar:
-añadir bastones, lanzas, javalinas, ballestas y ondas al arsenal.
-en las armas de municion esta pueda recuperarse o parte de estas en un chanse.
-funciones a las capturas como puede ser que las cabras puedan transportar algunos elementos o los goblins que atrapas sean un burrito de carga.
-poderle añadir funciones al goblin como puede ser recojer agua, plantar puede dar mucho juego pero lo dejo mas como una fantacia que como un elemento que pueda ser mejorado.

Sin mas que a la aventura que este juego es MUY bueno que me tiene enviciado y mi mas grande felicitaciones a los desarrolladores por esta obra mi mas grande satisfaccion con este titulo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047361974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2740, 'last_played': 1611813619}
review:
How can you go wrong? Many games charge far more and offer far less.
Easier as multiplayer as in faster but still not fast. 
Single player is a struggle as you'll need to progress more slowly.
Hard enough to be a challenge but not so hard as to require you to "git good".
Beautiful graphics and colors and the random gen map always seems to look good.
Combat is simplistic and a bit clunky but still offers nice options like knives, clubs, various arrows etc.

Simply put it's a little gem of a game and if for some reason you don't like it then heck, it's cheaper than a pack of gum.

review: В принципе игрушка очень интересная. Если Вы любитель песочниц-выживалок, то игрушка зайдет на ура. ;) Мне всё понравилось и графика и система крафтов и геймплей в целом, но есть только один минус - под конец игры приходится слишком много фармить и от этого игра становится скучной и однообразной. Надеюсь в будущем разработчики это сбалансируют и добавят контента, ибо из-за отсутствия контента наполнять игру унылым фармом, как по мне - это не очень. Ну а в остальном всё отлично. Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996224551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1530523771}
review: Force of Nature has a lot of good aspects and a lot of bad aspects that overshadow the good. First you will notice a majority of the reviews say the game is slow. The game isnt slow, the game feels slow because it is poorly designed. Force of nature uses a leveling system which is implimented to be more of a tutorial of sorts in which content is locked behind levels. This would be fine if you didnt have to make literally every new unlocked item in a level to progress to the next level. This makes the game feel boring because there is no free choice, you feel like you are just checking off boxes on a never ending list. It takes far too long to get to the good part of the game to make the game worth purchasing and even if you hit the good part you feel no pride because you got to that point because the game forced you to that point through a disgustingly poorly designed leveling system. Which brings me to the reason Im giving the game a bad review the tags are wrong. There are no survival aspects no food meter, no water and no danger. You basically spawn in and start the game in a whole foods. At best it is a really mediocre game to kill sometime with a buddy in the games VERY beta multiplayer and at worst it is a grindy slog that rewards you with no sense of accomplishment for doing anything because the game beats you over the head with its god awful progession system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254642701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1623512256}
review: I've only been playing for a couple hours but i'm totally hooked. the game is grindy, at first but in a really relaxing way where you can multitask. I think the controls are semi unique and pretty great, the game is pretty and i already have the urge to play this together with someone else so i'm going to get a couple copies. However in my opinion the trailer and video's on the game's steam store page don't do it justice. This game is better then i had expected and i am probably going to sink allot more hours into it. I regret postponing my purchase of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055207201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1533299336}
review:
GREAT! Hidden gem of a game.  Highly recommended for single player or even better for COOP with the friend or girlfriend. Deep crafting mechanic. Chill play style. after 2.4 hours i am starting to get that nice feeling like the area where i settled is becoming my home. 

I bought it at 66% off for about $2.90 and feel like im ripping the developer off. Im going to encourage the dev to do some DLC and will happily pay full price for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017781105', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1530173492}
review: By the time of this review I haven't been playing that much. Despite that I really dig this game. It has a lot of potential. The map looks a bit broken but what to expect of a game in early access. On the plus side there's a great beginner questline to help you getting started and the game itself looks great and runs smoothly! The crafting menu is easy to learn and the grinding isn't bad at all. Overall it's a game worth more than the pricetag and I can't wait to see what future updates will bring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052598774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1368, 'last_played': 1530021981}
review:
I gave this game a lot more time than I would have normally, since I received it as a gift from a friend.  I could see a lot of potential in it, and really really wanted to like it. 
The game plays a lot like an early access/early beta game unfortunately (and indeed, I've played some early access titles that were significantly smoother than this one). The UI and controls are very clunky and a lot of the gameplay just isn't as smooth/optimal as it could be.
However the incredible time sinks and grindy feeling just wore me down. Waiting 20+ real minutes between doing things in the game, just waiting for your stamina to regen was frustrating. Especially when that full stamina bar, only let you chop down 2-3 trees which might give you enough logs to make enough coal, to make 2-3 bars of metal to make 1 item which is a component then for something else. 
Then there's the fact that upon death you lose literally hours and hours of time worth of items that you made (even just simple food takes an incredible amount of time to make in this game) and how much you lose goes up with each death. Oh, by the way there's no way to tell a mobs level before it attacks you either, so death isn't uncommon. 

So for those TLDR: It's a very pretty game, that would have had a lot of promise, but it just feels like an abandoned early access title that was never finished. Not even worth the sale price for the frustration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259534706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1706662865}
review: I just bought the game because it was on sale, otherwise I wouldn't have found it. But i'm sure glad I did because it's well worth the full price or even more. In my full experience of gaming, I do enjoy playing mmorpgs and mostly moba/pvp type games but there's just something about this game that already has me hooked. Alot of tryhards out here might complain and leave bad reviews because it just doesn't suit their blown-out ego and crafting takes "too damn long" but in my opinion it's what sets it apart from most games. I haven't played much yet just a few hours as of now but I don't see myself quitting anytime soon.. With that being said, congrats Devs on building this unique game and I look forward to seeing more and better content in the future. +1

author: {'steamid': '76561198161904742', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1685730287}
review:
Кривокосая поделка жанра сурвайвл. 
Персонаж не умеет прыгать - Ну ладно, много игр без прыжков
Персонаж не умеет бегать - Ну ладно, возможно он ходит быстро
Персонаж ходит медленно будто обосрался - ...
При истощении стамины (энергии) персонаж движется ЕЩЕ МЕДЛЕННЕЕ
Враги, когда у них мало хп, убегают и их НЕВОЗМОЖНО ДОГНАТЬ
Ближний бой - это всегда размен из-за медленной анимации и передвижения.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036034742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1516944090}
review: Only game I have ever refunded on Steam. The controls are extremely clunky and the menus are unituitive. Gameplay is slow and non-engaging and crafting/gathering resources is tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297692277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1651294955}
review: This was sort of an impulse buy; however, I am thoroughly impressed with everything this game has to offer.  The graphics are wonderful, the idea is brilliant, and I found myself having fun in a very short amount of time.  My poor boyfriend has trouble pulling me away to play other games with him.  There is a splendid sense of accomplishment each time I advance or complete something that shows progress toward something amazing.  I'll be glad when more is added.  I'm eager to see how it will grow.  I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes to explore a new world; the calm and soothing experience of staying home and tending gardens and animals; and, of course, those who like to battle monsters and mean critters who want to eat your face.  It is a fantastic game.  So glad I spent the money.

review:
[h1] ДОБАВЬТЕ Steam Cloud. [/h1]


игра просто супер. есть мелкие баги но они не сильно бросаются в глаза. Есть несколько комментариев где говорится что игра очень однообразная квесты почти одинаковые и все это нудно, но некоторые просто незнают того что игру разрабатывал 1 человек, да есть те кто ему помогал но восновном все делал именно он все эти квесты немного затянуты и однообразные для того что бы игра не была короткой.


Оценки (сугубо моё личное мнение)

Графика (8/10)
Геймплей (9/10)
Сюжет (6.5/10)
Квесты (6.8/10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198098444256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3067, 'last_played': 1545087187}
review:
PLEASE READ: Many reviewers are saying they do not like the controls because it is tedious picking up things. I thought this too and almost stopped playing until I heard my husband's voice in my mind "Check the control settings." There is not a tutorial that explains this but in the control setting you will see there are quick harvest and quick pick up options. The game was much more enjoyable after I discovered this. 
I absolutely love this game. Think ARK meets Diablo II. Two of my favorite games in one.
I have been slowly enjoying the game and not working extremely hard on completeing the quests quickly.  I have over 47 hours in this game and unfortunately this means I am running into issues with save space. I cannot port to a new area without the game shutting down. I am on my last quest and excited to complete it, but I cannot possibly because I am stuck at my Home Base Location. Please help? I really want to finish this game but it keeps crashing...

author: {'steamid': '76561198047540254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1529773878}
review:
The mechanics for collecting items/resources Is very strange. You have to press a key (default is space) to allow the character to pick up items, and then press another (default is L mouse button) to collect that item. "Creative Mode/Sandbox" isn't a true creative mode, you still lose health, stamina, and you still have to collect resources, which is very slow. I bought the game for the world exploration and to mess around in the sandbox, which in this game just isn't my cup of tea. The biggest draw away for me though is the two button system for collecting. I just can't get used to it and so probably won't get far in the game. I'm not sure how I would go about altering the controls for this, as no matter what I'd need two buttons since that is how the game is programmed. 

Others have said that playing in multiplayer is good/better. I haven't tried that mode so I can't comment on it. However with the current pace of the game, it most likely is better in a co-op situation and would help it move along faster. 

Note: I bought this game during a sale for 2.95.

author: {'steamid': '76561198448566968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1529677084}
review:
生存游戏没有饥饿值，制造游戏没几个可以做的东西
一个脑瘫患者大叔迈着僵尸的步伐在十米开外人畜不分还会卡树迷路的岛上过着被野兽追-打残血它就跑-回血食物加的非常少-体力回的更慢-牲畜根本打不着-被哥布林群殴-又被野兽追死，如此反复的游戏
画面差，动作迟钝，节奏缓慢，打不到野兽，看不到路，回不起血体，一堆没有用的食材和种子
即不能愉快种地，又不能痛快打猎，你想要的都没有，只有怎么能恶心死你

author: {'steamid': '76561197972149443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1520188046}
review:
Avis assez mitigé, Force of Nature est bien fait mais l'exploration devrait être au centre du jeu; dommage qu'on ne puisse pas déléguer au gobelins capturés/domestiqués, certaines tâches répétitives. Mode solo oblige, on finit par se sentir quand même bien seul. La re-jouabilité est limité je pense, j'ai déjà du mal à fini ma partie.
Je reste sur un avis positif, le jeu reste bon si vous aimez le genre.

review: I have really enjoyed this game. The style of it reminds me of old school runescape. It is a very grindy game, though enjoyable if that's what you like. In between gathering recources and building your area, you're tasked with killing various monsters. Good game kids could play as well, but challenging enough for others to enjoy. Definitely worth $8

author: {'steamid': '76561198804398033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1528825852}
review:
作为建造类游戏，我玩儿的也不少了。但我能说，这是我玩儿过的，最烂的建造游戏么，没有之一！SHI一样的操作界面，砍木头等动作必须退出建造界面，建造的时候视角又蜜汁难控制！造出来的工作台和箱子为什么只能放到屋子里？最让人不能忍的是，为毛造东西强行重复算时间？太累人了！

战斗方面，刚了敌人半天，结果怪打不过，都开挂跑了。WTF？

总的来说，这游戏就是画面渣+操作SHI+建造系统强行浪费时间，果断弃坑！这破游戏3块2都不值！凸=。=凸

author: {'steamid': '76561198218568356', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 4528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4528, 'last_played': 1525040628}
review:
Enjoyed it at first, but getting the ressources becomes more and more tedious and annoying.
Especially the randomness of particular drops is annoying, but also that you can't really isolate enemies, which sometimes results in you shooting at one enemy and thereby aggroing the 3 enemies within a 10m radius as well. So instead of fighting 1 enemy, you fight 4. And die.
Some day I might play this game again, or I might not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030308926', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1545707991}
review: Amazing game. Basically Force of Nature is a slow based survival game. It has alot of adventurous areas to explore and fight monsters. For $8 you will be getting alot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105633837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1528862039}
review:
This is a great game.  Yes, the pace is sloooooow and if you are trying to rush through everything without reading the instructions given by the game, you will find movement, crafting and just about everything else a royal pain.  Slow your roll, don't try to hurry through the game and you will find it enjoyable.

Couple things of note:  Get the best weapon you can early. Get armor made. Get a fishing pole and fish. Have something constantly crafting because crafting takes forever.  Don't venture out further than your quests have you venture... or do and enjoy some death.

(Note to Devs:  You could speed up crafting time by about 25% because at times it is painfully slow and I can see that aspect ruining the game for people with less patience)

TLDR: Relaxing grinder with fun exploration albeit some clunkiness in learning to navigate and interact (15 minutes is all it takes to get used to it... really), entertaining fight experiences and logical crafting. Not for the impatient or those who are expecting epicness.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961241274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2835, 'last_played': 1548723323}
review:
A sandboxot próbáltam inkább, mert a kampányos tényleg kicsit lassú, ahogy páran írják.

Kellemes meglepetés 8 eurért, mászkálós, gyűjtögetős, építgetős, hatalmas a térkép és van elvileg magyarul is (nem próbáltam)

A táposabb ellenségek kicsit messzebb vannak, hangulatos, jópofa a graifka és zépek a hangok, a zene is tök jó csak ritkán hallani.

I mostly played sandbox, because the campaign is a bit slow as other have noticed it. Try sandbox if you feel campaign slow.

Nice surprise for 8 eur, really huge and balanced maps, lots different stuff to gather, farm, craft.
Cute graphics, nice sounds, very nice music but its rare to hear.

It was a good purchase well worth the money, very fun and cute game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121371584', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 10092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1706362977}
review:
Supervivencia lenta y sin apuros, modo de construcción y de crafteo bastante intuitivo y que lleva mucho tiempo el farmeo de materiales como para hacer todo a lo loco.
La supervivencia es "tranquila", no vamos a tener ataques de mobs a nuestra base y si buscamos problemas es salir del "área segura" para cazar enemigos, necesario para conseguir oro y poder avanzar de level a nuestro personaje.
Con cada nuevo level trae disponible nuevas cosas para hacer, obviamente cada vez se pone mas difícil.
Es entretenido si te gusta desarrollar tu base tranquilo y sin apuros, como dije el conseguir los materiales y craftear cosas lleva bastante tiempo, incluso algunos materiales están en lugares que es complicado acceder y necesitamos estar bien equipados para poder pasar ya que los enemigos son bastante complicados.
Los mundos se generan siempre de forma random asique nunca vamos a jugar en un mismo lugar mas allá de que los materiales son siempre los mismos.

Recomendado 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198105753615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1527685882}
review:
I played for around 16 minutes, and i didnt like the game at all.

Is the first time i request a refund of my money.

The game controls are awful. 

If you want to harvest something you have 2 choices, press the Q key and click the item you want to harvest or press the L.Alt key. But if you want to loot something, you need to press the L.Ctrl key or press Q and click.

To interract with things, you need to press the E key.

That makes it impossible to loot around and harvest things because you need to press 3 diferent keys to do things that you can do with just 1 key in any other survival game. Why couldnt they just make the E key do the 3 things? Harvest, interract and loot.  You can change the controls because wen you try to change it, you get a message that says "That key is already in use" and you cant set the E key for the 3 actions. 

That was the stronger reason for me to give up on the game. Maybe for others thats not a good reason, but i hope this helps other people in the future to choose if they are up for that or not.

Other thing i didnt liked is that the enviroment is lifeless, plants dont move, u cant pass tru almosy anything like grass or flowers, it didnt feels like an oppen world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198825133557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1527597108}
review:
总体来说 ，这游戏的模式还是可以的，沙盒、生存、创造等等等等。
但是做任务才能升级的设定和包括制造、种植、生产在内的那么长时间的花费真的是很恶劣，完全是在浪费时间不说，为了升级而刷怪探索已经不能说是自由了吧。还有这dan疼的操作模式，哪怕是全设置了快捷键也相当的麻烦，窗口之间的切换还要一个一个按部就班的关掉，否则打不开另外的窗口。地面上几乎一切物体都会阻挡你的脚步，哪怕是一棵向日葵，探索过程中你需要花费大量的精力开路，不包含游泳、坠落之类的设定把你定死在平坦地势上，连行走都是死板无趣的。
唯一支撑我完了9个小时的可能就是它生存建造的游戏类型和那30多块钱了。在游戏继续优化更新以前，真心不推荐，相比较来说，同价位的游戏比这好的真的不少。

review: The game seems slow at first, but once you've played more it is GREAT! There is alot of menu back and forth, but you'll get used to it just like the other crafting games.  I can't believe it has so many thumbs down, or the it's only $7.99.  I'd say if you've played only once or twice give it another try. It gets addictive!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120306953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1527263819}
review: I like crafting games. I like low-key nature survival games. I like research trees (which this sort of has). This game is boring, way too slow, and very grindy. The camera and controls feel a bit sluggish (even at max on a good computer). There is no other option to save than to save and exit, thereby respawning all the monsters you've killed. The achievements sound so easy and doable which is why I keep foolishly coming back to this game, but the whole game is just too slow and grindy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171696335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2254, 'last_played': 1539460867}
review:
This is a charming game with wonderfully textured graphics and simple gameplay.  The quests help the player build the rpg character and move the game forward.  The player has a lot of automony in the game to decide what to do and where to explore (open world).

Force of Nature has all of the excellent components of open world rpg:  crafting, gathering, fighting, and leveling up according to quests.  The battles are not bloody or gory in any way, and the game is very approriate for a younger crowd that can handle battling some monsters: goblins and ghosts etc.. and hunting bears, wild boars, and foxes.  The controls of the game are simple, but take some practice.  

This is a great little world with loads of fun details and balanced play.  Definitely worth a it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000089747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 3019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1444, 'last_played': 1544636882}
review:
Très beau jeu, bien conçu avec un beau graphisme et pas difficile à comprendre et très addictif.

Conseil : 

1. Il serait bien de rendre les mouvements libres quand les options de construction sont activées car se déplacer en latéral comme maintenant est vraiment pénible. (C'est bon, j'ai trouvé. Il faut utiliser la barre d'espace)

author: {'steamid': '76561198423658347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4062, 'last_played': 1575545062}
review:
这大概是一个不打通关就会憋出内伤的游戏，有许多地图BUG可以卡，蹲草丛，躲树林。前期提高了生产力，收材料，刷材料的效率就会高一点，附带着升级下装备，虽然前期被狐狸秀了一脸，但后期爆狐狸头和哥布林就跟玩一样。中期堆放素材要科学，把自家路面铺上石头虽然很浪费但是后期炼金、种田、种玫瑰、炼矿就会快很多。后期攒水晶碎片确实很是一件很碎心的事，碎片掉率感人，唯有炼金才是正途。
缺点不少，画质有点渣（低配电脑也能流畅运行），虽然有时会闪退（？？？？？？），背景音效很写实（也就那几种，谁能告诉我，大晚上，公鸡打鸣是什么操作？拔羽毛后的悲鸣？？？？？）一些制作平台为啥只能放家里？谜一般的操作视角……

author: {'steamid': '76561198119840578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1525722572}
review:
I don’t usually review games, but I most certainly want to review this one. I decided to play something new last night instead of letting my depression win, go to bed, all that good stuff.

All in all, I don’t think this is a bad game, per se, but I don’t think it’s a great one either. I would say it was a nice change of pace, playing a different game in a genre that I sort of enjoy, and it certainly gave me what I had been needing at the time. But while I am rating this a positive experience, I think it is only necessary to provide why this wasn’t the best experience in the hopes of giving your team necessary feedback for your game.

When I first started the game up, it automatically opened the player menu for me so that it could give me my first quests. This was all well and good; it gave me the chance to hover my mouse over things and see what hotkey opens what, and I found that I could move my camera by holding space (on accident). I could pick stuff up off the ground, and walk. I had no reason to really play without my inventory open, so I was organizing as I went along gathering resources. This only became a problem when I got my first knife. The instructions provided said to place it in a number slot to use it, which I did, but found I could not use it for some reason. I wasn’t entirely sure what the system for using tools was as it was my first tool, so I tried hitting 1. Nothing happened. Tried left clicking. Nothing happened. Right click? Still nothing. I spent about five minutes trying to get close enough to things to find out if I needed to be near something, smashing my face into trees and bushes, desperately attempting to cut everything in my path. All was for naught. Finally, I decided to close out the game and come back in, since sometimes my computer is the problem and that tends to fix things. Whoop-tee-doo, I could suddenly use my knife! Then I re-opened the player menu to organize things, briefly thought the game broke again, and then realized what the problem was. It was not my computer, it was the player inventory that I could do everything but use tools in apparently. I felt like such a fool. Granted, most players probably don’t play with their inventories open, but I still feel like this situation would’ve been avoided had the game told me that.
After that bout of confusion, I then proceeded to go back to relatively enjoying the game. I had a nice little campsite that was quite literally already closed off from the rest of the world, so I had nothing to attack me too early into the game. I wasn’t even 100% sure there were monsters at all yet, but I had a big pile of rocks and lots of trees surrounding my camp. I honestly couldn’t even see far enough to see if monsters existed since the game exists in permanent, apparently un-changeable fog. I found the ocean to be rather pretty with the overall game scenery to be lacking, but as it’s an indie game it could have been worse, and it actually looks pretty decent.

Then came the quest to kill goblins. After wasting a lot of resources to clear the brush, axing my way through trees, bushes, and sunflowers, I finally created a path. My introduction to the combat system was not pleasantly smooth, although I did kill my first goblin just fine. I had just hopped into a Discord call as I was discovering this part of the game and my language about it was pretty foul. Needless to say, I didn’t enjoy it. It felt like a shot in the foot after enjoying the gathering mechanics well enough and left me feeling quite sour. Monsters spotting you seems slightly random. I was up on a cliff mining stone and a bear noticed me from below, ran all the way around, and started beating me up. I felt glorious in managing to kill the bear, but I was almost dead and the ratio of healing items to how much you get hurt just is not enough. I also got spotted by a goblin that wasn’t facing me on that same sprint for resources out of my camp, which was unfair and ultimately ended in my untimely demise (and losing half of the resources I left my camp for).
Even worse are the Goddamn animals. Bears, foxes, and boars give literally no fucks in hell about each other. You can be attempting to run from any one of those and another will just run up and join the assault. And by attempt I mean, you really can’t outrun them. You really. Really. Can’t. Your player just isn’t fast enough, because they randomly pick up speed, don’t really seem to have a cut off point of just how far they’ll chase you, and your hope of losing them lies in escaping through a spot just barely wide enough for the player to fit through and hoping the animals get stuck. If you can get out of their line of sight after doing that, you are home free. But it’s still just so unnecessary. You don’t want to make unsurvivable situations for low level players. Yes, you want to make a challenge so the game doesn’t get boring, but if an experience isn’t enjoyable then it’s just not enjoyable. The predatory animals really need to be updated. Maybe make it so foxes will run away if Goblins, bears, or boars start charging at the player. Boars and bears fight each other. Something. A system where players can get crafty to survive encounters rather then being unable to escape death is much more enjoyable.

And last but not least, please explain how to use tools and weapons more thoroughly. I have wasted over thirty nets trying to catch and tame one animal. The net explains what it can catch, but not how to use it, leading to so many of them just being plain old wasted. I even googled how to do it, because the game explained nothing. It did not even give tips on how to catch something. And I’m still struggling! Trying to tame things so far has been a complete waste of time and I am required to do it just to level up enough to be able to craft a bed. And I need the bed so I stop wasting the resources I really don’t have! Please don’t get me wrong, to an extent the “figure things out yourself” method is more fun than games that baby you through everything. But there’s a point where you’re not explaining enough and this is most certainly it.

Despite all my qualms, though, I do like the game. I enjoy that it gives us the basics and then encourages us to do things on our own rather then step-by-stepping each mission. However, I think it takes not explaining things too far, and I feel like the ability to cook food from the get-go would really help making the time it takes to finally create a bed much more worth it, much less grueling. Maybe allow us to make a starter bed? An elevated bow of palm leaves roped to a stick like a makeshift tent or a handful of palm leaves tied together and plopped on the ground. All in all, it’s a nice game for what it is and I really do look forward to seeing how this game may grow over time.

I appreciate all the hard work your team has been putting in to make this and look forward to roping a friend into playing multiplayer with me sometime. Thank you for making Force of Nature.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314806986', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1525700218}
review:
虽说这游戏不算特别垃圾但是用户体验极差！
1.首先是这不三不四的视角，俯视视角锁定在如介绍视频的角度，就像其他人的评价所说感觉头抬不起来也低不下去，而第一视角一眼望去全是迷雾20米外人畜不分，切换了两下发现第一视角的能见度比俯视还要低一点
2.按键操作机制非常非主流，改了键位也要重新习惯，收货跟拾取就不能用同一个键么，打开设施面板也要按两个键：锁定视角调出名字+鼠标点击，E键在箱子里是快速储存在工作台是打开合成表在生产设施又变成收货，操作体验极差。
3战斗机制非常弱智，展现在玩家面前的第一次武器介绍内容（原文我忘了）说那把轻型的武器虽然攻击小但是可以边打边走，但其实这个游戏的战斗不！存！在！走！位！敌方攻击都是锁死的，走位撑足了拖延敌人零点几秒的移动再攻击时间，遇事全靠血量硬钢，技术含量为零，门口清了区区一些哥布林就要回家休养
4.捕获哥布林我再各种情况下丢了40+个陷阱没有任何反应，这种几率我都不知道是我的姿势不对还是几率就是这么低，任务介绍里也压根就没有写清楚。要不是我百度了一下可能连抓鸡都要研究一个下午更别说抓哥布林了，既然给了介绍就不能写清楚一点么

author: {'steamid': '76561198072510140', 'num_games_owned': 2192, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1752, 'last_played': 1525441334}
review: I was very very surprised to how much i like this game. Sometimes the price of a game makes me vary to how good it could be but not in this case. I play a lot of survival type games and this was nice change from those. While its pretty much like the other where to go gather resources and build up your base and farm and whatnot it has some slight differences i enjoy. The main difference is that everything is locked behind your character level and the character level increased after you complete the mandatory quests. I really enjoy this aspect of it because it keeps the game interest. It makes t so you cant just sit there and farm resources and in fives hour have the best gear. You have to do the quest then your able to level which cost something of its own. Then you unlock new things which help you complete the next set of quests and so on. I am 29 hours in and i can still see a bunch of stuff left to unlock. While it can be grindy it still is very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983259012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2627, 'last_played': 1525727395}
review:
Only played multiplayer with one friend so far.
I am at 40 hours played and he is at 20.
50% of the time played together we did the following and 100% of the time of me soloing while my friend was offline so that we could:

Gather water.
Plant/Gather coffee beans.
Gather water
Make Coffee.
and...

Gather water.
Plant/gather wheat.
Feed animals to get needed eggs/wool. (which also requires water to feed the animals and water is VERY slow to come by)
and...

Gather water.
Plant/Gather wheat.
Turn wheat into flour.
Gather more water.
Make bread.

Then later made pies which took all of the above plus:
Gather water.
Plant/gather apples.
[insert wheat+egg farming here]
Gather water.
Make pies.

To make a stack of coffee, bread, pies, or any consumable for healing health or energy would take multiple hours just so we can progress in one biome.
I HIGHLY recommend farming for wool for your equipment every other tier. You will spend way too many hours gathering wheat and wool. Kiting monsters with arrows saves you from taking too many hits once they are in range, so you don't need to rely on having the best armor at all times even if solo.

My biggest complaint is that the wells that generate water have a max capacity of 6 which is way too low.
Animals such as chickens or cows should have a chance to produce like 1-3 eggs/milk instead of just 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030229968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3282, 'last_played': 1666530516}
review:
Force of Nature.

When i saw the intro video i bought the game straight away and it turned out to be a good thing to do and because i can.
And even before i actually start writting a review on this i will state that there is NO WAY i would ever ask for refund on this game, just to clarify that and here is the reason why. (Also this is a review on Creative mode of the game that i play right now, i want to try everything before starting survival and getting them achievements rolling in).

1. Graphics are good.
2. Controls are easy, in fact they are laid out the same way as you would play an fps game, 
3. Combat system is a bit crappy but tolerable, as long as you dont give the enemy a chance to run away.
4. crafting system is actually better than the one you have in games like minecraft. 
5. A VERY GRINDY GAME, thats right...there is no easy way in this game. Either its leveling up or building a mill, the items required are sometimes hard to come by. (Actually not, mill and brick house are easy to build, as long as you have supplies laying around in your chests. 
6. As mentioned above leveling is quite tricky, for example, to reach level 9 you need 10 honey and 15 onyx chips. At first you might think *ah man, thats BS, i will never get it* but there is actually a trick on how to bypass this if you have correct materials, altar and alchemical lab built....plus a dozen of roses of any colour.
7. The hardest in this game has to be the gold ingots. The thing is that its tough and i mean VERY TOUGH to get your hands on gold coins, which are dropped by certain monsters in different areas. Goblins drop most of the time copper coins but sometimes 1-3 gold coins as well. You might feel that its not fair to kill 10 goblins and only 2 of them dropped 2 gold coins each, but then again there is always another way. Go ahead and enter desert map, kill off a couple of devils, because they only drop gold coins not copper anymore, and as a bonus they tend to drop topaz chips. 
8. There is an alternative for getting gem chips, if you happen to have yellow or white roses laying around somewhere, get them in seedbeds and constantly grow them, build mill and get that elixir rolling in, because as soon as you got that and hundreds of stacks of roses, there should be no problem with chips anymore.
9. Building something in this game is actually as easy as making coffee....for experienced players there should be no problem gathering certain resources and building stuff, but seems to me other people think otherwise.

Overall this game has a bright future and i absolutely love it. Keep up the good work devs, dont forget to add more stuff to the game in near future. Say an enchantment table would be nice, to enchant armor or weapons using gems or chips.

All the haters out there can piss their pants trying to get their refund on 2 hours play time, seriously....2-3 hours and you already writting a negative review. How about spending more time on the game? You will like it eventually...

This is a HARDCORE survival game and i like it the way it is, no changes needed. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997748682', 'num_games_owned': 875, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1523485257}

author: {'steamid': '76561198165729684', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5786, 'last_played': 1525140118}
review:
Why did I play this game? The payoff for the amount of work you have to do is non existant. Not wanting to mention the frustrastion involved with getting to level 12 because other reviews do a great job of telling those problems but simply put, this game is too realistic in the worst way, you could literally walk somewhere and chop wood and the other tedious tasks faster in real life.

When you finally reach the last level, if you ever keep playing long enough, the amount of work involved is overwhelming and the developers created the perfect storm to ensure your frustration and that you absolutely hate this game before it's over. To reach level "13" where there's no incentive as far as new upgrades, you need to create 5 of each gem, which means you need to dig 2250 sand blocks to create 450 glass bars then make 450 test tubes, you need to fill the test tubes with 10 flowers each for a total of 4500 flowers to make the elixIirs, the developers put a cap of 6 wells so you have to wait minutes for them to fill up with 6 water each that's 36 water every 3-4 minutes. To make 5 flowers takes 16 water so the most you can make is around 2 per 3-4 minutes unless you stalkpile water which takes time in itself, then you have to wait 3-4 minutes for them to grow................ were talking hours upon hours, then wait for the elixirs to become chips then wait for the chips to become gems.......... ARE WE HAING FUN YET???? Just to make it a little more FUN they force you to make 15 gold bars on top of that and 20 molotov cocktails....... there a couple more hours of great enjoyable content for you. Even at the highest level with the "best" armor your no match for most enemies......... I'm done with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007973488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11257, 'last_played': 1642846573}
review:
So I see a lot of people complain that this game is a grind, and too slow etc.
Yes, it's true that the pace is a bit slower than many games.
And of course it would get boring if you start to craft something and then stand around to look at the progress bar.
I have found that I always have plenty of things to do, and by the time they are done so is the crafting.
To me this is relaxing, and a good contrast to stressful RTS or FPS games.

The main skill in this game, in my opinion, is to be able to aggro one enemy at a time. The further you get in the game the more important this gets. This could take a bit of patience in some circumstances, as you might have to wait for enemies to wander apart. But it's also quite fun to circle an area and look for opportunities to pull an enemy away from the bunch.

Of course there are things that could be improved, getting a little bit of story into the game would be one thing. But considering the low price, and the fact that this is a one man show I must say this game is remarkably good. With the right mindset you will have a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163834595', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1509913277}
review:
So this game is a fairly straight forward survival simulator. Easy to play and I didn't encounter any bugs.

I was a little bummed on the limitations. for example you could only build a certain amount of huts based on your level.
I found that you definitely do not want to be a packrate in this game. carry what you need and store what you feel you may need.  You are even limited to a certain amount of storage boxes based on your level.  (why??)
I recommend getting a good weapon early on in the game so you can explore farther without needing to run back to base and heal.
Game Mechanics are a little clunky in the movement, but it makes up for it with crafting dynamics in my opinion.

for the $7.99 I would say give it a try!  6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198281098984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2584, 'last_played': 1524350044}
review:
Suite à mes 43h de jeu et une partit fini en coop, je viens laisser ma petite évaluation dessus.

C'est l'un des meilleurs jeu auquel j'ai eu le plaisir de jouer depuis pas mal de temps.
Je le place dans la même ligné que the witcher vue sont niveaux de gameplay et ses mécanique ultra pousser.

Bien entendu je déconne, faut pas rêver.
8€ pour choper un cancer c'est un peu chère à mon gout. 

Tout d'abord parlons du multijoueur qui est totalement flinguer.
Un allié meurt, tout le monde meurt.
Seul l'hote pourra valider les succès steam durant la partit, et uniquement lui débloquera le mode hardcore une fois la partit fini.
Donc quand vous aurez fini de souffrir après des heures de tuerie visuel, 75% de l'équipe l'aura fais juste pour le fun.
Sois dis en passans, le fun est mort après le lvl2, quand tu commence a comprendre a quel point tu va devoir refouler tes pulsion suicidaire.
Je sais pas pour le solo, mais a plusieurs quand tu passe presque 2h uniquement en craft pour t'équiper et ainsi pouvoir explorer une zone froide, ou chaude, les envie de meurtre se font omniprésente.

Le seul point positif c'est la musique.
A mon avis tout le budget a du y passer et c'est pour sa que le reste est vide.
Le temps de jeu se comble par l'attente et uniquement l'attente du repop de monstre et le craft d'objet.
Après l'attente c'est uniquement du bourrinage de débile.

Les gnome que l'on capture sont tellement bête qu'ils attaquent pas les ennemi.

Enfin bon, c'est un jeu sympa pour passer le temps quand t'as rien a faire avec des amis, mais a part sa, chercher pas le jeu de l'anné.
En même temps pour 4€ en réduc, j'attendais pas mieux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067662896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5777, 'last_played': 1668814360}
review:
Agréablement surprise. 
Ce jeu est très addictif mais je le conseille uniquement aux gens qui ont de la patience et qui souhaitent un jeu de détente. C'est plus ou moins long de fabriquer les éléments pour créer son village ainsi que la nourriture, mais au final ça le rend plus réaliste. Avec un peu d'organisation on s'en sort très bien.
Si on est bien équipé les combats ne sont pas si difficiles à condition d'avoir les habits et la nourriture adaptés à son niveau.
Je n'ai pas d'avis sur le multi car je n'y joue qu'en solo et cela me convient.
Je n'en suis qu'au niveau 8 et je ne compte pas le lacher avant la fin !

author: {'steamid': '76561198349336698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1523515912}
review:
Очень скучный и однообразный игровой процесс. Я люблю песочницы, люблю стратегии и строительство, но здесь все настолько затянуто и нудно, что играть дольше пары часов не тянет (не пары часов в день, а пары часов всего!). Возможно в кооперативе процесс интереснее, но в одиночку это совершенно не стоит потраченного времени. Например, чтобы набрать 50 штук земли или глины, ты должен несколько минут стоять на месте и ковырять землю палочкой (то бишь тыкать мышкой по одному месту) и всё - больше ничего не происходит. Аналогично с остальными ресурсами. Понятно, что во всех песочницах добыча ресурсов занимает много времени, но, вспоминая ту же Terraria, там можно делать кучу дел, открывать мир, копать сокровища, сражаться с монстрами и попутно разведывать месторождения. Здесь же ты тупо копаешь и рубишь, чтобы суметь скрафтить хоть что-то стоящее. А зачем крафтить? Правильно - чтобы копать и рубить до следующий вещи. 
Есть и другие существенные минусы - неудобное управление, странная камера, потеря множества полезных вещей после смерти (с учетом того, что на добычу этих вещей уходит до фига времени) и прочее.
Понятно, что игра пока на ранней стадии развития, но рекомендовать ее на данном этапе никому не буду.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143723213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1519542860}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993894575', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 1030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1523823948}
review:
It is truly a grind but I played and played hoping it would be worth it, hoping area farther in the game would be more exciting. So I crafted my fur armor to brave the cold right after I unequip my hot armor from braving the hot. The next place to go I must craft white fur armor now or it is too cold; with no content truly new or exciting. White fur armor takes every ingredient but x more + another material; sooo grindy. 

This game can be moderately fun if you play with a friend on free mode and avoid the normal progression mode like the plague. For me though it is too late to do that mode; I’m already grinded out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196745281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1538673798}
review:
Pros:
- excellent challange w/o being too easy  or too hard
- very engrossing environment and atmosphere such that it feels as if you were actully stranded upon a desert island
- very rewarding to "get next level" and craft new things
- employs a fetch/gather resource based system that is balanced well (not too grindy, not just given either. Items must be earned and it feels very rewarding)
- beautifl envrionment that does not at all feel bland or repetitive. Very fun to explore
- many resources such as ores are limited in their quanitity and location. Must be wise about how you spend resources
- many decorations make crafting and personalizing your "base" very fun and unique
- environmental sounds are fantastic and make sense based on the types of critters near you
- excellent leveling system and items to craft to suit your play style
- excellent tutorial and menu system
- price to get this EA game is outstanding

Cons:
- for some folks - they may prefer a soundtrack vs envrinmental sounds 
- the combat is clunky and awkward but nevertheless it is functional
- no controller support as of the time of this writing
- obviously the game is in EA, neverhteless could use more items to craft and npc merchants or quests
- could use some recurring quest lines to keep things interesting for endgame (ex go fetch, go kill, defend the base, protect an ally, escourt an ally etc)

OVERALL:
- I love this game and rate it a 8/10 based on my EA experience with it. It is of course a niche game, but if your into it then its a great little game for super cheap!

author: {'steamid': '76561198170382415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1564104542}
review:
TL;DR: Some parts of the game are great, but overall it's a bit too cumbersome for me to really enjoy with consistency. Worth it for the price ($7.99 USD as I type this)

I tried really hard to like this game, and made sure to give it a solid 8 hours of focused gameplay over a period of about a week. The videos on the store page show a rather dynamic camera movement which I could not recreate and it left me struggling to be able to see some of the world immediately around my character and made combat a bit cumbersome. There is also not much of a tutorial or guide available in-game.  What is there is actually really nice, but I found myself having to occassionally pause everything and sit back trying to figure out how to do something.  

On the positive side, I've run this on multiple computers of varying abilities and had no problems crop up.  The world is beautifully generated, and I felt a bit drawn in to wondering what the story behind the world was. (I didn't find any real storyline, but I don't feel that that takes away from this game).  Most of the game makes sense right from the top if you've played similar games before.

Ultimately this is the type of game I play when I want something a little less intense and can afford to just relax without feeling like I need to rush to get things done in-game.  Despite the negative portions of this review, I will be returning to the game intermittently, but not regularly.  The game does give you a nice sense of accomplishment as you build, craft, and explore so you really do feel like you're being successful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993036518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1479, 'last_played': 1524065534}
review: I've really tried to like this game ,but the rediculus amount of grinding you have to do to do even the simplest of things gets old within the first couple of hours and just keeps getting worse and worse. The game will make you collect large quantities of rare and semi rare drops from enemies that half the time won't drop anything at all. Once you finally do get everything your reward will be unlocking a basic crafting recipe that in any other crafting type game you would start with. After grinding through level after level and still just getting the most basic of crafting I finally just had to admit that this was a waste of money and an even bigger waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983434998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 1990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1990, 'last_played': 1515150319}
review:
Un petit plaisir, mais trop instable actuellement pour que je le recommande.

Si vous avez le malheur de vivre un crash in game, vous perdrez votre partie. Pas de système de sauvegarde en cloud qui puisse vous permettre de la récupérer. Dommage.

J'ai ainsi commencé un game que j'ai perdue au bout de 10 heures de jeu. N'ayant pas eut envie de tout recommencer étant donné que tout prend quand même pas mal de temps, j'ai laissé tomber. A part ça, le titre n'a pas de gros défauts si ce n'est qu'il est un peu mou. Le craft est riche, le jeu est beau et les environnements a visiter sont variés et agréables. 

A voir sur la durée si il devient plus attractif.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960566151', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1524021190}
review:
I was going to write a whole diatribe about my experience with this game but after looking at some reviews I think [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197972200621/recommended/568570/]bigfoot's review[/url] down below says it best. 

[b]TL;DR:[/b] The "Losing items when you die" system wouldn't be that bad if you didn't have to [b][u]PAY TO LEVEL[/u][/b]. I'm fine with a "punishing" difficulty if need be, but this seems made to artificially inflate your time played by incredibly-grindy farming. Which is sad because I was kind of enjoying the game. Picked it up for $4 but I'm still refunding it. Someone with 20 more hours played than my 1 hour saying the same thing as me tells me that this game is going to have zero change in gameplay/enjoyment much later on.
