author: {'steamid': '76561197972200621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1495, 'last_played': 1586268176}
review:
I was going to leave a review after only a few hours of playing because I wanted to vent my anger at the devs, but decided to hold off and push through some more levels.  I have reached level 7 and currently progressing very slowly towards level 8.

I say very slowly, but the devs have made it such a struggle to progress quickly.  While this could be a good thing they appear to have done it purely to extended your gameplay.  I see no other reason.

It's grindy, very grindy.  You farm to make something, using all your resources, to discover you now need to make something else, which requires some resources you have just used up plus others you have to grind away the hours for.  I personally don't mind grindy games, I actually quite enjoy it, but this game does really push me to my absolute limit.

With each level you have a number of objectives to complete, which can be tricky on it's own, but you also have to pay to move to the next level.  This payment is in gold/copper/resources or anything else they choose.  This is my 1st issue with the game.  There is no reason at all to justify this 'payment' other than to make you farm/grind for much longer than is necessary.  The game very quickly switches focus from survival and exploring to all about levelling-up.

When I reached level 6 and seeing the new stuff I could make, I did then see that more exploration would be possible.  The objectives were straightforward, albeit grindy, but the thing that made me scream out in pain was the payment of 5 gold bars (75 gold coins), plus some other stuff.  You only get coins from killing goblins, and they drop either gold but mostly copper coins, meaning I needed to kill a shed load to reach the next level, only to have them taken away from me when I did.  Again, the 'payment' system is unforgiving and unforgivable.

Combat!!  It's not really combat, more just hitting out until your enemy is dead.  I eventually found the best thing to do is to walk hit whilst walking backwards to try to avoid enemy hits.  If you attack one, every enemy around you will also attack.  If you get outnumbered, you're as good as dead, unless it's goblins as they are fairly easy.  You can't turn and run, because everything runs faster than you - I found this out when attacked by 2 boars - I ran butt they continued to attack me, and a fox joined in for the gits and shiggles.  No way to defined yourself.  This is the second issue with the game.

There are other niggles and dislikes, but the above 2 points really make the game frustrating and unenjoyable to play.  I bought the game at 50% off, and while it's very good for the value I believe the price should be ignored when reviewing a game.  I can't recommend the game.  If they sort it out by removing the level payments and improving the combat, I'll give it a thumbs up :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993886588', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1649853551}
review:
Bardzo rozbudowany krafting to zaleta tej gry. Do tego dochodzi po parę zadań do każdego poziomu, po którym wspinamy się wyżej odblokowując nowe przedmioty możliwe do budowania/kraftowania. Gra wciąga i to bardzo. Na początku jest łatwo. Później trzeba myśleć co należy dalej robić, skąd wziąć przedmioty. Dodatek to tryb Multiplayer, którego nie miałem okazji przetestować bo nikt z moich znajomych nie posiada tej gry niestety a szkoda, bo we 2 osoby na pewno grałoby przyjemniej. :D

Minus jest taki, że za bardzo nie mamy gdzie składować przedmiotów, ponieważ zbudowanie skrzyni/beczki do przechowywania jest "drogie" a to też mało daje bo w takiej beczce znajduje się zaledwie 10 slotów.
Spora ilość moich przedmiotów leży na ziemii bo boduwanie beczki jest "drogie" jak już wspomniałem, a za itemy do zbudowania beczki, lepiej zrobić inne bardziej użyteczne rzeczy, ponieważ niektóre itemy są zbyt cenne, aby budować pierwszą lepszą rzecz.

Miałem tylko polecić grę i zmieścić się w jednym zdaniu a wszyło jak widać. Także, jeszcze raz POLECAM!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044400749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 11917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5187, 'last_played': 1570018350}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023931705', 'num_games_owned': 1713, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1524951585}
review:
Excelente juego, lo tenía en deseados, lo vi en oferta y lo compre, al principio me pareció “tosco” y los controles son algo “particulares”, aunque después de unos minutos ya está todo incorporado y se empieza a disfrutar. No solo me sorprendió para bien, sino que me tiene enamorado! debemos farmear muchísimo, pelear, craftear y construir pero de una forma obligada bien integrada en un camino evolutivo de crecimiento muy logrado, creo que es el primer juego de este tipo que sabe utilizar el cumplimiento de los objetivos para ir avanzando y lo hace de una manera armónica, está muy bien balanceado en este aspecto y engancha muchísimo. 
Por ahí leí unos comentarios donde mencionan que el juego es lento o que se tarda bastante, pero creo que la definición correcta es LABORIOSO, al que no le guste el hecho de tener que conseguir recursos y saberlos administrar para ir avanzando se va a quedar afuera de este juegazo, que promete, cumple con creses y tiene algunos detalles donde hace que sea un placer explorar, solo hay que jugarlo, el mismo juego se encarga de enseñarte, guiarte y acompañarte, es fabuloso realmente, estoy a mitad de camino y ya me saca esta reseña personal y lo pagaría nuevamente a precio completo (casi que me siento en deuda con los desarrolladores por pagarlo en oferta).
Hasta acá no me encontré ningún bug, solo satisfacción, ganas de jugarlo, avanzar y disfrutar, ya veo venir que me voy a quedar con ganas de más… 
Lo único que podría pedir es más espacio en base para guardar cosas (cofres y barriles) :D
RECOMENDADO A MAS NO PODER SEÑORES!!!! Muchas gracias por esto!! aplausos......

author: {'steamid': '76561198025253042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1610988158}
review:
Aunque todavia no he completado el juego creo que ya he visto mas que suficiente para hacer un analisis.
Lo primero destacar que segun tengo entendido el juego lo ha realizado una o dos personas, ya sobre esta base entramos en la materia de como es el juego.
Es un juego bastante entretenido a mi manera de ver, tipo minecraft, empiezas como naufrago en una isla generada proceduralmente (isla aleatoria por partida), debemos ir poco a poco hacer una serie de misiones que consiste en crear cosas o recopilar ciertos items y conforme subimos de nivel aprenderemos nuevas formulas y podremos crear mas cosas.
La gente en los analisis se queja de que es un juego LENTO, a mi sinceramente no me lo ha parecido, ese es el encanto que tiene este juego, que vas poco a poco, no es el tipico juego que talas 2 arboles y ya puedes montar una granja.
Tiene multijugador cooperativo aunque yo aun no lo he podido probar (no tengo a nadie con quien jugar xDD).
¿Lo recomendaria? claro que si, pero unicamente a un tipo de publico concreto que le gusta jugar sin prisas y a juegos que te tienes que buscar la vida y que no buscan objetivos concretos si no que juegan por diversion y para desconectar del mundo real.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039468449', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1630584883}
review:
At fist a thought that it was lame….it took too long to make something or even run somewhere.  But you get used to it. Took a little time to get all the control right and how to do stuff (and to just ignore the rabbits). A small tutorial option would be nice. 
I’m level 9 and I still think this is a very slow game…just to gather things…sloooowwww 
chopping wood even with the iron axe is still slow. I hope you make them better so you can feel a different. 
The quests I like a lot except the gather things to level up. a little different quests would be nice, its alot of build this make that.  Why gather tings to level up? Make more “you must do this before you can lv up” quests or an xp bar. I just skipped a lot of enemies just by chopping through the woods avoiding enemies and strait to the stone thing just to save health food and stamina for the gathering of gems (lv 8 to 9). 
And it would be nice if you can play with others trough internet….I think that’s is a must nowadays to have with this kind of game. 

I hoped to see like a goblin house or something, goblinchests? The game feels abit stiff and lonely...maybe some random npc to save or intreact with? 

But overall I like it. I will play until Im tired of chopping wood slow.

pssst...were are the female character!????

review:
一款不错的沙盒生存游戏，虽然不是大热游戏但是游戏性还是比较丰富的。如果你看介绍觉得这游戏不错可以在打折的时候入手。鉴于这款游戏的攻略不多，玩家也不算太多，本人做了一份自己体验的指南分享一些自己的经验。有兴趣可以看一下。

指南名称：Force of Nature for Chinese(自然之力中文版攻略）

author: {'steamid': '76561198094363701', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1523700003}
review:
我思考了很久，究竟是推荐还是不推荐。
最后我终于在玩了一天一夜之后，决定，于我个人而言，我弃坑。
优点：说明书很全面。生存游戏和RPG的结合很好，自由探索的世界，就一个固定视角的游戏而言，很好。
缺点：添加进制作时间应该纯粹是为了杀玩家时间，强行拖游戏时间，收集要素太过繁多和冗长，。
          其实以上都不算事！最过分的是操作手感跟SHI一样，大概整个游戏中唯一需要的技巧就是“秦王绕柱走”，只是，即使用上这个技巧也不会对战斗有多大影响就是了。猪脚虽然操作手感跟SHI一样，不过敌人倒是很灵活！你造吗！四五只怪兽围攻你，结果你顶着被人揍得满头包的痛苦，把敌人挨个磨成丝血之后，它喵的突然开了加速，疯狂逃窜！！！然后你就只能眼睁睁看着它消失在远方！（即使你手握长弓也没用，它哪里都钻！）啥都没留下！结果你磕了一堆用十分钟做出来的血药，射了一堆手感SHI一样的箭！战利品就捞着1只！反正我是一口凌霄血憋成内伤。
本来之前就有所耳闻，手感跟SHI一样，我想习惯一下应该还行，
但是我低估了这坨SHI的威力，我第一次觉得玩游戏是件累吐血的事。。。。。
如果有一天它能完善战斗系统，做成画面更精美的游戏，我会再支持一波。
至于现在，我弃坑了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198002142971', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1524004155}
review:
This game has a LOT of potential. The main issue I have with it, is the multiplayer needs lots of work. The fact the players can only go so far from each other is a problem. I get the whole working together thing, but allowing players to move more freely from each other helps with the whole co-op thing. Especially when mobs start to despawn in already explored areas unless you're in single player mode.

Also, PLEASE ADD A SELECTION TO PLAY AS A FEMALE INSTEAD! Im a girl, I'd play to play as such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314455800', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1689286068}
review: Muy buen juego! recomendado! voy 11 horas  y avance lo suficiente para decir que esta genial y muy completo. No se si haya final y no me importa, el hecho de poder construir, jugar cooperativo e investigar es genial. USEN SU IMAGINACION :D. Me gustaria poder formar parte del staff o grupo creativo para aportar al juego e incluso promocionarlo (: le veo gran potencial! JUEGUENLO, lleva su tiempo al principio pero se aprende rapido. SALUDOS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198386787182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 395, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1586634439}
review:
"Force of Nature" wirkte auf mich im ersten Spieleindruck sehr einfach gehalten und rückschrittlich. Will ich so etwas wirklich spielen? 
Doch dann habe ich an dieser Einfachheit gefallen gefunden. 
Ich fühle mich entspannt in dieser Spielwelt. 
Die Reizüberflutung und Kicks aus den modernen Spielen dieses Genres bleiben hier aus und sorgen so für Entschleunigung. 

Wer nach einem gemütlichen Survival-Spiel sucht und keine hohen Anforderungen an Grafik und Spielmechanik hat, sollte FoN vielleicht mal ausprobieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058561178', 'num_games_owned': 1697, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1527932785}
review:
El juego en si, es fabuloso, entretiene bastante por la cantidad de cosas que se tiene que hacer y la verdad que su precio me ha dejado asombrado, porque ay juegos mas pobres de trabajo y son mucho mas caros.
Lo unico que le pongo en contra, es el poco espacio que te dan los baules para guardar cosas y la poca visibilidad que te da el personaje cuando esta apunto de morir y si me lo pongo a mirar bien, te acabas acostumbrando.
Por lo demas, yo no e visto que aya nada mas que me haga dudar de este gran titulo.
Saludos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273161783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1524228577}
review:
The game is a bit robotic in the way it makes you do things. Its not like you can "multitask".  It has this "wanky" feel to it.. I see where the DEV was going but feel short.  Window means window... it locks you in and you cant get out of the window as I use 3 screens, I have to be able to get to other screens.. thats a  problem for me.. 

It needs to be smother having to cancel on each menu is just a pain in the butt... 

I like where its going but cant give a recommend at this time... maybe once you work out the basic problems..  

Problem list??? Where do I start....

Ya need to get you basic setting set first...
window... full screen... audio graphics... ya get that working first... 

If you looking to get this game be ready, your going to need lots of time...

author: {'steamid': '76561198449575923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1631462246}
review: Эта игра напоминает мне как я приехал в деревню к бабке,рубил дрова,копал яму под туалет,собирал червей на рыбалку.Вечером возле магазина ко мне пристали местные гоблины,сразился с ними,стрелял из самодельного лука по котам,заделал из их шкур импровизированную броню,в посадке сколотил шалаш,там нюхал клей,развёл костёр,подключился по мультиплееру местный алкаш,с ним пошли на медведя,он нас убил,я заспавнился дома в карманах не хватало 10 рублей и со странными ощущениями в области заднего прохода.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038888717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1566034210}
review:
ce ne sera pas le jeu du siecle, mais pour moins de 10 euros, c'est super. c'est agréable, pas trop gourmand, amusant et ca passe agréablement le temps. 
Sérieux, n'ayez pas l'exigence d'un bethesda ou autre BB. on s"amuse pour peu qu'on ne cherche pas la perle rare.

J'apprécie d'y jouer en solo. Et non je ne le trouve pas difficile. ne soyez pas Conan le barbare ou Scrubb! faut avancer pépere et être prudent. Les monstres ne vous suivent pas longtemps, alors courrez .

author: {'steamid': '76561198195374435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1518986706}
review:
I wanted to give this game a little more time before I gave it a review, but I think I have a good enough idea considering how many other similar games I play to this one. (Keep in mind, this is based off of the questing mode, not creative).

Pros:
- I really like that there are quests.
- The graphics are nice. 
- It's harder than minecraft.
- Co-op is easy! I started a world and my husband was easily able to join me in a world I had started in single player.

Cons:
- You cannot move forward without completing the quests, you cannot level up and crafting is unavailable (besides the basics) until you level up (which in some way I do like, but some items would be nice earlier than when they are available to you).
- Combat isn't the best. You basically click until the enemy is dead or you're dead.
- It's a grinder. While, my favorite games are survival, open world, crafting games, this game takes a little more time than a lot of other games. Grinding seems necessary in these types of games but it's a little more than my, personal, liking.
- Crafting time, some items take an excessive amount of time, it seems. I don't mind that crafting takes time, but there were a few times I was just watching for a while because I was waiting for things to complete.
- For me, I want to be able to be efficient and by this I mean I want to be able to gather, build, or explore, while waiting for something to craft or build. Because of the points I made above, it felt like I was only focusing on one task at a time. I would gather one item, then another until I had everything for a crafting item or to complete a quest. I couldn't really deviate from the quests because in order to move forward you had to complete them.


So, I guess this game easily lost my interest. As you can see, I don't have very many hours in, I really wanted to like the game and I did enjoy it, but not enough for me to put more time in (it felt like work). Like someone else said, I wish there was a neutral option because I know this game could be enjoyable for people who don't mind the things I mentioned above, but if you're like me and you like seeing progress in a timely manner, it probably won't do it for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999993890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4507, 'last_played': 1522886623}
review:
Devido a la cantidad de comentarios diciendo que es un juego lento,
yo me tome el juego mas como un juego de supervivencia, que como un juego de construcciones. 
 (En menos de 70 horas ya tenia todo desbloqueado, el maximo nivel y misiones completadas. Juego terminado.)

 ¿porque dicen es un juego lento?:
-las construcciones necesitan muchos recursos, algunos hay que craftearlos y estos pueden tardar "mucho" en crearse.

Para mi, el juego se me hizo corto, pero, me tubo enganchadisimo pensando en como economizar mis recursos y crafteando solo lo necesario y mas eficiente.

Mi puntuacion: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197983419308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1816, 'last_played': 1527369858}
review:
Ce jeu est INCROYABLE ! Un multi fonctionnel et une aventure hors du commun !

...

Nan je déconne, soyez pas trop exigeant, ça passe le temps avec les amis sur un jeu pas trop cher ( a prendre en promo, même a 8 € ça fait cher).

Vous mourrez, toute l'équipe meurt même si vous êtes tous très éloignés.
Des heures et des heures de farming de fourrures pour pouvoir être tous équipés pour avancer dans la map.
Si vous n'êtes pas tous a proximité de la nouvelle zone, vous ne pouvez pas charger la map.

Bref il y a du contenu mais optimisé pour 1 seul joueur et bidouillé pour marcher en "multi".

Pour les joueurs casual pas exigeant et petit budget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141311938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3251, 'last_played': 1690638035}
review: Долго сомневался брать игру или не брать. Отзывы крайне противоречивы. В общем взял и очень рад. игра спокойная и неторопливая, что гарантирует приятное времяпровождение уже сейчас. А ещё и апдейты ждут! Пока осваиваюсь в сингле, перед тем как ринуться в мир мультиплеера данного шедевра!

author: {'steamid': '76561198312701968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 41920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34082, 'last_played': 1640625738}
review: Меня игра "зацепила" сразу,  (люблю выживалки) а тут еще и в кустах смотрю кто то прячется, сразу -  ага, куда это я попала? это не просто "тупая выживалка" это ПРИКЛЮЧЕНИЕ, это выживание в новом, враждебном для меня мире,  (играла на пиратке, пробничек) тут же "побежала за лицухой" поняла, надо брать и не пожалела. Да, есть и плюсы и минусы, но во - первых ни такая она и дорогая,  во - вторых   она еще в разработке (сейчас делается 2 часть и делается одним человеком)  нет игра реально цепляет, я даже мужа "подсадила" чтоб по сети поиграть, он не долго ломался (хотя до этого только в касынку играл)  Да, тут нет ЗОМБИ, нет КРОВАВОЙ РЕЗНИ, но без них игра не стала хуже, даже мне кажется выиграла, представьте в Весеннем биоме (с розовыми деревьями) или в Магическом  (с мыльными пузырями ) зомби разгуливают? если вам надоели Зомби но дух авантюриста и война в вас еще остался, тогда берем игру и ИГРАЕМ

author: {'steamid': '76561198029109271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 21092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20787, 'last_played': 1701255851}
review:
je fais cette évaluation car je vient juste de le terminer en mode hard core...
Que dire qui n'as pas été déjà dit...comparé à Don't starve que je n'ai pas aimé à cause d'un craft totalement illogique ,de recherche continue de nourriture et de chauffage  pour finalement mourir plus tard car tu as trop coupé de bois et que les monstres n'ont pas apprécié et te le font savoir en bande d'une douzaine...en plus c'est plutot moche alors de celui est vraiment beau.
Ce jeu n'est pas du bashing !! tu dois évaluer tes chances et devoir kitter les mobs un par un si possible !!
La gestion de ton camp est de surtout créer des labyrinthes de sortie afin qu'aucune bestioles de l'exterieur ne puisse y entrer.et mettre des lampes portables pour reperer les coins les plus surs !façon Petit poucet ! ^^
tous les mobs que tu as éliminés ne respawn que lorsque tu quittes le jeu DONC Dès que tu as la quête de recherche du premier fragment et donc les portails de téléportation;
Tu dois prendre le temps de faire ton parcours pour poser ton portail le plus près possible du lieu , ne pas hésiter à contourner et ca prend un temps fou!! donc une foutue patience est de mise !
je n'ai mis que 7 portails en mode HC.
L'interface n'est pas vraiment tip top mais tu peux configurer les touches ..heureusement
Finalement pour gagner tu dois soit continuer a farmer des mobs voir memes des hard pour chopper hasardement des fragments de pierres précieuses.
Soit et c'est la l'astuce ultime et la beauté du  jeu !! faire pousser des roses !!!!
Ce n'est pas un jeu pour kikitoutdur car tu dois gerer ton equipement pour etre optimum selon les climats que tu traverses et la moindre erreur peut etre fatale!
La première partie t'apprend les règles et la découverte du jeu , Hélas tu dois refaire celle ci en mode hardcore sinon le succès n'est pas validé..Confirmation après réception d'un mail des Dev.
Le seul truc négatif pour ma part est l'alchimie qui intervient quasiment trop tard et donc inutile quand tu connais tes possibilités. ca aurait pu etre un must mais au début..
Sinon j'ai vraiment transpiré en évitant surtout de paniquer selon les situations et réellement adoré ce jeu...

author: {'steamid': '76561198015970646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5109, 'last_played': 1566932328}
review:
Force of Nature is a very good game in the crafting, building, and survival genres.
I would very much like to try the Co-op in FoN.

For the price, FoN is a great singleplayer experience.
The game feels very complete and there are no additional in-app purchases needed to enjoy the game.

The game is properly challenging, but careful preparation should allow you to prevail. This is a game with a goal to reach, collect the FoN shards and assemble the FoN artifact. So much more than just an aimless sandbox building/survival game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009351603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 4105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4105, 'last_played': 1490414388}
review: I poured a good chunk of time into this and enjoyed it for the most part.  Oddly, the game becomes really lonely after a while.  You keep building what starts to look like a town, but there's no NPCs to share it with, no other players to interact with and after a while it kind of feels pointless as a result.  If I could give this a nuetral rating  I would, as it stands it nudges into a positive 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021878614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1876, 'last_played': 1517536956}
review: This game is more or less a grind-fest with generally simple mechanics. If you have little to zero patience for grinds, I'd avoid it.  Otherwise, this one will keep you busy for a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389890263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1700034034}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002356718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1520282467}
review:
In spite of the great price for the amount of content you get I just can't reccomend this game due to the tedium it involves. 

Hacking your way though the same enemies again and again so that you can collect enough gold pieces, etc. in order to level up(which is required to be able to build more buildings and craft more items) again really detracts from what would otherwise be an enjoyable game.

Eventually the game became more of a source of stress than a source of enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065428544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1663972221}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018891968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1575888077}
review:
이것 저것 조잡한것이 많이 보이는 게임이지만

장점

author: {'steamid': '76561197974854710', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1635630581}
review:
The price is nearly right for this game but I would say it's still a little high due to the lack of content this games got. The graphics are very bad for a game in 2018 there is a lot of '' Early Access '' games that don't have this issue so this game shouldn't either. The character creation is not very well made and limited to what you can do. The in-game objects clip a lot and you can find yourself inside a rock more times than not. 

The fighting style is generic and something that you could make yourself in one of them game building programs you can find on steam. The mace is really slow and not a very good weapon to fight with when you have multiple enemies around you. 

The objects seem like they have been imported from an old ''sims island'' game and you can't really build anything nice it's all been preset up for you. The play style is very slow and time-consuming with all the resource you need to gather just to build a small object.

I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone I know and I think there is a lot of other options that are on the market that you could try before paying money for this game. I will attach some screenshots to my profile so people can see some of the in-game objects and how they look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045765418', 'num_games_owned': 2112, 'num_reviews': 776, 'playtime_forever': 2938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1806, 'last_played': 1586965440}
review:
Very good sandbox with nice sounds. Music for now notice only one, for couple min. Was great but sadly only one time it appeard and suddenly. We land on beach in random generated world. Gather, build/create, explore and fight. We must explore to win, go further in forest to taiga and jungle. Make food, tame animals and create items that will help you to survive. World is full of foxs, bears, goblins and many more enemies that want you dead. You can play with couple friends with ease. Game is worth buyin' and playin'.

Controls are easy to learn and you can change them. Graphic is simple, no much of effects but gameplay it's his magic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043139843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 28303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13121, 'last_played': 1622512741}
review:
Hello all who read this.
This game is so time consuming and the rewards are not that great. It would be nice if you could plant the trees and they would grow back. I have been through every map and I have got almost all the Stone.
It would be nice if the Stone came back like from a earth quake or some FORCE OF NATURE.
As you play you see that all the monsters re-spawn and in bigger numbers as you level up.
The end reward for the game is by far the worst I have ever seen in a video game.
But if you have NOTHING to do in your life then this game will keep you busy right up to the end. 
I hate how the things you fight just run away I did find away around this and it works every time because you can not chase them down. The trick is to know how much your main weapon will do with one swing. then hit the bad guy with a hit from the pick or the axe then switch to the main weapon and one hit kill. 
Most people say you get what you pay for and that is very much so for this game.
It most defiantly needs some updates that will make it a better game.
I do recommend this game because it is fun to play
I have to say playing the game 4 times at over 100 hrs of game play each game has severely retarded my life. This word just means slow and everything you have to do in the game is slower than a heard of turtles. I have found that playing the game in the Sandbox mode with no restrictions has it's rewards. Like in the quest part of the game you get only one ally in the sandbox mode you can have as many as you want.
However I have not been able to trap anything but Goblins for alleys.
but you get 20 of them and nothing will last very long LOL.
It would be nice if there was more gold and more use for gold in the game
I would like to see you to be able to go to the lake and pan for gold and then melt it into bars. If they ever get an expansion out for this game it would need to have about 10 more levels. Because topping out at level 13 and having to kill 22ed level bad guys
is really hard. some golden arrows would be nice.
You really don't need to cheat in this game just use the bushes and trees to your advantage if you build stuff the monster will hack on it and you just hit him with the arrow. the monsters hate your buildings and will do anything to kill it. Use this to time to kill them OR run. 
In the sandbox mode I have about 18 of every animal and 30 wells it makes the game very easy. well hope this helps all of you see yea

author: {'steamid': '76561198046119749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1612, 'last_played': 1654582796}
review:
처음에는 뭐지 존나 싸네 하면서 삿는데하면 할수록 헤어나오질 못하고 있다. 진짜 너무 재밋는 게임이다.
이상한 성취욕을 불러일으켜서 어느덧 정신차리니 해가 떠오고 있었다. 
초반에는 답답해서 힘들지만 레벨이 오르면 오룰수록 더욱 재미를 느낄수 잇게되니초반 2시간 정도만 버티고 해보자

author: {'steamid': '76561198188578901', 'num_games_owned': 2526, 'num_reviews': 956, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1525895495}
review:
Tek başınıza sayısız collect, loot ve craft işleriyle uğraştığınız bir oyun. Tabi LAN oynayacağınız biri varsa şanslısınız çünkü o şekil de mümkün. Çeşitliliğin çok yüksek olduğu, basit grafikli bir hayatta kalma oyunundan beklenen birçok şeyi veriyor. Biraz ağır işleyip mekanik yönünden fakir olsa da gelişebileceğini düşünüyorum.

Oyun tek başına fazla uzun ömürlü değil. Multiplayeri zor sıkar ama şu an online multiplayer yok. Online multiplayer çıkarılması mutlaka gerekiyor yoksa oyun öksüz ve yetim. Şimdilik olumlu oy veriyorum ama multiplayerin çıkışına veya çıkmayışına göre fikrim değişebilir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208681956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1521305306}
review:
A pozitív oldala, hogy rengeteg mindent lehet benne craftolni.  
Sajna ennyi, a többi mind negatív... 
Egy dologhoz rengeteg minden kell, amiket hosszadalmas összesezdni, végig craftolni. 
Pl.: Egy kis keritéshez kell szög és deszka. Deszkát a fa kivágásával lehet (rönk és aztán deszka) Ez még egyszerű. A szög már nehezebb...először kell csinálni parazsat a tűznél, botból. Aztán kell csinálni szenet rönkből és parázsból. Vasrúd, amihez kell a szén, meg még parázs és vasérc. (ami ha elfogyott a parton kereshetsz bent az erdőben) Majd ha ez mind megvan akkor jöhet a szög. Ez a kör 2 oldal karámhoz elég. Vagyis ezt 2x kell eljátszanod, hogy meglegyen a karám. Ehhez ha hozzá adjuk az elkészítés idejét, a karakter lassú mozgását és a fura, szintén idegesítő irányítást (bár megszokható, de ettől még idegesítő marad) azt kell mondjuk, nem érte meg ez a 20-30 perc, fél marék szögért. 
Egy kis tároló láda 20 deszka, 10 szög, 1 vasérc.... csak még egy példa, hogy mennyi fölös idő kell bármihez is a játékban. 
Sajnos csalódás, imádom az ilyen játékokat, de ezt 3 óra alatt végleg leírtam. :( Ez van...

author: {'steamid': '76561198244662622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1521048318}
review: I really wanted to like this game, and I did enjoy it for a while.  I like crafting, farming, and building and exploring, and as far as I got, this was great.  As has been said, there is a lot of grinding, but I didn't mind that.  To craft more things and better gear, you have to level up - no surprise.  I got to level 7 and had to find another Nature shard to get to 8.  But between me and that shard was a broad band of dense, mostly dead vegetation (which you have to use an axe to cut through), where the temperature was too hot for my beduoin gear (helps you keep cool), which was also filled with monsters way above my level.  If it has been more open, or less hot, I think I could have made it through by eating continuously to keep my health up, but I tried for HOURS.  I just couldn't get through that area without dying.  The map is different each game, but I'm not willing to go back and start over from scratch hoping I get a map that is doable.  So I am done.  Maybe my experience is a one-off.  I hope so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153155416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1786, 'last_played': 1697313212}
review:
I really do enjoy this game. Pretty easy to get yourself pretty involved in it. What I learnt is that certain areas are better for certain resources than others. Like the winter deadland is best for sticks. Jungle is best for pawnleaves. Beach is - of course - sand. 

The only thing that really annoyed me was the fact that if you saved and exited, you wouldn't load back to where you were before you exited. You have a specific save point, which would either be where you started, or a portal you set. I have used this to my advantage (agroed like 3 bears, 3 goblins, several boars and foxes - long story), so I just exited and viola! I am back at camp. But when you are trying to streamline to a "Force of Nature" shard and you run out of time and you don't want to plop a portal down yet, it can be such a pain. 

I also like to pick on location with a neutral temp (so I can wear anything there without issues) and just build everything there. All my portals are placed right where I destroy and collect the "Force of Nature" shard. I just use those portals to get to different biomes for resources faster and to have a headstart toward the next shard. 

Overall, love this game. Definately worth the buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977880088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1519671568}
review:
Da ich gerne Ark und Rust spiele, habe ich mir dieses Spiel gekauft.
Die Grafik, nunja Geschmackssache. Ist mal was anderes.

Viele Leute schrieben das das Spiel sehr " klobig " sei.
Dem kann ich 100% zustimmen.
Der Charakter spielt sich sehr sehr altbackend. Mir fällt aktuell kein Spiel ein wo die Bewegung so hakelig war.
Fifa98, 20 Jahre her. So in etwa läuft der Charakter bei Force of Nature auch.
Oft bleibt man mit dem Charakter an irgendwelchen Ecken sinnlosen Ecken hängen.

Den Charakter selbst kann man keineswegs anpassen. Lediglich die Hautfarbe und die Farbe der Hose.

Es gibt wirklich keinen Grund, wirklich keinen sich dieses Spiel zu kaufen. Ich hab es logischerweise zurückgegeben.


Fazit : Man hätte daraus echt etwas machen können. Aber ein in der Art liebloses Spiel mit sehr schlechter Engine hat kein Platz in meiner Bibliothek verdient. Nein.Nein und nochmal Nein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048448030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1269, 'last_played': 1521601248}
review:
Game is alot of fun, graphics are good. However this game is alot more grindy than anticipated, not to mention that as you get higher in the levels resources become more problematic to find ( as you have all ready mined most of the ore around you for previous levels ups ) 

   That being said, the only thing that really vexes me about this game, is the lack of fences early on in the levels. ( all the animals you get are stupid and will walk right towards enemies outside of your area ) We should be able to craft fences around lv 3 or so. that way we can pen the animals for their safety and the players sanity.

All in all, I give this game a 7 / 10.  not a bad game at all, and very enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008376208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 3585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3435, 'last_played': 1521350940}
review:
I do not recommend this game.  I can handle the grinding of gathering materials, making stuff, repetitive, boring combat.  I simply CANNOT tolerate losing a ton of stuff every time you die.  Trust me on this one.  if it irritates you to lose items on death, then this game will royally piss you off.  I am talking about losing hours worth of effort that it took to gather items and craft them and such.

Do not buy this game if that bothers you.  It is VERY easy to die.  All it takes is one of your tamed animals that you didn't manage to get to follow you back to your safe area to get attacked, and collect a big train, and then run close to you, and you are screwed.  You drop hundreds of items.

Yes, you can just run around with minimal resources in your pack, but at some point, you're going to need to carry stuff such as portal materials.  Dying and losing it sucks.  They need to let a corpse drop so you can go retrieve it.  Still a risk involved, but not so punishing as to make the game unfun.

tldr: If you have a NetFlix account, then you can find some joy in a game where stamina regen is terrible.  Just alt tab out and watch some flix, and come back and do 2 more fights, then rinse repeat. :p

If you feel like you can tolerate the "features" of the game I document below, then buy it.  Otherwise, I wouldn't.

[u]Update 1:[/u]

Run speed is a bit slow.  Glad there is fast travel, but even quick travel is a joke.  You cannot put portals too close to each other, so you still end up slooooow jogging a lot.  I can't imagine how bad it would be if you have to slow foot it all over the place every single time.

[u]Update 2:[/u]

Stamina regen is a bad joke.  I spend 90% of my time waiting on it.  Even eating food like bananas doesn't help that much.  This is a very negative aspect of this game, and I can see it causing me to stop playing.

Update -> To be fair, coffee helps with this, but you gotta grind up the materials to keep stocked up on coffee.  Early game is brutal, but the grind is always there.

[u]Tip 1:[/u]

[spoiler]Fight animals that flee near thick vegetation.  They'll often get stuck in the vegetation so you can catch them and finish them off.  I did that to two foxes so far.  VERY satisfying.[/spoiler]

[u]Tip 2:[/u]

[spoiler]Running into the middle of vegetation will sometimes make it so animals do not follow.  It's saved me a few times.[/spoiler]

[u]You gotta be kidding me #1:[/u]

1 strawberry = 7 hp in 10 seconds
1 strrawberry juice which requires 2 strawberries is 12 hp in 10 seconds.

You're better off eating two strawberries unless you are in a tough fight and the few extra hp might help.

[u]You gotta be kidding me #2:[/u]

The well can only hold 6 water at a time.  Yes, that's right boys and girls, you have to micromanage the collection of water.  Everything in the game is a grind.  I'm pretty much ok with that, but having to micromanage gathering water out of the well?  Nah, that's not cool.

[u]You gotta be kidding me #3:[/u]

You drop a crap ton of stuff EVERY death.  I had 13 cooked meat.  Lost 7 of them and literally about 30 other items in my inventory.  I should have read up more on this game.  Never would have bought it.  Death penalty is too severe considering how easy it is to die early on.

[u]You gotta be kidding me #4:[/u]

The sheer volume of materials needed to do anything in the game is pretty much over the top.  15 gold coins to get one gold ingot... [spoiler]It takes killing a lot of goblins to get 15 gold coins.[/spoiler]

[u]You gotta be kidding me #5:[/u]

Here is a good example of how ridiculous crafting is.

To make leather gloves, you need 14 pelts and 10 ropes with 2 burlap.  14 pelts shuld be enough to make 14 pairs of gloves.  You could hang 10 people with 10 ropes at the same time.  Utterly ridiculous.

Suggestions:

1-Increase movement speed.  An 80 year old man can move faster than my avatar.

2-Make it so when you die, you have a chance to recover your stuff.  Put a timer on it, but if you get back in time, you can get your stuff back.

3-Lower the resource requirements for things like armor and weapons.  14 hides for a pair of gloves is frankly stupid.

4-I spend way too much time alt tabbed watching netflx or surfing the web.  A game should not be so tedious as to make you feel like you have to to do this to prevent boredom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076744941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1910, 'last_played': 1626156785}
review:
Cute, fun, relaxing game for a low price. I got this on sale for 50% off, so for me this feels like a real bargain. If you've got the survival/builder itch, give this a try. It *is* a slower paced game however, so keep that in mind.
 
Update: This game has gotten a little hate lately, so I want to give my 2 cents on a couple points: 

1: Chunkiness: I despise clunkers, like, I cannot play them for very long before getting disgusted and consider them bad games. This game is not what I'd call clunky. It's no Japanese fighter, sure, but if you compare it to say, Mass Effect 4 (or even a Bethesda game), it ain't got nothin' on that clunk. 
2: Graphics, honestly, despite the basic graphics, it still offers a lot of beauty. Flowery forests, sunset beaches, etc. I really enjoy the scenery in the game.
3: Content/play time: I have 51 h ours in this game, between 2 worlds I started. There is *plenty* to do, collect, and build for a very long time. That being said, yes, I really would have really loved to see some updates and new content, but you'll get your money's worth out of this. 

Pros: 
-Fun mix of a little combat, farming, building, crafting and exploration. 
-Despite the basic graphics, the game can still be very pretty

Cons: 
-Spacing/spawning of enemies can be a bit silly at times. You can be running around with no monsters in sight and all the sudden you come across 3 bears, 2 goblins and a boar all at once and you don't have a chance of fighting them. 
-I have to restart the game every 30 minutes because at about that time, it starts lagging big time, like, Kenshi bad lagging. But once I restart the game, it's fine again for another 30 minutes.

Other notes: 
-As I mentioned before, it would have been nice if they added updates and new, fun stuff to build, but they didn't really do that. The game does feel finished, but a few more touches would have been nice. 
-I honestly think the interface/controls are fine. You do need to take a moment to get used to it, but once you do it makes sense for this type of game (you can harvest/keep track of your farm pretty efficiently) and I'm all for developers trying new things. The camera angle won't let you look directly up, and this is annoying though. 
-There isn't exactly a story. You do have quests, which is nice, but it's just telling you what you should build next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047875535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2282, 'last_played': 1606383090}
review:
Un jeu simple et prenant, sans prise de tête, agréable pour se détendre et passer le temps.

Actualisation 50h plus tard :

Cependant, si vous jouez la "campagne" la fin vous laissera sur votre faim... (sans déconner ^^)
Une saveur un peu amer de "tout ça pour ça".

Ca reste cependant un jeu détente et prenant, pas prévu pour le rush ni débordant d'action... 

C'est une belle aventure "guidée" à travers les biomes qui peut avoir une "fin" (ou non puisqu'une fois tous les objectifs terminés le jeu propose de continuer de voyager.)

Je recommande d'autant plus à petit prix pour passer le temps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030010932', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1521148510}
review:
PLEASE READ BEFORE BUYING

I only just picked up this game about an hour ago, I like it but here are some Pros & Cons! 

Pros:
- Has great potential as a Game.
- Easy to Pick up.
- Crafting in the game does really deep and only just at the entry crafting!
- It's worth the Price! (Paid: £5.79 GBP)

Cons:
- Graphics are not the best in the world, but are perfectly fine.
- No Music, really needs some sort of music
- A.I. has bugs, plus unfair towards player (eg. animals and goblins will work together to gang up on you).
- Player can get stuck in certain places with no way out.
- SFX need more some work, as comes from the other direction of Animal/Goblin so will end up running into them instead of away from them.
- Needs more work, as it's lagging for my Heavy Gaming PC Rig. 

Misc:
- Has a grind, you either hate it or like it.
- Story is 50/50 so not sure what to say about it.
- World gets genterated and makes some good and bad areas to work with.


Overall, it's a good game but does need a TON of work to make it better in a number of areas. 
So for my score for the game, I give it a "6/10"

I am going to keep on playing this, but will give another review in 6 months to see if it's any better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332017349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1518208439}
review:
Anfangs etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig von Optik und Steuerung her, 
jedoch eine gelungene Mischung aus "alten und neuen" Spielelementen.

Kurz reingefuchst in die Geschichte und danach leider geil ! !

Es gibt immer was zu schaffen, das Spiel ist spannend, man ist aber im Gegensatz zu anderen Survival-Games wie ARK, RUST oder dergleichen nicht zum "Dauerzocken" verdammt um Erfolg zu haben und kann ohne großen "Trouble" das Spiel erleben.

Schönes Game, tolles Prinzip, fairer Kaufpreis, daher top, DANKE an die Entwickler +++

Survivors Ahoi ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198220293383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4762, 'last_played': 1519902688}
review:
ストアページのSSだと見下ろし型のようになっているが、動画を見るとわかるように
一般的な自キャラのケツを追うTPS視点にもできるサバイバルっぽいゲーム
サバイバルといっても空腹や渇水などの要素はなく、HPと気力(スタミナ)、
それから気温くらいしか自己管理の必要はない
HPの方はともかくこの気力の方はかなりのストレスとなる
まず木を切る、岩を砕くなどそういった大体の行動で気力は消費されるのだが
自然回復はかなり遅く、また回復アイテムは作成がかなり面倒である
とにかくリアルタイムを食うゲームであり、アイテム１つ作るのに平気で１分などかかる
（アイテムはレベルでレシピ開放。序盤はしょぼいものばっかり）
地形の起伏なども合わせてとにかくすべての調整がまるでなってない
これを量産しようと思うと６０個作るだけでもう１時間なわけだが(放置はできる)
（６０個なんて１回遠征に行ったらもうなくなるから冒険行くたびに数時間の待ち。
マルチしてたら×人数分の作成待ち）
それ以前に素材をかき集める必要があるので実際にはもっとかかる

後半になると井戸などの水を汲める施設(水はこれでしか手に入らない)などは増やせる
井戸は自動で水を６個まで組みためてくれる　何故６個だけなのでしょう
苗床に植物を植えるのにも、家畜に餌をやるのにも、回復アイテム（料理）をつくるのにも水がいるのに
時間経過でしかたまらない水を必要分集めるには一体何時間待ったらいいのでしょうか
その工程を何度繰り返すのでしょう
私はキノコを何千個集めさせられたのだろうか

武器はショートとロングのソード、そしてメイス　モーション同じ　メイスだと振りながら歩けない　威力高。後は弓くらい
防具は鉄製の防御力の高いものもあるが、前述の通り気温の概念があり、
寒い場所では暖かい服、寒い場所ではその逆といったような格好を要するので（適さない格好だとHP、気力が減る）
装備できる機会はほぼない
施設の建築などはマイクラなどのように１つずつブロックなどを組んでいくものではなく
最初から出来上がったものを任意の場所に設置するという形式
設置をミスると破壊しないと移動できない　作るのにはかなりのコストがかかるので私は諦めた



ここからネタバレ


クエストの最後には敵が低めの確率で落とす”宝石の欠片”５つで作成できる
”欠片ではない宝石”を６種類作れと言われる
５こずつね
欠片２５個を６種類分なので９９９９９９９９個くらい集めればいいんじゃないですかね
それからそのへんのゴブリンとかいうザコがたまに落とす金のコイン１５で作成できる
金の延べ棒も１５個必要
(ちなみに金属を焼くのには光る琥珀と石炭が必要。石炭を作るのには光る琥珀が必要。琥珀いくつ作ればいいんですか
石炭は作成するための施設の最大設置可能数が少なく、また時間もかかる。なのに必要とされる数がかなり多い。
金属類はもはや何をするのにも必要となってくるのだが、マップ上で鉱石岩を見つけられるまでひたすら歩き、
血を吐きながら作った気力回復アイテムをがぶ飲みしながら鼻くそみたいな量の鉱石を取って帰らないといけない）
それらの素材をなんとかかき集めていざフォース・オブ・ネイチャーという題を冠したアイテムを作成すると
なんと感動のエンディング、SSをあげたあれである
「おめでとうございます！」
やかましいわ
そして解放されるハードコアモード、やるやついないだろ
感情で書くもんじゃないけどほんとにこのゲーム嫌いなので低評価押したくて書きました
この文を見て購入を踏みとどま方がいれば人助けになったと思います
プレイ時間７０時間超えは面白いからではありません　ゲームのバランスが全てにおいて馬鹿だからです
フレンド誘っちゃったので責任取って最後までやりました
ほんとうにつらかったです
５００円くらいで買いましたがこんなんやるんだったら時給欲しいです

書き忘れたというか並べたらキリがないんだけど
マルチだとプレイヤーがはなれられる距離に制限があって
アプデ前は視野内とかそんなレベルでひどかったのが
今はマップロードされない程度であればはなれられるようになってる
１バイオーム内で３回くらいはロードされるから何とも言えない距離　まあまあ不便
あと天候があって雨降ったり霧がかりまくったりして昼でもとにかく見にくい
天候は見にくいだけで特に何か影響があるわけでもないと思う
夜とかなんも見えないけど光源設置すると敵が壊しに来る
設置する系のものはだいたい敵の攻撃対象になっていて
家守るために壁とか置いてるとそれをわざわざ壊しに来てくれるから逆効果になって
壁置いてるせいで敵が寄ってくるという状況になる　でも壁とか置かないと設備壊される

author: {'steamid': '76561198139533833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1601607476}
review: I was surprised by how fun this game is to play. It reminds me a little of old-school runescape but with the solitary aspects that I prefer in sandbox games. The UI is a little clunky and hard to navigate at first, but you get used to it. I hope there will be some updates to make the UI a little easier to manage and a little more intuitive. That aside, I'm having a great time playing this and I find the recommended quests to be helpful as a new player.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982395611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2699, 'last_played': 1520567814}
review:
Description:
Crafting, survival, open world, and sandboxy.

Pros:
The game has a decent environment for protecting you from harm in the early game which helps to minimize pointless frustration.  The level system accurately and efficiently guides the player through the tech tree, and each level's build requirements force the user to stretch their skills and knowledge and force exploration of the map outside of the player's comfort zone.  

Building caps per level (e.g. - you can only have 2 wells until you level up further) keep you focused on the next construction project needed to level up and minimize the tendency of some players (me) to build bases that sprawl endlessly.  Portals are built into the vanilla tech tree and dying sets the player back a reasonable amount without brutally punishing them.

Cons:
The controls work efficiently but the overall usability could use a 15-20% improvement before I would call it intuitive and frictionless.  The map is large but the biomes are lacking in features and unique areas that would encourage exploration for the sake of exploration.  The main menu has a humorous combination of being both confusing and easy to use.  For example, 1) a friend can't join my world if I started a single player session but if I exit and load the same game as multiplayer (by clicking "Start a new game" for some reason), they're automatically alerted that I've created a lobby if the game is open.

Overall, the pros outweigh the cons by a significant margin and this is a pretty great buy for the price, especially for lower-end computers that might struggle to keep up with modern crafting games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198381169933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2180, 'last_played': 1520778897}
review: 这游戏真的适合养老的人来玩TAT，记住滥砍滥伐是要遭到报应的，你永远也想不通为什么怪物能几下把你打的跟孙子似的却弄不掉一棵小草，打自然之力碎片的时候永远都是找一片茂密的树林用斧头砍出一条小道，用弓箭把怪一个个引过来然后慢慢消耗。后期找碎片的时候，棕榈叶到热带去砍，树枝到很冷、而且很多骷髅的地方去砍。到现在我不知道这里面的树木资源能否重生，但好在地图够大，能玩下去。切记随身带着一份传送门的材料，还有一开始的时候只要级别高了你是不虚跟熊正面刚的，但永远不要被围攻，那样不想死的话就存档退出吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198061801907', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1519590102}
review:
This game is an odd case. I've been enjoying aspects of the game, and I'm probably going to persist with it for a bit longer - it isn't a total disaster, and there's a lot of potential here to make a great game - but there are too many things which are frustrating or annoying or just plain stupid to be able to give this a recommend.

Firstly, the controls.

The controls are the absolute worst I have ever encountered in a first person game. 
You will be constantly, every few seconds throughout the game, flicking between two completely different interfaces with different controls, and this is the biggest most fundamental flaw this game has.

It's a first person game with standard WASD movement and mouse look, but only while all you want to do is move around or attack something. This is the first of the two control interfaces, and one that any gamer will be familiar with.

As soon as you need to interact in any other way, with any other aspect of the game (even as simple as picking up items from the floor) you have to flick to the other control method, which is still WASD movement, but you now have a mouse pointer you can use to click on items to pick them up or interact with - which are invariably too far away, prompting an error message telling you to move closer - or to use the many menus which appear onscreen as well for crafting, construction, etc. Crucially, as your mouselook has been replaced with a pointer for interfacing with, you now cannot turn or rotate your character whatsoever - you're stuck strafing, facing in whatever direction you were looking in when you switched to it, until you subsequently decide to switch back. If you get attacked or sudddenly need to turn around for whatever reason, while you're trying to craft something or pick up items, the first thing you will have to do is switch back to the other control method before you can even think of doing the simple basic task of facing your opponent.

What makes it worse is that items on screen that you can interact with (be it things to pick up, things to harvest, or crafting stations) are only highlighted when you are in "mouse pointer" mode so if you're running about looking for stuff, you will need to perpetually switch in and out of "mouse pointer" mode just to see the items highlighted on screen. 

On the plus side, this double control interface thing is actually reasonably seamless - you can switch from one to the other by tapping "Q" (although if you have any menus open when switching out of "mouse pointer" mode, you will need to double tap "Q" as the first tap will only close the menus - another annoyance). And if you just need to quickly dip in to the other control interface, you can hold spacebar to do so, and releasing it will switch back. 

But for all this complexity, forcing you to spend 50% of the game unable to turn your character, and the relentless error messages when you try to click on an item that you're not standing pretty much on top of "please move closer!", you can't help but feel that it could have been made infinitely more slick by simply highlighting objects you can interact with when you move close to them, and then having a keypress to interact with the nearest one. It seems a LOT of effort to give you a point-and-click interface for interaction, when you still have to move your character right next to the thing anyway, negating any need to have moved a mouse pointer over to it in the first place.

Next, combat

Combat is just DULL. It's the worst. You have one attack (whatever weapon you have currently crafted) and you just stand next to a gremlin and click the button. You do an attack and then wait around 1 second to recover before you can do it again. You will get hit one time while recovering, then you repeat. There's no skill, or tactic. You just stand there and click a bit. They can't see you from very far away, so if there's a bunch of them in one place you can walk towards them until the nearest one spots you and runs over to fight you (its friends won't bother), you can deal with that one by itself then repeat to pick off the others one by one. It's so tedious that when the game quests demand that I collect gold coins (only obtained from killing gremlins) I find myself shutting the game down until I can be bothered tomorrow. The game only really started to get fun once I'd cleared a decent area of the map out from enemies, so I could actually run around undisturbed - now the game is telling me (in my latest quest) that I have to build a bed for sleeping on, and that if I sleep  on it then enemies will respawn. This may be the thing that makes me abandon the game, forcing me to grind through this most tedious of tasks over and over.

Right - graphics.
The graphics are basic but functional, at least everything is clear, but it all looks a bit 2005. The render horizon is so close it's ridiculous, things fade into view from approximately 10m away, and the solution for keeping things visible when you're walking near trees is to simply cut those trees down temporarily (they literally just turn into tree stumps if they would obscure your view)

You can't zoom in or out at all, and you can't even look up. 

Also the boundary clipping around objects that stops you walking past them is just ridiculous. Plenty of gaps that look like you can walk through them, turns out that bit of twig poking out at knee height means nope you really cannot go that way. 

I haven't even really started on the game itself yet. The crafting is a real grind. There's only so many "oh so I need to collect 50 of those to make 20 of those to make 10 of these to make this new weapon that will improve my attack speed by slightly less than 2%" before you just say sod it and walk away. Everything is just so slow, and marred by more annoying "features". You can do basic crafting from a menu in the interface, more complicated crafting requires you to go to a crafting station. Things crafted at a crafting station will remain at the station until you collect it (some of them take several minutes so you will run off and come back when it's finished). Fair enough. But the basic items you craft in your crafting menu, which you can do anywhere at any time, will remain *stuck in your crafting menu until you go back into it to collect them*. Literally, the first time you craft something you'll be thinking "great, now where is it". It's not in your inventory. No. It's in your crafting menu, waiting for you to click "take" on it. Despite several hours in, this still trips me up. I'll be at a crafting station trying to make a thing I need "oh I need 20 rope, ok cool I can make that in my menu, I just need to collect some leaves first". Go and collect leaves. Craft 20 rope. Go back to crafting station to make the thing "not enough rope". WHAT? Oh yeah. Have to go back into my crafting menu, collect the rope, put it in my inventory, now I can go back into the crafting station menu and craft the thing. The game is literally holding me up because it requires me to move an item from one part of my inventory to another before it will recognise it. Oh and you can't queue items for production anywhere, not in your basic crafting nor in the crafting stations. You have to wait for current production to finish before you can start a new one.

Bored yet? You're probably beginning to get an idea of what the game is like. "Oh these items need 45x soil to craft them, I'll just go and get that". Stands character over soil, and holds mouse button for literally three solid minutes. That's the standard of grinding in this. Endless "go here and hold your mouse button for at least 75 seconds".

From the preview videos it looks pretty slick, but be aware that almost all of the clips shown of gameplay have been sped up significantly.

I really wanted to like this game, and it really seems to have some potential, but honestly, I hate it so much, and it makes me feel like the devs really hate me when I play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094651734', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1518774099}
review:
"Эта игра висит у меня в желаемых около полугода или больше. Не смотря на карту мира, нарисованную в пеинте, и странный ракурс, уверен, что фермосимулятор затягивающий." ©

Я так никогда еще не ошибался.

Повелся на жанр и графику. Графика в самой игре оказалась хуже, чем на скринах в магазине. 
Управление и туман вокруг - убийцы этой игры. 
Не ведитесь на приятные скрины, в самой игре при ином ракурсе, вы не увидите ничего, кроме серого сплошного тумана без намека на какой-либо фон. Просто серые текстуры вокруг.
Управление - отдельная тема. Зачем было выдумывать одноколесный велосипед без педаль, если можно сделать нормально, привычное всем, управление?

Переход на новый уровень.. Не вижу смысла в системе "побегай пофарми квесты, а потом еще побегай и пофарми на лвл". Это "выживание, песочника, крафтинг, симулятор", или RPG? Да я столько фармил разве что в World of Warcraft'е, и то это сопровождалось миром, имеюим нормальную карту, а персонаж не жил в серых текстурах "тумана".
И все бы ничего, но ведь у вас еще и энергия заканчивается от ОДНОГО срубленного дерева, в то время как на лвл вам нужно не только его срубить, но и подолбить камни, и прочее. В общем, особый вид мазохизма, а не "переход на новый уровень".
Да и в целом эта скоропостижная полоска "энергии" требует изменений. Ну слишком быстро она улетучивается, не реально, еды даже столько не найдешь, что бы ее восстановить и нормально пофармить (то есть поделать то, зачем я в эту игру и приходил).

Я не буду ничего говорить про косметические шероховатости (огромные такие бугры) этой игрушки. Возможно их доработают. Но пока что выглядит не очень. Будто скачал на каком-то левом сайте бесплатную инди rpg.

Не смотря на то, что купил по скидке, и честно пытался найти в игре хоть что-то, что способно затмить все ее косяки, деньги вернул. Очень их жалко за подобное отдавать.

Имхо. Но без скидки игра денег своих не стоит точно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119190512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1519250262}
review: I like it, I really feel like I showed up on an island with Goblins!  Thank goodness they can only see a short ways otherwise I might be toast in this mystic land!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051769404', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 12977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3300, 'last_played': 1592182104}
review:
If you are reading the reviews then you are considering buying the game. Buy the game. I got the game in a hunt for games my wife might be willing to play (she is not a gamer to the tune of outrage that she had to use W to move forward). After playing for a couple hours I decided I was going to devote an unhealthy amount of time to this game regardless of whether or not it piqued my wife's interest. She finally gave it a shot and is now hooked. This game is for literally Everyone 10+!

Pros
Easy streamlined interaction with world objects
Tons of crafting & building
Farming, fishing, adventuring alone or with your trusty chicken (or friends I guess)
When confronted with a choice between realism and game experience, the game seems to opt for the latter - initially I thought that being unable to walk through the bushes was stupid. Then I realized the goblin things and bears couldn't get through either. Then it occurred to me that I wouldn't walk through a damn bush in the woods IRL without an axe or something either.

Cons
No female player model - even something basic would be much appreciated!
Fog is depressing - the draw distance is short (I understand why, but it is almost oppressive)
Game is too cheap - I know that sounds crazy, but this IS at least a $20 game, so the $10 list price undersold the quality and content of the game by quite a bit

tl;dr: Buy at least 2 copies of this game, even if you're not sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022328608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1519070218}
review: It's a painful grind...two and half hours of collecting crap to make a little hut to put a table in was about as much as I could stomach and when it told me I had to make another 15 nails which required me to grind more iron and palm leaves and sticks and then spend another 10 mins waiting for them to make something else to make something else to make a couple of nails it was time to uninstall.  **** knows how long it took them to make some of the stuff in the trailer.  Might be someone elses cup of tea but it's not mine.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974869646', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2173, 'last_played': 1527343087}
review: This game is not hard to get your moneys worth at all especially if you play with friends.  The wiki is a bit light and it does get grindy, repetitive once you are levelled up, and IMO not a high replay value but if you are bored and looking to kill a couple days it is worth a playthrough.  You can easily get 20-40 hours for $5 which is the same time you put into for a lot of $60 AAA titles honestly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106037757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1499099441}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053486643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1519515699}
review:
I'm giving a positive, but it's a frustrating game in a number of ways.

The combat and resource gathering can be frustrating. Heavy stamina drain, dodge consisting of walking backwards (which usually just makes you miss more often and still end up getting hit quite a bit by the enemy) isn't much use. Would kill for a roll-dodge or even a block or something other than just watching that three-second-swing over and over. A slow cumbersome weapon (cudgel) when we can craft metal axes and picks early on but get stuck with a slow haymaker weapon is frustrating. Rough aiming with the bow with arrows that seem to get blocked by everything including the terrain and the far edges of pine trees.

Leveling up is a bit annoying. You gain levels not by actions but by doing quests. Some quests, such as getting 5 gold, are unecessarily painful, and require that you get lucky on drops from mobs as they often drop copper rather than gold coins. So it takes 15 gold coins to make one bar, and you need to get 75, and thats just to get to level 7. Did i mention combat is frustrating. ^^ (mainly this is annoying because it's not just holding you back from gaining some quest reward, it's holding you back from reducing the frustrations involved in crafting that comes with leveling up and gaining either more things to do while the items slowly craft themselves out, or by giving you more of the crafting buildings to do more stacks at once, or work on multiple items that that particular crafting building type is required to create).

There is no way to fast transfer from your inventory into storage (such as shift/alt/ctrl-click to move stacks) though there is an option to quickly fill a box with like items which is handy but not as much as a quick stack transfer.

Resource gathering, combat, and everything in general is made less enjoyable by an overly demanding stamina system. The stamina drains so fast that the only way to mine, fight, chop trees, hack bushes, etc is by rapidly spamming sunflower seeds, or eating other things that have longer delays before your allowed to eat more. I like a stamina system normally, it represents cost for action which adds a degree of realism, but in this case it's overkill and just punishes the player for wanting to try to do anything in the game.

Animals need to be hand fed food/water to produce a single cycle and provide a resource. There should be a way to just supply stacks to the animal and let it produce while you wander off and do something else. Instead, you feed it, wait for a slow timer to cycle through after a few seconds, then feed it again. Make it like a crafting table where you put in stacks and get stacks slowly back instead of having to hang around and feed them this way. Too monotonous even with a bunch of the same animal.

Limitations on number of crafting buildings means that you can't just put down five forges to quickly spam out a bunch of bars, or put down five cooking tables to quickly make a bunch of foods. Nope, instead you have to sit and wait or wander off and do something else while items slowly craft themselves out. Did I mention combat and resource gathering are frustrating? To add to this limitation, the buildings have a set number of slots for tools, some different tool sets are required to craft different items. SO either you have a building devoted to one type of crafting and another building to another type of crafting (since the number of those crafting buildings you can have are limited by level), or you have to swap tools and store those unneeded tools somewhere to spam craft stuff while you wander off to do something else, since crafting items can take quite a bit of time.

Anyway enough frustrations... the game is pretty well put together for all. I haven't come across any bugs while playing. The sounds and visuals are decent. There looks to be plenty of content. For all not a bad game and reasonably priced.  So despite what I don't like about it, and in spite of my frustrations, I'll probably continue to play it from time to time to unlock more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973376656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1519017195}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973630764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1575311440}
review:
I found this game pretty poor, even consideringthe price tag. 

The controls and UI are clunky and take a while to get used to. It feels like a browser game from a few years ago.

Unfortunately I found more that I didn't like about this game than I liked. 

You don't gain XP from killing or crafting but have to complete set tasks for the next level. Sadly the devs missed an oppotunity here because the tasks are almost always just a grindy as xp farming.

The story is non existant, something about portals, doesnt really explain why you are there or what you are trying to do.

Some of the other features involve needing to domesticate chickens before you can make bread for some bizzarre reason. Domesticated pigs provide you with worms and you need to melt down dozens of gold coins to make a button compass that doesnt point north. 

This game seems to be trying to take all of the features of other similar games, but dilvering them in a very poor way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023681591', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1573301412}
review:
Recomendo. mas leia o feed.

É um jogo interessante. bastante complexo. um pouco travado no combate, mas acredito q seje intencional, por se tratar aparentemente de nosso personagem ser uma criança. Acho que esta faltando um ou mais NPCs para ajudar nas fazendas. pois ter q alimentar um de cada animal por vez e plantar cada canteiro individualmente, acaba se tornando algo extremamente massante e repetitivo. que no momento acabou sendo o principal motivo por eu nao voltar a joga-lo por enquanto. Entao fica a dica para os desenvolvedores: adicionem ou um npc para ajudar na fazenda (pod ser ateh um goblin) ou um cocho para alimentar os animais. e as plantaçoes serem necessario mais dias para produzir e produzir mais, para q nao tenhamos q ficar replantando todo dia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148711399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1870, 'last_played': 1643918312}
review:
Очень люблю игры-песочницы с открытыми мирами и кучей крафта. Эта игра одна из таких. Конечно, есть свои неудобства, например, герой только мужского пола и нельзя сменить на женщину, такой опции нет, но зато можно выбрать ему любой цвет кожи, волос, шортов-семеек, причём, прямо в середине игры через настройки. 
Очень своеобразное управление, но оно тоже привыкается. Главное клавиши под себя назначить. Например, я поменяла только одну кнопку - инвентарь поменяла с I на Tab и теперь всё легко и просто открывается в любой момент. 

Играть одному достаточно трудоёмко и скучновато, так как ресурсов надо очень много. А вот по коопу с близким человеком играется отлично.

Сотни рецептов для крафта, одно делается из другого. Огромный открытый мир. Охота, фермерство, крафтинг, собирательство, рубка леса, бамбука, выбивание всяких ресурсов для крафта - в общем, время только так улетает за ней. А как только берёшь очередной уровень, открывается ещё больше плюшек, и твой лагерь начинает выглядеть не как аборигенский, а уже похож на средневековый городок. 

Рекомендую однозначно всем любителям такого жанра!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032826136', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6896, 'last_played': 1518938399}
review:
わかりやすく致命的でダメな点はぱっとみ見当たらないが、
このゲームでないとならない、という魅力も見当たらない作。


だが、プレイしていて細かいポイントで小さくイラッとする箇所が多い。

・クラフトをメインにするなら、UI操作の設計には気を使うべき
（一番見る回数、操作する回数が多い箇所なのでここで小さなストレスが発生する作りだと、
　その回数分ストレスが積みあがってゆく）

・視覚的に通れそうで通れない地形

・足の遅いプレイキャラ。気力が少ない状態や装備によってはさらに遅くなる
（移動速度上昇の恩恵が実感できるのが最終盤に入ってから）

・そこのでかい水たまりから水を汲ませろ
（プレイ中の待ち時間がほぼ井戸の水が溜まるの待ち）

・戦闘がノーガード殴り合いなので、体力と気力回復アイテムの生産が必須で、アイテム生産で待ち時間が発生する
　→気づいたらこんなにプレイ時間かさんでた
（真面目にプレイするより、ながらでだらだらとプレイする方が合う）



一応、クエストの最終目標達成までプレイ。
だが、最終目的を果たしたものの、あまり達成感を得られず、
達成しました、というダイアログと、
「ハードコアモードを解禁したよ！初めからプレイしてね！」
といった内容の文章が表示された。


…勘弁してくれ。
また最初からこの形容しがたい苦行を2度以上やりたくない。


実績コンプは諦め、そっ閉じした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198038161286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1520634289}
review: Ist eigentlich ein tolles Spiel, aber wenn man stirbt, verliert man Rohstoffe, das wäre auch ok, wenn es einen nicht um Stunden zurückwerfen würde. Es hat mich nach 13 Stunden so frustiert das ich es deinstalliert habe. Um in level 6 Level auszusteigen muss man 5 Goldbarren besitzen. Jeder Goldbarren besteht aus 15 Goldmünzen, also insgesamt 75. Zum Glück hatte ich schon 4 Barren und eine Münze.... die letzten 14 zu suchen war schwer und dauerte einen Stunde. Auf dem Rückweg zum Lager wurde ich von zwei Bären angefallen und hatte keine Chance, danach waren meine 4 Barren weg. Jetzt nochmal stunden lang nur >Münzen sammeln und eventuell wieder alles verlieren scheint mir nicht sinnvoll.....

review: I am new to this game but I like it. I think it has a great potential. I find it a bit hard, but I am getting used to it. Pretty hard to earn the gold coins at the beginning, I already died a few times and lost a lot of stuff... but I actually really enjoy this game. The graphic is simple but still very realistic and nice and I think there is heaps to do. It is definitely a game I will be going back to and looking forward to next levels and new opportunities. The forest is a dangerous place when you a newbie , half naked and with a poor weapon :) But I am hoping it will get easier in time. So far I have nothing against the game and I really enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022920934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1519310037}
