author: {'steamid': '76561198055982590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1505465192}
review:
Tons of potential, but many gameplay aspects totally suck enjoyment out of the game

Crafting is excessively grindy and tedius, even for a game in this genre. The most basic materials like coal or nails need an excessive amount of time and resources to make, resulting in an excessive amount of time spent grinding for materials with very little payoff.

Combat seems to be a massive afterthought, which wouldnt be a problem if it didnt happen so often. can't take five steps without getting swarmed by goblins you have to fight off with in depth "hold the left mouse button" gameplay.

Dying results in you losing a massive amount of supplies from your inventory, which again, could have taken you hours to accumilate.

The leveling system is by far the worst offender, not being able to craft things even though you have all the supplies to do so is incredibly frustrating, and not being able to level up without completeing a list of arbitrary tasks which require even more grindingfor supplies and materials just adds to that.

I have high hopes for this game, fantasy based survival/crafting games are almost non-existant, but as of now, it needs a lot of the kinks ironed out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062822745', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1503513500}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053380965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2578, 'last_played': 1505293445}
review:
Nach knapp 40 Stunden war ich ohne mich zu beeilen durch.

Das Spiel bietet eine angenehme Atmosphäre und hat durch zahlreiche Crafting Optionen Suchtpotential. Es erfordert außerdem sehr viel Geduld, sodass man ohne weiteres nebenher Filme oder Serien anschauen kann.

Zu bemängeln finde ich das Kampfsystem. Ziemlich stumpf, da es eigentlich nur aus gedrückter Maustaste halten besteht. Da hätte man sich etwas bessseres einfallen lassen können.

Alles in allem ist das Spiel für den Preis (8 EUR) in Ordnung, ich würde es aber kein zweites mal durchspielen wollen.

review:
เกมนี้สนุกมากครับ ถ้าเล่นไปเรื่อยๆๆ ก็จะเข้าใจระบบเอง สำหรับสัตว์ที่เวลาเราตีแล้วมันหนี  ที่มันหนีได้ เพราะดาเมจ ไม่แรง พอที่จะตีให้มันตายไว เกมนี้ต้องใจเย็นๆ ครับ ไม่ต้องรีบ ฟามของฟามอะไรก่อนก็ได้ เพราะเควสจะเริ่มยากขึ้นเรื่อยๆๆ แนะนำให้คราฟอาวุธ แรงๆ   ถามว่า ชอบตรงไหนมากที่สุด ชอบ ตรง ที่มีเควสให้ทำ  หาของมาแล้วก็อัพเวล  มีอะไรให้ทำหลายอย่างไม่เบื่อแน่นอน  รับรองสนุกแน่ครับ เกมนี้ เล่น ออนไลน์กับเพื่อนได้น่ะ

author: {'steamid': '76561198008084934', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 10663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6959, 'last_played': 1613493757}
review:
Игра идет без проблем на моем стареньком ноутбуке 2008 года. Для меня это один из важнейших показателей. Ну, помимо этого понравилось:
- красивые пейзажи
- отменная озвучка окружающего мира
- возможность построить так называемую ферму на острове практически с нуля, почувствовать себя Робинзоном.
- игра развивается, добавляется что-то новенькое постоянно.
- обилие всякой живности на острове от кроликов и курочек до каких-то огненных големов и смертей с косами мало кого оставит равнодушным.
Не понравилось:
- для повышения уровня персонажа нужно собирать определенные ресурсы. К примеру, для перехода на новый уровень нужно 10 золотых монет. И пошел лупешить гоблинов, а с них как назло одна медь сыпется. Иногда бесит.
- сюжетная линия не ахти. Какой-то мужик, который ничего не помнит, оказывается на непонятном острове, и малость остепенившись, бросается делать компас, который видит местонахождение неких элементов, которые ему необходимо собрать. Откуда он узнал про эти элементы неясно. И почему это стало его основной целью, а не, скажем, разработка планов того, как выбраться с этого острова.
- Не нравится то, что герой умирает, потом возрождается с небольшой потерей ресурсов, и ведется коллекция его смертей. Это основная причина того, почему я не прошел эту игру до конца. Накоплю  5-10 смертей и начинаю сначала. Я бы предпочел, чтоб герой на какое-то время терял сознание, а потом спустя пару дней восстанавливался на том же месте. Да, не совсем реалистично, но более реалистично, чем копить смерти.
Кого-то возможно напряжет, что герой только и может, что бегать, драться, рубить деревья, добывать руду, копать, стрелять из лука, ловить рыбу, а остальную работу(готовить на кухне, ковать в кузнице, шить, и т.п.) за него делают какие-то невидимки, ну, на мой взгляд, это мелочи.
В целом, если вы любите нечто такое необычное, то я рекомендую поиграть в это творение.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104884186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2604, 'last_played': 1574018157}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198252973984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2965, 'last_played': 1527419189}
review:
さて、自分がこの作品を購入した理由ですが、まあ安かったからなのが第一ですね。
面白くなくてもコンシューマのソフトをフルプライスで買うよりも安いのが、購入の決め手になりました。

画像自体はそこまでのものではありませんが、自分は気になるほどではありませんでした。
ただ、マインクラフトに始まるクラフトゲーム等と違い、レベルが上がっていかなければクラフトできる種類が増えていきません。
材料が揃っていたとしても、クラフト出来ないジレンマは相当なものでしょう。
そのレベルにしてもクエストに沿って製作したりアイテムを採って来たりとしなければなりません。
敵を倒してレベルが上がるといった仕様ではないため、そこも注意が必要です。

他の方も書かれているようですが、そのアイテムを取りに行く過程で大量に敵が待ち構えている場所などを越えていかなければなりません。
敵を一体づつ呼び寄せて倒すなど、工夫が必要な場面も多いです。

ここまで、色々書いてきましたが自分はこのゲームをお勧めします。
物を作っている時間に採取をしたり、自分で柵を作っていって、小さい集落みたいにしたりとても楽しんでいます。一人ですが。
出来れば、マルチで友人と遊ばれた方が、より楽しく遊べると。思います

author: {'steamid': '76561198327150778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1504788151}
review:
日本語対応ということなので、購入してみました。
日本語対応なんですが、エキサイト翻訳につっこんだ様な具合ですので、気になる人は購入は避けるべし。

ゲームとしては良くあるサバイバルもの。

良い点。
Lv制、クエストありなので、次の目標が立てやすい。
そこそこのグラフィックのため、あまり重くない。

悪い点。
敵はリポップするが、資源の再生システムはなし。
栽培可能な一部の植物、食べ物は畑で栽培できるものの、建築に必用な木材、石材は不可。
その為、初期エリアから敵のうろつく外部へと開けた穴は塞げず、死ぬもしくは寝るなどリポップ条件を満たすたびに敵の襲撃にあう。
建築物には強度があるため、襲撃も受け続けると壊れるのですが、破壊されてしまった物を修復するには+αの資材が必用という理不尽な流れが出来上がります。
穴を開ける場所は、よく考えたほうがよさそうです。

建築も資材を揃えて置き場を決めると、時間経過で自動で出来上がります。
自由度はマイクラに比べるとかなり落ちますね。

敵はソコソコの強さ。タイマンならこなせますが、複数にかこまれると防御ができないので厳しい。
デスペナとしてランダムで持参しているアイテムをロストしますので、敵と戦うときはご注意を。

自由に色々やりたいと思ってやると、ストレスがたまります。
総評として、なんというか、あとちょっとが足りないゲームだなという感じでした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052277634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3671, 'last_played': 1504239449}
review:
It's fun, and has plenty of content to play in single player, and justify the price. The price is highly reasonable for even less content... however...

Multiplayer is a mess--you and the other player(s) are essentially all one player, the host... you can't go far from the host, and host has to level things up for all the characters, and if the host leaves, so do you (no server to speak of).... Since it was bought specifically for multiplayer, I can't recommend it...

If you just want a relaxing single player survival game, you could do worse. And the dev does seem to be active, so multiplayer might eventually become a legitmate thing. I'd surely change my not-recommend if it pops up someday...

review: Sehr schönes Sandbox / Crafting Game. Man kann leveln, man kann verschiedene Sachen herstellen, man kämpft gegen Monster und muss Quests erfüllen. Es macht regelrecht süchtig, weiter spielen zu wollen. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037381863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1504580001}
review:
This game is not without some significant faults that make game play less enjoyable. 

Playing in “General Mode” limits the items you can craft based on your character’s current level. This make early game play challenging, but not in a good way. The items you can craft at the beginning are simply underpowered, and it’s not like you can farm materials to make stronger weapons and faster tools early on. You’ll encounter enemies that are not hard, but take a lot of swings to kill because of the weak weapons. Farming will become very redundant due to the slowness of the tools. You have to advance in a very linear way; it’s very anti-sandbox. The game does offer a creative mode that supposedly unlocks all building/items. 

Leveling is a little weird, you have to complete quests, which is fine. But you also have to collect resources (the same that you use to build things) are part of the requirements. Said resources are consumed when you level up. You have stats, and the only way to gain higher stats is to complete the quests and burn through resources. 

Draw / View distance. This game has a very limited draw and view distance; hiding un-rendered areas with fog. This makes the world feel very small.

This game has a weird handle on menus. submenus prevent access from their main menus; even when both menus are visible. You have to do a lot of menu juggling to get between menus. It's very clumsy, frustrating, and inconvenient.

All crafting benches require additional tools; and later on upgraded tools. It’s neat, but also requires a lot of busy work to collect the items necessary to build the tools, then the resources to build the benches.

You cannot personalize or change your character.

The English translation is a little rough; there are some grammar syntax errors that require you to read through a tool tip or quest multiple times to understand what it actually means. Some of the word usage is awkward, such as “Splinters”. You’ll actually collect some in the very first quest, and you’ll be like “Those aren’t really splinters… technically they are, but…”

Building is a little clumsy, you can’t rotate your view of the area, and camera control doesn’t feel natural. 

Camrea control in general is very clumsy.

Be prepared for a lot of walking around, micro management for item crafting, redundant and boring framing. Slightly overpowered, but not difficult to defeat enemies that are time sinks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009958363', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1504468806}
review:
Controls are a little bit awkward at first, but you get used to it pretty quickly.
Its a good game so far.
Its not really a survival game - not enough survival mechanics in this game.

Pro:
-alot of stuff to gather
-alot of stuff to craft
-farming
-animals
-combat(pretty basic though)
-pretty relaxing

Con:
-pretty grindy
-combat is pretty basic
-no hunger / thirst (pretty big thing to me, would improve this game by ALOT)
-art style/colors ware a bit depressing
-clunky ui. it works, but it could be improved

afterall i give it 5 out of 10 points, and recommend it cause its definitily worth 7,99€

author: {'steamid': '76561198009308719', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4900, 'last_played': 1505589653}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079109937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1519, 'last_played': 1590853572}
review:
무언가 시간 때울게 필요한데 고사양 게임은 무리고 비싼게임도 싫다면 추천한다
이 가격에 그래픽이나 모션 따질거면 고사양에 비싼게임을 해라
이게임을 고사양에 쩌는 그래픽과 모션으로 만들어 준다면 비싸도 사줄 의향이 있음
현재로서는 가격에 딱 맞는 사냥, 빌딩, 크래프팅, 생존 게임

author: {'steamid': '76561198135729720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2892, 'last_played': 1600276973}
review: Bravo! Il y a vraiment que dans les jeux indé, qu'il y a une telle recherche de gameplay! Un jeu addictif, passionnant, complet, beau, et pas cher! Je l'aurais demandé au Père Noël j'aurais pas eu mieux que "Force of Nature". Si vous aimez les jeux de survie, farm, craft, gestion, rpg, ce jeu est pour vous, pour nous :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198135986607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3563, 'last_played': 1505430500}
review: Je ne m'attendais vraiment pas à un jeu aussi complet. Pour un jeu pas cher on peut vraiment faire beaucoup de choses. Une fois pris en main au travers des 3  premiers niveaux on peut découvrir une miriade de possibilité, exploration, construction, combat, leveling. Je le recommande chaleureusement ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198157772293', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1506825265}
review:
This is a pretty good game for the price, you could play this game for hours and not get bored. There is a lot of crafting and building and the combat is not bad. There are a few things I would like to see added or changed in the future which includes the following:

House Building: Being able to place your own foundations, ceilings, walls, doors, windows, etc would be really fun and would definetly increace the number of hours I have on this game

Being able to Destroy/Move old/garbage huts and replace them with better ones: I placed a trash hut at the beginning of the game in a good spot and was hoping I could replace it with a better one, I really hope this is changed in the future!

*THE NEXT FEW PROBLEMS I MENTION ARE ABOUT MULTIPLAYER WHICH IS CURRENTLY IN BETA, MY REVIEW WILL CHANGE WHEN NECESSARY*

Distance Limit from Other players: Currently you can only go a certain distance away from your fellow players in Multiplayer, I understand that rendering so much could be a problem, but I hope that the dev can find a way around this problem. THIS PROBLEM HAS BEEN SOLVED IN A RECENT UPDATE!!! :D

Player limit in Multiplayer: Currently, you can have a max of 2 (its 4 now) Players in General Mode (Regular Survival with Quests) and 4 Players in Creative (Survival with all recepies, and no Quests). While again, this helps prevent preformance issues, I hope the dev can find a way to fix this. 


I am not demanding that the dev changes all these or saying that the game sucks because of these minor problems, I am just recommending what I think should be added/changed to improve the game. Force of Nature is a good survival game that is worth the price, I give it a 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031172371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1505282017}
review:
I enjoy this game because that what I was looking for.
But I do not consider this a standard crafting-survival game, so you need to think if it matches what you are looking for.

There are atamina and health meters, but they regenerate if you rest or eat.
There is food, but no hunger meter.
There are enemies, but your base is basically a safe place to rest and farm resources while you heal.

So if you are looking for a difficult survival game where everything attacks you when it gets dark, this game is not for you.
However, if like me, you are looking for a relaxing crafting game when YOU are the one that dictates the pace and progress speed, this is a great game to pass the time, and worth it even in development stages.

I do want some features that will help make this game more fun:
- The compass points to the relic, and that's fine, but it should also point to the north. Shouldn't be too hard to implement two needles.
- Minimap can be useful in navigation
- Better marking on the map to know where resources like iron are located, or an ability to mark places on the map and add notes to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066553474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1504207717}
review:
This game feels like it wants to be a more visually realistic version of don't starve or even stardew however it waaaay misses the mark. The gfx are buggy there are menus upon menus to get in the way of things. There are limited quick buttons. Uou have to press space just to see what in front of you you can interact with...and then you click on said thing. 
In addition there is no real survival mechanic. You can eat but you don't starve, you can drink but you won't die of thrust and you can make fire but wont burn or freeze or over heat to death. With that all said tbh i don't really see the point, you want to build without dying etc get stardew. You want survival move to don't starve or even rust, both are literary better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158562129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1504387170}
review: I loved the idea of this game - I'm a sucker for open world crafting games - but I got bored after 4 hours. Crafting got tedious way too fast, and the game felt very linear. Combat is clunky to the point that it's not fun, and quests were limited to building x to level up, only so you can build y to level up again. I think my 10-year-old will like it, but I lost interest pretty quickly and needed something with a more advanced combat system and more complex quests.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070919233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2623, 'last_played': 1586652615}
review:
テンポはいまいち。理解するのに多少の時間を要しました。

日本語対応していますが、直訳や誤訳が多いので最初は？？？状態です。
操作性がイマイチで、テンポの悪さに通じています。UIの改善と操作キーがもう少しだけ細かくなればテンポも良くなると思います。
一日の長さの割には移動速度が遅いので、この辺も切り替えができるといいのではないかと個人的な主観です。
クラフトがメインのせいか、戦闘がかなり雑な気がしました。クラフトは楽しいです。クラフトが目当てでの購入だったのでこれはあたりでした。操作性が良くなればストレスも減るはず。
これからのアプデでアイテムが増えたり操作性の改善や誤訳直訳改善を期待します。
スタート画面から雑で誤訳満載なので、手探りからのクエスト感ですｗｗ

マルチのやり方が分からなすぎです。どうやったらマルチで遊べるのかそこがクエスト状態。
半日要してフレンドとマルチできましたがクラフト制限が解除されててお邪魔させてもらったプレイヤーがデフォルトになるようです。
同時にログイン、ログアウトで待ち合わせしないとマルチできません。
他プレイヤーと一定距離離れると移動不可能になり警告が出ますが、距離感が狭すぎてマルチでありつつも役割分担してのプレイはなかなか難しいところなのがとても残念です。
チャットもかなり不便で日本語対応していない、チャット画面をまるっとだしてからチャットをしますが、チャット画面でかすぎでした。＾＾；

これからのアプデに期待しています。誤訳直訳の件は英語ができないのでご報告しかねます。
ただ、おそらくBackの直訳だと思うのですが、　裏　となっているのは気になり過ぎなので、　戻る　か、もしくは英語のままがいいと思われます。
キャラが目覚めたときに「わたしはどこ？」は日本では昔からギャグとして使われるセリフなので初っ端からシリアスにはできなくなってしまいました（笑）

author: {'steamid': '76561197969162919', 'num_games_owned': 934, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1506601241}
review:
This game has a lot of potential, but I can sadly not reccomend it in its current state.

A few things need to be fixed first:

- Render distance, you can't see more than 20 or 30 meters ahead before the fog sets in.
- Controls are clunky and not very friendly
- You can't move very far away from each other in multiplayer
- There's way too much grinding to get the materials you need to craft

However, I hope these things will be fixed in later patches, and then I'll gladly reccomend the game. It has a sort of The Sims Castaway feel to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000538414', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 6550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2974, 'last_played': 1589842453}
review: Force of Nature is a laid back survival game that starts off slowly and never reaches the hectic pace of its competitors. This is a great game to relax with and just build yourself a life. The campaign mode is quite linear. You'll build a rope, a campfire, a knife, etc. After a few days you may wander from your beach home and encounter a monster or two and some natural predators. Don't expand too fast or get too far from your base at first. Build first, then explore. Stock up so that you can build later too. Fun game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092213489', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1503914532}

author: {'steamid': '76561198414850569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1926, 'last_played': 1506826047}
review:
这游戏视角和汉化都没什么问题，我是真的天然适应那种视角，而且根据任务来也能接受，但这不是重点。
重点是，这游戏难度跳跃得太大了，6级以前感觉确实枯燥乏味，就是不停地砍树，收集基础资源，打基础怪，掉落一些微不足道的战利品，然而7级开始进入地狱模式，7级要去收集一片自然碎片，首先要走很长的路，路上要不停地杀怪，喝药，到了目的地还得更加小心，一堆事先安排好的怪围在碎片周围，主角虽然有7级之名，却没有7级应有的装备水平，那些4级怪还带呼友系统，走错一步就是群殴逼你传送回家或者刷档，第二片自然碎片更夸张，给安排在沙漠中心，气温问题捉襟见肘，但跟怪一比不值一提，怪走位我打不到，我走位我还是打不到，还配备了远程攻击和肉盾，一堆789级的变态在路上就给我来个下马威，然后碎片周围全是10级的庞然大物，不知道死在呼友系统上多少次，反正最后强行肛过了，接着就是第三片自然碎片，放在那遥远的地方，中间是一片雪原，里面的怪统统20级不讲价，攻高血厚得亲身经历才看得懂，我是靠绕路绕了几个小时砍了近百棵树近百株草才能看见希望的曙光，稍微砍错一棵，死神就来和我群挑了，尽头是一片魔法森林，里面的怪只有10级上下，算是唯一的安慰。但这并不妨碍我吐槽这个游戏，好歹也是9级了，装备上限实在太低，拿着所谓的镔铁大剑上去硬干，伤害根本没增加多少，或者下血本作近百支特效弓箭，打到20级的敌人身上感觉像在挠痒痒，穿着厚重的铠甲走路都成问题，却还扛不住几下，还得带上不同的衣服适应不同的环境，翻箱倒柜找不到一件能够扭转局势的武器的痛苦谁能知道？而且资源还不是无限的，等你焦头烂额于如何制作更好的武器之时，还得马不停蹄地砍树砍石头，收集基础资源，反正我是没信心玩下去了，10级肯定更劝退，真的是麻烦制作者自己认真玩一遍好么，我就不信你发现不了其中的问题

author: {'steamid': '76561198137134323', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1506985725}
review:
Está bastante bueno, sacando los gráficos de lado, es bastante amplia la variedad de cosas por hacer y construir y craftear... bastante difícil a la hora de juntar materiales ya que no se regeneran y cada vez pelas más la zona donde estes... los bichos y variedades bastante poco vi por ahora... recomendado 100% :)

Máximo para 4 jugadores por el momento, es completamente cooperativo ya que no podes alejarte mucho de la zona si tus compañeros no te acompañan. A los Devs les recomendaría cambiar esa opción.

Voy a ir agregando info a medida que pasen las horas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314405780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3404, 'last_played': 1513868890}

review: 재밌네요 ㅎㅎ

author: {'steamid': '76561198155436794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1662480895}
review:
I brought this game the other day after reading reviews on it. Being just £6 i thought it was worth it as i love the genre. I like survival and craft games but i was not sure whether this would live up to the quality you'd except as some survival games nowadays are just following a trend and are'nt very great once you've played them but after playing this game when i should of been going to bed as i thought id try it out well lets just say 4 hours later in the early hours of the morning i was glad i brought this game. Ive only played it a total of 6 hours so far but i feel this game lives up to its genre.

You start being stranded on a beach and wonder how you got there then it literally throws you into survival mode, giving you quests and level ups along the way. Its quite fun if you like this type of game and i like how you can keep and farm animals but a word of warning never tame a sheep (any animal) near goblins....lets just say i had attack alerts going off constantly while i chased a group of goblins round who were chasing my sheep round, then the boars decided to join in....it did'nt end well and looked like something you'd watch while listening to the benny hill theme. My sheep however did survive and after a few attempts recused and brought back to my hut! 

The only negative thing i can say is that my worst enemy of the game is copper ingots! Omg they are annoying to make.
Other then that if you like survival crafting games, give this game a try, you should'nt be dissappointed!

My opinion: 8/10.

Have a lovely day =]

author: {'steamid': '76561198108120615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1634588372}
review:
I actually have really been enjoying this game. That is, until my quest required that I fight a goblin to get to the next level. I really do like this game but find that I have gone as far as I am able to go now since I do not like games that require me to fight things. I just get too freaked out! I checked out the settings and am unable to play in a peaceful mode which in my opinion, should be optional.

It was fun while it lasted.

review:
I love this game, I've never heard of the developers before in my life, so i took a stab in the dark here and im glad i did. This little gem of a game is worth every penny, and this game isnt even finished yet. 

The updates are little additions here and there, as well as little changes. So far im loving this game and would highly recommend this to anyone who wants a change from the triple A titles and want to kill some hours on indie games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069436648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1503363985}
review: My girlfriend and I got this game and it honestly is a great game. Has cool RPG elements along with a really good sandbox system and its honestly unique and very entertaining. The combat is simple but it's a great game if you like rpg/sandbox type stuff and is very relaxing to play. However the multiplayer (it being in beta as I write this) has some issues where it gets stuck on loading eternally with a "Waiting for data from other players" notification, but, my girlfriend and I having contacted the ONE DEV about this issue have received recognition from him and he's trying his very best to fix things and continues to be very helpful and we are very appreciative. This is a great game especially for one guy developing it. The camera angle is different but it isn't bad or unbearable. I definitely recommend this game and have good faith in the developer. Just be patient and let the guy take his time. He most likely has a life aside from making this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013779216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 10284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8039, 'last_played': 1504242905}
review:
i spent very happy time for the first 20 hours, until my character reach level8.
To achive level9, i was destinated to the very far side of the map, almost across the universe.
i walked and walked, but at some point, temperature became too hot.
i made and equip all anti-environment equippment, but that's not enough,
i must eat prercious food all along the way, and at last reached the questing point, but many enemies showed ultra-response and rushed towards me.

i tried almost everything, but temperature drained my HP so quickly.
After 40 hours, i found myself doing nothing but bake bread for restoring  HP.
i need 3 hours baking bread and consumed it for only 5minutes of fighting toward the questing point and retreat.
i bake bread ,try forward and retreat again and again and again.

i recommend this game IF YOU LOVE BAKING BREAD ALL THE TIME.
Of course i don't.

World is created each time you begin new game, so i understand sometimes i can't avoid picking up very unfriendly environment.
But this is BEYOND try and challenge-matter.

balancing was very poor and i abandoned playing after 20 hours  challnge and failure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134467883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1509064889}

author: {'steamid': '76561198177039967', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1638317418}
review: Игра норм в принципе. 1 - выбешивают вечно убегающие лисицы, тв@ри, бесят пздц. 2 - после недавних обновлений минут через 10-15 начинается жесткая просадка фпс с 60-80 до 22-18 это жесть. а так вполне играбельно. 5 съёб@вающих лисиц из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091113322', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1710539546}
review: Oyunu survival olduğu ve denizi çok güzel gözüktüğü için aldık. Başta oyun kuramadık ve multiplayer'i çözemedik ne oda vardı nede kuruluyordu. İade talebi gönderdim o sırada uğraşırken çözdüm dönce dünya oluşturmak gerekiyormuş biz dünyaya isim vermediğimizden kurulmuyormuş. İsim verme yeri çok saçmasapan biyerde. Dünya kurunca onu multiplayer bölümünden paylaşıyormuşuz. Bunları çözüp oyuna girene kadar oyun iade oldu. Oyundan çıktım kütüphanemden silinmiş para da beklemede 24 saat sonra vericekmiş steam. Çok saçma bir durum. Şimdi ooyunu tekrar satın aldım tavsiye ederim arkadaşınız varsa ve sisteminiz çok iyi değilse mutlaka satın alın. Ark kadar ultra grafikler yok ama yinede sevdiriyor..

author: {'steamid': '76561198078109208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2219, 'last_played': 1509383280}
review:
Gut Ding will weile haben,
das beschreibt dieses spiel ganz gut. In Force of Nature gehts nichts schnell und das muss es auch gar nicht. Es macht einem keinen druck zu verhungern oder verdursten oder das die vorräte verderben. So manch einer sagt das währe ja kein richtiges survival, ja und? Dieses Spiel bietet entspanntes sammeln und anbauen, dekorieren und bauen in entspanntem feierabentempo. Wer aktion im schnelldurchlauf sucht muss eben was anderes spielen. Mir persönlich macht es viel spass und ich kann mich austoben mein " zuhause" auszubauen und so zu gestalten wie ich möchte. Das kampfsystem ist zugegebener maßen ein wenig gewöhnungsbedüftig und der gute herr hauptakteur nicht besonders hübsch und hat ab und an seltsame bewegungsabläufe. Der Rest ist aber hübsch gestaltet mit liebe zum detail. alles in allem kann man hier viel zeit verbringen für wenig geld.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973598382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1566, 'last_played': 1504367828}
review:
What a great little game this turned out to be!
If you enjoy base building, progression, exploring, resource gathering and survival then you will probably enjoy this game quite a lot.
Some reviews I noticed there was alot of mention of invisable walls, I don't think the term invisable is warrented in this case, sure there are cliffs and collision but most things can be chopped down or mined away plus alot of the time the collision is actually handy not to get swarmed with mobs, you can quite easily cut a narrow path through the undergrowth to take on mobs one at a time for example.
For the price and the content already available its a no brainer! Buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054996980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1502828752}
review:
My son and I each bought a copy of this last week.
 We've played it every day since then. 
We just reached level 12, so we might take a break from it soon. 
  We have enjoyed the game. 

I like how the dev (or Dev Team?) has been releasing small additions/patches often.

Granted, this game is still in development.
 It remains to be seen how far it will come.

 As it is now, it IS worth the 8 bucks we paid for each copy.
 And that's really the bottom line.

 However,
 I'd like to be able to venture far-further away from each other. 
And the collision needs some improvement. 
 And it was sometimes a pain that he had to log out, so we could log back in together.
 Also, feeding chickens to get one egg at a time was hard on my wrist and my patience. 

 The rest is just obvious stuff. like "needs more stuff". 

 Ideas for some of that "more stuff":

 I'd love to eventually see caves, abandoned houses, bridges, NPCs, shops, escort quests, 
a pet (that can be tamed, leveled, and kept permanently),
spooky towers, and humor. 

Thanks for a fun game at a fair price. 
 Keep up the good work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989071649', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1567195291}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198091281378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2984, 'last_played': 1528447856}
review:
Force of Nature is a Frustratingly Fun Open World 2d Castaway type game.  It does have it's pros and con's 

Pro's
Easy Combat 
Good Controls 
Crafting will keep you busy for hours
Keeps you Entertained 
Nice rain Affects
Armor and weapons are nice
Weather affect is a nice touch



Con's
Constant Farming for materials can become boring and tedious
Aggro on emeies is out of Range they will swarm you half a mile away
To many trees in the forest areas you will spend hours whacking away trees and branches 
Animal run away to much causing aggro issues that can get you killed easily
Magic doesn't need to be here Altars etc
Needs more cooking recipies 
Needs more Armor to fight off cold weather
The map is pure shit but will help you
Poision remedy needs to be easier to obtain
Ending of game is shit

Now even with more nitpicking than positive I recommend this game it is very fun and can keep you entertained for hours on end. What would make this game a solid thumbs up I would get rid of the magic elements and turn this into a solid Castaway type game IT IS A VERY FUN GAME just a few things need tweaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140915028', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1375, 'last_played': 1502288244}

author: {'steamid': '76561198145489258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1703880151}
review: Отличная игра, правда не хватает более высоких технологий и более хардкордного выживания (постоянной потребности в пище и сне). Было бы неплохо увидеть переход от "железного века" к паровым машинам - добывать каменный уголь, строить паровые турбины для электрических фонарей и новых станков, пришедших на смену деревянному столу. В этом плане потенциал для дальнейшего развития игры колоссальный

author: {'steamid': '76561197996884002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1502067351}
review:
Infelizmente esse jogo tinha tudo para ser perfeito, porém logo de cara me vejo com um limite de distancia entre a outra pessoa que esta jogando com você... Sem contar que o craft é muito lento, você não sente fome, sede, etc.. É apenas o HP e Stamina, deixando o game um tanto quanto Arcade e não simulador.
Se quiser jogar offline, até que é interessante, porém o modo multiplayer além de estar em beta, é bem zuado, pois os dois players ficam vinculados a mesma quest e não é individual quanto nos demais jogos, até para aumentar o level, somente o host pode fazer isso para os dois.
Mais um Refund para a coleção.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055586349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2116, 'last_played': 1504388539}
review:
Like survivor games? This has got the right balance between crafting,building and bad stuff. In fact, it immediately pulled me in and kept me going until the early morning hours!  You can spend your time building, crafting, exploring without risking dying every 10 minutes. You don't have to die of thirst by refilling yourself with water every second or eating every minute. Your stamina is tied to how much work you do. More work, more stamina required. The nourishment then doesn't become some ridiculous kabuki theatre like certain other survivor games like Stranded Deep.

The game is truly progressive in that the more you engage and want to grow your base and character it will allow you to make the move. This will then allow you to craft more complex things including buildings, weapons, armour, farming. Capture sheep and start the important job of cultivating wool an important ingredient in armour and clothes. Increase the quality of your wearables and increase your character's armour rating. A very smart gentle nudging to move to bigger and better things. 

Graphics are just fine maybe understated but not pretentious. Brings back to mind the Ultima top down  series but more complex  and involved. Primarily survival but allows you to move to RPG areas without being in your face. 

It  then cleverly ties to character development and advancement  qua role playing. Playability is off the charts. Winner!

author: {'steamid': '76561198130858509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1502054645}
review:
Game is kind of addicting, I keep playing to see what else I can build. But, like any early access games there are things to be inproved. The crafting system needs work, the navigating through the bushes and trees gets very annoying very quickly. This games seems to be a survival game, why are there gobins?

If you like early access and are willing to keep at the game, then youd enjoy this

author: {'steamid': '76561197971522769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4602, 'last_played': 1565631132}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018201450', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1502041057}
review:
I have around 12 hours into the game, this one is an odd game.  It is grindy, monotonous, slow paced, graphics are meh, sound is basic as hell but for some strange reason it is very addictive.  Its got that... civilisation-one-more-turn feel to it.  What keep you going is all the cool stuff that opens up to you to craft once you level up.  The new gear means you can push further into the wilderness and see more biomes, loot and monsters.   

The interface is okay, could do with some more hotkeys here and there, but nothing too essential missing.  The sound is passable, at least its not too annoying.  one tip:  put the portal away from your main area, it has an annoying loud hum that made me turn down the game's volume and it can't be moved once placed.  The graphics are passable, its not cute, charming or beautiful, but does the job ok.  The movement of the player is a little slow, wish he can run faster.  You can't out run any of the creatures in the game really.  

NO, despite what other reviewers have said... no this game doesn't lend itself to roleplaying, its mechanics are too predictable, "mechanical" and linear for any meaningful roleplaying.  

Another complaint:  The pacing is haphazard, Thing were slow but steady until level 6 to level 7, it got super slow to level up with a bunch of hard to do quests and what is most annoying is the RNG required to get the 5 gold bars to levelup,  (To get gold bars you need gold coins drop randomly from goblins, this took absolutely forever at this stage.  Once you grind pass level 7, the RNG for getting gold is mitigated somewhat by the much better weapons you get at level 7 and so you are killing stuff much quicker.  I haven't done the level 7 quests yet, but they seem to have returned to reasonable again.   Hope it doesn't slow down again, its a slow going game that can feel like a glacial slog if it slows down any further, I was tempted to quit for the night during level 6.

The good:  Its a solid game, very tight, even though the level questing is linear there is room for variety in terms of the efficiency engine you want to create for yourself.  Not quite open-world variety, but what little there is makes your decisions feel important.  The loot is well thought out and nothing is obsolete and everything seems consequential.  The price is definitely a bonus.  Played this alone and probably wouldn't be a good multiplayer game with adult gamers (at least my gaming buddies, the pace is way too slow.  As a single player that is exceptable, I could be listening to music or something), but I could see this work with young kids though.  

Yes, I would recommend this game to those that enjoy an old school slow-paced linear leveling survival game that is well designed and tight and have a real addictive quality to it, then go for it, the price is fair.  If you want adrenaline pumping action, hair-pulling difficulty, or a game that is difficult to master, you are going to be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257149497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1502142481}
review:
第一次好评，留个纪念~

这款游戏是个不仅限于喝水吃饭睡觉打豆豆的生存类游戏， 有比其他生存类游戏更大的世界~

比较重要的一点，看了这么多差评，游戏开发者居然都在漫长的更新上解决了，就凭这点我送上好评一个~


解释几个让大家差评的点，这几点可能是版本的更新而解决或在设置上的问题。

1 首当其冲的反人类视角 (我室友第一次玩就能Free Camera，根本在打我这个强行接受设定的M的面）

解决方案： Setting - General - Camera - Free

2 按部就班地升级解锁

秒变我的世界，从此海阔天空： New game - Game mode - Creative

3  没有妹子的余生

让基友也跟你遇难吧： Multiplayer - or start a new game - 你的随意存档 - Play - Shift+Tab - 查看好友列表（右下角） - 右键你的好友 - 邀请加入游戏 - Play

author: {'steamid': '76561198051295885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1507030291}
review:
I know we say graphics aren't everything but despite my initial reaction to look of the game I've already spent a bit of time in it and want to play more. Force of Nature really puts you in an untamed wilderness, you have to actually bushwhack to get to places. It forces you to reshape the land. I find that very refreshing. Plus you also get the fantasy element of fighting goblins and whatnot which is a nice change of pace to the zombies that infest most survival games these days. 

Clear the land, build a house, smack some monstes around.

Dislike 2: embers don't burn avatar which is question mark for me, ember storage is in your inventory?

author: {'steamid': '76561198093713895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1511491603}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989310904', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 7956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7271, 'last_played': 1629772696}
review:
Um dos melhores jogos de sobrevivencia que ja joguei !

Jogabilidade excelente
Variedade de materiais extraíveis do mundo
Muitos inimigos (aumentam conforme você aumenta o level)
Possibilidade de construir inumeras coisas
Barracos, Barris, Baús, Fogueiras, Fogão a lenha, Fornalhas, Portais, e inumeras outras ferramentas e maquinas
Possibilidades de  domar diversos animais, como porcos, galinhas, galos, vacas, ovelhas cabras e muito mais
Cada animal domado vai ser responsável por produzir elementos como leite, ovos, penas e outros diversos elementos que serão usados no crafting do jogo

Jogo baseado em quests, o que  dificulta a subida de nivel, deixando o jogo mais desafiador ainda.

Grafico bonito e leve, enviroment agradável, variações climáticas dos mais diversos tipos, como sol, chuva, neve, neblina etc...

 ainda não encontrei nem bugs e nem algo que pudesse relatar contra o jogo, então é um jogo que recomendo muito.

review: 非常的差评如果游戏打分为10分满分的花这个游戏只能算3分，操作模式太过固定，无法跑步算一个，连一只鸡都追不上，科技分配制度不合理，前期烧完铁只能拿着木棍去打怪？都能烧铁了我就不信不能做弓箭，换成大佬估计连枪都给你做了，全程只能跟着任务跑而且任务如果没做完连等级都不能升！！！！所以我认为这个游戏只能给3分游戏题材的3分~剩下的都是0分，现阶段不推荐入手游戏性太差！！！！！！！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198022215970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 8221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2580, 'last_played': 1689087382}
review:
Hmmm...
Habe sehr viele EInschätzungen und Bewertungen gelesen.
Diese haben mich inspiriert es auch zu kaufen und zu testen.

1.) Grafik ist nicht die beste ,,, daher für alle Grafikfetischisten FINGER weg:) Für mich i.O.  !
2.) Handling Steuerung ist sehr Gewöhnungsbedürftig , aber der Mensch ist ja ein .....lassen wir das , man kommt zurecht,            
      gewöhnt sich daran. Hoffe aber dennoch das sich die Kamara irgendwann mal noch ein wenig verändern lässt:)
3.) Story ( falls man es so bezeichnen kann) ist okay und motviert weiter zu machen bin jetzt lvl 7 kurz vor 8 hab mir da    
     echt  jetzt zeit gelassen, da es ab da natural Teile zu finden gibt , die bewacht werden...:-)
4. Kämpfe sind etwas stupide aber O.K. man muss halt auf passen und immer gut dabei haben, ich habe derzeit Brot  
     dabei gibt 40 Gesundheit in 20sec oder so plus meinem Kaffee der das selbe in Ausdauer macht. Also "Stupides" 
     ist zwar möglich, aber nur mit einem Gewissen Equip und genüged Vorbereitung. Dennoch muss man aufpassen, da
     weglaufen meist nicht hilft , ausser man kennt einige Tricks, was aber nich immer hilft. Mir machts spass!!!
5. Sound Kulisse Hindergrund sind okay , für mich passt es , da ich oft ne 12std. Schicht habe und danach einfach entspannen will sei es craften oder sammeln oder auch etwas fighten um an Gold zu kommen.:)
6.) Multiplayer ist in Vorbereitung, d.h. theoretisch funzt es  schon....muss das aber leider noch antesten mit nem Kumpel.

[b]FAZIT:
KLEINES GELD ..... GROSSER SUCHTFAKTOR!!!!   Erwische mich oft noch dabei  wo ich mir sage , ach nur noch die Bretter hertsellten die Hühner nochmals Füttern und nen Sprung zu den Kühen gehen . Ach etwas Holz fehlt noch  das mache ich  noch usw usw usw,
Für Zwischen durch und auch für länger durchaus geeignet meine Empfehlung bei einer skala von 1-10 (10 beste) wäre ich hier auf eine gute 7plus oder auch 8.
Klar gibt es  "Conan" "ARK"! usw..... wer kennt das nicht. Aber das hier ist entspanned , wenn man will und es macht spasssss!
Mal sehn was da noch kommt. Ausschlaggebend war für mich der Preis, hatte es im Angebot gekauft für gute 5 Euro:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198250283818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1500230643}
review: I got bored. Fast. Was excited to play this and bought it when the July sale came out. But I was a little disappointed when I saw that I have to unlock everything and have to wait days on end (in game) until I can actually build anything. I played this for less than an hour and just stopped. I liked the idea/concept of the game, but I would like to just have everything there at once to build. And maybe have the days and nights a bit more lengthy.
developer_response: There is an creative mode which is almost the same as general but everything is available from the beginning. Also in the near future I will add the magic night vision glasses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036434805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2148, 'last_played': 1501098224}
review:
Ich sag mal klipp und klar, worum es in diesem Spiel geht und auch ein paar Worte zum neuen Multiplayer ... Spielprinzip + Pros und Kontras



- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
SPIELPRINZIP
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Survival? Nope!
Ein Survival würde implizieren, dass man reagieren muss, um sein Ableben zu verhindern ... also die Handlung des "Überlebens" tätigen ... 
Bei "Force of Nature" gibt es dafür weder die essentielle "Hunger", noch die "Durst" Anzeige ... sprich, man kann den ganzen Tag, gemütlich im Garten herum chillen ...

Und dort wo man beginnt, lauern auch keine Gefahren ... man könnte einfach da bleiben, wo man anfängt und es würde nichts passieren ...  diesen Ort zu verlassen, birgt nur das unnötige Risiko sich Gefahren auszusetzen ... warum sollte man sich das antun?

Ja, wären da nicht die sogenannten "Quests" ... und der Drang nach Belohnungen ...
Denn diese Quests sind der Grund, der uns nötigt, die Startlocation zu verlassen ...
Sie funktionieren ungefähr so:
1. Baue X
Um X zu bauen, musst du Y finden
2. Baue Z
Um Z  zu bauen, brauchst du 2 X

Und so weiter ... also begebt man sich quasi immer freiwillig in Gefahr, um seine Quests abzuschließen ...

Im Grunde genommen ist das für mich kein Survival, sondern ein Aufbauspiel ... mit Schwerpunkt auf 


- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
MULTIPLAYER
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Etwas unfair, ein nachgereichtes Multiplayer-System, welches sich in der Bethaphase befindet, zu beurteilen, aber so ist der Stand der Dinge:

- Ein Spieler hostet die Welt, die er vorher alleine erstellt hat
(sprich, der beigetretene Spieler, kann diese Welt nicht alleine weiter spielen, sollte der Host off sein, umgekehrtes ist natürlich der Fall)

- Die Spieler dürfen sich nicht zu weit von einander entfernen, bzw. immer in Sichtweite bleiben, sonst ist da einfach eine undurchdringliche, unsichtbare Barriere.
Das bedeutet, man kann nicht sagen "Du gehst Erz holen, ich baue hier weiter" ... sondern nur "Los, wir gehen Erz holen" oder "Wir bauen hier weiter"

- Programmiertechnisch spielt man eine Person, auf zwei Personen aufgeteilt.
Steigt Spieler 1 eine Stufe auf, steigt auch Spieler 2 eine Stufe auf
Stirbt Spieler 1, stirbt auch Spieler 2 ...

- Es gibt 2 Modi, einmal den "Quest"-Modus, wo man alle Konstruktionen die man bauen kann, durch das abschließen von Quests freischalten muss, sprich "Man hat Aufgaben" ... und den "Kreativ"-Modus, wo es weder Aufgaben, noch einschränkungen gibt, hierbei werden allerdings auch keine "Errungenschaften" freigeschaltet.
Allerdings kann man den "Quest"-Modus nur alleine oder zu zweit spielen.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PRO
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

+ Sehr tiefes Craftsystem, hier kann man wirklich viele Dinge herstellen, bin ich von anderen Spielen nicht gewohnt

+ Für eine Zufällig-Generierte Welt, sieht das alles sehr gut aus. Wird für langanhaltenden spaß sorgen

+ Einzigartige, kreative Ideen ... Graben nach Ton, Zinn, Kupfer, Palmwedeln, Kokosnüsse, Sonnenblumenkerne, Kaffeebohnen, so viele Blumen und Pilzsorten ... und dazu noch ein Bauernhof Simulator ... alles in einem Spiel, für schlappe 8 Euro ... hier wurde vieles richtig gemacht

+ Alle Gegenstände die man fallen lässt, werden grafisch als auf dem Boden liegende, 3 Dimensionale Gegenstände als das dargestellt, was sie tatsächlich sind. Wird man ein Ei auf dem Boden, ist auf dem Boden also ein Ei zu sehen.
Sowas simples, bekommen selbst Entwickler mit Millionen Budget (The Elder Scrolls Online) nicht hin, ist man ganz einfach nicht gewohnt. Finde ich Klasse, dass sich dieser Aufwand hier gemacht wurde. Sieht nicht nur schick aus, man kann "sehen" was da liegt, ohne irgendwie da reingucken zu müssen ... !

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
KONTRA
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

- Die Grafik ist "Naja"

- Kein Charakter Editor, man spielt immer diesen hässlichen Jungen, und wenn man, so wie ich, das Spiel mit einer Freundin zusammen spielt, spielen wir zwei hässliche Jungs, da es nicht Mal möglich ist, ein hässliches Mädchen zu spielen

- Das Kampfsystem ist so primitiv und schlecht gemacht, dass ich seine Funktionsweise gar nicht erst erklären möchte.
Stellt euch einfach das primitivste Kampfsystem vor, dass man sich für ein Third Person Adventure vorstellen kann

FAZIT

Ja, dass Kampfsystem ist beschissen, die Grafik ist Banane, es gibt keinen Charakter Editor, der Multiplayermodus ist eine Zumutung und es ist kein Survival ...

Andere Frage: Macht es spaß?

JA, irgendwie schon ... 

Also im Teamspeak/Skype mit nem Freund oder einer Freundin abhängen, zusammen im Multiplayer Modus "Force of Nature" zocken ... und man hat einen lässigen Abend mit Unterhaltungswert, zu dem Preis, lohnt sich das auf jeden Fall :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198016501753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6690, 'last_played': 1530729412}
review:
I caught Force of Nature on sale for $6 bucks, and grabbed it to give it a try.  What a lucky find!
I'm 90 hours into FoN, and still having a great time with it! 

You can nitpick the little things, like the camera view is a little odd compared to a lot of 3rd person games, but the game is chocked full of fun! 

Money well spent right here, this game is great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064341909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1547442870}
review:
Brutally slow...fun concept but bogged down with bad controls!

I hate WASD based games.  Had I known this ahead of time I would not have spent the $8.

I've played about 3 hours and still hate the controls.  Can't recommend it based on those.  If you can get rid of the WASD functionality, then I will come back.  Until then, it's a Thumbs Down!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025007953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1509235094}
review:
This game rocks. It has an old-school feel to it. Smoke a bowl, play some tunes, and do your thing. 
Resource Gathering, Farming, Base building, Crafting, Survival.
It's slow paced, take your time in each level building your new unlocks and making your base how you like it.If you're just trying to get to an end-point you aren't going to have a good time. 
I recommend playing with a friend, I've really been enjoying this one. 

Bummers:
No Linux
No female char - ladies game too, damnit!
I see a lot of bitching about the tether to the other player, frustrating, but good when one of you tends to wander off and die.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992433506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1508395348}
review:
Für rund 8 € kann man nicht mehr erwarten, daher empfehle ich das Spiel, die Grafik würde ich als akzeptabel und die Steuerung als unhandlich bezeichnen. Im Spiel selbst geht es eher langsam voran, das Crafting ist zum Teil unnötig verzweigt, was unnötig Zeit kostet und am Anfang nervt.

Wer das Genre mag, viel Geduld und Ausdauer mitbringt wird "Force of Nature" bestimmt mögen.

Grafik : -2
Gameplay : -2
Steuerung : -1

Preis : +1

Gesamt : 6 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198090511780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2634, 'last_played': 1529262336}
review:
I was kind of afraid I wouldn't like this game but the price was low enough I figured I'd give it a try. I'm so glad I did because it's turned out to be one of my favorites. The creators didn't get caught up in trying to over complicate things. It's a simple sandbox survival game that sates the desire to build, explore, farm, fight, and level up. HOWEVER I haven't yet felt 'forced' into doing any of the above. Some days I just hang out on my farm and make a ton of coffee. Other days I go on a killing spree in the woods around my house.

It's a great, simple game that lets you play along in your favorite play style. For the price, this is a good game to have in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125204859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1500672377}
review:
Invisible wall - invisible wall - I sure do hope - you like invisible walls.  Because they're everywhere.  I think navigating the landscape is likely the most challenging thing about this game.  That hill is too steep, but the one right next to it, which looks the same angle, isn't.  Ok.  Then the trees and bushes are in your way.  You chop them down, collect the stuff, now you got too much stuff.  Now storage becomes an issue.  Where do I put all this crap?  Build some chests and barrels.  Ok.  But now that's an ever creeping problem.  Bah - I really dislike invisible walls and storage stress as part of a games 'challenge'.

That said, after 30 hours I'm still enjoying it.  Mostly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996104527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1923, 'last_played': 1564956148}
review:
I really have enjoyed this game. I purchased this game on a weekend to do multiplayer with my two adolescent sons, at the time of writing  this you can only do two players in "survival mode" and 4 players in the "creative mode" the only real difference I noticed was every thing was unlocked to build and no quests which I don't recall having any rewards, the quests seem to be like a tutorial kind of guidance. I really enjoy the game though and think it is an amazing value, could easily be worth more. 

Ps I have a hard time having the discipline not to build unlimited buildings or the best items right away in "creative mode" but since you have to grind out the resources, it's not that over powered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031457095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1502945610}
review:
Bought this game cause I'm a stingy bastard and didn't want to fork out $25 for LiF;Forest Village after watching my partner abuse the game for weeks on end. I decided to give this a shot, cause fucking $7.99 mate! 

Needless to say, we were both fucking impressed, little goblins chasing you round, goats and chickens that make your gay uncle Marvin look straight, and some madly entertaining gameplay. 

+1 to developers, may they continue to bless us with more rabbit chasing galore!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057700787', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1520426057}
review:
見下ろし型の箱庭サンドボックスゲーム。昨年末登場のゲームだが
頻繁にアプデをしており良好な感じ。ただ現状はまで荒削りなためあくまで早期アクセスゲーの
域は出ない。箱庭ゲーが好きな人にはたまらない要素がつめこまれているので
値段もお手頃なのでオススメである。

生活部分、農業、畜産等やれることは多いもののスタミナによって制限するパターンであり
テンポが非常に悪い。またレベル制が導入されており、好きなものを自由に造る
ということはできないためそこらへんRPG的な部分であろう。

敵は動画でもわかるが、イノシシやくまなどの猛獣からゴブリン、死神などのファンタジーな
面も色濃いのでそこら辺で好き嫌いが分かれるか？

author: {'steamid': '76561197997071860', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3020, 'last_played': 1544739738}
review:
[i]Hello, this is another 'early access crafting survival sandbox game'.[/i] And if you're interested in theme, it's actually fun!
[strike]-------------------------------------------------------------------------[/strike]
[h1]Theme of the game[/h1]
You're washed ashore of some land. You've got some boldly ripped shorts on you and... that's all. Goal: survive against wildlife, and build youself some roof over your head (or over your things). Good luck!

[h1]Execution of the idea[/h1]
Someone sat down, and actually thought trough the whole thing. Progression from digging stick to first class shovel is nicely implemented - all tools have great impact on your gameplay, and you feel, that there is really need to push forward.

[h1]Gameplay feel[/h1]
After every discovery, of what you can build, smelt or make, there is an influx of 'oh darn, this is sooo repetitive! And yes - it is and it is intended this way. If you actually landed with nothing on you on a foreign land, you won't build brickhouse from day 1 - you'd have to really make your tools, gather materials and so on. Yet from time to time you discover ways game is making some tasks easier for you - you just have to work your way to them!

The game lacks proper story, and I don't think there is a need for one. But in return nothing stops you from some roleplaying.

[h1]Audiovisual experience[/h1]
Music is virtually non-existent in the game - it plays every time you discover and visit new biome (you can force in the options to play it when you visit it again, after some time), and honestly I wouldn't mind it playing more often. It's catchy and good. But the real background is really the true sound of nature - cicadas in the night, birds singing, ocean waves washing the shore, sounds of insects buzzing around you, delicate noise of leaves in the wind, bubbling of a swamp, ice breaking in the frozen desert, or creepy silence of the cold wasteland... It really can relax!

The graphics are nice - nothing much else you can say about them. They are pleasing, but not super-highly detailed, they blur a little. This has nice side effect of the game having quite low hardware requiariments, while it still looks good. There are a couple of ingenious tricks, that make the game more immersive - like vision going out of sharpness, like your avatar is shivering from the cold, or bloody noise and occasional blackouts when you're hurt badly. Small visual cues, that make the game feel more natural.

There are no errors I could spot (except flower pot just floating in the air), and in over 40 hours I've spent in this game, I haven't got a crash or error.

Protagonist's movement are absolutely great - not disrtacting, natural (he has to actually turn around, and not just swirls in place as you move your mouse).

[h1]Interface and playability[/h1]
Coming from other crafting/sandbox games, UI is surprisingly polished. It feels natural, and consequential, but is poorly documented. I feel like some more actions need extra buttons (like 'Take all' should have its own hotkey, or when clicking an item in the chest with i.e. shift all items of this kind could get transfered), but in the end it serves its purpose - you're not limited by it, most of the time. WHERE IS MY MAP ZOOM!?

One thing that needs to be mentioned is the camera - first thing you need is to set it to 'free' in the options, or else you'll end up in that strange overhead view.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]
While most of the game is collecting stuff, combat is unaviodable. It doesn't require lighting fast reflexes, but rather feeling into it and good timing, and you'll get out of most of the fights unscathed, just keep number of enemies you're fighting low. You won't drown, fall to your death or otherwise croak, so until you wander into pack of bears while backpedalling shooting your bow at goblins, you'll be fine. In short - remember your surroundings.

[h1]Target audience[/h1]
That's hard question. It's both engaging game, and a relaxing one. It has potential, is pleasing to eyes and ears, and transfers very well the difficulty of making your way in the wilderness. I'd say, if you've enjoy watching [i]Primitive Technology[/i] on Youtube, you'll probably enjoy this game. It's building blocks and mechanics are very simple, so I'd say the age bracket is very wide.

[b]I clearly enjoyed this game, and I do not regret spending money on it, It's something different, just not in the same way as jumping from Minecraft to Goat Simulator. There are downsides - like repetitiveness of some tasks and the fact you have to progress from biome to biome in a sequence, or you'll end up with enemies way above your level, but in return you get to immerse into experience you're probably not going to experience (unless you go to field trip in Australia and get lost in the bush).[/b]

[h1]Final objective score: 6.5/10[/h1]
[h1]Final personal subjective score: 8/10[h1].

author: {'steamid': '76561198041974325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1500093694}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962021312', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1285, 'last_played': 1502300455}
review:
I am a huge fan of sandbox based games. Once you figure out how the mechanics work it's rather enjoyable. I hope they open this game up to allowing fans to do custom modifications like they did with 7 Days to Die. 

The graphics are pretty decent
The concept is great
The user interface could use some minor tweaks to make it a little more understandable to the new players but easily able to figure out. 

I would recommend it to anybody looking for a nice game to fill their time when they get bored with their other sandbox style games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038689828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1621943277}
review: A basic, but still enjoyable survival game. Waking on a tropical island, you must use your wits and resources around you to survive. More a casual game, then anything really serious. Probably what makes it so entertaining.

review:
I did enjoy this game for a while now and except to the coop we can recommend it, it is fun and a beautiful game, but we would not really recommand to get it for playing coop. If you want to know why go please to my steam curator page: http://top-or-flop.bytefortress.de/review_force_of_nature.html
Unfortunately most people will probably want to rather play a game like this with some friend, so we can't recommend it for now till this coop system gets changed.
This game has still a lot of problems and if you are thinking about buying it and aren't sure yet you should read my page.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134640233', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1322, 'last_played': 1663792167}
review:
For those who like surviva games, FON (Force of Nature) is a cheap and very enoyable way to have fun! The exciting gameplay, ambient sounds, thrilling exploration and the great ease into the game is soo good in this game. As you can see, i have played a reasonable amount of time on the game and so i would definately recommend it!

Now you need to understand, however, that this game is new and still has polishing to do but so far (for a new game) it has done really well. Also, i do understand how some people have complained about the grinding element. Firstly, practically all survival games need some aspect of grinding at times and so i feel that FON did really well in creating inventive ways to grinding so it wasn't so boring because there was always an adventure when getting some new materials!

I just want to say that, for the price of this game, you should certainly think about getting it because of the fun you will have as well as the new addition of multiplayer!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004200033', 'num_games_owned': 3629, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1630702521}
review:
====== รีวิวฉบับสั้นๆ เด๋วว่างๆมารีวิวฉบับเต็มให้อีกที =======

Force of Nature เป็นเกม Survival + Sandbox ในรูปแบบที่ไม่เหมือนใคร แค่มุมมองของการเล่นก็ไม่เหมือนใครแล้ว โดยเกมนี้เริ่มต้นมาเราจะติดเกาะอยู่ แล้วต้องเอาชีวิตรอดไปให้ได้ ซึ่งการเล่นก็ไม่ยากเลย เพราะมีเควสสอนการเล่นเกือบทั้งหมดของเกมเลยทีเดียว แถมในเกมมีอะไรให้เราทำเยอะแยะ ตั้งแต่สร้างไอเทมต่างๆ สิ่งปลูกสร้าง สร้างฟาร์ม ล่าสัตว์ หรือแม้แต่ออกผจญภัยและต่อสู้กับสิ่งมีชีวิตต่างสายพันธุ์ นอกจากนี้เกมนี้ ยังสามารถเล่น Co-op กับเพื่อนได้ด้วย

สำหรับเกมนี้ในช่วง Early Access ก็ถือว่าโอเคครับ ราคาไม่แพง ถ้ามีเพื่อนเล่นก็สนุกดี ถ้าเกมนี้สมบูรณ์เมื่อไหร่ก็จะยิ่งน่าเล่นกว่านี้แน่ๆ

author: {'steamid': '76561197962347142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1499237178}
review:
This game is fantastic. I have already got my moneys worth and I cant seem to put this game down. I love the quest system which basically guides you through the game. The graphics are not that great but they are acceptable, the gameplay far overrides the need for great graphics. Every session of grind has a reward where you can get to the next level or achieve the ability to build something new. 

The fact that you can move everything you have built around without any penalty is brilliant so when I get bored with my homestead or come up with a better idea i can just move things around.

Some improvement on the combat would be welcome and some small quality of life improvements would be great like being able to shift click stacks between inventory and storage, being able to queue crafting recipies wouldnt go a miss either.

All in all a fantastic game from a developer who seems to listen to the people playing it. Well worth the asking price, sale or otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075441669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2563, 'last_played': 1554557803}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014196104', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 8023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6891, 'last_played': 1526839209}
review:
For the few £ I spent it has been a great game.

50 hours in and my thoughts are as follows.  Not played sandbox yet so this is only for levelling and currently level 10.  Initially I found the crafting clunky and it took a while to get used to.   The hard caps to stop you levelling are annoying, Early levels you have to go kill goblins to get your gold coins and later levels have to kill stuff to get your gem chips.  Having to kill stuff to level annoyed me but i can see why the dev did it this way.   At the start I found the goblins a bit of a weird addition to a crafting/exploration game but you get used to it and some of the later monsters I found quite fun.

Annoying to have to craft a set of clothing for basically a new area and to level.  I can see the rationale behind it but going from a tropical +35 to a -5 area in a matter of a few strides seems a bit weird.   Not sure why the dev capped certain buildings in the levelling mode to me if I want to build 10 wells to sort my water problem out I should be able to.  I am hoping sandbox mode allows this.

That aside the game is laid back for the most part and is well balanced and I have had fun playing it.  Grindy in places it still gives a sense of achivement and I am hopeful that the dev keeps up his great work.  As a left hander who never got to grip with WASD great to see controls can be changed and you can run it in windows mode just remember to use the escape key before going out to windows.  This could turn into a classic game.  Once I finish the main game I am looking forward to see how sandbox goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069015489', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1486, 'last_played': 1500774490}
review: Verilen paranın hakkını karşılayan bir oyun. Öncelikle bu oyunu arkadaşınız ile beraber oynamanızı tavsiye ediyorum. Şu an için max 2 kişi beraber oynayabiliyor ve oyun içinde 100 metreden fazla birbirinizden uzaklaşamıyorsunuz. ( Açıkçası bu durumu pek kafaya takmadık.) Tek başına oynarken kaynak toplamak biraz sorun olabilir. ( Tabi bu sizin sabrınıza ve neden zevk aldığınız ile ilgili) . Oyunda quest yaparak level atlayabiliyorsunuz.  Oyun lvl 8 den sonra başlıyor ve inanılmaz zevkli.  Oyunun en büyük artılarından beri iklimlendirmenin olması. Aşırı sıcak ve soğuk yerler için elbise ve kolye yapmak zorundasınız. Yaratık çeşitliliği gerçekten iyi. Craft malzemeleri biraz zengin bir hale getirilebilir. ( Bu arada oyunda sürekli güncelleme ve yenilik yapılıyor.) Özetle parasını fazlası ile hak ediyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066102063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1498782078}
review:
I had read some positive and negative reviews and I thought "Well, it's on sale right now, and it looks like my kind've thing, why not give it a try?"

Spoilers: I returned the game for a full refund.

First of all... the game plays slowly. Not a relaxing kind of slow, it's a boring kind of slow. ...and that's if your stamina (which runs out entirely too quickly) hasn't packed up too much, in which case it becomes mind-numbingly slow. There are foods you can eat to restore stamina... but they don't restore much. You're better off just leaving your character sitting there, browsing the internet in the background and coming back in a minute or two when it's back up to a reasonable level.

The camera is absolutely atrocious. Typically when you play something you expect to be able to WASD and the camera follows you nicely, or use the mouse as camera control. Not with this game. The vast majority of the time if you want to control the camera you have to move your mouse whilst holding Space. ...why not hold right click or, y'know, actually switch to a good FPS view so WASD + Mouse was an option?

The menus are a pain in the ass. Inventory is something I like to keep open in games. In this game though it restricts your movement and camera control of course because... why wouldn't it..? There are multiple crafting menus rather than having a single one with different categories in it. This of course means more screen space and control is taken away from you.

Nothing is obvious. Either you need it spelled out for you or have to somehow stumble upon a solution by blind luck. I needed palm leaves for rope. Sure, you find some laying around. I used that for a knife (and you HAVE to make everything in order or you can't move on to the next step). No palm leaves for rope, how do I make a hatchet to progress? Turns out you have to kick the palm tree. Because of coouurse.

Combat is ridiculous. For rabbits you have to trap them in a corner. This is very difficult because they are faster than you and even when you have them trapped chances are they'll STILL get away. It's easier with goblins because they don't run. Aaand neither can you. You get two weapons early game to beat goblins with (which, of course, is necessary for game progression). One does less damage but allows you to dodge, one does higher damage but you need more of a swing so you're more likely to take a hit. This is a lie though, as you cannot dodge at all. Doesn't matter how much you side-step or back off, they will keep hitting you, so the only real option is the higher damage weapon, and you're still going to get hurt. You only have these two weapons, no armour, and of course no ability to make the odds better in your favour by preparing.

Levelup is the most awkward thing about the game though. You have to complete certain tasks in order to level up, and thus y'know, actually play the game. The entire game ends up an extended tutorial, and as much as I really tried to give this game a chance to get better... it just... continuously got worse. At no point did I ever have an ounce of fun. It was just a chore to get to the "real gameplay" which I eventually realised would never come. In most games you expect to be in a good position within maybe half an hour at most. It took me over an hour to get... essentially nowhere. For the majority of the time I kept thinking "I wish I was playing something else."

This game could've been so much more. I think that's the worst part. The ideas are there but implemented so badly that you have to wonder what in the flying fiddlesticks were they thinking when designing this game? If they changed the camera to FPS that alone would fix a shit tonne of what is wrong with this game. Remove levelup via tutorial and just give it an exp-based system. Make combat optional, like... you can choose to go to areas that enemies are in, or choose to play it safe. Also make combat less like a pointless slapfight too.

This whole game feels like that one friend you don't really like who is dragging you to every clothes shop in town and making you look at every item of clothing in the store whilst you're hungry and tired and just want to go home.

Ultimately I'd give this game a 1/10. That 1 is only for the ideas they have, wasted on the horrendousness of their execution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002189495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1569723686}
review:
If your wondering if you should pick up this game it's a big yes from me at least. I was worried about the camera view, but it is much better than the video shows and there is some other camera option which I haven't tried yet.

The game is fun to play. It's an open world, but it's also quest driven to unlock craftables. The quest driven part is very nice; keeps the game interesting and each play through is randomly generated.  You also level up as you kill goblins, collect coins from them, craft certain items, tame animals, build farms, etc. It's a very nice mix that keeps me busy and it's enjoyable. There is a pretty good variety of animals and creatures which is good to see so far. 

The graphics are nice. I picked this up on sale and I'm very happy I did. The amount of games on Steam can be mind boggling, but this one should keep me coming back for more.
