author: {'steamid': '76561198300317497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 10457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6117, 'last_played': 1571251572}
review: Es unjuego de supervivencia pero a medias,porque no tienes que preocuparte por tu alimentacion o el agua es mas tranquilo en ese sentido,lo feo para mi es la camara que se enfoca de arriba y no puedes modificarla pero te acostumbras,la progrecion del juego en si es lenta,tienes varias cosas para crear y son todas necesarias,tienes varias partes de armaduras que te van resuciendo los daños de los enemigos pero la pega es que en cada sona diferente del mapa hay climas variados y no puedes ponerte la mejor armadura que tengas ya que por ejemplo estas en el desierto y no tienes proteccion adecuada al calor se te va vajando la stamina lo mismo para el frio y demas lugares pero es lo bueno del reto del juego adaptarse al clima de cada sona,en el tema de los enfrentamientos con los enemigos y demas animales esta pasable no tiene mucha variedad de golpes y cero bloqueo o esquive pero tampoco es grave el juego en si te va llevando a cumplir siertas tareas para poder sumar niveles y poder desbloquear mas recetas para el crafteo,en el tema de graficos esta bien sin ser sobresaliente tampoco es que lo necesite el juego en si es muy entretenido te lleva sus horas completarlo yo lo recomiendo para desestresarte de los otros juegos de surevivencia mas harcor no te arrepentiras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198130998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2340, 'last_played': 1485528957}
review:
For this price, you can't go wrong. It's a fun game, well set up and quite unique in the whole survival scene. Set up camp, do the quests, fight enemies, get stronger yourself and get better equipment. With every new level you get new technologies, buildings and tools and weapons. Expand your camp to a small farm and eventually turn it into a small village. Catch animals, grow crops. Almost everything you find in the world can be used at some point. The world itself is huge, with various biomes and you need to clothe yourself to withstand the elements in those biomes.

The quests are challenging and you need to use some tactics to defeat the enemies around you. The further you wander into the world, the stronger enemies you encounter. You can also catch some monsters to help you in your fights.

The game has some issues, but the cool thing is that it will even run on my laptop with an Intel HD3000 gpu. Because of that I am willing to overlook the issues and just enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031486572', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1570820670}
review: Почему-то напомнило Dungeon Siege) Наверное всё из-за системы подбора вещей, на самом деле, если разрабы не забросят игру, тут можно создавать кучу всяких классных фич, типо пещеры с лутом и всё такое, но игра конечно и без этого заслуживает внимания, цена тоже справедливая, пару вечеров еще посижу, главное сильно не засиживаться, такие игры могут затянуть) В общем моя оценка 7/10, потому что нет музыки, которая кстати также могла бы улучшить игру, а боевка ну уж слишком примитивная.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004482608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2619, 'last_played': 1485933548}
review: The game started off pretty fun early on but around mid to late game it became extremely grindy. Needlessly slowing you down. For instance every time you save and quit or sleep in game all the mobs respawn. At first it was fine because you haven't explored much of the map yet and you're looking for mats, but by mid game you have all your mats and what you really need to do is get to your next objective. Combat by the way isn't very fun you just trade blows, but that's forgivable if the games focus isn't on combat. At first that's what I thought and I was ok with it but then why respawn all the mobs if the focus isn't really on combat? Getting to new areas requires you spend several game days creating a path by chopping down trees and bushes. That's literally all you do for days.  Also the game bottlenecks you by not allowing you to create higher end items even if you have the components for them. By level 5 or 6 you can create a portal with some restrictions, to help move you around a little easier, but moving beyond the technology of stone tools escapes you? Just a lot of things like this that wind up frustrating me into not wanting to play. For the price it isn't bad but it needs a lot of work to make you want to finish it. I'm going to keep it installed and wait and see what direction the developers decide to take it with future updates and if the game changes for the better I'll write an update but for now I'm done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008064825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1595, 'last_played': 1531293784}
review:
I do not recommend this game. Here is why.

Art/Aesthetics: 10/10
AI: 9/10
Campaign/Story: 2/10
Functionality: 10/10
Learning Curve: 6/10
Replayability: 5/10
Mechanics/Implementation: 3/10
Gameplay: 2/10
Immersion: 8/10
GUI: 6/10
Controls: 5/10
Sound Design: 8/10

Overall Score? 6.1/10

Game looks nice with that survival "arc" and immersive feel, but it is barely fun; the game is ultimately time consuming and boring. Force of Nature has in its core a badly implemented leveling/building system. You need to find resources very hard to obtain in order to level up. In order to unlock critical items you need, you are forced to do tedious quests in order to gain the next level. But... it only gets worse. The game is very strict. There is hardly any freedom in this game even though it claims to be an open world... game mechanics such as your stamina is horribly awful (for example if you are out of stamina, you cannot defend yourself or mine for resources + you can't run), obstacles (SOOOO MANY, like trees or even bushes) get in your way that you want to go hence you are forced to spend a really long time grinding your way through them (only to completely destroy your stamina), enemies run away from you all the time and it is extremely difficult to kill them or even catch up to them (so expect various enemies to take away your health then run away all the time if hurt), AND FINALLY the worst part of this game, progression!!

The progression in this game is terrible. Let me point out it has taken me 16 hours just to get to LEVEL SEVEN (7)! You need to get to level 2 just to get an axe to chop down trees, yeah it's that bad. The time and effort needed to be put in this game in order to do anything is worse than even space engineers, and that game's survival mechanics sucks too. But anyway, if you are tired of the items you got and you wanna get even better stuff, prepare to grind another 10 hours out of your life.

Limits placed on what you can build is another BIG issue. First off, why can't I put chests on grass or nature ground? Outside of the little cramed area that is so called a house? The chests also don't contain a lot of space to store items. That is pretty disgusting in itself as I am forced to litter my own yard with useless items you can't even get arrid of. Inventory space is a problem, interior spacing is bad, and by the time you are at level 7, you can only build 2 houses and 2 other that costs a heck ton of resources. You can only build one of this building and one of that building, why not unlimited and freely expand my territory?

- Camera angle unadjustable, I hate the top down view.
- Limitations placed on all of what you can build.
- Wonky GUI, not fluid. You have to spend time dragging items from your inventory to a chest for example (no control or shift click).
- Enemies run away from you all the time and are hard to kill at that point. No rewards for loss of health and stamina.
- In hot weather and out of food to eat to cure stamina? RIP
- Lack of hotkeys.
- GUI wonky implementation (hard to explain, just copy Minecraft/factorio mechanics and scrap this GUI).
- Forced obstacle removal to get to where you need to go.
- Forced direction, hardly any freedom.
- Incredibly bad leveling system (why can't you just kill things for XP?)
- Incredibly tedious resource gathering.
- Incredibly bad stamina implementation.
- Agonizing progression system.
- 8 hotbars instead of 10 for your quickslots (WHY ONLY 8??)
- Bad controls.
- Some rigid sound affects are present, specifically the goblins.
- Lack of paliside Gates.
- Iron axe/pickaxe at level 8? Progression gap.
- Spelling errors.
- Half naked until 10+ hours of gameplay.
- Feels unfinished.

BUT...
- Very nice immersive playstyle.
- Has lots of potential.
- I like the portals idea.
- I like the click and hold mechanic where you can gather like 100 wheat in 2 seconds. Not even minecraft has that.
- 5 feathers given from a rooster? SWEET!
- Tame an ally to fight with you? Nice.
- I like the beginning choices of your cudgel, stone cudgel or fang cudgel. Why can't you add more weapon variants?
- Art style is almost flawless.
- AI is very good (EXCEPT WHEN THEY RUN AWAY!)
- I like the compass mechanic.

Overall, this review seems harsh, but not bad. It can compete as it has that spark of potential and I WANT to like the game. So if the game improves and these major errors are fixed, then I'll gladly change my review and play it again. But for now? $7 ... I guess it is almost worth it if you removed at least the creatures running away ALL THE TIME, obstacles in your path, the stamina mechanic improvements, and finally rehauled the leveling system or give the game more freedom.

review:
Also das ist seit langem mal ein Spiel das richtig Spaß macht. Ich hab es jetzt sehr lange gespielt und bin durch.
Allerdings geb ich jetzt auf. Das einzige was wirklich unter aller Kanone ist wie ich finde ist das ich im Prinzip für jeden Levelaufstieg bezahlen muss in Form von Edelsteinsplitter. Und der letzte Aufstieg kostet mich so viel das ich jetzt nochmal bestimmt 60Std. spielen müsste und nur die Splitter zu sammeln und das ist mir zu doof. Ich muss 25 Splitter pro Sorte zusammen bekommen von 6. Das sind 150 Splitter. Ich bekomm von jedem 6.-7. Mob einen, da muss ich gut und gerne 1000 Mobs killen. Nein danke aber bis dahin ein Hammer Spiel. Von mir einen dicken Daumen hoch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117677346', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1505143927}
review:
[h1] Ein sehr schönes Game mit viel Potential	[/h1]

Nach knapp 6 Spielstunden möchte ich euch dieses Game gerne ans Herz legen. Es bietet die typischen Survival-Elemente wie Crafting, Kochen, das Anbauen von Lebensmitteln sowie das Halten von Haus- beziehungsweise Nutztieren. Mich persönlich fesselt das Spiel von der ersten Minute. Ich habe das Spiel hier bei Steam entdeckt und bin nach einem kurzen Technikcheck sofort ins Let´s Play gestartet. Es gibt ständig etwas zu entdecken und selbst das Sammeln von Rohstoffen wird nicht langweilig. Schnell kommen erste Erfolge wie das errichten der ersten Hütte oder das Fangen der ersten Nutztiere.

[b]Folgende Eckpunkte möchte ich gerne festhalten:[/b]

+ Schöne Grafik
+ Wechselnde Wetterverhältnisse
+ Verständlicher Einstieg in das Spiel ohne langweiliges Tutorial
+ inzwischen deutsche Lokalisierung
+ gute Ressourcendosierung auf der Map (nicht zuviel, nicht zu wenig)

- starre Kameraperspektive, hier bitte nochmal nachbessern
- teilweise schwierige Kämpfe, wenn z.B. 2 Bären kommen (evtl. Möglichkeit zur Flucht ?)
- Charakter startet nach dem Laden immer am Strand (nur ein ganz kleiner Kritikpunkt)

Alles in allem empfehle ich dieses Spiel jedem der das Survival-Crafting-Genre mag.

Bei Interesse könnt Ihr euch mein Let´s Play zu Force of Nature ansehen, zur Playlist geht´s [url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL7RapV8R_QRlvKb8gDYTj5oWMjMu4ElG3] hier !	[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198059234783', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2894, 'last_played': 1586877001}
review:
Woah, that was 50 hours already?! Just finished the game, good god. Well it's my first review so im gonna keep it short:

Pros:
- Beautiful world
- Nice but yet a bit incomplete crafting system
- Skillful and difficoult, but if too hard grind can compromise the lack of skills
- Dying doesn't feel too punishing yet you wanna avoid it
- Easy to understand, difficoult to master. You really need some creativity or tons of grinding for pots to beat some chunks of enemies

Cons:
- Killing enemies doesnt feel rewarding enough, since there is nothign such as EXP. Plus the drops feel a bit weak aswell. The coins appear to be fun at first like a currency, sadly all u gonna do with them is melting them for material... Please do a seperate leveling system by killing stuff next to the progress with the quests... where you can specialize your char and customize his stats! WE WANT!
- No Coop. Really hope thats gonna happen... This is one of those games in which you really wish you could play with friends...
- Too Grindy during the last 2 Levels... Thing is, this game isnt too complex, so grinding easily feels monotoneus. Would add more stuff to craft like e.g. enchanting equip´ment or being able to upgrade it or smth would bring more variety into this. Maybe even more types of arrows like frosting arrows etc.
- Camera might get you frustrated, but you get used to it. At start it was depressive not being able to tilt the cam... I get why, but really hope its getting at least a bit more dynamic.

All in all, watch some gameplay. If it appears okay to you, then get it, because its a decent game and all its flaws are basicly being too simple and in early access after all. If the devs keep on adding more good stuff and get that cam more dynamic and support online mode (at least coop if no pvp aswell), we would have a fantastic game worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025839409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1495852949}
review:
This is an Early Access review, so i'm hoping these issues get adressed in future patches/versions...

The concept is one we've seen before, Unnamed guy stranded on unnamed island, survive.

my first complaint is that unless you are telling a -specific- story, there is no reason to not allow some style of character selection between male or female character. I make this grip for a lot of these games. Life Is feudal had it, but they eventually added the option. Savage Lands and Subnautica are other culprits that still has yet to make the fix. DEvs often cite 'it's a lto of work' and i'm sure it's a good bit of coding/modeling, but really... a little forethought for those of us who are not male gamers, who like ot see a girl in the lead... it's not that much to ask is it?

The camera is VERY unintuitive... it would be easier to set Q & E as strafe and have A & D for turning, or something, than to have the mouse control the camera spin, especially when the pointer is your form of interacting with objects...

a zoom option might be a good thing too, but that's a small nitpick...

SAdly my play with this game has come to a halt due to multiple, consistent critical crashes. the kind that make you reach over and hard restart your whole system. i haven't tracked down the cause, but since it happens at the exact same moment, EVERY time, regardless of graphics settings, I'm giving up until there's more patches done on this to stabilize it a bit.

I Really want to like this game, but the UI, controls, and character need a lot of work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163057885', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 542, 'playtime_at_review': 1954, 'last_played': 1711893062}
review:
Ein Spiel, dem ich anfangs recht skeptisch gegenüber stand, da die Grafik nicht mit den grossen Blockbustern der heutigen Tage mithalten kann. Dennoch muss ich gestehen, das ich sehr positiv überrascht bin vom insgesamten Gameplay. Es gibt diverse Dinge die man hätte noch verbessern können, zu der die etwas gewöhnungsbedürftige Einsammlung von Rohstoffen , sowie des Interfaces, doch steht es dem Spielspass nicht im Wege. Man hat den Kniff relativ schnell raus. 

Fazit: Wer im Entdeckungsfieber gepaart mit Aufbaulaune ist, der ist hier genau richtig. Dennoch ist anzumerken, das man nur durch vorgegebene Quests ein Lvl aufsteigen kann und somit weiterkommt. Soweit nicht schlimm, sofern man kein Spieler ist, der vollständige Handlungsfreiheit wünscht.
https://youtu.be/4PCXtpQ1pog

author: {'steamid': '76561198043243158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1485808635}
review:
Красиво, но одноообразно. Быстро надоедает. Сутя по другим отзывам "поиграйте 20+ часов, и вот там будет интересно".. Ну флаг вам в руки. Имхо, игра не должна превращаться в работу.

Во время действий быстро кончается стамина и непрерывно требуется жать кнопку "съесть еду на стамину". Зачем так сделали - не понятно.

Не удобный обзор, его можно только немного отдалить. Тот самый случай, когда очень помог бы игровой компас и маркер на расположение "лагеря".

Копишь ресурсы на квест - сдаешь, опять копишь ресурсы - сдаёшь квест. Копишь ресурсы, ставишь квадратик с постройкой. Вау.

Менеджмента ресурсов там почти нет: собираешь всё что можно, сваливаешь в лагере, т.к. сундука долго нет. Видимо это контент для 20+ часов. Ресурсы начинаешь всерьез считать, только когда надо накопать грунта или добыть руды/камней. Это нудно и долго, потребуется съесть много еды, для чего её надо добыть и тоже потратить стамину. В общем занудно.

Сильно упрощенный Stardew Valley. Правда мир - 3D. Но как по мне, играбельность и реиграбельность в 100 раз важнее, тут этого нет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084040112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7918, 'last_played': 1561249326}
review:
I love this game!
One of the cutest sandbox games in the genre.
I have reached level 11, and, um, oop, I forgets to keep playing..... my compound is now so cute, I just keep making it prettier.
(In truth, you can complete the game and continue playing the same game!)
I love the fact that is is rather difficult to achieve the higher levels, and cannot understand why some folk are not enjoying a good challenge!
The graphics are enormously cute.
I would recommend this game to parents to give to their teenage children, as it teaches some very good planning skills! Also... this game is great for sharpening anyones' skills in arithmetic!!! (Younger kids might be scared of the widdle goblins... chuckle?)
And as a 58 yo woman, I reckon all adults who love games will love this!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013390602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1663866741}
review:
Insgesamt ein sehr gelungenes Spiel.
Schöne Grafik, die Quests halten das Spiel in Bewegung. Die Steuerung ist etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber nicht schlecht.
Der Schwierigkeitsgrad steigt mit jedem Level (ab Level 6 - davor ist es eher als Tutorial zu betrachten) stark an, was die Aufgaben zu einer echten Herausforderung machen.

Ein paar Schönheitsfehler sind, daß man immer an der Startposition beginnt (zumindest bis man das erste Portal gebaut hat), das zwingt einen dazu sein Lager in der Nähe aufzuschlagen, und dass man nicht mehr benötigte Gegenstände nicht zerstören kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063013739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1576346246}
review: This is a relaxing, simple game about survival. Progress is slow, but steady. I managed to spend 7 hours on it today after buying it, but I think I made more progress in that time than I have in other games of this type. You have to level up in order to unlock more items for crafting and building, but I think these goals were designed well enough so that the game doesn't become overwhelming. There are plenty of resources near where the character is found, so it's not incredibly taxing either. I highly recommend this as a cheap way to do some casual single player gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020613938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1485734406}
review:
Well implemented, but not engaging.

This is the epitome of the overdone harvesting/crafting/fighting mechanics of most roleplaying games.  Most of your time will be spent waiting: walking, waiting for crafting status bars, holding down the button while resources are gathered or enemies are hit, and waiting for health/stamina bars to recover.

The game elements are deciding the most efficient order to execute tasks in (strictly limited by a forced progression), and spotting unintelligent enemies you need to avoid/attack.

Because your progression through crafting/building will be managed by the game, and that is held up waiting tasks, the game is essentially a series of waits.

On a positive note: the graphics are okay, the interface is easy to learn, it's very stable, and the progression makes sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011949350', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 845, 'last_played': 1499888463}
review:
I first came across this game via a random YouTube video. Survival game are a dime a dozen now adays, so I wanted to see what was different about this one. The first thing I noticed (and liked) was the quest system, clear goals and challanges makes this stand out for others I have seen and played. The next was the Diablo style game play, a fixed camera angle set up behind your character. Recipes as you level system, this is a love or hate feature, I happen to love it. Having to wait for things to craft can be annoying, but if you have several things going while you are harvesting, hunting or exploring, the time melts away.

All in all, I am very happy with this game and love the fact that the Cev is frequently updating it with new features and bug fixes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072410628', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1520200309}
review:
This game isn't for everyone. Right now, the game definitely gets annoying in that recipies are unlocked via level ups and there is litte guidance as to controls at the beginning (for example, it took me multiple in-game days of me waiting for sticks to spawn before discovering I can kick trees to get sticks). Also, as others have said, the camera angle is absolutely terrible,  

That being said, I am enjoying the actual game now that I've gotten some of the basics down. I'm compelled to constantly be gathering material and thus explore. I do think the stamina needs some slight tweeking, but overally its a fairly decent game, especially for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016419675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3800, 'last_played': 1558777983}
review:
Minecraft in Robinson Crusoe-Version lässt grüßen :)

Dieses Spiel macht wirklich großen Spass !!! Man landet auf einer einsamen Insel. 
Am Anfang überlebt man mit dem was einem die Natür gibt. Aus Steinen werden Splitter hergestellt, aus Palmwedeln Seile, aus einfachsten Materialien werden erstmal Kleinigkeiten gebaut, einfache Werkzeuge hergestellt usw.
Man bekommt jedes Level neue Quests zum erfüllen und diese Quests leiten einen außerderm durch die Karte und man hat sehr schnell den Dreh raus. 
Ab und zu ist natürlich auch mal paar Minuten Holz kloppen oder Erz farmen dran aber es hält sich in Grenzen und artet nicht aus zu einem langweiligem gefarme, da natürlich auch die Insel Feinde bietet :)
Am Anfang relativ leicht Goblins, dann greift dich mal ein verrücktes Wildschwein an usw.
Ich habe bis jetzt knapp 30 Std gespielt und bin Level 8 und mir hat einfach die Vielfalt was man in dem Spiel alles machen kann am meisten Spass gemacht :) Tiere einfangen (zähmen) und eine Weide bauen für seine Schäfchen Kühe Hühner etc^^
Laut Liste bzw. die Kronik zeigt einem was man mit div. Level bauen kann. Diese geht aktuell bis Level 12

Kurz und knapp ich kann euch nur das Spiel empfehlen, wer gerne Craftet, Farmt, die Welt erkundet und aber auch Aktion bieten die div. Monster und Feinde. Die Musik ist sehr entspannend, und das Spiel läuft sehr rund und ist wirklich gut gelungen.
Negativ sind die nur 2 möglichen Kameraperspektiven die die Umschau etwas statisch machen, aber man gewöhnt sich da schnell daran

Gerne könnt ihr auch auf Twitch mal reinschauen
Rabauckyoutube

Schaut einfach mal rein :)

An die Entwickler !! WEITER SO !! Top bis jetzt

author: {'steamid': '76561198044895216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1485676455}
review:
木材や鉱石を集めて拠点を構築。
農業でHPとスタミナ回復アイテムを作り冒険の準備を整え島を探索。目標は未探索MAPにも表示されてる虹色に輝く鉱石。
肉食獣やゴブリン達と戦って素材をゲット。
HPとスタミナゲージと相談しながらぎりぎりまで先に進むか、次回に備えて進軍に邪魔な木を伐採しながら引き返すか。

そんな感じで自分のペースで島を探索するゲーム。・・・だったらよかった。


ゲームコンセプトは良いのだが過剰なまでのクエスト進行によるアイテムの作製制限と厳しすぎるゲームバランスが駄目にしている。



このゲームはクエストという名目で指定された施設を建て、アイテムを作製していく事でレベルが上がり新しいアイテムが解禁されていくシステムなのだが、
このクエストで指示された以外の順番でのアイテム作製は　一　切　認　め　ら　れ　な　い　

鉄のインゴットが手に入ったから石の斧から鉄の斧に変えて採集効率あげたい。→駄目。その前に料理施設建てなさい。

料理や動物の餌やりに水沢山使うから井戸を２つ建てたい！　→駄目。レベルが上がるまで１つしか建てられない。

虹色の鉱石守ってる敵が集団でボコってきて辛い・・・防具作りたい。　→駄目。虹色の鉱石手に入れたら作っていいよ。


・・・そう。このゲームにサンドボックスやサバイバルゲーム特有の自由差は全くない。
貧弱な装備で奥地に進み上級素材を入手して無双するとか、序盤から拠点構築に力を入れてアイテム満載で探索に励むといった
プレイヤーの好みにあった攻略の仕方が出来ない。あるのは制作者の意図した通りのバランスによる進行のみ。



それでもゲーム内容は自分の趣味ドストライクだったし、厳しいバランスでも我慢してやり続けるつもりだったが
第二の虹色鉱石を探しに行ったら気温の変化でダメージを受けるようになり、指定された防具を作らないと絶対に先に進めないバランスと察して心が折れた。
苦労して防具作ってもまたすぐに同じ事やらないといけないと思うとやってられない。（辛いのはここだけかもしれないけどね）



過度な締めつけがなければ値段も考慮してお勧めできたのだけど、
パッチなりMODでバランス調整がされない限りはマゾいバランスに耐性ある人にしかお勧め出来ない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198026992270', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1416, 'last_played': 1485681471}
review:
this is a great game in that there is no timeline to pressure you with having to get things done now now now, you can take your time in doing quests,  explore the land, kill things and with no fear of dying coz you just loose a little loot and just respawn back at your base or portal that you nominate and just keep on going.

All in all a very well designed game with a good crafting system that will keep you entertained for many hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132999797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1486278550}
review:
This isn't a *bad* game, explicitly.  But it's also not a *good* game.

It's supposedly a survival/crafting/adventure game..  and 18 hours of play into it, it's fairly nonsensical on all 3 fronts.

To begin with, the available camera angles are *abysmal*.  You basically have "overhead" and "almost overhead". Which means you have about 25 feet of visibility, regardless of weather conditions.  And since I haven't read anything suggesting an in-game story reason for this, such as "your character is hideously nearsighted".. there's no excuse for it.

Additionally, visibility is further decreased by treecover. Which is nigh everywhere.  Down on the ground, where your character is, you would ostensibly be able to see reasonably well.  Up above, where the camera sits.. tree cover reduces your visibility to a mere 3-5 feet in many places..

And considering that your ability to survive encounters with goblins and hostile wildlife is wholly dependent upon your ability to be able to see them before they see you, and selectively "pull" individuals.. well, effectively you will die far more often from the complete rubbish camera angles and getting jumped by multiple enemies (none of whom have any logical in-world reason why they would be working together, btw) than from any other circumstance.

You will be attacked by bears. Boars. Goblins.  These sorta make sense.  You will also be attacked by foxes.. who are harder to kill than the weapon wielding humanoid goblins.  This does not make sense. Neither their durability nor their behavior.. as, simply put, foxes *don't do this*.

The Crafting system.. I have mentioned it is nonsensical. Some examples..  Early on,  you build a "blast furnace". Well, even if we discount the silliness that what appears to be a medieval bread oven is being called a "blast furnace", despite no bellows or the like,  you gain the ability to cast ingots of copper, iron, tin, gold...   And when you build an anvil, you can make copper or iron into nails..  But yet.. when you go to make a "spiked cudgel", you cannot, as logic would dictate, simply hammer a bunch of iron nails into a cudgel.. no, you must go slay many aggressive animals with your inferior weaponry in order to acquire their teeth and claws, substances far less effective to make a cudgel "spiked" than actual metal *nails*..

There's a lot of similar nonsense. Later on, when you have the ability to make clothing.. you need something like 14 pelts to make a pair of gloves.  I could see that if you were killing chipmunks. Bears?  Boars? Foxes?  Um, hell no.  Requiring nails to make fences..   There's a dozen ways to make fences.. sturdy fences, that don't require nails at all. I can actually build you a *house* without the use of nails..   So some very illogical bits here.  Requiring gold ingots to make a compass. Dafuq?   It's not that I'm expecting immaculate realism here, but if you're making a game in which crafting and survival are significant components, you ought to be expected to at least pick up a boy scout handbook or something for reference..

Similarly.. you can smelt and work iron. Yet the first weapon advances past your inferior animal-fang-and-claw-studded-cudgel is a *bronze* sword.  You can work iron. Why the *hell* would someone concerned with survival make a weapon of Bronze?  The "Bronze Age" preceeded the "Iron Age" for a reason.  Anyway..

Let's talk about levelling.. and its effects..  Every time you level, you gain a small amount of health, stamina, and defense.. and apparently, the magical understanding of things like "pants" because you've beaned 50 goblins over the head.  Yeah, crafting is locked behind level walls, which are determined mainly by completing a couple quests and how much loot you've gotten from killing various aggressive things..   The combat and exploration mechanics are *entirely* forced and feel very unnatural.   You're set off to acquire some various mystic widgets.. which you mysteriously know you need to get because reasons, but yet you cannot comprehend pants without beaning things in the head...  There's no "story" here to make this an "adventure" or "rpg", despite the tags... there's no lore that I've discovered within the game context...  The only reason you do anything is because a little quest box tells you to.. 

And, in my opinion, that really robs much of the redeeming quality as an "Adventure" game that Force of Nature has.  

You can basically sum it up as "grind a whole bunch to satisfy some nonsensical quest requirements, level up, kill a bunch of wildlife to magically gain the ability to make pants, repeat ad nauseum." 

Most games with a "survival" aspect to them generally fail in that regard... and this is no exception.  But it's not too far from its peers, so I'm got going to be too ruthless in my criticism here..    Apparently, later on, temperature of the area you're exploring plays a role, but for the most part, you don't have to eat, you don't have to drink, you don't have to sleep..  Ingestion of food replenishes heath and/or stamina.. water is used for agriculture, animals, and crafting.. but you don't actually *drink* any of it.. unless you make coffee.. 

But the main element of survival is the mindset... and this game misses it totally with its forced combat and level locked crafting mechanics.  If you're trying to survive, you don't go randomly wandering into hostile territory just for giggles.  You do it because you lack something you need to stay alive.. and you do so cautiously and with the best preparation you can muster. Force of Nature completely throws that out the window. The arbitrary and forced nature of a lot of this game just totally ruins any chance of immersion, and that's quite a shame.

This is an ok *start* for a game.. if it were an "early release" and one could expect much of this to be changed before it was considered a "Finished Product".. but as a "finished game", give it a pass unless there's some massive patches released that fix the view distance issue at the *very* least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118318394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2902, 'last_played': 1485908920}
review:
Es gibt einiges das mich am Spiel stört oder das ich zumindest unglücklich gelöst finde.

Besonders schade finde ich, das man komplett an die Quests gebunden ist, was die Craftingmöglichkeiten angeht. Ich fühlte mich dadurch stellenweise ziemlich limitiert und saß lange auf Rohstoffen, die sich erst einige Level später, dank der Quest-/Levelabhängigkeit verarbeiten ließen.

Auch der Umstand, das es bis Lvl9/10 einfach nicht lohnt Lagerplatz zu bauen (zu teuer, zu aufwändig, zu wenig Slots) ist bedauerlich. Es ist sicherlich nie Sinn des Ganzen gewesen, das Spieler ihr Inventar auf dem Boden verteilen, weil das Lagersystem viele Level lang schlicht zu unattraktiv ist.

An den oft kritisierten Kamerawinkel habe ich mich relativ schnell gewöhnt, dennoch führt dieser nicht selten dazu, das man plötzlich von 2 Bären, nem Fuchs, nem Wildschwein und am besten noch 3 Goblins zugleich angegriffen wird, weil schlichtweg der Überblick fehlt.

Auch das Craftingmenü könnte besser durchdacht aufgebaut und bedienungsfreundlicher sein. 

Etwas das ich sehr schade finde ist, das die Häuschen die man baut, schlussendlich lediglich als Herberge für Werkbänke und Lagermöglichkeiten dienen, die man versucht möglichst platzsparend aneinander zu quetschen, was nicht nur nicht sonderlich schön aussieht, sondern mich vor allem etwas wie eben ein 'zu Hause' für meinen tapferen Überlebenden vermissen lässt

Eine Empfehlung bekommt das Spiel dennoch von mir ,da es trotz allem Spaß macht und der Preis fair ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013239620', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1485486580}
review: This game is not a sandbox. Crafting is limited to your level and it forces you to gather and craft some set of items to level up. And the priorities are not logical at all. For example, it forced me to craft a furnace before even find something to wear or make a shelter. Seriously I'm eating strawberries and coconuts to feed my stomach and i'm fully naked except a ragged boxer and i'm sleeping in open under the rain but the quests are forcing me to craft a fucking furnace for coal and beat goblins for gold coins(!?). Wtf

author: {'steamid': '76561198095948386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1819, 'last_played': 1582230504}

author: {'steamid': '76561198231717940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1916, 'last_played': 1686143805}
review:
Ich habe das Spiel entdeckt und war sofort begeistert. Es hat etwas besonderes und es macht mir extrem viel Spass. Ich kann nicht sagen warum, aber wahrscheinlich ist es die liebevolle Art mit der es gemacht wurde. Bugs scheinen hier ein Fremdwort zu sein. Einzig die Kamaraführung mag man etwas weitläufiger haben. Aber das ist auch nur Gewohnheitssache. Ich mag diesen kleinen Robinson und all die vielen Dinge die er hier so machen kann. Trotz Kampfaspekten (die ich normalerweise gar nicht mag und ablehne) finde ich das Spiel unwahrscheinlich entspannend und ausgleichend. 

Und jetzt auch noch in deutscher Version. Ich bin rund um zufrieden. Ich glaube ich habe einen Juwel entdeckt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104169410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1738, 'last_played': 1634396519}
review:
Great little single player survival game with RPG elements and a goal based leveling system.
Pretty good graphics. The camera is vertically fixed (you can rotate view all around you but not up or down) so it takes some getting used to. I didn't encounter any bugs although the interface isn't completely refined, but overall it's easy to learn and get into. You can't beat 8 bucks and it's at least worth that much - no need to even wait for a sale!  I highly recommend for anyone who likes survival crafting games and ISO RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123860582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1483789574}
review:
操作界面很是蛋疼，而且生存游戏这个说法有点挂羊头卖狗肉，不如说是个RPG游戏，而且非常消耗时间。倒也不是说喜欢快餐式游戏，实在是体力消耗这个系统做的十分差劲，有体力这么个概念出来是好事，更加真实了，但也仅此而已了。停留在有体力这个概念而没有设计出一套完整的与游戏节奏想匹配的系统出来，这就导致你前期打完怪没血每体力时只能挂机，后期没血没体力时只能在老家机械式的重复劳作，中期会有回血回体力的护符，但也无非就是减轻了一点枯燥而已。最重要的是
[--------------你可能玩了10小时，有七八个小时处于低效率状态，完全感觉不到生存游戏的那种分秒必争的氛围-------------]，这是生存游戏爱好者们最不能忍受的。也没有生存游戏那种“活不下去”的说法，就算死了无非就是掉点东西，又从老家爬起来，老家又是不会刷怪的，如此一来就缺少了可玩性，因为你只要消耗足够的时间去重复劳作，总能通关的。换一个说法，有这么一个游戏，它只有一个按钮，你只要坚持手动点个十万次就能通关，你会觉得这是个生存游戏吗？你会觉得这个游戏好玩吗？

author: {'steamid': '76561198084572529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 6858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4356, 'last_played': 1580395292}
review:
I'm going to give this game a positive review BUT I also want to give a warning. 

i find the game quite addictive at this point as theres always something to do, its not necessarily a good thing though. Collecting water, planting stuff and managing the animals is fun, but becomes quite old fast when you realise how much time it will take to get object A to make objest B. In fact you can quite easily stay at home base for 7 in game days just making stuff. I'm positive some folk will like that though as it gives a sence of accomplishment.

The graphics are ok if not a bit grainy and the weird camera angle can be annoying at first but it just adds to the charm of the game, there are different biomes that require different clothes to keep hot or cool but this adds the "you have to do this to proceed" element which is fine, till you run out of water. I really enjoyed the biome changes as it improved the immersion and even though you generally fight the same mobs which are just re-skins each biome sets a new enemy /challenge against you and the graphic effects really do add to the overall atmosphere.

Combat: Now this is my biggest gripe about this game and seeing as its a core element it can, for some casual gamers, be game breaking. This game will punish anyone not prepared, running wildly into ANY area can and will get you dead in seconds if you are not levelled correctly or have the required health/stamina/armour. some areas are completed closed to you as the mobs are always levelled to the biome and not the player. This also means that running through areas previously cleared is a cake walk late game and just a waste of stamina. However the addition of placing portols can negate this entirely.

The enemies seem to always be able to hit you in some circumstances no matter what, I've been several paces away and completely out of range of the mobs but still get hit even with speed amulets and the short sword, very frustrating seeing as the game awards you with a "Bad Player" achievement when you die 8 times...Stamina seems to bleed out of you whenever you use something and an increase in level doesnt reduce the cost you just get more stamina and better equipment.
things to note are that enemies are always faster than you, get 2 attacks to your one and swinging your sword only ever hits one enemy even when surrounded. At least you dont lose everything on death but you Do lose some stuff which can be a royal pain but adds a rogue like quality to the game.

Not bad but exceedingly time consuming to complete some tasks

author: {'steamid': '76561198118634423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1500662232}
review: Just bought this game, I really like it. Yes, it takes a little bit to get use to the controls (for all the Mincraft addicts, lol). But, it is something different and fun to play. As of this review I have only been playing for an hour and I am moving right along. Its not for the hardcore gamers, balls to the wall running thru the game and finish by noon. It is smooth progression and relaxing game play, until you run into a Goblin or Bear, then its panic time. But if you know how to use the surrondings to your advantage, you can take them on. So quit whinning. It might be a cool idea if the Developers did some type of little game play demo to let people decide for themselves. But for $7.99 its a good grab. I blow that much just getting coffee in the morning going to work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055426325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1645594705}
review:
This game is really nice. I like that it is linear because it explains how to do things, and you will never feel lost. You will have a hard time running out of things to do in this game, and getting to know the island simply by living there is a joy in itself. The game is challenging but you will never feel like you aren't mmaking progress.

All in all, if you are looking for a relaxing game, this is it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146534236', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1599642405}
review:
This game for the price is not bad. The graphics are good, the movement is a bit awkward at the start. Only thing that might get annoying after a while is being locked into a tutorial Based level up system.

Do this and get that and you eventually get something in return.

Sometimes the quests dont sit right with me. You build a forge before getting basic clothing. 

But maybe thats just me.
If you can overlook those facts you might have fun and get your moneys worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013944972', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 3394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2965, 'last_played': 1572473557}
review:
Fantastisch!

Wuseliges und ( bisher ) bugfreies Spiel für diverse Stunden Aufbauspaß. Man kann Pflanzen ziehen, Tiere halten, sozusagen quasi eine Farm aufbauen.. es gibt jede Menge Crafting Rezepte für Möbel Haushaltsgeräte Waffen Klamotten.

Natürlich muss man erstmal von allem etwas finden und zur Farm bringen.. dann kann man mehr draus machen.

Damit nicht genug.. gibts jede Menge Gegner und wilde Tiere.. die einen fleissig angreifen. Und natürlich Quests bzw. ein Level System über das man neue Crafting Rezepte freischalten kann.

Kleiner Tipp: Möglichst am eigenen Spawn bauen und [u]nicht[/u] sämtliche Büsche bis zu den Gegner abholzen. Möglichst nur einen Korridor frei machen.. dann hat man wenig Probleme mit Angriffen.

Es ist grafisch nichts besonderes.. aber es sieht sehr anständig aus. Die Welt ist lebendig und bunt. Ein bischen hübsch halt auch ( viel Natur ^^ ).

Hier noch ein paar Besonderheiten:

Spawns: Beim Start wird die Welt generiert.. inklusive festen Spawns für den eigenen Charakter, Tiere, Gegner, Wildtiere, Lootplätze ( Wiesen, Pilzstellen usw. ). Das bleibt dann auch so. Alles spawnt bei Reload neu, dann kann man also ordentlich farmen gehen oder neue Tiere beschaffen. Das führt allerdings auch dazu, dass wenn man eine Gegnerhorde killt und dort in der Nähe dann baut.. wird die Base grundsätzlich nach Reload angegriffen! Also lieber abseits der Spawns bauen.

Ableben: Stirbt man, spawnt man mitsamt dem Inventar wieder am ursprünglichen Spawn. Der Wiedereintritt kostet allerdings.. und zwar zufällige Items aus dem Inventar! Dabei entscheidet der Zufall, welche Items ( das können wenige oder viele sein ).. und auch wie viel von den jeweiligen Items.

Kamera & Steuerung: Ich lese hier immer das Gejammere bzgl. Kamera und Steuerung. Die Kamera ist starr. Man sieht nicht unmittelbar was hinter einem ist. Aber von dort kommt auch meist nichts unerwartet ( es sei denn man läuft blindlings an Gegnern / Wildtieren vorbei, die einen dann "unerwartet" verfolgen ). Man kann sich umdrehen und die Gegend checken. Die Steuerung kann man sich einstellen. Insgesamt sind Kamera und Steuerung okay.. vielleicht ein bisschen gewöhnungsbedürftig.

[u][b]Fazit[/b][/u]: Daumen hoch. Die 8 Euro sind bestens investiert!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025032082', 'num_games_owned': 1516, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 3832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3832, 'last_played': 1486666922}
review:
Remember that this is not a survival game, but more like a RPG/Sandbox. You don’t fell  lost as “what I need to do”, everything on the game always has recipes and information of what you need to find or “how to get” everything you need. It's a nice game for patient people but I'm going to talk about the negative sides. If any of them bother you I suggest to skip this one.

* Level and quests obligatory to proceed.

* There are no camera change. (You need get used to it. A third person from above, even if that occasionally have trees blocking your vision during combat).

* Limit of buildings per level. (Some of the crafting-tables  has to be made inside other buildings)

author: {'steamid': '76561197984221489', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1040, 'last_played': 1675304418}
review: Very relaxing fun game. Well worth the $8. The camera & controls are a little strange. But once you get used to them its not that bad. I dont understand why people give this a thumbs down. For the price this is a good game. Build anywhere on the map and the "grind" some people talk about is not that bad. It is not a "survival" game where you have to eat or drink. (some people complained about this) You eat to regain stam. not to stay alive. BUY it , you will not be sorry you did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003839953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1484909780}
review:
Игра на сильного любителя микроменеджмента. На ОЧЕНЬ сильного любителя.
И этот ММ, честно говоря, немного печалит. Самая большая проблема - в производственных штуках нет очередей. Ну. для грядок с растениями это еще какой то логике поддается, но то, что на столе невозможно выстроить хотя бы небольшую очередь - вымораживает. Хочешь сделать осколочков для последующего изготовления стрел - нет, дорогой. подожди, пока на столе не изготовится 10 единиц праха, который тебе зачем то понадобился. Хочешь несколько яиц сразу -не выйдет, или заводи много много кур, или жди. В результате изготовление, например, простой буханочки выглядит как постоянная беготня между коровой (молоко), курицей (яйца), ожиданием, когда там изготовится мука, изыманием воды и собиранием пшеницы (так как куриц и коров надо кормить - той самой водой и семенами пшеницы). 
Еще одна проблема - управление. Оно, с одной стороны, и логичное, но не додуманное. Нельзя, например, вытащить план постройки в отдельное окно. В результате, чтобы посмотреть, чего нам не хватает для счастья в этой жизни - или записывай на бумажке, или лезь по всем вкладкам - то есть - В (постройки), в открытом окне - Сооружения - в следующем - открывай (а не просто наводись) нужное строение. Посмотрел - молодец.
Еще одна претензия (но это уже вкусовщина) - отсутствие золотой руды. Золото - а оно нужно для слитков, которые нужны для поднятия левела - выпадает ТОЛЬКО из вражин. И выпадает, надо сказать, нечасто - обычно сыпятся медяки. В результате, для добычи 75 золота (т.е. последующей выплавки 5 слитков) приходится устраивать локальныый геноцид этих милых, в общем то, существ. С учетом того, что они, худо-бедно, сопротивляются, падает здоровье, его надо постоянно поправлять, а еще в самый неподходящий момент может заглянуть на шумок медведик. С понятным результатом. Итого - сбор такого количества монет превращается в пытку.

Резюме - в принципе мило, но на любителя. С учетом невеликой цены - можно пару деньков побегать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029321453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1497211763}
review:
Over all: The very best kicking Simulator of all time. Need Bananas? Kick some palm trees. Need some Coconuts? Kick some palm trees! Need XYZ? Kick all the trees or bushes (well you need the bushes for sticks and palm leaves). Jokes aside:

You are stranded on a island/land where Goblins, dumb bears and some boars live, and they want to eat your flesh. But, there is a wall of Sunflowers which separates you from the dangers from all the flesh eating, horny beasts. Yeah! At the start you*ll get a pretty good Tutorial, which will help you, to understand the game.

It has a top-down perspective like DIablo, which is pretty refreshing. The controls are a little bit difficult to master, but after some time you will get used to it.

This game has a pretty good mix between combar and management, with some good graphics.

One the one hand I*m glad that boars and bears are pretty dumb, on the other hand it*s some kind of strange, that if you are stuck between two bushes/trees/sunflowers, bears, goblins, boars won*t attack you. Maybe they can*t find a path, which is pretty fortunate in the beginning, where those beasts are pretty annoying. They won*t leave their current place, so they don*t retreat to their place, where you found them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002756056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3681, 'last_played': 1514304966}
review:
재밌다. 간단하다. 쉽다. 다만 레벨업이 점점 귀찮고 복잡해지는 경향이 있으나 나쁘진 않다. 스토리는 그냥 무인도에 떨어져서 7가지의 조각을 모아 하나의 조각으로 만들면 끝난다. 마지막 조합법이 굉장히 귀찮다.. 그리고 이후는 자유로운듯 하나. 

일반모드는 레벨13이 끝이고 하드코어모드는 모르겠자 지금하고 있다. 다만 죽을거 같으면 저장후 종료를 누르고 나가면 되고 무기를 1번 2번에 장착후 번갈아가면서 쓰면 무기 딜레이가 0이 된다. 공속이 초당 1인셈 .난이도에 흠이가는 요소는 있다.

하지만 이 가격에 이런 퀄리티는 나쁘지 않다 웬만한 허접한 거 만들어 놓고 2만원쯤 받아먹는 게임제작자들이 본받아야 한다. 
그리고 1주일에 한번씩 꼬박 꼬박 업뎃한다. 버그있으면 바로 수정하고. 제작자의 성의도 있다.

 물론 콘텐츠가 복잡해 보이나. 간단하고 쉽기때문에 후에는 단순 반복인 경우가 있다. 그럼에도 추천하고 싶다.
꾸준힌 업뎃이 매주마다 기대되기 때문이다. 한글화 안되어있으나 쉬운영어다. 초등학생 수준. 몰라도 눈치껏 해라 쉽다.

어찌보면 단순하지만 중독성도 있다. 또 다른 아쉬운 점은 3인칭 시점과, 멀티 지원이 아직 안된다는 것이다. 하지만 재미있었다. 값어치는 충분하다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258679199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1484750465}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152658396', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2151, 'last_played': 1706203000}
review:
Хотелось бы сделать свой обзор на эту замечательную игру!
Как по мне в ней есть всё что нужно:
- выживание;
- крафтинг, которого не много и не мало;
- экшен, когда ты идёшь за очередным фрагментом Force of Nature;
- открытый мир, который хоть и ограничен определённой локацией, где ты можешь выжить без специальной брони, но и того хватает. А дальше с бронёй тебя ждёт ещё большая локация со своим миром.
Много различных врагов и на каждй локации они свои. Когда увидела голема, то радости не было предела. Очень хотелось поближе подойти и рассмотреть его.
По началу кажется, что камера неудобная, но когда ты прокачаешься немного и у тебя будет твой первый меч, то на камеру внимания не обращаешь. Камера раздражает только по началу, когда для тебя самый главный враг мишка, которого просто так не увидишь. Потом эта проблема пропадает.
Фарм. Он есть и он нужен. Игра всё-таки с крафтом. Я спокойно хожу фармить шкурки и для меня проблемы в этом нет никакой. Часа за 2 можно почти 200 шкурок нафармить и при этом подобывать руду с камешков и деревья порубить на поленья. Для меня это не трудно и не нудно. Тем более что кабанов, лисичек и медведей в лесу очень много.
Не хватает наверное того, где можно было бы ненужные инструменты, оружие, броню как-то переработать или просто сложить. А то у меня всё на пляже валяется в кучке.)
И не очень понятно сколько можно приручить животных всего на определённом уровне. Не подписано.
Очень понравилось обновление, где можно гоблина приручить и у тебя появляется союзник, который помогает тебе в бою. Очень помогает при фарме шкурок, так как он наносит тот самый важный удар после чего животное не успевает убежать и  ты его спокойно убиваешь. Про гоблина подписано какого уровня можно приручать и это хорошо.
Очень нравится игра. Сейчас хороших и интересных выживалок очень мало.)
Но здесь наверное можно было бы и кооп сделать. Кооп имеется в виду как отдельная функция в игре, отдельная вкладка. То есть сетевая игра, где максимум могут играть только 4 человека, а не толпа из 100 людей на острове. Тем, кто не может играть долго один будет скучновато и они поиграют пару часов и забросят игру. И если бы я не снимала видео по ней, то и я бы её забросила. Но пока играю и мне интересно что же будет в той или иной локации, где я ещё не была, какие враги меня встретят.)
Разработчик молодец! Игра замечательная.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997196175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1484602140}
review:
By the time you get the 3rd shard you realize the game is just going to be the same thing repeated over and over, and personally I don't find it to be enough fun to repeat 9 times (or whatever) to make the thingie out of the shards and find out what it does, or what end game is.

 The game is too boringly grindy. The UI is frustrating and unoptomized. The camera angle is annoying. And what am I supposed to do with all these stacks of sticks?

author: {'steamid': '76561198007429976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1484631501}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072943118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1484604008}
review:
Die Kamera ist nicht vertikal schwenkbar.
Der Avatar ist fest am unteren Bildschirmrand verankert.
Die Grafik wirkt etwas überholt.
Das Charakterlevel-System ist aufwendig gestaltet.
Die Quests haben den Charakter eines Endlos-Tutorials.

Man kann einiges an dem Spiel aussetzen, weil es einen anderen Ansatz verfolgt, als es in ähnlichen Spielen üblich ist. Dabei ist es aber sehr gut gelungen und schafft es, lange zu motivieren. Alle oben genannten Punkte haben ihre Begründung und sind nicht unbedacht integriert worden.
Ich kann nur betonen, dass ich noch nie erlebt habe, wie sich die Charakterentwicklung so natürlich auf das Spielverhalten auswirkt. Eine sehr gut ausbalancierte Spielmechanik ist dafür verantwortlich, dass man das Gefühl hat, sich beim Leveln nennenswert weiterzuentwickeln.
Durchaus zu empfehlen und an dem Preis kann man auch nichts aussetzen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033130290', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1502742096}
review:
Мне вот интересно, разрабы сами то играли в своё творенье?) В целом игра не плохая, но когда в округе кончились пальмы с кокосами и бананами(а настало это быстро), а кофе варить еще не научился, игра резко переходит в режим "Чувак, регень выносливость, а я пока чайку попью". Не могу я уже этот чай пить, через 5 минут добычи ресов, опять чай пить идти минут на 15 до полного регена. К остальному можно привыкнуть: и к отвратному виду и к убийству нереально большого количества времени на добычу ресов(ибо нужно их очень много, падают очень мало, и усложняется быстрым исчезновением выносливости и долгим восстановлением оной). 
Вывод: Игра не для работающих людей. Можно конечно заходить на пару часиков вечерком после работы, но уровень тогда будет получаться пару-тройку таких вечеров, да и быстро наскучит колупать ту же руду или собирать бревна)

author: {'steamid': '76561197975836077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3834, 'last_played': 1558612805}
review: Also ich kann das Spiel nur empfehlen !  Hübsche grafik , sehr atmosphärisch , ein ruhiges gameplay...sehr smooth und kein geheze. Ein interessantes Lvl-Up system mit quests die zu erfüllen sind . Definitiv ein Spiel zum geniessen . Ein oft genannter schwachpunkt sei der fixe Kamerawinkel , ich muss aber sagen , das hat Konzept als Stilmittel und man kann sich daran gewöhnen.....Ein grosses Lob an die/den Entwickler , hatte selten ein so gutes Preis/Leistungs-Verhältnis auf Steam. und es wird immer noch optimiert...Super !

author: {'steamid': '76561198140513912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2561, 'last_played': 1489674113}
review:
Чтоя могу сказать об этой игре...
Во-первых: Она мне оочень понравилась) а именно тем, что в ней присутствуют теги Крафта, Добычи, Строительства, Охоты (даже приручения животных!), и так же Выживание!
Во-вторых: Графон просто чудесен, мил и уютен) Я бы даже сказала великолепен для тех, кто любит инди и для тех у кого слабенькие видеокарты (о да, я та, у которой слабая видюха и та, которая обожает такие игры)) Музыка тоже восхетительна! 
В-третьих: к сожалению даже у этой игры есть свои минусы... но они компенсируются всем вышеперечисленным, но это не значит что игру надо оставлять такой! Вовсе нет! Она требует доработак и ещё каких!) Буду надеятся и ждать выход обнов)
Немного о минусах... За 30 часов игры я уже к ним приловчилась и не считаю их как таковыми совсем страшными или неудобными, но с начала игры было сложно...
- камера.. о да, в начале она приносила просто катострофические неудобства, но со временем это стало даже удобно)
- карта... она не имеет контролируемого масштаба (не уменьшается не увеличивается, и это до сих пор приносит неудобства...) а то что она пиксельная это даже мило (^_^)
- музыка... не смотря на то, что она прекрасна, проигрывается она 1 раз, и в настройках этого не изменить( хотелось бы чтобы было побольше музыки)
В будующем хотелось бы увидеть добавления вещей, оружия, материалов и многого другого, в том числе и живности, строительства и возможно ещё больше разной флоры)
Желаю удачи и сил разработчикам, для улучшения и продвижения этой игры! И да, она стоит своих денег!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031438789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 4166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1561785645}
review:
Ignore the "its not sandbox" because whilst the levelling is controlled by quests and items, within a level you are free to do what you want.

If you want to get to level 12 then yes - your going to grind.
If you want to explore, then the creation of items compliments that aim.

For instance, at level 6 you gain access to Portals and are strong enough to move outside your localised area to find a place for them.  Levels 1-5 are about getting started and for me Level 6 is about exploration.

At 8 hrs in, I am exploring and level 6.  I am not looking to get to level 12 or complete the game - I am looking to enjoy my experiences.

On a final note: the Devs released a patch yesterday that broke digging.  Within a few hours they had fixed it.  Updates at the moment are every few days and add elements to the game - many are fan suggestions.

Overall:  this is one of those games I found by accident and am delighted to have done so.

With steam's refund policy - why not try it for 2 hours and see what you think?

author: {'steamid': '76561198033438541', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4042, 'last_played': 1595654317}
review:
Just finished the game. If you like lots of crafting, some fighting, loads of base building and farming then you may enjoy this game. That being said, it is very very very grindy- building and crafting takes a variety of materials which you'll spend most of the game collecting. In-game content could use a bit of tweaking (ie wells refilling to a more reasonable amount- I think I spent around a third of the game getting water for crops, cooking, livestock. Very slow and somewhat frustrating as the well only refills to 4 units and even with 6 wells at the end I was still short on water) Oddly there's also no way at present to destroy items so after a while you end up with a pile of old gear, assorted junk and a ton of wheat seeds strewn all over the place.

If you're keen on combat then you may not like this. Your character is very squishy and the wilderness is populated by plenty of monsters who hit a lot harder than you do. Very basic click to whack something with a sword and see if you or it dies first. No skills, nothing fancy, stuff your face with food to recover health and stamina. Combat may be a bit difficult for first time players. Armour doesn't provide much in the way of protection and even wearing the endgame gear I had to duck behind trees and bushes in order to survive pulling more than one mob at a time. Your weapons, while they don't have durability or need repairing, don't do much damage so expect to spent a lot of time poking bears with swords and getting mauled. Part of the game involves killing large numbers of enemies guarding quest-related rocks (which you mine for Force of Nature shards needed to craft said FoN) and you'll spend a lot of time cutting and chopping narrow paths through flora and fauna to survive any kind of combat- most mobs can't slip through small spaces so despite aggro they're unable to reach you. This sounds a bit odd but if you play the game for a bit you'll understand.

Most of your time though will be spent building up your base so you can craft better gear, farm more ingredients and cook a mountain of food that you'll end up going through each time you venture out into the forest. No rushing headlong into battle, you'll need to plan ahead and prepare before getting into a fight. I think I ended up eating around 500 apple pies towards the end.

Hoping that there will be more content updates in the future but for $9 it offers a fair amount of gameplay and so long as you're ok with grinding a whole bunch I'd say it's worth getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282004415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3233, 'last_played': 1502634473}
review:
Recomendado!. Muy adictivo XD. Llevo pocos días jugando y me encanta.

Lo que no me gusta:
- La cámara definitivamente. Me gustaría que pudiera rotar la cámara cuando abro el inventario.
- No saber  el tiempo exacto no se si se pueda construir un reloj en niveles mas altos. 
- El tiempo de construcción ( porcentaje de progreso ) No se modifica cuando se utiliza la cama para amanecer rápido. Me imagino que para no abusar y que todo se construya al instante al utilizar la cama. 
- Me gustaría que el mapa indicara mas información. Los pixeles de las rocas aveces no se distinguen bien.
- Me gustaria que el nivel de los allys se pueda saber antes de entrar en combate. Seleccionándolos o al pasar el mouse
- Me gustaria que se pudiera etiquetar los barriles o cofres para indicar el contenido. ( Como cuando se cambia el nombre a los portales ).

author: {'steamid': '76561198060506055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 13395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6381, 'last_played': 1487195202}
review:
This is a fun little game and it is not an Early Access game although some folks don't realize this.It requires patience and finesse to get the most pleasure from this game.

If you are a player that likes to blast through a game on a marathon run...this game will disappoint you. The crafting requires a ton of foraging, harvesting and trail blazing. 

It is very important to keep your base (spawn point) surrounded with the vegetation barrier...the goblins do not like you and will batter the walls you put in place.The devs put in a GR8 little alarm system to let you know.

The camera angle is an aerial view only and not a very large diameter, but it is enough to get a couple seconds to set for the attacks from the mobs as you try to get the shards.
This is where you can cut trees or break rocks and ores to get a narrow pathway to the mobs and a chance to retreat and hide to regain your health.

At first the game gave me vertigo but once I played a bit that effect went away.
The sound effects are really superb in a headset (or not) you can almost smell the seabreeze.  ;)

The detail on the farm animals ,their vocals and the rooster crows really enhances the immersion for me. But if bees buzzing and roosters crowing annoys you ...you might want to adjust your settings for the game.

I recommend this game to those of you that are looking for an adventure, a smidgen of challenges and questing that requires a desire for tedious gameplay.

I hope the developers will build on this first game they did and maybe put out Force of Nature 2  .

author: {'steamid': '76561197996631814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 14775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8480, 'last_played': 1588780734}
review:
Lo mejor del 2016 y si siguen asi del 2017.
Hacia tiempo que un juego no me enganchaba tanto.
Totalmente recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117733023', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1706918031}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041852072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3582, 'last_played': 1516198393}
review:
Игра со стороныы кажется и  красивой. 
Есть моменты в игре.
1. Балансировка в бою не сделана. Вас мгновенно может сгрысть две лисы. Если у вас появилась усталость, то можно просто забыть про все что  вы так добывали и тут же из-за де баланса потерять.
2. Строительство поселения  через крафт не продумано. 
-сундуки вмещают столько же как и бочки. Стоимость бочки такая же как и сундука? 
-здания не имеют уроня апгрейда. Приходится постоянно строить типичные здания.
3. Уровни игрока привязаны к заданиям, что очень стесняет в действих.

Хотелось бы видеть.
1. Возможность отогнать животных огнем.
2. Более свободный крафт. Уровень игрока.
3. Продуманная система добыча ресурсов. Руда не только каменной керкой, а так же и другими приспособлениями.
4. Возможность возраждаиться деревьям, кустам,  кна тех местах где срублены были, что бы не было образований пустых полей. Пускай не постепенной но как то со временем.

В общим кто хочет себе потрепать нервы, цена не большая, покупаем и треплим.

МИНУС ИГРЫ, СЮЖЕТ В КОНЦЕ ИГРЫ ПЕЧАЛЕН И НЕ ПРОДУМАН. ВЫГЛЕДИТ ВСЕ ЭТО ТИПА СПАСИБО ЧТО ВЫ ПРОШЛИ ИГРОВОЙ МИР.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068389515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4362, 'last_played': 1515178844}
review: I FINALLY after 75 hours of gameplay got the force of nature. I usually don't do forum posts or reviews but I feel like I had to. I Love this game and adore it. It reminds me of like the old fashioned diablo but so muc better because there is crafting and terrain cutting there is a large element of thought to this game. I have seen people whine about how horrid some parts are I think it is quite well balanced. each biome is different from another with temp differences. Sometimes you need more gear in one than another you can't just wear one suit and run the game. Even with ultimate gear two of the areas require you to modify your gear to survive in them. It is brilliant to mechanic that instead of just having one setup each area you need to plan out your advancement. Some areas need antidotes or teas and some need a lot more on the stamina because there is a lot of cutting involved some need a lot of health because you have to sacrifice armor for heat cold management. It is brilliant this game gets 5 out of 5 stars for its type. It isnt an MMO it isnt an RPG it isnt a sandbox it is elements of all of them and I would love to see more games like this in the future. Great job developer on a game well done. Stability seems to be quite good as well. The only downside I see is some players like to be spoonfed and when they get the best gear they like to be brainless and be set his game requires thought effort and planning.  The areas are gorgeous I LOVE the last area with the purple flowers and the trees and the bubbles. I love the fact that you have to make your own stuff instead of just going to a shopkeeper. Some places were enraging and you die a lot but thats ok i think some areas should be vicious for me it was the dreaded snow area. Pretty yes died alot also yes. I hope the dev doesnt modify it much further then where it is because it is great. I dont wanna see it dumbed down I would however love to see controller support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083128743', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 4633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1631, 'last_played': 1485913232}
review:
Bueno voy a empezar por lo siguiente (8 dolares) hoy por hoy es un regalo, es un juego que esta muy bien realizado, para los que saben de juegos tiene los tres items fundamentales, es entretenido, a cada progreso necesitas progresar aun mas y eso te mantiene pegado a la PC no pidan grandes graficos, pero los que tiene estan muy bien, me gustaria que tenga lenguaje en español eso haria que mas gente acceda a el.

sobre el juego:

comenzas tirado en la playa vos y tu alma, me costo un poco entender lo que tenia que hacer por estar en ingles pero una vez que entendes la metodologia es rapido, pensas que estas solo en la isla con los animales pero de golpe comenzas a sacar maleza y alli estan los orcos, lobos, jabalies y osos. los orcos son muy accecibles pero el resto es otra historia, intente cazar animales silvestres al empezar pero el juego es realista, son mucho mas rapidos que vos y necesitas mejorar las armas para hacerte de ellos. . . no me quiero estender mucho luego lo continuo puntuacion 8/10 en el genero.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998090429', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1420, 'last_played': 1484522328}
review: Основное вы и не в моем обзоре прочитаете, но самое важное, что  здесь нет элементов рпг, о которых написано в описании в магазине. Надеясь на подобное смешение, я и купил игру. Думал, что буду как в дьябло вываливать хрен на стол и бить гоблинов пачками, качая магии, а возвращаясь домой, пахать поле и кормить кур. Такого тут нет. Это все тот же сендбокс. Лвла получаешь за квесты, шмот только крафится, никаких способностей или пасивок тут нет. В остальном, очень годный сэндбокс, с крафтами по часу, как в расте и адовой дрочью лута для лвлапа. Тащемта рекомендую только тем, у кого слишком много времени.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272969858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1528659806}
review:
The Force of Nature game is a beautifully constructed game with a forgiving construction system. The ambience is perfect with the exception of emphasized stomping sounds for rabbits (Not a Negative). Some of the current flaws with this game aren't massive or horrifically displeasing but rather minor inconviences. The eating system is rather lucrative as I still yet to understand how to eat, which appears to be essential for moving through the game as it restores stamina and potentially health. I wish that the battle system wasn't required or it was at least able to be switched off. The game is gorgeous for requiring such low stats for your PC even the most fragile of PCs should be able to run this perfectly and be a real pleaser without any battle needs. The water is a gorgeous trickling attraction as it dawns gorgeous growth within what appears to be the fresh water habitat. Some other minor inconviences you will notice, such as when in battle if you are under a tree you can not see where you are, if the trees aren't behind your character. Maybe the developer will later implement a combat specific removal of the upper tree much like when they go behind the player to aid in the battle. This game quickly became my favorite thus far for a the reasons it doesn't require a beefy computer and still is beautiful, the low amount of keys used to manage the character which allows you to learn buttons easily even if you missed the tip for how to make it happen, I absolutely ADORE the collect all near key that is even conviently located near WASD (L.Ctrl). Overall, if I were to mention rather to purchase or pass. This would be a sure fire purchase as long as you are into sandbox games. Note to the developer (How do I Eat?) ***Note: The term "Sandbox" doesn't refer to a Minecraft Creative but rather the world is your oyster, at this time I haven't seen a creative or actual sandbox mode***

Perks Pleasure Rating: 8/10

-----UPDATE-----
I figured out how to eat, it become a realization that if put in the hotbar you could use it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094710132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1397, 'last_played': 1527340332}
review: Об игре могу высказаться очень положительно. Увлекательный геймплей. Большая возможность развития персонажа. Не хватает мультиплеера в игре. Очень надеюсь, что такая возможность в скоре добавиться, было бы не плохо поиграть в нее с друзьями. Из минусов можно отметить то, что добыча ресурсов уж очень затянута, времени тратиться много чтобы хотя бы приготовить один пирог, но это не делает игру плохой. Возможность построение собственной деревни, развитие животноводства и растеневодства на равне с возможностью ковать вещи и воевать с мобами, все это конечно делает игру великолепной и затягивающей.  Из недочетов: Хочется конечно добавить возможнсть изменения угла камеры, в некоторый локациях фиксированое положение камеры не очень удобно.  Подводя итог, хочу сказать спасибо разработчикам за такой качественный продукт. Жду обновлений и доработок гемплея.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034700088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1484260594}
review:
Хочешь контента? Да ладно, вот тебе непроходимая карта на которой ты будешь рубить не нужные тебе деревья неск десятков часов! Вот, гораздо веселее... а то контенту ему захотелось.

+ Игра стоит своих денег
+ Есть крафт и экшен
+ Есть постройка, но крайне мало

- Нет сюжета
- Багов в игре не замечено, но ОЧЕНЬ многие вещи в игре реализованы через ж...
- Онлайн составляющая, без онлайна. - Затягивание прохождения - Тот же контент, вид сбоку - Энергии придано слишком много значения
