author: {'steamid': '76561198081186140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1484273125}
review:
Not bad for the price.

Don't be expected to be able to roam around and do as you wish, levelling is reliant upon completing quests, and the quests are the generic craft xxxx item or collect yyy materials.

Wrongly tagged as a sandbox, very linear leveling and a major time sync.

Unless your utterly bored, I would give this a miss, but then .. you'll soon be utterly bored after a couple of hours.

Camera angle is very limiting.  Crafting system is almost decent but lacks some thought... to many menus to click through, can't open another windows if you have a recipe page open without hitting the cancel button.

If they removed the quest req's from leveling it would be a step in the right direction, still wouldn't be able to call t a sandbox though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116722329', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1485387519}
review:
Всем привет.

Когда покупал эту игру, не особенно надеялся, что она окажется качественной и сможет зацепить. Но теперь с уверенностью могу сказать, что Force of Nature, тот редкий случай, когда за не большую цену, нам предлагают очень даже приятный продукт, который способен цепануть и продержать в своих "лапках" долгое время. 
Так как я занимаюсь Ютубом, то увы не могу сесть за игру на 10-20 часов и безвылазно в ней сидеть, - нужно заниматься и другими видео. Но по данной игре, я с удовольствием запишу сезон выживания, - именно с удовольствием.

Из плюсов:
+ Сочная, красивая картинка
+ Хорошая оптимизация
+ Грамотная и интересная система прокачки, которая каким-то образом, - сильно затягивает.
+ Огромное количество крафта и интересные производственные цепочки.
+ Не плохая система приручения животных
+ Огромное количество растений, которые можно выращивать, собирать и использовать в различных крафтах

Из минусов:
На данный момент могу назвать только статичное положение камеры, которое постоянно подталкивает к тому, чтобы его поменять... но нельзя. Однако для слабых компов, этот минус является плюсом, потому что нет дальней прорисовки, а значит нет дополнительной нагрузки на проц и видяху.

В общем всем, кому нравятся выживалки и песочницы, - рекомендую.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qqg4z87bxdc

author: {'steamid': '76561198077168733', 'num_games_owned': 2385, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1627972191}
review: Oyunu biraz tereddütle aldım kuzeyli kardeşimin yorumuyla yola çıktım ama iyiki almışım tamamen oyun hayatta kalma tarzı sevenlerin mutlaka almaları gerekmekte olduğunu düşünüyorum.Değişik bir oyun tarzı olmuş oyun ne yapılması gerektiğini levellerle öğreten tadından yenmeyen bir survival oyunu. Vaktim kısıtlı olduğu için şuanda başından kalkmazdım o derecede beni sardı sıkılmıyorsunuz yani :D Fiyatı bana göre ucuz geldi hak ediyor aldığınız paraya. Dövüş sistemi biraz geliştirilmeli örnek veriyorum bir mızrak alıp iki üç kişiye saldıramıyorsunuz aynı anda, bu ilerleyen update'lerle düzeltilir inşallah. author: {'steamid': '76561198308605439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1363, 'last_played': 1484451588}
review:
Pro's:

Keeps you busy

Con's:

Looks as thougbh it has a 2bit ingame Map
Far too Grindy
You get led through the game in a continuous Tutorial style quest system 
You can't level up without grinding for items it is going to take from you
Single player.
No trading system.
No Trading cards.
Oh, did I mention the map?  It is from something my 4 yr old great niece could make, you can't tell anything from anything else it is that badly formed.
Game Dev's take ages to get back to you (Last Problem post replied to : December 2016)  Too long to be replied to for a game as young as this on steam even though the game is supposed to actually be quite an onld one.
It is like they have added this game to steam to get play time from people....The more you grind the more game time they get from you and the better they look in Steam's eyes

author: {'steamid': '76561198025134606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1588723300}
review:
Great game.  My fav these days!  If you're looking for something that is easy to play while watching TV, then this is it.  If you're into survival games, but tired of monsters constantly attacking you so you can't get started hardly, then this is the game for you.  Easy slow start, good instructions within quests and crafting.  

I wish there was the choice of male vs female character, but as it is, you're male, like it or not.  Perhaps in some future update they will add the option to be female.  Being a "girl gamer", it would be a welcome addition.  

I honestly can't think of any real "cons" for this review.  The UI was a little clumbsy to get used to but after a time I got used to it.  The graphics are good (not fantastic, but good enough).  The map is too pixelated to be of much use to me so far.  I have yet to find a way to play with my friends, but there may be a way.  Still pretty new to the game.

I really enjoy this game.  Was looking for something relaxing, and I like building things and gathering resources and creating my own camp.  There may be more to this game than that, but I haven't gotten very far into it yet...  I like that it gives me options as to how I want to play tho.... I suppose if you wanted to have more combat, you could do that .... but I mainly like to do the farming and gathering and creating.  

Great game!  Highly recommended.  I've already been telling my friends about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186360914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 19197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6506, 'last_played': 1509002225}
review:
BEST Survival/ Crafting Sandbox I've ever found on PC. Yes, it beats Terraria in play and price (in my opinion). I thought the price was awesome for the content, I've only had an issue with it crash one time, and never after that (playing a lot for around a week now and boy am I PICKY AF about bugs!)

Once you've mastered the control mechanisms and the quick bar, this game is easy to play and fluid. If you need more monsters in a certain area, all you do is save/ quit and reopen the game then use the portals to get right back. 

It could use a little improvement, as all things can. Here is a list of things I would like to see improved:

~I would like to see the farming plot numbers pushed upwards per level, as farming can be a bit tedious. Maybe an option to exchange the small plots up to the bigger plot sizes?

~Make a tree farming plot available to regenerate tree supplies at home, especially the fruit bearing trees and sugar cane/ bamboo.

~Please add hotkeys for the harvest all button like the Ctrl key is used to collect. Perhaps the Alt key for harvest all? I know the button is in the inventory but getting that up then hitting that button that slows things down.

~A little more variety in decor, such as, please make a hanging lantern available to hang on the buildings. I don't mind if "Hovel" and up is required to hang them, as that makes sense that straw like huts wouldn't hold them well.

~I would also like the cooking station numbers to be increased per character level a bit. Cooking tends to be somewhat slow.

~I love the apple and meat pies, please make coconut and banana pies available, or find a use for them. Also, I would like to see orange trees and lemon trees, and to make juices for stamina options (OJ and lemonade that would also need the sugar/ honey use).

~Need more uses for sticks and stones, or an option to destroy materials. The game isn't buggy but I'm sure leaving the extra junk lying around has a potential to create issues, including lag, even though I haven't seen it yet.

~More uses of gems, such as embrodered into armors and engraved into weapons? (Tailor Bench and Anvil?)

~Maybe I haven't played far enough into the game yet but I'd love to see a few more different types of monsters. Maybe in an expansion?

author: {'steamid': '76561198035976827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1506375815}
review:
I'm not sure if I can recommend this game or not. In some ways it is a fun game. I am not a fan of the view angle at all and can't get used to it. I suppose this angle doesn't require a sky box so maybe that is why it was used but I do like the look of the game.

The crafting systems are well thought out and very detailed. However if you are not a fan of grinding for ingredients this game may not be for you as it does require a lot of grinding. I managed to scrape together enough of the required items to make a few bits of armor only to find that I needed a different armor set to get through an area to reach a quest item. So back to grinding... I turned the game off after that. I'm not sure if I'll carry on with it or not because I'm getting bored with killing the same things over and over. 

This is not an expensive game and it appears to be getting reqular updates. If you don't mind grinding and like building your little village then you may enjoy this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013724453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6244, 'last_played': 1606062736}
review: This game is more of a time and resource management game than a sandbox rpg. There is no survival elements at all other than staying alive if you want. Dying doesn't have any real consequence other than loosing a few inventory items and at times letting yourself die is advantagious.  This game is a time sink and one of the grindiest games out there but that is not saying it is bad. Contrary, it is a very addictive game the grind is done well but could use a few minor balancing tweaks.   If you are looking for a crafting/building/survival game this is not it. Even though it has those elements they are extremely limited and are only there to get you to the next level.  The developers are not active in the Steam forums and that leaves a lot of guessing on where/when/what is planned for this game. As far as I know the game is out of Early Access and no major changes are expected.  Hope this review helps a you make an informed decision on the purchase.  I have over 100 hours in the game and really enjoy it for what it is.﻿

author: {'steamid': '76561198031777377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1484306791}
review:
Survival bastante completo para lo poco que cuesta, con un sistema de crafteo progresivo y de dificultad media-baja.
De bueno, tiene por ejemplo la posibilidad de domar animales, recursos limitados sin reaparición, y almacenamiento limitado.
De malo, que cuanto más prograsas, más tiempo tienes que estar farmeando para hacer una cosa tan simple como un destornillador... o una brújula...

author: {'steamid': '76561198073239312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1484149381}
review: Judging from the video of the game on steam it looks to be something that I would enjoy playing.  However, I'm disabled and I have to talk to my computer in order to use it.  I installed the game as usual but when I went to play it it wouldn't accept my mouse commands or directional commands and this was just at the menu screen.  On any other game I'd just say, "Go up (number)" and it would move the selection up or down however many I'd say.  Or I'd say, "move mouse (direction)" and the mouse would begin to move; whereas with this game it wouldn't do anything.  I would really like it if there was a fix to the game so that I could try again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158395032', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1589831861}
review: Das Spiel macht echt mega Laune. Die Grafik ist hier total zweitrangig. Die Art und Weise vom "Craften und Farmen" ist hier super ausbalanciert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050390138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2352, 'last_played': 1509285815}
review:
For its price this is a bargain. I've played a few "survival" games and I found this one to be the most enjoyable. I like the fact that there's a "story" so that you learn howto craft the basics and level up in the process. 

I also like the fact that you can craft items pretty effortlessly. You dont need to chop down 100 trees to build a little hut, for instance. So I think its a proper pace for this game. There's also plenty of details on each resource, including where to find it. 

What I miss is a soundtrack that kinda suits the nature and such aswell as a 1st perspective camera view. 

Other then this, its a polished game with alot of content. I luv the animals, they are beatifully designed. A bit silly though how the rabbits run into the sea without caring about the fact that they are under water (occassionally) :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198167958424', 'num_games_owned': 1193, 'num_reviews': 527, 'playtime_forever': 15156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4079, 'last_played': 1588497489}
review:
Ни когда не тамьте две коровы сразу в лесу ;D они не везде могут пройтии в итоге собирают вокруг себя кучу мобов, которые потом атакуют вас))) Еле выжила.
Игрушка сложная! Много ресурсов, много крафта, мобы респятся потосянно - при выходе из игры, или переходе из локации и сне - по ходу дела. А для выживания приходится использовать все что создали разработчики. Обычно в играх часть крафта провисает из за ненадобности или сложности добычи реагентов, тут все иначе.
А прокачка вообще хардкоровая.
Еще у меня такое ощущение что мой персонаж растет с каждым уровнем и мужает, хтя может мне это только кажется.
Я читала ниже комментарии, все недовольные этой игрой - это те люди которые не захотели  или не хватило терпения разобратся.
____________

Прошла игру два раза, это одна из любимых игр!

author: {'steamid': '76561198143627818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2072, 'last_played': 1483922733}
review:
best 8$ I ever spent.

Yes you grind, you grind lots but its a game and aim towards micro managment where you will have to colllect numerous ores, items in order to craft and level up to potentially move to another section of the map to confront higher level monsters etc...

If you have no patience or dislike management type of game you should stay away. It is not a building type game since you need to level up to unlock certain things and grow your village step by step.


Best 8$ ever spent with over 10hrs of game play

author: {'steamid': '76561198061625086', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1484656490}
review:
First off...I love this game. I'm not sure if you can truly call it a "Survival Game", as it lacks most elements that make a survival game just that. Eg: there is no hunger or thirst and you do not need to sleep.
There is a pesky stamina bar that you will constantly need to pause to let refill, but that’s really about it apart from health that is really only lost if the player gets hit by an enemy.

There’s a TON of stuff to craft, a massive island to explore, animals to tame and add to your farm/village, and plenty of enemies to conquer.
If you’d like to get a feel for it, check out my Let’s Play series here and let me know what you think:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=htMl8jp6yPE&t=62s

author: {'steamid': '76561198007357907', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1483804666}
review:
I would realy like to love this game and I recommend playing this game but there are quite some design issues with this game:

* first of all this game has this artificial barriers of progress. U need lots of grinding to get a level (levels are needed to progress - gain access to better equiptment, buildings etc.)
* the whole interface is rather not intuiitive. pressing [leer] to get access to buildings / farmable ressources? sorry there are better ways
* aiming isnt very easy, in my oppinion there should be an autoaim, because ammunition is expensive and a lot of creeps tend to run away 
* there should be some kind of automation, like for coal, crops etc.

The whole game gets from me like a 5,5 from 10 but still - for that price I recommend to guy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020840247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1516832702}
review:
Bonjour tutti.

Alors ce Force of nature ! 

Donc le genre vous vous en doutez s'est du suvival/craft/action.

Coté survival s'est assez light la nourriture ne sert qu'à se healer ou a récupérer de la stamina (pas de jauge faim, soif ect)
Même chose pour le dodo, il ne sert qu'à se healer (même pas pour passer le temps durant une longue suite de craft) sachant que votre premier lit ne sera craftable qu'au niveau 6.

Côté craft y a juste se qu'il faut, la liste de tous les crafts figure dans un onglet dre l'inventaire

Côté action/gameplay s'est basique, on frappe du clic gauche et droit, clic droit est plus puissant, sinon vous donnez un coup de pied. On ne saute pas, on ne sprint pas. on court lorsqu'on est en forme et on marche lorsque la barre d'endu est en dessous de 20% (à vue de nez).
La difficulté des combats IA pour se que j'en ai vu est assez simple run hit et parfois re-run quand l'ennemi panique et fuit, domage que pour l'instant il n'alerte pas ses potes...
Quand on meurt on rez au point de demarage ou plutard en créant des portails, on pert pas mal de butin aléatoirement.

Graphiquement s'est joli sans plus (je ne suis vraiment pas exigeant, préférant le contenu au contenant)
L'ambiance sonore est basique aussi, chant d'oiseau, mouche qui passe, tout le monde reconnaitra cette bibliothèque sonore. Musique je sais pas je l'ai coupée.

Bon en résumé je trouve que ce jeu est agréable, un bon rapport qualité prix, facile et accessible pour les petits joueurs comme moi, connaissance de l'anglais inutile.
Les PGM hardcore survivors seront surement déçu devant la facilité.

13/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198356979315', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1556049196}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993089979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1483287048}
review:
Ein nettes kleines Spiel für zwischendurch. 
Es gilt hier zu erkunden (Rohstoff suche), bauen, farmen, kämpfen und Tiere züchten...
Es ist stimmig und bis jetzt habe ich noch keinen Bug entdeckt.
Für den "Vollpreis" von knapp 8 € ein wirkliches Schatzkästchen.
Mir gefällts schon jetzt!!
Dazu kommte auch noch, es wird noch verbessert und erweitert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137770912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1483649126}
review:
At the beginning the game is funny but quickly turns out to be very time consuming to get the next level.
The fixed camera angle it's anoying, nowadays there's no reason why you can't allow a game like this to move the viewing camera some degrees.
There's no queue system on the crafting stations, why??
The tame of animals it's funny, you can feed them and get useful materials for the crafting.

The game is very very grindy and at certain points you will feel a huge loss of time.
Maybe creators can review the grind line so players may have a sense of reward for the time invested.

It's a funny game to try out but not to spend hours.
For now I don't recommend, maybe in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019727508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1650, 'last_played': 1605622159}
review:
Englische Titel sind für mich meist ein Grauß! Aber man findet sich recht schnell rein und zur Not gibts ja Google. 

Positiv
Schöne Grafik und ist echt nett anzusehen und schönes Feeling durch die Akkustik
Fauna und Flora sind abwechslungsreich
Grosse Crafting-Möglichkeiten
Auch ein längerer Spielspass ist gegeben. Ich hasse nichts mehr wenn ein Game nach 10-15 Stunden durch ist
Das Levelsystem verleitet dazu zu sagen "ach komm das mach ich noch"

Negativ
das sind ja schon die Kameraposition genannt worden - das nervt wirklich
Das Levelsystem - ja ich weiss oben hab ich aufgeführt als positiv, die Kehrseite - man kommt manchmal echt nicht weiter bzw  nur mit sehr viel Geduld
Das Bausystem - als Jäger und Sammler nehm ich mit was ich kriegen kann. Heisst im Umkehrschluss man kriegt sehr schnell Platzprobleme, kann aber Lagerkisten nur in Gebäude reinsetzen. Darfst aber nur levelbegrenzte Häuser/Hütten bauen. Das ist sehr nervig und stört mir den Spielspass

Im Grossen und Ganzen gesehen ist FON ein schönes chilliges Game was auf Dauer Frohsinn bringt. Trotz der negativen Eigenschaften bekommts eine Empfehlung - vielleicht tut sich ja noch was

author: {'steamid': '76561197972011136', 'num_games_owned': 1271, 'num_reviews': 794, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1630708965}
review:
https://youtu.be/SWqts5rSdtQ
Nouvelle vidéo 4 ans après que j'ai oublié que j'avais le jeu...
Un grand plaisir à trouver une interface en jeu très bien faite, bien qu'il soit sortie le II il n'y a pas longtemps, je trouve que l'achat du 1 n'est pas à exclure car je n'aurais pas fait un second pour ma part mais une update, au vu de ce que j'ai vu sur le II , l'arbre de compétences n'existe pas sur le 1 mais cela n'est pas gênant dans la mesure ou le nouveau ne surpasse pas le 1.

De mon avis vos mieux acheter le 1 en super prix,  le nouveau propose un graphisme plus lissé et un arbre de compétences et je pense une map procédurale, mise à part ce dernier point le 1 permets tout de même de jouer à un jeu peu cher qui est similaire au 2.
Ma conclusion avant d'acheter le 2 , achètes le 1 et si il faut cela te conviendra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004468758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 2717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1812, 'last_played': 1522887776}
review:
Through all its faults, this is a fairly good game, specially for its price. It's very clearly designed and made for those that love grinding to progress. 

The difference to me is that the grind matters. Every item has value, and a use. You have to prepare for your explorations, and while you're exploring you will find things to make a better base.

The con being the same that many have. The restrictions are to restricting. You start out far too slow in all aspects. Fighting, harvesting, moving, etc. It also seems pointless to have a build restriction. The player is already restricted from crafting the best supplies and buildings due to the cost of building them. There's no reason to bar a player from accessing them as well. On top of which, when you level up, it requires resources. Often time it's vital resources that may be hard to come by. Once you level up, they get deleted, just gone from existence. Why? Where did they go? Why did I need to sacrafice vital resources when completing 5 quests would suffice to level up?

The scaling of conflict is about right, however even 13 hours in, I have never experienced monsters sieging my base as shown in the video. The only way this seems to happen is if you build your base on top of a heavily infested area, as monsters always respawn on sleep / log in.

The camera angle is often times infuriating. If the player had some control over it, or it were angled lower to see further that would be much better. Or simply just do it top down as the standard isometric style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007354287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1696777165}
review:
Ich war mir nicht sicher, ob ich dem Spiel jetzt ein like, oder nicht geben sollte.
Aber, da das Spielen doch viel Spass gemacht hat, gabs einen.
Es ist mehr oder weniger eine typisches Überlebensspiel. Rohstoffe sammel, verarbeiten, bauen, kämpfen...
+ Viele Rohstoffe
+ Viele Craftingrezepte
+ Reichhaltige Flora und Faune
+ Viele Bauten und Dekorationen

o Passives Craften
o Passives Bauen
o Animationen
o Rohstoffverlust aus Inverntar bei Tot

- Kampfssystem: lahmes "Klick & Hit"
- Kein (weg)rennen möglich
- Kamera nur drehbar
- Aufstieg nur über Rohstoffe
- Das wird für Level 7 zum Problem, da man die Rohstoffe nur bei den (zu) starken Monstern bekommt
- Mit Pflanzen belegte Kästchen (auch mit drüber hängenden Palmblatt) nicht passierbar

author: {'steamid': '76561198075196874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1196, 'last_played': 1563303402}
review:
Ein super Spiel für 8 Euro. 

Wenn es Stimt das nur ein Spieler, dieses Spiel Programmiert. Respekt. 

Kämpfen, Sammeln, Craften, Bauen, Questen alles dabei mit einfachem Stly und gute Möglischkeiten. 

Bitte weiter Entwickeln.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974727383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1483006750}
review:
This game plays like 10-15 year old RPG. This isn't always a bad thing, there are plenty of great games from that era, this however 

The graphics are really bad, the menus are terrible, the camera is locked at a weird, bad angle probably to hide the limits of the engine to render things far away.

The game progresses as a never ending tutorial, you can't do anything other than going through a handheld list of do this to unlock that, then do that. The entire game is monotunus and clunky.

I really enjoy these kind of games, but nothing about Force of Nature lives up to the promises of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206415820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1520951745}
review:
潜力很足，缺点太多。
我期待的是一款【自由度高】的荒岛生存游戏
结果我感觉我在玩一个拙劣的RPG游戏
【很生气】这款游戏的升级要素其实就是完成一个个任务 不完成没有能力制造更高级的工具和武器等等 这样的设定使得整款游戏的流程变得非常缓慢 大部分时间你都耗费在无意义的事上 而不能升级高等工具使得这时间变得更长。
最让人失望和难以忍受的就是战斗系统了 别想了 【没有操作 只有挨打】 掉了物品 食物的补给根本跟不上被群殴时掉落的血量
另外地图和环境的设定也很奇葩 玩了你就明白 这份地图到底有什么探索的价值我是没怎么看出来
可以改进的地方太多了 
何以解忧 唯有差评

author: {'steamid': '76561198039164605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1660227781}
review: This game is good, a bit slow but i dont mind slower pace for crafting and stuff, but it is a grind for the recources, but if you like casual crafting game with some combat in it then its a good relaxing game mostly, and for those saying you have to have the menu open to gather resources all you have to do is hold space bar down then click the resources, it explains what to do quite well

author: {'steamid': '76561198310137516', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1623344189}
review:
a nivel contenido es interesante, tiene muchas cosas que ofrecer, lo malo es que para avanzar es un poco complicado, pero quizas sea eso lo que de emocion al juego, llevo un par de dias con el juego y me ha parecido bueno, aun esta un poco crudo pero quizas en un futuro algo pueda surgir, recomendado
EDIT: después de unas 50 horas de juego complemento con lo siguiente:
- Se debe mejorar el sistema de combate, ya que es muy lineal, no tiene una opción de esquivar, a no ser que vayas hacia atrás.
la velocidad de los golpes en combate debería ser diferente, debería también poder usarse un ataque secundario con mas daño que el principal, pero no es el caso, el golpe es lo mismo tanto con el click derecho como con el izquierdo.
- Las monedas deberían tener más usos y no solo el de fundir para obtener lingotes y subir de nivel.
Aun no lo completo al 100%, ya que lo juego de manera ocasional, pero cuando lo termine, culmino la reseña... sin embargo lo sigo recomendando

author: {'steamid': '76561197995095625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1483935894}
review:
I don't often write reviews, but this game certainly warrents it, I saw a review/play through of the game on youtube and wanted it straight away, and at under £6 it's certainly worth it.

There's plenty to do and it's very easy to lose a few hours (5 hours first time) to the grind, there's a lot of grind, but it's not hard, or boring, there's a lot of menu's and clicking through things, but if you like building and crafting, it's great, the combat (only seen animals and goblins to date) seems simple enough and not too much of a challenge, but I couldn't kill a rabbit if my life depended on it.

The quests seem simple enough too, some building, crafting,  and killing, all in all a nice walk through tutorial style.

My only quibble with the game is the only view you get, top down, which take's a bit of getting used to, and I would prefer a slightly longer range view.

But, I'd certainly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031169814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1592744411}
review:
I am loving this game this far.   Don't get me wrong my first play thru I got over whelemed by goblins and boars.  So I die a few times at first.   Game reminds me kind of a Sims 3 Survival game (lol).  As in most games of this nature you find yourself waking up un sure where you are.   You get a tutorial quest line that levels you up while you learn gathering resource and crafting the differant Items and building  things you will need to progress.  I like the way it drives this home.

Some things I would ask for in the future though.  

1.  A more detailed map.   Maybe a map ledger or perhaps a way to mark things on it.
2.  More options on the building cues maybe more auto craft like for exsample the water you get from the well you make around level 5 I think.
3.  Less running npcs.  Fox, rabits, and goblins I'm looking at you.

Things that might turn you off with this one are:

1.  Stamina regen in the early levels.  It does get better as you level up thankfully
2.  The grinding of raw materials you need to craft things.
3.  Mobs that run, and how if you give chase you can get over ran, and killed rather fast.
4.  The slow swinging of your weapons in the early levels.
5.  the controls/interface might turn folks of at first till they get the hang of it.
6.  The postion of your character on the screen.
7.  The small area in which you can grab stuff in.

Having said that I would like to say its a fun relaxing game for the most part.  It has a lot of what I have always wanted.  Sure it has things that will make you go WTF at first but the more you play, the easier those moments get.  I found that level up was challanging enough to keep me intrested.  Which is always a good thing.

Most of all bare with the folks mkaing this one.  It has regular updates and is still in development.  I am greatful for this one it has a new way of doing stuff.  Sure its a gamble but in the end it works for me.

I hope if you do give this one a try.  You willl have as much fun as I have had so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983808830', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1500684610}
review: For 8 € you get a really awesome game. I am missing some survival parts here, like hunger and thirst, that would be really nice. I hope that will be some interesting things to discover. I really do recommend playing this game if you like some action adventure rpg like games. Pace is pretty slow so you can relax very well while playing. Only thing I dislike so far is, that you can't move houses and the portal around. I'd like to do that because I like to restructure everything while unlocking new things.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979518268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1483667149}
review: The control scheme is downright barbaric. It's slow and clunky with very little in the way of options. The camera is fixed so you never actually see any farther than about 30 feet in front of you. Any game that has you thinking about how bad the controls are rather than just playing and having fun is, in my opinion, not playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011231901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1705435162}
review: Maybe it's the fact that the graphics remind me of oldschool Runescape, but this game is addictingly fun. At times it may feel like a bit of a grind (and, to be honest, it IS a grind sometimes), but there's always something that I want to do and always some goal to achieve, which is something many survival games fail to do. As you start to get near the next level it gets a bit grind-y but once you hit that level-up you're given loads of new things to do almost to the point where it's overwhelming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043364439', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1483620984}
review:
The game is tedious, dull, and overly restrictive.  It offers little of the freedom of a sandbox game, and instead forces you to complete objectives in order to learn how to craft things, which can only be crafted upon reaching certain levels.  Not only that, but you can only craft a limited number of the structures each level.  For example, upon learning to craft anvils, you can only craft one and must level up in order to craft another.

The user interface design is also pretty awful.  If you want to pick up items and drops, you have to open the menu.  Also while the menu is open, you can move around, but you cannot turn, and you cannot mine, dig, chop trees, or fight, and while the menu is closed you cannot inspect the progress of the various crafting stations.  Items also take a substantial time to craft, sometimes a minute or more.  Combat has no depth, it involves little more than just holding down the LMB until the enemy falls down or runs away.

I never got far past building a stick hut and a table, and it took a few hours of playtime just to get to that point.  Around that time I realized that the game just wasn't fun, and I can't really say I "played" the game because it never really felt like I was playing.

I get more satisfaction out of doing the dishes than I do out of this game.  Speaking of which, I need to go do the dishes.

EDIT Jan 6 2018: I wish I had known at the time that I could have gotten a refund for this piece of garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022695937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1892, 'last_played': 1505027323}
review:
игра с потенциалом... НО

наибольшие из  замеченных грустинок:

- угол камеры и приближение не меняются, если вы внизу а мобы на холме - нифига не увидите, и да маштаба у карты нет....
- горячая кнопка сбора лута вокруг не дублируется для сбора урожая
- скорость шага\бега одна и не меняется (бега нет вообще, если закончилась выносливость - персонаж изображает ковыляющего инвалида паралитика)
- вылеты, судя по всему по памяти (заканчиваются после 4 лв - видимо чтото связанное с заданиями туториала)
- крафтом и убийством левел НЕ  КАЧАЕТСЯ... кач левелла - только выполнением определенных, заданных разработчиками, условий. странных к слову условий...
- крафт... не быстрый. в туторе, банально сделать угольки - прийдется тупо ждать. да, ставьте несколько костров...
- функция постоянной подсветки интересного и нужного вокруг отсутствует - проще заскриптовать лконтрол на постоянный кликчтоб не долбить пробел нонстопом...
- то, как копает персонаж палкой копалкой - детям показывать нельзя
- животные агрятся и получив леща убегают... убегают так что шумахер нервно в сторонке курит...
- с открытым инвентарем вы не можете драться и поворачиваться
- дожди будут идти постянно..(
- 

советы по игре:
- не рубите ничего предварительно не попинав ногами... с тех же подсолнухов можно  получить 8 семечек , а не 3 если сразу срубить их
- лисы... мочить этих "№;%:! можно следующим образом - встать так чтобы убегать она могла от вас только по прямой, бьем дубиной до момента когда эта паскуда делает от вас лапы и стреляем в догонку из лука... 
- первый артефакт (как добыть и не проклясть разработчиков) - ставим портал в лесу так чтобы между мобами и порталом были преграды образующие коридор с единственным проходом  для ОДНОГО моба и агрим в надежде что побегут не все... стоя в проходе валим их. стандартная пачка - 2 гоблина + медвед  и все они 4 лв. и да... выложите все ценное ибо умирать всеравно прийдется
- не парьтесь рудой (медью и золотом) - монетами с гоблинов вы наберете ресурса больше чем киркой...
- 

как то так, а дальше будем посмотреть. игру брать рекомендую адвентерам\ фермерам\ выживальщикам с дальним прицелом

author: {'steamid': '76561197989322803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1487506066}
review:
Хорошая игра которой нужно ещё развиваться!) Очень приятная атмосфера и озвучка, яркая и опять же приятная графика! Меня увлекло! Спасибо разработчикам!)

Хотелось бы увидеть следующие улучшения (ну на данный момент, то что бросилось в глаза в первую очередь):

1. Хотелось бы иметь какую то причастность к созданию таких вещей как постройки. Не просто чтобы как бы посадил каменную печь и она растёт себе в процентах, а может молоточком где постучать или что то вроде этого.
2. Чтобы было побольше всяких предметов для создания (ну это будет скорее всего)
3. Хотелось бы чтобы главный герой мог бегать.
4. Чтобы был износ инструментов, оружия и одежды.
5. Чтобы у героя появилась потребность в еде, воде и сне.
6. Изменить звук добывания камня (а то ощущение что персонаж вгоняет кирку в песок), например сделать таким как в факторио.
7. Улучшить боевую систему. Скорее всего это может заключаться в том чтобы сделать персонажа более проворным.
8. Было бы не плохо если бы в настройках появилась возможность настраивать гамму и яркость.
9. Не помешала бы возможность менять масштаб интерфейса. В главном меню, с моей точки зрения, текст можно сделать меньше чтобы ушла лёгкая ватность контуров текста (да и смотреться будет лучше), к курсору это тоже относится - меньше и чётче. Хочется повысить резкость самой картинки.
10. Было бы неплохо чтобы костёр догорал.
11. Ночь и день были чуток подлиней.
12. Ну и пока не знаю есть ли это в игре но было бы здорово добавить какие ни будь пещеры, скалы, катакомбы, руины и т.п.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031351458', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4198, 'last_played': 1501054833}
review:
An sich ein sehr gutes Spiel und Preis/Leistung is top.
Leider wird es in den höheren Level recht schwer und ziemlich nervig.
Denn ab Level 7 oder 8 muss man, um aufzusteigen, jedes mal ein piece of Force of Nature sammel.
Davon abgesehen das dort sehr schwere Gegner sind, ist das hinkommen das Problem.
Nicht nur das alles zugewachsen ist, nein auch sind überall Berge und Schluchten und das ist dermaßen nervig.
Das kann schon mal Stunden dauern.
Das ist aber auch mein einziger Kritikpunkt, wäre das Spiel an sich nicht so gut würde ichs deswegen nicht empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090593095', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1622641034}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026277768', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1481813328}
review:
For time being, this game is fun for approx. 3 hours until you got to the point where you should capture an animal, which you are supposed to use as a domestic animal later on. It was impossible to catch it by the trap so I stopped to play this game and I am waiting for the update...

However, the game itself has an original idea compare others survival type of games. It's much more optimistic to play than the post-war and post-appocaliptical games. The graphics is easy and funny and reminds you good old gaming days in the middle of 90's. It works smoothly on non-gaming laptop (Samsung bought in 2012).

author: {'steamid': '76561198165611875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 8711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4942, 'last_played': 1586383848}
review:
TL\DR - Challenging game that requires you to focus on the right things at the right times. It also requires you to use nature to your adventage.

-Pro-
Interesting game that challenges me to do something else then what I'm used to, see "a few insight" for details.

-Con-
Ok to sub-par graphics.

-Neutral-
Controls are quirky at first, but I got used to them.  Progression can be questioned as it's dependent on doing quests (think of it as a very long tutorial). There is no permadeath but you'll loose some inventory permanently when you die (random, see "a few insight").

-A few insight-
This is a game you won't go into in the "collect all, grind early" philosophy... it won't work for you... notice how the vids show selective looting?.  Now if you go about it grabing what you need when you need it... and you keep a decent "nature" shield around your base... you'll do fine. -Edit- : Loot left on the ground does not despawn, so it's a decent alternative to building lots of chests.  Basic loot can go into single item pile with nearly the same effectiveness (hint : leave the partial stack slightly to the side).

-An extra insight-
I've seen some bad review concerning mostly the stamina system. First, this is mostly an early on issue where (a) you don't have a lot of it (it grows with levels, as well as natural regeneration), (b) you don't have access to lots consumable to replenish it (wait untill level 7 for coffee, thank me later) and (c) your tools are not as effectives (you start with stone tier, then copper tier, then bronze, then iron, then steel... each tier take less "hits" to gather the same ressources). All in all, it's pretty much what I said when I said you should only loot as you need... part of what challenged me to think differently.

-I got this for free-
A friend of mine was kind enough to gift this to me.  Other then being very grateful for that friend, it has no bearing on my review.

-Why don't you give any negative review?-
I try to be fair in my review and not waste time on bashing a game.  If there is some improvement to be made to the game, I voice it in suggestions.  Otherwise, I just don't play games I don't like (period). (ps : this is for those that wonder why I never gave any thumbs down so far).

author: {'steamid': '76561197993748260', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1534406442}
review: The game has been updated and has a robust, and informative, crafting system. I enjoyed the game a lot, even though there's a learning curve at first. The monsters for beginners are a little bit hard in groups, especially with a boar, or two. The pulling system is great but the fog of war seems a little too close. It would be nice to have a mini map to keep an eye on enemies as you're exploring the woods. I recommend this game at this time as it is playable and user friendly, you have to get used to the combat system with hopes that they'll fine tune it in the future. I'm not too big on multiplayer, so it seems implementing MP on an unrefined system seems a bit early.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021403893', 'num_games_owned': 2604, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 1493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1564784800}
review:
В данном обзоре я расскажу вам о замечательной игре гриндилке Force of Nature от разработчиков  A.Y.std. Данный обзор не является плагиатом и написан мной, Гвардом, от первого до последнего слова!

Данная игра зацепит душу любого олдфага начинавшего путь геймера ещё с ZX-spectruma. Данная игра очень сильно напоминает Аллоды: Проклятые земли. Игра отличается от прочих выживалок во-первых весьма придирчивым и довольно объёмным крафтом. Здесь нет очень быстрого старта и развития как во многих нынешних выживалках. Здесь очень долгое и кропотливое развитие. До того момента как вы сможете создать свой первый бронзовый меч пройдёт не один и не пять и даже не десять часов беспрерывной игры. А уж первую майку и первые штаны - и того позже. Забудьте о доступности всего и сразу — тут вам не Майнкрафт.

Начинаем игру мы с того что нас выбрасывает на необитаемом (как мы думаем по началу) острове буквально в одних рваных штанах. Очухавшись и оглядевшись по сторонам мы начинаем делать свои первые шаги благо туториал пунктуально ведет нас под ручки и дотошно обучает нас всему. Все задания объясняются подробно и показывают места своего выполнения на карте.
Начинаем с того что собираем все что плохо лежит, а так же рубим и трясем все что видим. Ресурсы нам еще очень пригодятся для крафта.

Для того что бы открывать более топовые рецепты нужны уровни, а их получать начиная с 4 будет весьма не просто.
Строить здания в любой форме и планировке не выйдет. Начнёте с шалаша, потом однокомнатная хибарка в которую даже три поросёнка бы от волка не спрятались... Ну и т.д
Зато в постройке элементов декора вас не ограничат и выбор довольно широк. Мой вам совет — первым делом постройте небольшой загон для животных — это сэкономит вам десятки часов, кучу нервов.Животные оставленные без присмотра — ВСЕГДА разбредаются по всему острову и искать их потом будет проблемно да и дикие звери не прочь полакомиться вашим скотом.

Кстати о вражинах ... Боевая система абсолютно точно копирует Аллодов Проклятые земли. Как собственно и система его создания. Да и брони, одежды — тоже. Кстати, создавать можно не только полезную и защитную одежду, но и просто практичную и красивую. Для того лучше сразу по возможности привести в загон к себе тройку овец и стричь с них шерсть. Её понадобится ОЧЕНЬ много.

Добыча ископаемых весьма и весьма важный процесс и часть игры. Разные ископаемые находятся и как бы впаяны в разные залежи камней. Разбивая их вы получаете камни, а так же тот тип ресурса который в жиле содержится. Тёмно-Коричневые жилки — железо, светлые — олово, светло-коричневые — медь и т.д Далее переплавка в слитки и т.д
Лечимся мы пищей которую готовим по сложным рецептам из многих составляющих. Можно и просто лопать на первых порах кокосы и бананы, либо нажарить мяса дичи. Для начала вам этого хватит. Часть этой пищи восстанавливает не ХП (или не только ХП) а и энергию, то есть ваши силы.

Ну и пара рекомендаций — если враги кажутся вам сложными, скрафтите оружие получше и мой совет не пользуйте лук со стрелами, особо по началу. Толку от них мало. И не забывайте крафтить и носить с собой минимум 15 ловушек для того что бы приручать живность. Курочка, Корова, петух, овечка — ваш необходимый минимум! И ещё когда будете крафтить порталы — один установите возле дома, а второй как можно дальше, желательно у полянки с первым осколком природы (там ещё куча мобов и медведей спавнится).

Маленькая хитрость для тех кому совсем невмоготу добывать сотни шкур животных для крафта — просто сохранитесь и выйдите из игры и снова тут же войдите — все животные соспавнятся на своих местах в прежнем объёме. Я не рекомендую так ,, читерить" но если вам уж совсем лень то воля ваша.
На этом я заканчиваю данный обзор, для вас старался Золотой Дракон Гвард, всем удачи!

author: {'steamid': '76561198261497422', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 3281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2899, 'last_played': 1559611040}
review:
The game is still early access, and there are a lot of factors to consider. Here are some things I'd love to see, however.
- An optional Hunger/Thirst meter (Thirst would be taken care of early-game by Coconuts.)
- More options for the camera angle. The distant view is a bit annoying at times, hard to see ahead of you or behind you. What would be great is a zoomed in 3rd person and 1st person.
- Less grind when it comes to Coal requirements for metal. Bronze is the earliest metal you can work on armor-wise, and total, it costs 25 coal to make 1 bronze ingot (5 for the tin and copper, 15 for the alloy), and the wood -> coal converter carries 50 coal, which also takes forever to make. Now, an iron ingot costs 5 coal, and iron is more mid-game than Bronze. You can make five times as much iron than bronze with 50 coal. The game should be increasingly grindy as you progress, but it jumps up and down. Because Steel requires a grand total of 30 coal per ingot, which, in my opinion, should be lowered along with bronze. And I question the realism of glass needing a higher temperature (more coal) than ore to smelt, but I'm not really informed, so don't quote me on that.
- The amount of pelt used for clothes is also a bit too high, in my opinion.
I really do like this game, though, despite the grind. As it's still early access, there's a lot of content to come, which I'm excited for. More content, naturally, makes the game have more of an objective and options so far as progression goes.

EDIT: Game eventually becomes more frustrating than fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010933023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1525593009}
review:
I have to say, this is the most frustrating game I've played in a while.  Not because it's a bad game, which is the problem.  There are a lot of things I like about the game, including the scenery and the basic crafting setup.  It's the wonky design choices that make it so frustrating, and they all sort of tie in together for added frustration.

First of all, the camera.  It's a static cam, which is just fine in some situations, like if you're on rails in close quarters, but this is an open world.  You have a very limited range where you can see danger coming, and seeing danger coming is hugely important, because everything that wants to kill you is faster than you are, and if there's a sprint key anywhere to be had, I haven't found it by looking at the control options.  You have one speed that seems to hinge on you being at max stamina, and it's too slow to do you any good.  You also have no armor to start with thanks to the layout of the skill tree.  You're going to learn how to tame a chicken, build a cook stove, and fry an egg before you ever get anything like armor, but you're still going to have to go fight goblins, and angry foxes, and wild boars, and heaven help you a bear if you don't see it in time, because the game requires you to have gold coins before you can level up.  So you're going to go fight all of those things literally in your underwear.  Crafting itself is somewhat deep, but slow, and I know I could speed some of it up by creating, say, an iron knife instead of a stone one to load into some of my crafting stations, only I'm running low on iron already and I'm hoping that eventually I will get to put some of it towards armor.  Instead of, you know, running out in my underwear to look for more iron rocks while failing to run away from things that want to kill me if I don't see them coming.  Add to that the fact that I have to go into a frozen-cam mode just to harvest anything or interact with crafting stations, and I'm left wondering what the purpose was behind all these clunky mechanics.

I do like the game...sort of...but even thinking about starting it up again in the state it's currently in just leaves me feeling tired.  And I play a lot of Early Access games--probably half of my library is EA games--so it's not a lack of patience or willingness to experiment.  It's purely down to frustration at how many of the design choices have combined to turn a good game into an aggravating game.  I'd suggest waiting to see how it looks further down the line unless a big lure for you is "but it's different!"  It is definitely different.  That doesn't always mean successful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022949988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1483631005}
review:
Its such a grinding game. It closely reminds me of "Life is Fuedal: Your Own" except you cant do freely what you want and level what you want up. You are restricted to build things until you level up and based on quest restrictions. And leveling up takes grinding. It took me 10 hours to get to level 7. 

Its still good though.  I already have 10 hours in for $8...seems worth it. I dont see me replaying this solely on the fact that i would have to grind again to get where i am. 

You are free to go around the world, however there are higher level creatures the farther you span, and environment hazards..... that require you to grind to get better equipment. 

POSSIBLE SPOILER:
An example would be you have to grind to upgrade your weapon to get a bronze sword which means you need bronze. But then you need to go out into the world to get the ore, which means you need to make bread to keep you alive. To make bread you need to farm wheat, make flour, produce eggs, etc. Then to keep your stamina high you need coffee, which means you need to farm coffee seeds, make coffee. But you cant do this at the same time as growing wheat, because you can have only so many crops. And thats just not to get the bronze sword, you need to do it every time you go out...when you need iron, when you need copper, when you need gold, etc. And you do need them because you need to make things based on quests, not your own interests. Also to level up you need ingots just laying around just to level up. And you do this all in your boxers/shorts, as you have yet to be able to make any clothing due to quest restriction. The only armor you have it your level armor. 

Its fun for awhile, but it gets too grinding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057617170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1517059733}
review:
С первого взгляда интересно
Шляпа начинается потом
Когда вы начинаете бегать и фармить
Ваш персонаж медлительный паралитик не способный прервать ни одого действия
Отвратительная камера и меню
Животные бегают так июого и издают такие мерзкие звуки что уже за это их хочется не просто убить, а замучать страшной смертью
Воевать так же медленно и без вариантов колотить стоя рядом с мобом и получая урон
тактики нет
Приручение животных-отдельная головная боль
Ох короче это хорошая идея с таким отвратным воплощением что я несколько раз вырубал игру в ярости от того что она такая мутная медленная и не управляемая, при том что крафт и идея тянули

author: {'steamid': '76561198069304044', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1536336391}
review:
So far so good, como dizem os gringos.
Jogo bem indie mesmo, mas pensa num jogo "completo".
Até onde eu sei o jogo foi desenvolvido por um único indivíduo, mas pensa num joguinho baum.
Você pode fazer de tudo um pouco nesse jogo, lutar, ser fazendeiro, fazer tuas armas, roupas (equipamentos), etc.
O começo é um pouco lento, mas depois do lvl 5 as coisas fluem melhor, principalmente depois de ter acesso as ferramentas de metal/bronze.
O jogo tem muita coisa que pode ser melhorada, e provavelmente vão ser melhoradas.
Diversão de pelo menos 20h, se jogado moderadamente.
OBS: Nunca jogue um único jogo por um tempo prolongado, você irá acabar enjoando do jogo prematuramente e alegará que o jogo não é o que você esperava. Jogue com moderação.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050585778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1483623240}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038037941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1585921474}
review:
Force of Nature ist ein Typisches Survival-Crafting-Game. Ressourcen sammeln, Unterschlupf und Ausrüsstung herstellen, gegen Monster kämpfen, etc. Nebenbei gibt es ein paar Quest´s die einen in das Spiel einführen und manchmal für Kurzweil sorgen. Das einzige Problem daran ist der Schwirigkeitsgrad der ca. ab Charakter-Level 7 deutlich anzieht. Das alleine wäre ja kein Problem allerdings lässt sich bessere Ausrüsstung nur mit höherem Level herstellen und um das zu erreichen muss man bestimmte Quests erfüllen und Gegenstände im Inventar haben die man aber meistens nicht schafft weil die Monster in den Quest gebieten zu stark sind. 
Deswegen würde ich es besser finden wenn man auch ohne Quest´s höhere Level erreichen kann um bessere Ausrüsstung herzustellen damit man diese schweren Monster auch besiegen und die Quest´s abschließen kann!! Oder verbessert einfach das Balancing zwischen Spieler und Monster liebe Entwickler!! Ein weiteres Manko ist die etwas gewöhnungsbedürftige Steuerung und Kameraführung die definitiv verbessert werden sollte. Trozdem macht das Game spaß und ist auf jedenfall einen Blick wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971486472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1483341040}
review: It isn't really open or sandbox. I played for about 30 minutes and kept running into limitations. The primary limitations were having to have a certain level to craft something, and the other was that the plants blocked my path pretty much anywhere I went.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236748184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2847, 'last_played': 1512899440}
review:
First thing I'll say about this game is: the dev, Artem, appears to be very dedicated to his work and has been tirelessly working on updates since release earlier on in December. I paid £5.39 for my game and honestly, it was not such a huge outlay that I cannot be patient while all the bugs are being worked out. Much of it is about play testing at this stage, and while the bugs can be frustrating, I am really interested to see how this game shapes up in the future.

The game does hook you right from the start, and this particularly if you are one of those people who understands that if you are going to get anywhere, it might take a lot of work. Some aspects of the game are a little grindy and repetitive and like many, I imagine, I have a whole list of things that I feel need changing...however, I can't deny that so far I have really enjoyed the process, and love pottering around my camp. For the price and the hours already spent on creating my little home, I'm sold on it. :}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008442636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1483146891}
review:
This is a game that has a lot of promise, but is tedious and has really awkward controls.  All of your recipes are linked to your level, and you get levels by completing quests.  This basically amounts to a game that's basically one long tutorial that holds your hand and never lets go.  It's not a sandbox, since you can never do what you want to do - if you have the materials to make better tools, you have to wait until you gain enough levels to make them, which is especially frustrating since you need tons and tons of resources to do anything.  There's a quest to build three seed boxes, which each require 15 soil, so you sit there digging at the ground mindlessly for what seems like forever, since each time you dig, you only have a chance of getting one soil.  Similar games are enjoyable because if your tools are weak or you need better weapons, armor, you can set that as a goal to reach and achieve - here, you can't improve your situation until you jump through all the hoops the game puts in front of you.

The controls are bad and awkward, and so is the camera.  You can't see things in front of you very well, and you can't really do anything with a window open.  Combat is monotonous - just holding down the mouse and waiting for the enemy to die, or to run away at the last minute faster than you can chase after it.  It has so much promise, but the flaws of the game make it very much unenjoyable to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087859824', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1461, 'last_played': 1485786016}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045302046', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1483193244}
review: I'd probably give this a thumbs up if not for the combat, which I find to be so bad it ruins an otherwise good game.  You move slower than everything else in the world, get hit probably 3 times more than the speed you can attack at, and most everything runs from you at mach-5 when they get low on health.  Combat in this game is designed to test your patience, and I prefer to have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029777026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 3317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1591600582}
review:
Nice little game. It's a lot about collecting, crafting and building and not so much about fighting. I like that. The graphics are ok and cute but not realistic or state of the art. The style reminds me a lot of WoW. Sounds are well done, almost all activities have individual and fitting sounds. Game mechanics are well done and easy to use. You usually click through simple menues that tell you what to do or how to do it. There are tips about how to get some items as you soon will loose overview of all the recipes and ingredients.

So basically all you do is start crafting crude tools, collect some food as you loose stamina quickly for all you do. After a while you leave the beach where you awoke and walk into the forest to find more materials - here you will encounter aggressive goblins that spawn copper and gold coins (another material) and wild animals. Stay away from bears and boars in the beginning. Then you build a camp (you don't have to do that on the beach, but it is preferable in the early game). Crafting get's more tedious as soon as you have an anvil and can work with iron. A handful of nails becomes quite a task and many new items or buildings will need lots of them. Iron ore becomes sparse and you have to travel far into enemy terrain to obtain some. Yet it is fun to find out how to create new things, like bake a bread or even make coffee.

I think this goes on and on like this, but I haven't played very much yet. I see that I will be able to craft iron sword and armor later, so I guess there will be more than only gobbos in my way.

Until you can build a wood cabin and fences as seen in the screenshots you will have to play quite some hours.

The only downside so far is that the game crashes after playing it for 1-2 hours. I use Windows 10 and have no idea what causes this. Suddenly the video driver seems to completely fold into itself and the game crashes to the desktop. Pretty annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984612179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1483155542}
review: I like survival games, but stay away from this one.  It's infuriating.  Some really weak mechanics.  I am just at the threshold of level 7, a piece of Force of Nature is all I need.  I have a teleporter set up near it.  I've cleared most of the mobs, down to a few, and then have died.  I've not slept, not saved, and the mobs are respawning every so often.  Not sure if it's a timed thing or what.  This game is just too frustrating to play, weak work around mechanics that spoil what could have been a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966214325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4277, 'last_played': 1489318123}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072152701', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483096434}
review:
I would try to like this game. But there are multiple things that bug me after already 15min.
First is this weird angle. Why can't you change it so that you can look into the distance?
Second the mouse speed. I usually have it quite high, so it bugs me that I have to "fight" with the low mouse-speed of the game. 3rd..... Why is the right mouse button never used? You could use it perfectly for changing the camera angle, even more so when you have some interface open. That way you don't have to close everything just to look around.

If those things are cleared up, I'm willing to give a thumbs up, but for now..... I'm inbetween.

EDIT: After reading through some more ideas, I think that the angle might be for low specs, but well.... at least make an option for higher-end systems so that they aren't restricted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029190646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1695765180}
review:
Juegazo donde los halla, vi un video del juego por internet y me decidi a probarlo, ya que me recordaba mucho a otros juegos de antaño. Un total acierto el haberlo probado y jugado. Es un todo en uno bastante agradable de jugar, a veces se hace pesado ( el farmeo ) pero es muy llevadero el juego ya que a medida que vas avanzando se desbloquean cosas nuevas y te hace seguir adelante. A simple vista no he visto ningun tipo de bug o fallo en el juego. Evidentemente tiene muchas cosas que mejorar a dia de hoy pero no dejan al juego de lado y le añaden parches corrigiendo cosas o añadiendo cosas      ( como el arbol de navidad ). De graficos parece un poco asi asao pero la verdad esque estan super bien los graficos, detallados y super fluidos a la hora de renderizar no te cuesta nada.
Ya os anticipo de que si os gustan los juegos que mezclen crafteos, supervivencia, misiones y un monton de cosas mas este es vuestro juego. Lo unico que lamento ha sido no haberlo encontrado antes para empezar a jugarlo mucho antes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048557167', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1544485203}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009792779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1686744225}
review:
I went into this game after watching 15 minutes of a gameplay by the Youtuber xBCrafted (I recommend checking him out) And I really enjoy this game so far. Plenty of more stuff for me to do, and I can't wait to fully explore them.

There is a bit of a grind in order to get to certain points in the game, which is good in my opinion.
And like plenty of others have already pointed out, don't be scared of the camera angle, you'll get used to it before you know! 

I highly recommend people to try this game, as its a very relaxing game.

The only "issue" I have is the water grind.. Makes you babysit a bit too much as wells stops making more water after 4, untill you take those out. A little nitpicking, but it's just since you need water for ALOT of things. Dont get discouraged though. Im certain you'll still like the other aspects of the game.. Even the "clunky" combat system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014704153', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 2330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2330, 'last_played': 1483020456}
review:
The game was fun at first, but not as good as I thought it would be.

The game is very limiting, in the fact that you can only craft certain objects at each level and you can only lvl by completing the set quests and crafting what is listed. So this game is wrongly classed as a sandbox game as there are limitations to what you can do. Such as you can't craft any clothes until lvl 7 or iron axes until lvl 8.

At lvl 6 I was only allowed 1 cooking table, so I could not make bread, coffee and cheese at the same time. And crafting is not queued, so you can only craft 1 thing at a time so it takes ages, especially since I did not want to leave my base without having  a decent amount of food.
And the food you find is not good enough as it hardly restores any health or stamina.

Iam currently, not allowed to make a better weapon than a cudgel or a crude bow, both are rather weak and hate that you can only attack 1 enemy at a time so if you get more than 1 goblin and a bear joining in the fight, you end up dead as I can't craft armour at lvl 6.

I hate how very restrictive the game is, so it makes this game less fun for me.
Everything takes forever to craft. It becomes very tedious and grindy, needing  15 amethyst chips just to progress, it gets boring by the time you get to lvl 7 as you need way too many items and
you have to spend ages making food and drink just to survive going anywhere.

When trying to hunt animals for pelts, boars and foxes will run away when their health gets low and they are way too fast espcially when you have -3 movement speed from wearing bronze armour. Only bears stay and fight, makes it annoying when you need 50+ pelts for crafting fur armour.

Other bad things is combat is terrible and so is the camera angle, it's a weird angle so you can't see into the distance.
Also for some strange reason animals need 2 traps before they can be tamed, the first trap thrown always fails.
I gave this game a chance, playing it even when feeling bored.


I got up to lvl 8, had to get my third force of nature in the cold area, the area surrounded thick in mobs each lvl 10, tried to pull 1, 5 mobs came after me, died, came back and am faced with the same problem this game is just frustrating and annoying, I can't recommend it anymore.

This game has a good concept, but is let down by poor execution, there is a lot that needs to be improved. It feels unbalanced and not as polished as it could be. I may change this game to recommend if the gameplay is updated and improved. Things such as when digging soil, you get 1 piece of soil at a time, which is slow when you need like 30 soil for a seedbed. Or having 30 animals and having to feed each of them 1 at a time. Which is crazy considering a real productive farm would have large feed troughs so that all animals can be fed quickly.

This game was played and the review was written before any major updates, creative mode or creature taming was added. Comments disabled because of nasty non constructive troll comments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059232567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483060293}

review: I've very much enjoyed this game 8 hours of gameplay so far. Its slow collecting but it makes it rewarding.  Sounds are relaxing. Lots to explore. It has quests and lots of options. the camera few and movement have been an ajustment but I feel its worth it from what i've seen so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127788130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482973189}
review:
Find leaf. Click make this. now click to make this. now click to make this.... ok, so where is the adventure part? I was expecting a more detailed minecraft. Not so much. You don't really build anything. You open a menu screen select build and it gets generated for you. 

IDK, maybe it will get better with updates. Controls leave much to be desired. The walls of text menus block free camera movement, but if you close them you have no idea what to do. Also anything that needs to be broken down to be collected can't be touched without the menu screen up so you have to jump back and forth.

I supose it has a survival element somewhere.. I got maybe ten minutes in and was too bored to continue. There are free phone apps with the same feel and better controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997925483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482971197}
review: 10 minutes in and I requested a refund.  Game needs some serious interface/mechanics tweeks.  Just like many of the other negative reviews state, there is a fixed camera angle that makes you feel like you are on a swivel and you are not allowed to see more than 10 feet in front of you.  Free motion camera is needed!  Also - the fact that you have to have your inventory window open to pick up items in the world is simply stupid.  Also - your character movement changes when you have said inventory window open so instead of moving left to right, you change to side stepping.  So forget about just leaving the window open all the time.  See a stick?  Walk up to it.  Open inventory window, click the new "Stick" box that appears.  Close inventory window, continue rest of your day.  Also, crafting...  When you are done crafting you have to click "Get Object" or whatever it was to put the item in your inventory.  What else would I do with it???  Apparently developer has never played any games like this in the past.  A major step backwards in design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175990243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1483214074}
review:
The game is OK, there are bugs which can be annoying.
Combat sucks. Combat sucks, yeah I typed it twice it is that bad.
The game is quest driven, to level up you need to complete set quests, which entails lots of farming for pelts, and other mats.
There is very little to build in the game, and it all has level requirements, see above.
Designed this way because there is very little to do in the game. You will end up growing food to go and fight some mobs, rinse and repeat. Get enough mats to finish that levels quests, level up, and start all over again doing the same thing every level.
You cannot design and construct your own buildings which would be a great improvement, hopefully the game will get better with new patches. 
Old equipment gets thrown on the floor, there is no way to destroy or recycle old stuff. Too many logs, not a problem, just leave them on the floor, they do not dissapear, however, the bloody fur set of clothes I made magically dissapeared from the chest they were stored in.
Right, some parts of the game are poorly designed and suck, I wish there was a sandbox mode even with the limited gameplay that would give you. At the current price I would buy the game again, just beacuse it is cheap and I hope the game will improve in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964896429', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1484586932}
review: This is a great little game. It's a bit grindy in places but for whatever reason it hooks you and you want to keep playing it to find out what's next. Updates have been almost daily at times which is nice, the game is super stable minus the occasional slowdown/stutter when it auto-saves. The camera angle option doesn't seem to do anything for me, and I'd like a bit lower angle camera so I could see further in the distance. Other than a few minor nitpicks and the animal pelt grind being a bit rough (animals run away too much) it's a really fantastic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177804790', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1489063469}
review: 很不错的游戏，如果爱好建设，经营，养殖类型的玩家可以尝试一下，感受从无到有的成就感。至于没有中文，其实游戏中的文本量很少，不认识的单词查一下就可以弄明白。如果因为没有英文就放弃一款游戏，那很多游戏都会被错过，希望您能迈出一小步，很多新大门将会打开。毕竟，因为自身能力不足而变得生气，需要发泄，最终退款给差评的人，大家一般称他为＿＿（填空题）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198122678006', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1584628704}
review:
游戏真的非常的不错，引入了升级的要素，解锁新的设计图纸需要升级，增加了游戏的可玩度。
地图很大，还有没探索完，不过应该有丰富的地形。
建造上面需要材料过多，需要收集很久，而且前期的工具不行效率不高，高级工具需要很高级才能解锁，拖慢了游戏进程。
游戏死亡后会随机掉落包裹里的东西，而且是直接消失不能再捡到，所以告诉大家一个方法，自己快死了赶紧ESC退出并在进入游戏，就会出现在出生点继续游戏(游戏开始都是出现在出生点的所以建议大家建造基地是不要离出生点太远）。
